Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a cord or vine aligned with a stake, the lower part of which is represented by a slanting line | crops aligned by size | *younger brother*; *disciple* (← occupant of a lower vertical stage in a hierarchy). For a conceptually related term indicating a "younger sister," compare 娣.
An abbreviated form# of 弟 (vertical alignment) + 竹 bamboo | neatly stacked pieces of bamboo (compare the bamboo counting sticks in 算) | *ordinal number*; *prefix*; *grade*; *degree* (← stacking).

Examples: 請求 需求 要求
Etymology: A depiction of an animal pelt, complete with head and limbs, that would be wrapped about oneself for warmth (compare 㒼 as described in 滿, 皮 and 表, as well as 韋) | *draw tight* | *want*  (← draw a desired object tightly into one's possession) | *seek*; *search for*; *request*; *ask* (for); *demand*; *buy*. In derivative characters, 求 conveys the concept "wrap" (← wrap a pelt about the body).

Examples: 足球 籃球 網球
Etymology: As per 求# (wrap) + 玉 jewel | pearl wrapped in an oyster shell | *round jewel*; *spherical object*; *ball*; *bulb* (compare 玉).

Examples: 性別 性格 個性
Etymology: 生# birth; life + 心 heart/emotions | one's inborn nature | *character*; *nature*; *sex*; *gender* | *essence*.

Examples: 呈現 呈獻
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 廷 (extend) + 口 mouth | extend an *offer* | *present* (something by extending it toward the recipient). Also, *expose*.

Examples: 計程車 程度 課程
Etymology: As per 呈# (extend) + 禾 grain/rice | extensive ears of grain | *standard* length (of plants) | *extent*; *distance*; *measure*; *limit*; *certain degree of time*; *about*; *to the point/extent that* (← standard length).

Examples: 把握 把持 把手
Etymology: As per 巴# (spread) + 手 hand | spread the hands and *take/grasp* an object (compare 捕).

Examples: 皮包 皮帶 皮膚
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines a drooping pelt with the head still attached + 又 hand/action indicator | spread open (open up) a pelt, then align it over one's body (compare 求, 㒼 as described in 滿 and 表, as well as 韋) | *skin*; *hide*; *leather* | (tree) *bark*; *rind*.

Examples: 被動 棉被 被子
Etymology: As per 皮# (align) + 衣 clothing | align clothing (or bedclothes/bedding) over the body | *cover*; *be covered* | *reach*; *suffer*; *incur* (← be figuratively covered by unpleasant matters) | *passive auxiliary verb* (← be acted upon ← suffer).

Examples: 公共汽車 公司 公園
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄨㄥ ㄍㄨㄥ`ㄑㄧ`ㄔㄜ   ㄍㄨㄥ ㄙ   ㄍㄨㄥ ㄩㄢˊ
Etymology: Originally, 八 split right and left + 口# mouth/hole (| space) | *open* space in which (divided groups of) people gather | *public* | *fair*; *official*; *governmental*.

Examples: 註冊 手冊
Etymology: A depiction of a profusion of slender, inscribed bamboo slats of irregular length, bound with a cord | *book*; *counter* (for books/magazines etc.) (← bamboo and wood as writing mediums). Note a variant form 册.

Examples: 討論 不論 理論
Etymology: 侖# neat assemblage/alignment + 言 words | orderly *discussion*; (logical) *argument*.

Meaning: then; really, indeed; as it turned out, after all; namely
Etymology: A depiction of a supple ear clinging to the side of the head (compare 耳) or a fetus clinging in the womb (compare 身). *You*, *after all*, *that is (to say)* and *of* are all borrowed meanings.

Meaning: extend; reach; come up to; and
Examples: 來不及 來得及 等不及
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a person + a hand reaching toward another person (compare 服) | *reach/extend* and press a hand on the back of a fleeing person | *overtake* | *amount to*; *equal*. By further extension are *and* and *as well as* (← equally), while *come to*, *exert* (upon) and *affect* derive from the original sense of exerting pressure with one's hand.

Examples: 烏龍茶
Etymology: A depiction of a large, coiled serpent | *dragon*. A seal inscription form adds an element suggesting the idea of rising upward, while the original oracle bone form# supplies the sound.

Examples: 學校 校長 校園
Etymology: As per 交# (twist/cross) + 木 tree/wood | wooden *cross fetters* or *shackles*. Also, *fence* (← construction of crossed boards). *School* is from the idea of a place where an exchange of teaching and learning (by comparison) is performed; the same notion is at work in 學. For shackles/fetters, compare 械, 枷, 絆 and 桎.

Examples: 別人 特別 別的
Etymology: 叧 as described in 拐 (sever/separate) here a variant of 歹* severed bone + 刀 sword/knife | separate flesh from bone by cutting | *separate*; *other*; *divide*; *distinguish*; *different*; *parting* | *farewell*.
A depiction of a deep, slender *well*. 丼 is a variant form of 井.

Examples: 歌曲 曲折 插曲
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄜ ㄑㄩˇ  ㄑㄩ ㄓㄜˊ  ㄔㄚ ㄑㄩˇ
Etymology: A depiction of a curved ruler or measuring implement | *bend*; *curve* | *tilt*; *turn*; *crooked*; *distorted* | *melody* (← tune which alternates high and low notes).

Examples: 骨頭
Etymology: 肉 flesh + a remnant element indicating the joint of a bone | *bone* circulating in the cavity of its joint | *frame*; *ribs* (of an umbrella); *outline*. Also, *spirit* (← bones as the essence of an existence).

Examples: 豆腐 豆漿 紅豆
Etymology: A depiction of a bean-shaped food stand | *bean*; *pea*; *pulse* (← resemblance in shape) | *miniature* (← small object ← small as a bean).

Examples: 身體 體育 體會
Etymology: As per the right-hand element# of 禮 (well-ordered) + 骨 bone | the orderly arranged bones of the *body*. Note the variant forms 躰 and 軆.

Examples: 符合 合唱 合作
Etymology: As per 口# (cavity | open container) + an abbreviated form of 今 (contain) | press/fit together a lid on a container, containing objects inside | *fit*; *join*; *put together*; *meet*. Extended meanings include *suit*; *match*; *agree/coincide with*; *correspond to*; *be correct*; *add* (to); *combine*; *set/adjust* (a device); *adapt oneself to*; and *check* (with/against).

Examples: 補給 給予 供給
Etymology: As per 合# (press/fit together) + 糸 thread | fit together pieces of fabric | *supply*; *supplement*; *fill*; *give*; *salary*.

Examples: 省錢 節省 省得
Etymology: 目 eye + 少 here a variant of 生# (slender grass shoots) | narrow the eyes in observing (compare 睜) | *inspect minutely* | *ponder*; *inquire*; *confirm*. *Reduce* and *omit* are borrowed meanings | *governmental office*; *unit of an administrative district* (← local authority of reduced/lesser power ← centralized power of the ruler).

Examples: 一直 簡直 直到
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 目 eye + an element# combining a straight line and a dot representing a pupil | eye looking straight ahead | *direct*; *immediately*; *frankness* | *fix/repair*; *correct*; *make/get well* (← straighten out).

Examples: 聽說 打聽 聽見
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 德 (one's true nature) + an element combining 耳 ear with the right-hand element of 廷 (extend straight) | pay heed to what is straight/true | *hear/listen* (compare 聖 and 貞) | *ask*.

Examples: 故事 故意 故鄉
Etymology: 古# hard; dried out + 攵 action indicator | harden into fixed reality | *old*; *die*; *the late* (referring to a deceased person) | *old acquaintance*; *reason*; *cause*; *circumstances*; *past* (← by reason of past circumstances ← stand firm upon established premises, for example, "because such and such is so, therefore X").

Examples: 當做 做法 做夢
吊橋 上吊
Etymology: A variant of 弔 (hang suspended) | *hang*; *suspend* | *wear* (a sling).

Examples: 非常 常常 經常
Etymology: As per 尚# (rise | raise) + 巾 cloth | raise a long skirt. *Normal*, *ordinary*, *continual* and *unending* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 哪裡 這裡 那裡
風景 風格 風俗
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄈㄥ ㄐㄧㄥˇ  ㄈㄥ ㄍㄜˊ  ㄈㄥ ㄙㄨˊ
Etymology: A variant form of 鳳 (large bird flapping its wings), later conceived of as the source of *wind* causing various life forms and other objects to flutter | *trend*; *atmosphere*; *taste*; *custom* (← things brought in then carried off by the wind).

Examples: 牛奶 牛仔褲 牛排
Etymology: A depiction of a *cow*. The pronunciation of the character simulates lowing.

Examples: 角度 角色 角落
Etymology: A depiction of a hard, curved *horn* | *corner*; *edge*; *angle* | *harshness*.

Examples: 解釋 了解 瞭解
Etymology: 角# horn + an element combining 刀 sword/knife and 牛 cow | *remove* cattle horns in butchering | *dismember*; *break*; *release*; *unravel*; *disentangle*; *untie*; *loosen*; *solve*; *melt* | *understand*; *explain* | *dispel* (← dispel doubts and obtain understanding) | *cancel*. *Comb* is by extension from "disentangle."

Examples: 絲毫
Etymology: A depiction of piled threads | *thread* | *yarn*; (musical instrument) *string*; *line*.

Examples: 彎腰 彎曲
Etymology: As per 䜌# as described in 戀 (stretch) + 弓 bow | stretched, curved bow | *stretched bow* | *pull/draw back on*; *curve*. In 湾, 彎 appears in the simplified form 弯.

Meaning: a bay, cove, inlet, bend of stream
Examples: 台灣
Etymology: 彎# bend/curve + 水 water | curving body of water | *gulf*; *bay* | *inlet*.

Examples: 等等 等待 平等
Etymology: As per 寺# (stand straight) + 竹 bamboo | bamboo stalks/pieces of *equal* height, arranged vertically | *equivalent*; *grade*; *rank*; *et cetera* (← listing of equivalent/similar items).

Examples: 拉肚子 拉票 沙拉
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄌㄚ ㄉㄨ`ㄗ˙  ㄌㄚ ㄆㄧㄠ`  ㄕㄚ ㄌㄚ
Etymology: As per 立# (exert continuous downward pressure) + 手 hand/action indicator | *drag* a heavy person/object along the ground | *pull*; *draw*; *carry off*. Also, *crush* (← press down on and crush).

Examples: 否則 否定 否認
Etymology: As per 不# (refusal; negation) + 口 mouth | oral *refusal/negation/denial* | *no*; *bad*; *otherwise*; *whether or not* | *as soon as*; *no sooner than* (← practically no time between the occurrence of two events). In derivative characters such as 痞 and 嚭, 否 conveys the concept "bulge," a carryover influence of 不.

Examples: 南部 西部 北部
Etymology: As per 咅# (spread) + 邑 village/settlement | spread over *part* of a settlement | *section*; *group*. Also, (via "a part"), *counter* (for books/papers) and *radical/classifier* for a Han/Chinese character.

Examples: 泉源 溫泉
Etymology: A depiction of a thin stream of water spouting from a round *spring* | *fountain*; *fountainhead*.

Examples: 原來 草原 平原
Etymology: 厂 cliff + an abbreviated form# of 泉 spring | round spring at the base of a cliff | *origin*. *Field* and *plain* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 美國 美麗 美術
Etymology: The present form combines 大 person standing outstretched and 羊 sheep (originally, goat), but neither of these elements can supply the Old Chinese pronunciation of the character. The phonetically close term conveyed by 㒼 (described in 満) suggests that 美, like 㒼, involved the notion "cover the body completely with an animal skin that has its head still attached." The exact provenance of the meanings *beautiful* and *good* is uncertain, as is the identity of the element replaced by 大.

Examples: 先生 祖先 領先
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 儿# person + 之 (forward motion) | advance in small  increments, the feet in close adherence | *go ahead*; *advance* | *tip*; *previous*; *the late*; *ancestor*; *first of all*; *prior*; *the future*.

Examples: 通知 交通 溝通
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄊㄨㄥ ㄓ   ㄐㄧㄠ ㄊㄨㄥ   ㄍㄡ ㄊㄨㄥ
Etymology: As per 甬# (run through) + 辵 movement | run/*pass through*. The many extended meanings include *go back and forth* (to work, school etc.); *commute*; *attend a school*; *frequent* (a particular place); *run between two points*; *street*; *avenue*; *traffic*; *go/run through*; *pass*; *pierce*; *penetrate*; *drainage*; *ventilation* and *conduct*. Also, *cook/heat up food* (← pass food through heat); *look through/over* (← run the eyes over); *do continuously* (← run through); *pass* (a bill); *maintain* (a position) (← be consistent from start to finish ← run through); *understanding* (← know a subject from start to finish ← run through) | *be reasonable/logical*; *reputation*; *be well known* (← reputation for understanding). Further, *as expected* and *in accordance with* (← run in accordance with expectations), *be known as by* and *be regarded as* (← reputation), *accept/admit* (← admit the logic of an argument), *degree* (← degree of completeness ← run from start to finish), and *thus*(ly) (← run in accordance with logic/expectations).

Examples: 官方 官員 器官
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of 㠯 is a depiction of objects that have been accumulated and wrapped. 官 adds 宀 roof/building | a number of people wrapped about/enclosed in an (official) building | *government*; *official* | *human organ* (← object controlling a variety of functions, in the manner of an official). Compare 營.

Examples: 管理 不管 儘管
Etymology: As per 官# (wrap about/enclose) + 竹 bamboo | (bamboo) *pipe*; *tube*; *flute*. There is no longer any specific connection with bamboo. *Control* is a borrowed meaning via the acquired, associated meaning of 官, here possibly with respect to the control exercised in playing a wind instrument; compare 筦.

Examples: 滅亡 死亡 傷亡
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 人 person + a long vertical line# behind which the  person is (partially) concealed (compare 毋). The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows 人 person hidden by an L-shaped object | be partially obscured and dimly visible, or fully obscured and non-existent | *perish*; *fall*; *die*; *dead*; *flee*.

Examples: 網球 上網 網站
Etymology: 罔# net + 糸 thread (for emphasis/clarification) | *net*.

Examples: 產品 毒品 化妝品
Etymology: Square-shaped object (tripled) | high-quality *goods* spread throughout a protective container (compare 舗 and 販) | *quality*; *counter for goods*; (person's) *character*; *grade*; *value*.

Examples: 地區 郊區 山區
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a line that curves/bends in penetrating three enclosures | *division*; *sector* (← divide a narrow section into smaller parts).

Meaning: period of time; date; time limit
Examples: 星期 星期天 星期日
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄒㄧㄥ ㄑㄧ   ㄒㄧㄥ ㄑㄧ ㄊㄧㄢ   ㄒㄧㄥ ㄑㄧ ㄖ`
Etymology: As per 其# (square/rectangular) + 月 moon | *cycle*; *period* (← lunar cycle conceived of as proceeding around a square/rectangular backdrop; compare 稘 as well as 季 and 週).

Examples: 今年 今天 今後
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧㄣ ㄋㄧㄢˊ  ㄐㄧㄣ ㄊㄧㄢ   ㄐㄧㄣ ㄏㄡ`
Etymology: A depiction of one object contained and concealed within another. It is likely the concealing object was originally a mouth (compare 含 and 吟, as well as 甘 and 音). *Now* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 獎學金 金子 押金
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 今# (contain) + an element combining 土 earth  and random marks | *gold* contained here and there within the earth | *money*; *metal*; *yellow*; *golden*.

Examples: 昔日
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 日 sun/day + a representation of one object layered on another | passage of days/time (likened to a figurative piling up; compare 昨 and 時) | *antiquity*; (previous) *night*.

Examples: 不錯 錯誤 差錯
Etymology: As per 昔# (pile) + 金 metal | pile up layers of gold/silver in inlaying | *mix*; *intertwine* | *disorder*; *mistake* (← irregular layering).

Examples: 快樂 音樂 樂器
Etymology: A depiction of an oak tree with acorns (ground into powder via a lengthy grinding process). *Music* and *enjoyment* are onomatopoeic, borrowed meanings, the pronunciation of the character simulating the din of a crowd | *play* (an instrument); *amuse oneself*; *pleasant*; *fun*; *happy*; *delightful*; *comfort*; *easy*.

Examples: 尋找 找錢 找尋
圖書館 讀書 教書
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 者# (pile) + 聿 implement held upright to carve/draw characters | pile of documents comprising a written work (compare 著) | *book*; *document*; *letter*; *calligraphy*; *style of writing Han/Chinese characters*.

The relevant seal inscription form shows a number of mixed items + 衣 clothing (here suggesting a supple/soft cloth sack) | *cooperate* in inserting seized goods in sacks | *work*; *assist* | *aid*; *help*. *Raise* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 讓步
Etymology: As per 襄# (supple/soft) + 言 words | take a pliant attitude in accepting a demand/request | *allow*; *concede* (compare 諾) | *transfer*; *hand over*; *sell*; *yield to*; *defer*.

Meaning: prefix for people's names; used in transliteration
Examples: 阿姨
Etymology: As per 可# (bend) + 阜 piled earth | high place with multiple bends | *winding heights* | *fawn over*; *flatter* (← twist the truth in order to gain favor). 阿 is most often used as a simple phonetic in names, compounds and idioms, rather than for its primary meanings.

Examples: 疾病
Etymology: 矢 here an abbreviated form# of 至 stopping point + 疒 illness | *illness* hastening death | *swiftness* (← hasten).
十# ten (doubled) | *twenty*. Compare 卅 thirty.

Meaning: together with, all, total; to share
Examples: 公共汽車 一共 公共
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄨㄥ ㄍㄨㄥ`ㄑㄧ`ㄔㄜ   ㄧ ㄍㄨㄥ`  ㄍㄨㄥ ㄍㄨㄥ`
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 廾# (pair of hands holding up/out an object in raising it high in offering; compare 具) + an object | serve; offer | *together*; *with*; *share* | *plural/humble suffix*.

Examples: 選舉 選擇 當選
Etymology: As per 巽# (arrange in formation) + 辵 movement (| action indicator) (for emphasis/clarification) | arrange prior to making a selection | *select*; *choose*.

Examples: 比較 計較 較量
Etymology: As per 交# (twist/cross) + 車 vehicle | crossing bars in the passenger compartment of ancient vehicles, which passengers grasped to maintain their balance. *Compare* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 母親 父母 祖母
Etymology: A depiction of a woman, with emphasis on the nipples | *mother*. Conceptually, the character suggests that a mother is a curvaceous producer of a succession of offspring from the darkness of the womb. The most ancient pronunciation of this term was MA, a sound comparatively easy for infants to produce. Compare 夫.

Examples: 數學 大多數 人數
Etymology: As per 婁# (continuum) + 攵 action indicator | enumerate people or a continuum of objects | *count*; *number*.

Examples: 表演 表達 表面
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 衣 clothing with 毛# hair/fur | spread a fur or an animal skin over one's body (compare 求, 㒼 as described in 滿 and 皮, as well as 韋) | *surface*; *face*; *chart*; *express*; *expression*; *outside*; *appearance*; *show*; *mark*; *monument*; *sign*; *outdoors* (← outwardness). Also, *the top half of an inning*.

Examples: 內衣 國內 內容
市場 飛機場 機場
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕ`ㄔㄤˇ  ㄈㄟ ㄐㄧ ㄔㄤˇ  ㄐㄧ ㄔㄤˇ
Etymology: 昜# rise + 土 earth | public space on high ground | *public square/plaza*; *place/location* | *scene*; *session* (played out in public).

Examples: 從前 從不 從來
Etymology: Originally, 走# run + 比 line up | run with others in a line | *accompany*; *follow*; *submit to*; *obey*; *abide by* | *consequently*; *in accordance with*; *therefore*. Also, *subdue* and *conquer* (← cause to submit). 从 is a variant form that appears in dual-element characters such as 坐, 巫 and 僉. 乑 is another variant form, this one appearing in 聚 and 衆.

Examples: 快樂 愉快 涼快
Etymology: As per 夬# (scoop out) + 心 heart/emotions | *pleasant*; *comfortable* (← heart with all the unpleasantness scooped out of it) | *refreshing*; *enjoyable*. Compare 欠/缺.

Meaning: happy, pleased, glad; joy; to enjoy
Examples: 喜歡 歡迎 歡呼
Etymology: As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure | group of like individuals enjoying eating and/or conversing | *pleasure*; *joy*.

Examples: 表示 示威 顯示
Etymology: A depiction of a frame-shaped altar, where the *gods* *manifest* their will | *show*; *indicate*; *display*; *express*. In dual-element characters, 示 nearly always functions as a reference to supernatural forces in general.

Meaning: god of the soil and altars to him; group of families; company, society
Examples: 報社 旅行社 社會
Etymology: As per 土# (pile of earth) + 示 altar/the supernatural | crowd thronging an (earthen) altar | *group of like-minded people*; (Shinto) *shrine*. Abbreviation for *company* is a Meiji-era coinage representing an extended sense of the term (group formed for a specific purpose).

The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a variant form of 見 (person whose sight is fixed upon an object he is being shown), the person here being understood as a *subject* or *retainer* | *retain* (a person); *serve* (as a retainer). As an independent character, 臣 is regarded as consisting of seven strokes, but some sources enumerate it as six when it appears as an element in a derivative character (compare the treatment of stroke counts in 此).

Meaning: to look at, look forward; to hope, expect
Examples: 希望 渴望 盼望
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 臣 (staring subject/retainer) + 人 person ← gaze at the moon. In the bronzeware inscription style, which adds 月 moon, the 臣 + 人 components have morphed into a single element. A seal inscription form adds 亡# (obscure) | *wish*; *hope*; *desire* (← hopes/desires with only obscure chances of realization).

Examples: 怎麼樣 怎麼 怎麼了

Etymology: 刀 sword/knife + a diagonal mark# emphasizing the flexible *blade* | *edge*. In 扨 and 靱, 刃 takes the form 刄, while in 牣, 訒 and 軔 it takes yet another form.

Examples: 忍耐 忍不住 忍受
Etymology: As per 刃# (flexible) + 心 heart/emotions | *bear*; *endure* (← heart that flexibly bears/endures burdens). *Stealth* and *concealment* are borrowed meanings | *secret*; *hide*; *incognito*; *sneak into/about*.

Examples: 認識 認真 認為
Etymology: 忍# endure + 言 words | *acknowledge* that something endures examination | *recognize*; *determine*; *knowledge* | *accept*; *approve*.

Examples: 報告 告訴 廣告
Etymology: 牛 cow + 口# mouth | cow bending its neck in lowing | *tell*; *inform*; *announce*; *signal* (← communicate in "speech").
A depiction of the legs of a table along with human legs spread from right to left. *Third in a series* and *third calendar sign* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 變更 更加 更動
Etymology: As per 丙# (spread) + 攴 action indicator | stretch a rope (compare the derivative character 綆, a rope attached to a well bucket). The meanings *replace* and *change* likely owe to the drawing of fresh well water to replace that which has been used, or dried up. (Still) *more* and *further(more)* are borrowed meanings, as are *grow late* and *stay up late*.

Examples: 考試 參考 思考
Etymology: A variant of 丂# as described in 号 (extend then bend) + 耂 an abbreviated form of 老 (aged) | elderly person with a bent back (compare 久). *Think* and *consider* are borrowed meanings, via 攷. Extended meanings include *idea*; *opinion*; *suggestion*; *intention*; *discretion*; *expectations*; *imagination*; *reflect on*; *prepare* (for); *intend to*; *expect* (that); *imagine* (that); and *contrive* (to). 考 also refers to one's deceased father; the character for one's deceased mother is 妣.

Examples: 溫度 程度 角度
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 庶 (pile) + 又 hand/action indicator | pile objects in small increments in measuring carefully | *measure*; *degree*; *times* | *whenever*.

Examples: 夫婦 功夫 大夫
Etymology: A depiction of an outstretched male (compare 大 stand outstretched) with a topknot | *mature male* | *husband*. The most ancient pronunciation of this term was PA (compare 母).

Examples: 難過 困難 難怪
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 漢 (stretch over a fire) + 隹 short, squat bird | bird stretched over a fire in being grilled | *difficult*; *disaster* (← tribulation as intense as being grilled over a fire) | *defect*; *flaw*; *misfortune*.

Examples: 反而 反應 相反
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 又 hand/action indicator + a thin sheet of wood | curve a thin piece of wood back upon itself | *bend back*; *return*; *warp*; *reverse*; *flutter*; *on the contrary*; *anti-* | *rebel*; *disobey*. *Counter for cloth or paddies/fields* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 出版
Etymology: As per 反# (thin sheet) + 片 (long piece of wood split down the middle) | *wooden slat*. Virtually the same as 板, except that 版 came to refer to woodblocks used in the printing process |  (printing) *block*; *printing* | *edition*.

Examples: 頭髮 手指頭 鐘頭
Etymology: 豆# bean + 頁 head | bean-shaped *head* | *head* (of a group); *leader*; *top*. Also, *hair* (on the head), *beginning* (compare 元), *brains*, *intellect* and *the mind*, as well as *counter for certain animals* (compare English "head of cattle").

Examples: 喜歡 恭喜 喜愛
Etymology: As per 壴# as described in 鼓 (round drum set on a stand) + 口 mouth | joyful voices at a feast with musical accompaniment | *joy*; *gladness*; *like*; *be fond of*; *pleasure*; *happiness* | *good*; *desirable*; *congratulations*.

Examples: 上午 中午 下午
Etymology: A depiction of a square-headed mallet, two or more of which would be used in alternation when pounding grain in the mortar framing the mallets. Latter half of a unit of measurement (e.g., for a group of twelve, 午 covers 7-12) as well as *11 A.M. to 1 P.M.* and *noon* are associated meanings in the sense of the alternating point of a given day. *Horse* (as the seventh sign of the Chinese zodiac) and *south* are borrowed meanings. In derivative characters such as 忤 and 許, 午 exerts the conceptual influence "yield," via the image of yielding so another person can carry out a task such as pounding grain.

Examples: 許多 也許 或許
Etymology: As per 午# (yield) + 言 words | yielding words | *allow*; *accept*; *acknowledge*; *admit*; *permit* | *forgive*; *pardon*; *excuse*.

Examples: 燈光 眼光 陽光
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines an abbreviated form# of 兄 (extend the arms) + 火 fire | extend the arms in holding up a torch | (radiant) *light*; *shine*; *ray*; *beam*; *flash*; *glimmer*; *glitter*; *glare*; *sparkle*.

Examples: 購買 買單 買賣
Etymology: As per 罒# net + 貝 commodities | seek to profit by buying (and then selling) | *buy*; *look for*.

Examples: 打算 就算 算了
Etymology: 祘 is a depiction of calculating sticks used by being placed in close, circular formation. The relevant seal inscription form of 筭 is an abbreviated form# of 祘 + an element combining 竹 bamboo and 廾 pair of hands | arrange bamboo calculating sticks in making calculations | *calculate*; *count* | *estimate*; *number*; *enumerate*; *rank*. The present form substitutes an abbreviated form of 具 (tool) in place of the calculating sticks element.

Examples: 右邊 左右 座右銘
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is as per 又# (the right hand/arm) + an object | *right* hand/arm (used in protecting).

Examples: 假若 若干 倘若
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a depiction of a supple young women combing her hair. A seal inscription form transforms the hair element into 艸 grass/plant and adds 口 (an object) below, probably under the influence of the seal inscription form of 右 | *youth* (← suppleness of youth) | *immature*. The minor meanings of *either/or*, *some ... while others ...*, and *if* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 體育 教育 發育
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the top element (now written �� )# is 子 child upside down, indicating a fetus filling then passing through the birth canal | *breeding*. *Raise*, *upbringing* and *growth* are associated meanings, with *foster* (growth) by extension. The addition of 肉 flesh is for emphasis/clarification.

Examples: 充實 補充 充分
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 育 (fetus filling then passing through the birth canal) + 儿 person (for emphasis/clarification) | fetus filling the birth canal | *fill* | *fulfill*; *satisfy* | *apply*; *allot*; *allocate* (← satisfy a requirement in need of being fulfilled) | *assign* (← allocate).

Examples: 傳統 系統 總統
Etymology: 充# fill + 糸 thread | unite/unify, likened to a full collection of threads | *control*; *rule over* | *totally*.

Examples: 記得 記者 記錄
Etymology: 己# arise + 言 words | words that rise from a writing medium | *notation*; *record*; *memory*; *mark*; *marker* | *write down*; *mention*.

Meaning: replace, replacement (of person or generation); era, generation
Examples: 代表 代替 古代
Etymology: As per 弋# (stake) + 人 person | rotate in keeping watch at a post marked by stakes | *substitute* (for); *alternate*; *take the place* (of); *replace*; *exchange* | *generation* (← one generation replacing the one that preceded it) | *price*; *money*; *materials* (← money exchanged for goods).
A vertical line cut by a horizontal one | slender objects produced by cutting. *Seven* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 老虎 馬虎
Etymology: A depiction of a *tiger*. The pronunciation of the character simulates a tiger's fierce roar. The classifier 虍 simplifies 虎 by eliminating the legs at the bottom. A variant form, 乕, appears in 逓, the Shinjitai form of 遞.

Examples: 號碼 掛號 符號
Etymology: As per 号# (cry; calling noise) + 虎 tiger | roaring tiger | *call*; *name* | *number*; *indicator*.

Examples: 處理 到處 好處
Etymology: 夂 leg/foot pointed downward + 几# desk/table | stop and rest on/against a desk, chair, or other furniture (compare 居) | *place*; *point in time* (place an object where it belongs). Later, 虍 tiger was appended to suggest the pronunciation, but the present form reverts to the original.

Examples: 公元 元旦 多元
Etymology: As per 兀# (head) + a horizontal line | *head* | *origin*; *cause*; *raw material*; *capital*; *prime element* (← head as source and beginning; compare 頭) | *former* (← prior ← original). 元 was devised to replace 兀 after the latter lost its original connection with the head.

Examples: 完成 完全 完畢
Etymology: As per 元# (round) + 宀 roof/building | be surrounded completely | *complete*; *fulfill*; *end*.

Examples: 接觸 接受 接著
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧㄝ ㄔㄨ`  ㄐㄧㄝ ㄕㄡ`  ㄐㄧㄝ ㄓㄜ˙
Etymology: As per 妾# (close proximity) + 手 hand/action indicator | *touch*; *contact*; *join*; *connect*; *associate*; *sexual intercourse*.

Examples: 計程車 計畫 計劃
Etymology: 十 (gather) + 言# words | speak in plotting | *plot*; *arrange* | *see to*; *handle*; *measure*; *weigh*; *judge*; *determine*; *total*; *accounts*.

Examples: 名字 十字路口 字典
Etymology: 子# child/offspring + 宀 roof/building | place in which to *raise* and increase the number of children* | *character* (← make one character after another by combining different elements) | *letter* | *small administrative unit* of a town/village (← small unit ← letter/character as one unit of a whole).

Examples: 老師 教師 廚師
Etymology: As per 帀# (march) + an abbreviated form of 追 pursue an enemy army | lead (marching) soldiers | *army*. *Teacher* is a borrowed meaning (compare 帥) | *study under*; *boss*.

Meaning: equal to; side by side; also, what is more; both
Examples: 並且 並列 並重
政治 政策 政黨
Etymology: As per 正# (straight) + 攵 action indicator | figuratively *straighten* in governing | *government*; *rule*.

Examples: 吃喝玩樂 開玩笑 玩具
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄔ ㄏㄜ ㄨㄢˊㄌㄜ`  ㄎㄞ ㄨㄢˊㄒㄧㄠ`  ㄨㄢˊㄐㄩ`
Etymology: As per 元# (round) + 玉 jewel | toy/*play with* a round gem (compare 弄) | *enjoy*; *take pleasure in* (compare 翫). Also, *trifle with* and *make sport of*.

Examples: 緊張 誇張 紙張
Etymology: 長# long + 弓 bow | *stretch* a bowstring | *spread*; *affix*. The many extended meanings include *tension*, *tautness*, *stiffness*, *will(power)*, *strain* (the nerves), *keep watch*, *exert influence*, *take/make a stand*, *put up/hang* (curtains/wallpaper etc.) and *lay* (flooring).

Examples: 男生 男人 男性
Etymology: 田# field + 力 power/energy | strong, limber *man* working a field.
As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 言 words | *who* (← demand to know another person's identity) | *whose*; *anyone*; *someone*.

Examples: 每每
吉他 吉利 吉祥
Etymology: A depiction of a (filled) container (compare 器) | *good luck*; *favorable* (← abundance ← abundant contents). In derivative characters such as 佶 桔 and 詰, 吉 exerts the conceptual influence "reduce/eliminate space." For the connection between abundance and good fortune, compare 祺.

Examples: 結婚 結束 結果
Etymology: As per 吉# (reduce/eliminate space) + 糸 thread | use thread or a cord to *bind/tie* and thus compact an object | *join*; *make/conclude* (a contract/treaty etc.) | *end*; *wind up* (← finish binding/joining).

Examples: 水晶
Etymology: A tripling of 日 sun, suggesting the *brightness* of multiple suns. *Crystal* derives from the compound 水晶.

Meaning: a star, planet; any point of light
Examples: 星期 星期天 星期日
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄒㄧㄥ ㄑㄧ   ㄒㄧㄥ ㄑㄧ ㄊㄧㄢ   ㄒㄧㄥ ㄑㄧ ㄖ`
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 晶# (brightness) + 生 (fresh) | fresh, bright, invigorating starlight | *star*. 星 is a scribal form simplification.

Examples: 非常 除非 非法
Etymology: A depiction of curved wings that spread in alignment to right and left | *not*; *non-*; *in-*; *un* (← brush off a request in objecting/refusing | *object*; *refuse*) | *fault*; *mistake*; *wrong*; *incorrect* (← negativity). Compare 不, as well as 拂.

Examples: 建立 建設 建議
Etymology: 聿 implement held upright to carve/draw characters (| upright object) + an abbreviated form# of 延 extend | extend vertically in making erect (compare 寒) | *build/erect* | *establish*.

Examples: 改變 改進 改善
Etymology: 己# arise + 攵 (strike) | strike to arouse/raise, inaugurating a *reform* or amendment (compare 變) | *amend*; *renew*; *anew*; *correct* | *replace*; *improve*; *change*; *check*; *again*; *another time* | *be formal/ceremonious*.

Examples: 連續劇 一連 連接
Etymology: 車 here an abbreviated form# of 陣 (military vehicles in tight rows) + 辵 movement | rows of military vehicles on the move | *be/put in a row*; *be lined up*; *range*; *arrange*; *link* | *be involved*; *be accompanied/taken*; *companion*; *regiment* | *attend* (← be one of many attendees).

Examples: 放假 放心 開放
Etymology: As per 方# (spread) + 攵 (strike) | strike an object, causing pieces to spread/*scatter* in all directions | *release*; *set free* | *reach*; *fire* (a gun); *expel*; *leave up to*.
As per 合# (press/fit together) + 口 mouth | press the lips together in sucking in air (compare 吸, 歙 and 噏). The *opening and closing of a fish's mouth* is a borrowed meaning | *school of fish*.

Examples: 生活 活動 活該
Etymology: As per 舌# (chisel-like implement in motion) + 水 water | break a container with a chisel-like implement, creating an active flow of the liquid contents | *activity* | *life*.

Meaning: in, on, at; go to; surname
Etymology: A depiction of an object that stretches before bending into a U-shape. *Here*, *from*, *interrogative particle*, *go*, and *exclamation of lament* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 石頭 石油 鑽石
Etymology: A depiction of a *rock* or *stone* beneath a cliff, suggesting a substantial pile of rocks/stones. *Sterile/barren* is by association (← rocky, barren soil), as is *rigid* (← rigid objects). *Unit of volume* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 研究 研究所 鑽研
Etymology: As per 幵# (grind) + 石 stone | *grind* a stone | *hone*; *polish*; *sharpen* | *wash rice* (← remove impurities ← polish).

Meaning: build; establish; display; particle of hypothesis, supposing
Examples: 建設 設備 設計
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a chisel + an element combining a hand and a bar | chisel an object into shape | *make*; *create* | *establish*; *provide*; *equipment*; *facilities*. By the time of the seal inscription forms, the chisel has become 言 words, with the hand/bar element developing into 殳.

Examples: 陳列
Etymology: Originally 攴 action indicator + an element# doubling 柬 sack | line up sacks/sandbags in tight rows | *state*; *explain* (← line up words ← line up sacks/sandbags) | *old* (← line up objects and leave them behind to rot). The present form replaces the doubled 柬 element with 東 (another character originally indicating a sack) and for 攴 substitutes 阜 piled earth.

Examples: 幸福 不幸 幸好
Etymology: A depiction of handcuffs for confining the movement of prisoners. *Good fortune* and *happiness* are extended meanings (← a prisoner's good fortune to escape his handcuffs).

Examples: 報紙 報告 報名
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 服 (spread over) + 幸 (handcuffs) | spread a restraining device over part of a criminal's body in *retribution* for a crime | *retaliation*; *recompense*; *remunerate* | *reward*. Also, *report* and *announce* (← report/announce punitive measures taken).

Examples: 專心 專業 專家
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄓㄨㄢ ㄒㄧㄣ   ㄓㄨㄢ ㄧㄝ`  ㄓㄨㄢ ㄐㄧㄚ
Etymology: 叀# is a depiction of a heavy, round stone tied to and hanging from a spindle by a cord that rotates | round/rotating object. 專 adds 寸 hand/action indicator | handle a round, rotating object | *exclusive*; *dedicated* (← handle a single object) | *monopolize*.

Examples: 運轉 轉變 轉播
Etymology: As per 專# (round and/or rotating object) + 車 vehicle | rotating/revolving wheels of a vehicle | *revolve*; *turn*; *transfer*; *convey*; *move*; *shift*; *change* (direction) | *roll (over)*; *fall down*; *knock down*; *fall down* (← object/person struck by a moving vehicle).

Examples: 政黨 黨派 黨員
Etymology: As per 尚# (rise | raise) + 黑 black (dark) | clandestinely raise supporters | *party*; *group*; *faction*; *fellow* | *favor*.

Examples: 主旨 宗旨
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 匕# double-pronged eating implement + 甘 (sweet food contained in the mouth) | ladle out sweet/rich food | *tasty*. *Contents*, *purport*, *aim*, *will*, *to the effect that*, *instructions* and *principle* are all borrowed meanings.

Examples: 手指 手指頭 戒指
Etymology: As per 旨# (ladle) + 手 hand/action indicator | *point to* or *indicate* something with a long, thin object such as a ladle or a *finger* (compare 將) | *designate*; *name*; (in shogi/chess etc.) (make a) *move*. Also, *head for* (← head for a designated point).

Examples: 變成 變更 變化
Etymology: As per 䜌# as described in 戀 (tangled) + 攵 (strike) | strike in an attempt to untangle a volatile situation, that leads to *change* (compare 改) | *unusual*; *unusual/wondrous event*; *political event*; *internal disturbance*.

Examples: 米飯 米粉 玉米
Etymology: A depiction of fruits of grain (rice), concealed in husks/hulls | *crop grain* | *rice*. *America* is via the phonetic construction 亜米利加 (亞米利加).

Examples: 天氣 冷氣 冷氣機
Etymology: 气# steam + 米 rice | vapors rising from steaming rice | *breath*; *spirit* | *vitality*; *mood*.

Examples: 考試 嘗試 筆試
Etymology: 式# ceremony + 言 words | make a formal *attempt* | *trial*; *test*.

Examples: 瀑布 宣布
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 父# (spread) + 巾 cloth | *cloth* *spread* over an object.

Examples: 希望
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows two sets of intersecting lines + 巾# cloth | long piece of cloth (compare 衣) with fine cross-stitches | *rare* (← rare, high-quality cloth) | *desire*/*hope* (← desire/hope to obtain something rare).

Examples: 精神 神話 神經
Etymology: As per 申# (bolt of lightning) + 示 altar/the supernatural | supernatural force associated with lightning/thunder | *mysterious power*; *God*; *god* | *mind*; *supreme* | *ancestor*; *soul of the dead*. In the dual-element characters 榊 and 鰰, 神 appears in variant form.

Examples: 文化 變化 化妝品
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a fallen person aligned with a seated person. A seal inscription form has a standing person aligned with another person, the latter assuming a curious pose. The meanings *transformation*, *change*, *assume a disguise*, *bewitch* and *deceive* suggest that the two figures depicted in 化 are one and the same individual, who has undergone a transformation in posture or appearance.

Examples: 禮物 食物 動物
Etymology: As per 勿# (obscure) + 牛 cow | obscure (= unremarkable) cow | *thing(s)*; *object(s)* (← things/objects of unremarkable characteristics).

Meaning: trust to, rely on, appoint; to bear, duty, office; allow
Examples: 任何 擔任 任務
Etymology: As per 壬# (encompass) + 人 person (| human agency) | encompass/bear *responsibility* | *duty* | *undertake* (← undertake a duty/responsibility) | *entrust*; *leave* (up to another) (← entrust/leave up to another a duty or responsibility) | *leave to chance*; *endure* (← endure a duty).

Examples: 菜單 簡單 單純
Etymology: A depiction of a flat hunting weapon, made of rattan, used to beat birds out of the sky with a fanning motion | *simple* (← simple weapon) | *single*; *individual*; *only*.

Examples: 世界 去世 過世
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows the top half of 枼 as described in 葉 (thin, flat leaves piled upon each other), suggesting successive generations figuratively piled one atop the other | *one generation* | *era* | *successive*; *for generations*; *life*; *the world* (← successive generations that make up life/the world; compare 葉 as well as 祖).
A depiction of a small, curved *boat* | *ship*.

Examples: 受傷 接受 感受
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 舟# (curved) boat (here a shape indicator suggesting a large, curved object) + an element combining 爪 claw/hand and 又 hand/action indicator | *receive/accept* a large, curved object | *receptacle*; *catch* (a ball); *popularity* (← receive general acceptance) | *reputation*; *be a success*. Also, *sustain* (damage) (← be on the receiving end of a damaging act) and *support(ing)* (← accept a supporting role), as well as *undergo* and *take an exam* (←be on the receiving end of a trying experience/exam) | *pass an exam*.

Examples: 附近 最近 接近
Etymology: As per 斤# (adhere) + 辵 movement | draw *near/close*.

Examples: 意義 義務 道義
Etymology: As per 我# (bladed weapon) + 羊 sheep | use a bladed weapon to sacrifice a sheep in a ceremony | *honor*; *justice*; *meaning*.

Examples: 歹徒
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is a variant of 冎 (bone circulating in its joint) + a line# indicating severance | *severed bone* | *bone*; *death* (resulting from the body being severed). Also, *bad/wicked* (← wicked deed).

Examples: 死亡 該死 生死
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines an abbreviated form# of 比 line up (people) + 歹 severed bone/death | a line of corpses | *death* | *die*; *execute*.

Examples: 便宜 方便 便條
Etymology: The right-hand element was originally an element of uncertain composition, but the Old Chinese pronunciation of 便 suggests that this element conveyed the concept "spread" (compare 丙, a constituent element of 更). 便 adds 人 person (| human agency) | cause to spread | *pass smoothly* | *excrement* (← offal that passes smoothly out of the body) | *easy*/*at ease* (← pass smoothly/easily) | *convenient*; *expedient* (← make something easy). Also, *letter*, *message* and *news* (of/from) (← pass word from one place to another).

Examples: 挑戰 戰爭 戰場
Etymology: As per 單# (weapon) + 戈 spear/halberd | use various weapons to beat enemies into submission or to death | *fight*; *war*.

Examples: 洞穴
Etymology: 宀 roof/building + 八# split right and left | remove dirt in digging a *hole* for a cave dwelling.

Examples: 空氣 有空 航空
Etymology: As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 穴 hole | *empty* *space* inside a connecting pipe/tube | *vacant* | *sky*; *the air*; | *absent-minded*; *pretend* (← no substance).

Examples: 排隊 軍隊 部隊
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 遂 (heavy object) + 阜 piled earth | heavy pile of earth that collapses to the ground (compare 隋). *Unit* is either via association (e.g. a collapsed earthen structure perceived as the ruins of a single unit) or borrowing | *corps* (← a unit of soldiers).

Examples: 跟進 跟前
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + 足 leg/foot | *heel* (← body part that adheres to the ground) | *follow*; *accompany* (← follow on the heels of another).

Examples: 山谷 峽谷
Etymology: As per 口# (cavity) + 八 split right and left (doubled) | a circular cavity in the earth from which water spouts | *sunken fountainhead*; *valley*; *ravine*; *canyon* (← sunken spot).

Examples: 北部 北邊 北方
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows two figures, one with his back turned | turn one's back to the enemy and flee (along a winding course) | *flee* | *north* (← flee to the north; or, turn one's back to the cold north wind) | *go northward*.

Examples: 必須 必要 不必
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows an object split in two by 弋 stake or another stakelike implement. *Sure*, *certain*, *by all means* and *not fail to* are all borrowed meanings.

Examples: 未來 未婚 未必
Etymology: A depiction of a tree with a diminutive, curved, and minutely visible branch obscured on top | *not yet*; *not be* (← not yet fully visible). *Sheep* (as the eighth sign of the Chinese zodiac) and *1 P.M. to 3 P.M.* are borrowed meanings. Originally the same character as 末.

Examples: 作業 職業 畢業
Etymology: A depiction of a stand with notched wooden supports on both ends. Heavy bells and/or drums were suspended from a wooden bar that was placed atop of (and connected) a pair of such stands (compare 對), exerting pressure upon the notches | *work/act* (← create notches) | *skill*; *occupation*. Also, *karma* (← result of acts taken).

Examples: 功課 成功 功夫
Etymology: 工# work + 力 power/energy | accomplish a job/piece of work | *achievement*; *merit*; *fruits*; *good deed*.

Examples: 描寫 編寫 書寫
Etymology: Variant# of 舃 (double/pile up) + 宀 roof/building | pile goods indoors | *copy*; *duplicate*; *transcribe* (← pile atop). Also, *photograph*, *project* (on) and *transfer/move*.

Examples: 風景 背景 景色
Etymology: As per 京# (expansive) + 日 sun/day | expansive *view* obtainable on a bright, clear day | *scene*.

Examples: 電影 電影院 影響
Etymology: As per 景# (expansive) + 彡 pattern | *image*; *reflection*; *figure*; *trace*; *shape* (← expansive images of patterns in reflection) | *shadow* (← emphasis on the shaded rather than the light portion, the reverse being the case for *light*). Compare 映.

Examples: 聲音 大聲 聲調
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of 殸# combines a suspended piece of slate used as a percussion instrument with a hand holding a stick used to beat the slate and produce sound that carries over a great distance. A seal inscription form adds 耳 ear | (musical) *sound* that carries over a distance and enters the ear | *voice* | *rumor*; *reputation*.

Examples: 平常 平安 平等
Etymology: A depiction of a water weed spread flat upon the surface of water | *level*; *flat* | *fair*; *calm*; *usual* | *common*; *ordinary*.

Examples: 櫃臺 舞臺
Etymology: 至# (arrow) + an abbreviated form of 高 tall/high | raise a tall *platform* from which to shoot arrows | *pedestal*.

Meaning: to discuss; ask for, beg; demand; dun; marry
Examples: 討論 討厭 探討
Etymology: Originally, 寸 hand/action indicator + a bladed instrument# (now styled 言; compare 誅) | carry out an armed *attack* | *subjugate*; *avenge oneself*.

Meaning: color, tint, hue, shade; form, body; beauty, desire for beauty
Examples: 顏色 黃色 白色
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 巴# (spread) atop a second figure | two persons copulating | *sex*; *lover*; *mistress* | *looks*; *appearance* (← motive factors stimulating the sex drive) | *color* (← complexion ← appearance).

Examples: 否則 規則 原則
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 鼎 tripod kettle/cauldron + a knife beside it for cutting food or other objects (compare 析). *Rule* and *law* are abstract, extended meanings (← abide by/*follow* norms closely ← be beside/in line with something) | *at once*; *if so*.

Examples: 容易 內容 形容
Etymology: As per 谷# (cavity) + 宀 roof/building | empty building into which voluminous goods are placed | *put in*; *contents*; *volume* | *contain*; *accept* | *appearance* (← shape of objects in a container).

Examples: 檔案
市場 城市 超級市場
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 止# (stand straight) and 平 (spread level/flat) | straight line of stalls/shops comprising a *market* | *buying/selling*; *transaction*; *have dealings* | *city* (← place where many gather). There is no etymological connection with 姉.

Examples: 福利 利益 利用
Etymology: 禾 here an abbreviated form# of 季 season (| season when soil is plowed) + 刀 sword/knife | sharp-edged plow | *work* (well/skillfully); *sharp*; *convenience*; *profit*; *advantage*; *be able to*; *be effective* (← sharp, effective implement).

Examples: 高興 興趣 感興趣
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 同 same + 與# (raise in unison) | work together to *raise*, *build* or *promote* | *interest*; *prosperity* (← raise interest; build up funds). *Prevalent* is an extended meaning.
厶 here a shape indicator + 弓# (flexible) bow | widen a bow by drawing back on its bowstring | *wide*; *big*; *widen*; *broaden*; *spread*. Compare 宏.

Examples: 加強 堅強 強盜
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is a shape indicator suggesting the horned head of a beetle + 虫 insect | beetle. A seal inscription form adds 弓# bow, functioning as an abbreviated form of 彊 (strong, tautly stretched bow), leading to the meanings *strong*, *strength*, and *force* | *compel*; *coerce*; *intensify*. Returning to the seal inscription form, this referred to a hardshelled beetle, making 強 弓 + a variant form of the bronzeware inscription character (beetle).

Examples: 安靜 安全 安定
Etymology: 宀# roof/building + 女 woman | woman resting/at ease indoors | *be at ease/peace* | *cheap*; *inexpensive* (← cheap enough to be purchased with ease).

Examples: 中央 央求
Etymology: 大 stand outstretched + a bar-like object | person standing outstretched, a pole with heavy objects at both ends extending beyond the shoulders | *center*; *middle* (← pressure exerted on the center of the body).

Examples: 特別 獨特 特地
Etymology: As per 寺# (stand straight) + 牛 cow | particularly tall bull, surpassing others | *special*; *excellent*; *outstanding*. For the idea of being excellent in the sense of surpassing, compare 卓.

Examples: 會議 建議 抗議
Etymology: As per 義# (ceremony) + 言 words | ceremonious *deliberation* | *debate* | *dispute*.

Examples: 辛苦 辛勤 辛酸
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄒㄧㄣ ㄎㄨˇ  ㄒㄧㄣ ㄑㄧㄣˊ  ㄒㄧㄣ ㄙㄨㄢ
Etymology: A depiction of a needle or a *sharp* knife/cutting tool, one adhering to or in close proximity to the object it is about to cut | *bitter*; *spicy*; *harsh*; *pungent* | *mustard*; *tough*; *painful*; *barely*. *Eighth in a series* and *eighth calendar sign* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 辦公室 辦法 怎麼辦
Etymology: As per 辡# as described in 弁 (split) + 力 power/energy | split/*partition* a work force into units and *perform* a task | *manage*.
As per 襾# (covered container) + 貝 commodities | commodities in a covered container | *buy*; *trade*; *merchant*.

Examples: 價格 價錢 價值
Etymology: 賈# buy; trade + 人 person | merchant evaluating (= setting a *price/value* on) commodities.

Examples: 總是 總而言之 總算
Etymology: 糸 thread + 悤# as described in 窓 (compression) | compress/*tighten* threads into a unified tassel | *unify*; *overall*; *total*; *general* (← pull a variety of objects into a single unit; compare 惣) | *control*. For the image of compression/compaction vis–à–vis threads, compare 縮.

Examples: 傳真 傳統 傳播
Etymology: As per 專# (round and/or rotating object) + 人 person (| human agency) | *transmit/convey* (in the manner of an object rolling from place to place) | *tell*; *pass along/hand down* (knowledge); *introduce* (knowledge); *spread* (to) | *follow* (a course); *go along*; *travel* (along a course). Also, *tradition*, *legend* and *biography*.

Examples: 意思 不好意思 思考
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows that the top element was originally not 田 field but a depiction of a profusion of fine bones in fontanels, open spaces in an infant's skull over which the skull bones eventually fuse; compare 兒. 思 adds 心 heart/emotions | finely detailed thoughts | *think*; *consider*; *believe* | *be sunk in thought*. Compare 慮.

Examples: 花園 花心 開花
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄏㄨㄚ ㄩㄢˊ  ㄏㄨㄚ ㄒㄧㄣ   ㄎㄞ ㄏㄨㄚ
Etymology: 化# transformation + 艸 grass/plant | *flower/blossom* (← part of a plant that undergoes a slow transformation).

Examples: 叫喊 叫好
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of 丩 shows it to be twisted threads. 叫 is 口 mouth +丩# for the sound alone to simulate a cry or calling noise (compare 号) | *yell*; *cry out*; *shout*; *scream*  | *call*; *name* (in derogatory senses); *appeal* (for); *clamor*.
An abbreviated form of 保 (protect a child). *Absent-minded*, *be dumbfounded*, *dull(minded*) and *stupid* are via the non-comprehending expression of an infant.

Examples: 保險 保護 保守
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 子# child + 人 person | child protected by being wrapped in a cloth (compare the replacement character 褓) and carried on the back of an adult | *protect*; *protection* | *preserve*; *maintain*; *retain*; *keep*. For the idea of enveloping a child in protection, compare 孚.

Examples: 成份 份兒 身份
Etymology: 分# portion + 人 person (| human agency) | *portion* out. *Harmony between the inner and outer person* is via reinterpretation, in the sense of contentment with one's allotted portion in life.
A depiction of a hand bumping up against something then bending or curving. *Nine* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 講究 研究 究竟
Etymology: As per 九# (bump up against and bend/curve) + 穴 hole | fumble about in the far reaches of a hole in seeking something (compare 探) | *investigate*; *research* (compare 考) | *master* (a discipline). Compare also 奧.
口 mouth + 可# for the sound alone to simulate a loud exhalation | *blow upon*. Also, *laugh* and *scold* (both, in a loud voice).

Examples: 電子郵件 條件 文件
Etymology: 牛 cow + 人# person | person sorting the meat and bones of a dismembered cow carcass (compare 解) | *item*; *case* (← sort through one by one).

Examples: 決定 解決 堅決
Etymology: As per 夬# (scoop out) + 水 water | scoop out earth in breaching a dam | *decide*; *determine*; *settle* (← cut through to a decision ← cut an opening; compare 判, 斷, 裁 and 折).

Examples: 小組 組織 組裝
Etymology: As per 且# (pile) + 糸 thread | threads piled in braiding (compare 素) | *braid* | *put together*; *assemble*; *construct*; *cooperate*; *set*; *suit*; *assortment*; *group of people* |  *class*; *crew*; *party*; *company*.

Examples: 年級 超級市場 超級
Etymology: As per 及# (press on) + 糸 thread | pieces of fabric of various quality, pressing on each other in being inspected | *rank*; *class*; *grade* (← levels of quality) | *head* (← make promotions contingent on the taking of heads on the battlefield).

Examples: 堅持 維持 保持
Etymology: As per 寺# (stand straight by) + 手 hand/action indicator | *hold* an object upright | *bear*; *carry*; *own*; *possess*; *have* | *last*; *keep*; *remain edible*; *preserve* (← keep on a lasting basis) | *durability* (← lasting); *be popular* (← have lasting fame). Also, *have someone bring* (← have another carry ← carry), *hold out* (← last), *be in/take charge* (← have firmly in hand); *pay for* (← bear the expense); *be propertied/wealthy* (← possess assets).
A depiction of the slender, limber figure of a running youth (compare 允) | *young*. *Die young* and *calamity* are borrowed meanings via 殀.

Examples: 開玩笑 微笑 笑話
Etymology: As per 夭# (slender and limber) + 竹 bamboo | slender, flexible bamboo. 笑 came to assume the  meanings of a separate character that added 口 mouth and meant the same thing as the predecessor of 咲 (open the mouth slightly in smiling/laughing) | *smile*; *laugh*.

Examples: 投資 投票 投入
Etymology: As per 殳# (throw) + 手 hand/action indicator | *throw*; *fling*; *cast* | (cause to) *stay* (← throw and cause to stick in place) | *sell at a loss* (← practically throw away).

Examples: 哪裡 哪兒 哪些
辦公室 教室 臥室
Etymology: 至# stopping point + 宀 roof/building | *room*/chamber representing a stopping point (i.e. leading on to no other rooms) in a *house* | *deep cavern* (compare 窒); *cellar* | *greenhouse*. Also, *dynastic family* (compare 家).

Examples: 房屋 屋子
Etymology: 至 here a variant of 侯# (lumpy object) + 尸 shape indicator (| cover) | lumpy covering object, such as the *roof* of a *house* or *shop* | *cover*; *business*. Also, *dealer* and *seller* (← the same semantic progression from "house/place of business" to "tradesman" as found in 家).

Meaning: descriptive of crying or of crowing
slip of paper or bamboo; ticket
Examples: 發票 郵票 鈔票
Etymology: Originally, an abbreviated form# of 要 (compress) + 火 fire | fine/light particles that rise from an object compressed by flames | *slip*; *ballot*; *vote* (← tiny pieces of paper or wood used as tickets or for balloting). 火 was later replaced with 示 altar/the supernatural.

Meaning: a mark, symbol, label, sign; standard
Examples: 標準 標題 標誌
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄅㄧㄠ ㄓㄨㄣˇ  ㄅㄧㄠ ㄊㄧˊ  ㄅㄧㄠ ㄓ`
Etymology: As per 票# (rise) + 木 tree/wood | raised, wooden *sign* | *mark*.

Examples: 流行 交流 流汗
Etymology: 㐬# is as per �� as described in 育 (newborn baby) + 川 river (| flowing water) | flow of amniotic fluid accompanying a fetus passing through the birth canal. The further addition of 水 water is to expand the scope of the term to that of a heavy *flow* of water | *float*; *pour* | *trendy*; *school* (of thought, art etc.); *style*; *rank*; *grade*. Other extended meanings include *wash off/away*; *circulate*; *wander*; *passage* (of time); *descent*; *distribute*; *divert*; *stroll*; *cruise*; and (a) *sink*.

Examples: 支持 支出 支票
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄓ ㄔˊ  ㄓ ㄔㄨ   ㄓ ㄆㄧㄠ`
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 又# hand/action indicator + a branch | skillfully manipulate a *branch* | *support* (← branch-like, Y-shaped object used as a support); *hold* (in check) (← forked stick that keeps an enemy at bay).

Examples: 獨特 獨立 獨自
Etymology: As per 蜀# (adhere) + 犬 dog/beast | adhere to one spot (compare 主 and 豆) in the manner of a *solitary* watchdog | *(a)lone*. *Germany* is via the phonetic construction 獨逸 (独逸).

Examples: 樹苗
Etymology: 艸# grass/plant + 田 field | sprouts/seedlings (obscured) in a field | *seedling*; *shoot*; *young plant* | *family*; *blood relations*.

Examples: 熊貓
Etymology: 豸 animal that ambles along the ground + 苗# for the sound alone to simulate the mewing of a *cat*.

Examples: 卡片 信用卡 卡車
需要 需求
Etymology: As per 而# (soft and droopy) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | be drenched and become soft and droopy. *Demand* and *require* are borrowed meanings.
As per 五# (cross) + 口 mouth | crossing of words in conversation. *I*, *my*, *our*, *one's own*, *oneself*, and *ego* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 語言 華語 語法
Etymology: As per 吾# (crossing of words) + 言 words | the crossing of words in conversation | *converse*; *talk*; *tell* | *narrate*; *saying*; *word*; *language*. 語 was devised to replace 吾.

Examples: 海邊 海報 海灘
Etymology: As per 毎# (dark) + 水 water | dark *sea/ocean* | *lake*; *vast*; *dense assemblage of objects*.

Examples: 電線 光線 界線
Etymology: 綫 is per 戔# (fine/slight) + 糸 thread | fine *thread*. 線 is a variant form with the same core meaning as 綫 but with the associated nuance of "slender line" | *line* | *clue*; *lead*. In 線, 戔 is replaced by 泉.

Examples: 黃色 黃豆 黃昏
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines an arrow + an abbreviated form# of 光 (light extending from a torch) | flaming arrow extending through the air in flight | *yellow* (← color of the flames).

Examples: 參加 參觀 參考
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄘㄢ ㄐㄧㄚ   ㄘㄢ ㄍㄨㄢ   ㄘㄢ ㄎㄠˇ
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 彡# (hair fully layered over the head) + a depiction of a young woman with three slender hairpins thrust deep into and commingling with her hair (compare 潛 and 妻) | *three* | *join*; *mix*; *meet* (← groups of three people commingling in coming, going or visiting ← three pins commingled in the hair) | *come*; *go*; *visit*; *obey*. As with 壱, 弐, and 拾, this character is used as a substitute for the usual number (in this case, 三) in documents as a precaution against forgery.

Examples: 一般 一般來說 一般而言
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄧ ㄅㄢ   ㄧ ㄅㄢ ㄌㄞˊㄕㄨㄛ   ㄧ ㄅㄢ ㄦˊㄧㄢˊ
Etymology: The element at left was originally not 舟 but a rounded tray. 殳 action indicator was added to suggest "*carry*/transport a tray on which objects are *spread out*" (compare 販, in which goods are spread on a board for sale) | *circle*; *(in) general*; *all* (← spread of objects from a starting point).

Examples: 命令 法令 禁令
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 今 (contain in the mouth) + 卩 kneeling figure | kneeling figure listening carefully to a long sequence of commands issuing from the mouth of a ruler | *command*; *order*; *rule*; *leader*.

Meaning: life; destiny, fate, luck; an order, instruction
Examples: 救命 革命 生命
Etymology: Abbreviated form# of 名 (reveal oneself) + 令 (receive a long sequence of commands) | receive a revelatory *command*/*order* from an unseen god | *calling/mission*; *fate* | *life*. Also, *name* (← name in ordering) | *word*.

Examples: 電視 電視機 重視
Etymology: Originally 示 altar/the supernatural + part of a compass-like implement (now written 見; compare 規) | compass-like implement used in divination rites | *sight*; *vision* (← envision the future).

Examples: 參觀 觀察 觀點
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄘㄢ ㄍㄨㄢ   ㄍㄨㄢ ㄔㄚˊ  ㄍㄨㄢ ㄉㄧㄢˇ
Etymology: As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 見 see | panoramic *view* (compare 睘 as described in 環) | *look*; *see*; *appearance*.

Examples: 聯絡 聯合 聯合國
Etymology: Abbreviated form# of 關 connect + 耳 ear | chain of linked ears, severed from the heads of enemy warriors (compare 馘) | *connect*; *join*; *align*.

Examples: 電腦 腦子 大腦
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 惱 (brain) + 肉 flesh (for emphasis/clarification) | brains | *brain* | *head*; *main*.

Examples: 朋友 小朋友
Etymology: A depiction of a long string of shells threaded together and spread in alignment (compare 貫, also seashells pierced and strung together). *Friend* and *companion* are extended meanings (← figurative string of friends/companions).

Examples: 價格 風格 性格
Etymology: As per 各# (come to a stop) + 木 tree/wood | wooden stick used to stop the doors of a gate (compare 閣) | *be stopped up*; *be blocked* (with); *standard*; *rank* (← stick used as a standard of length) | *substance*; *frame-shaped* | *correct*; (grammatical) *case*.

Examples: 女兒 兒子 一點兒
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows, as depicted in 思, a profusion of fine bones in fontanels (open spaces in an infant's skull over which the skull bones eventually fuse) + 儿 person | *infant*; (very young) *child*.

Examples: 修改 修理 修正
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄒㄧㄡ ㄍㄞˇ  ㄒㄧㄡ ㄌㄧˇ  ㄒㄧㄡ ㄓㄥ`
Etymology: As per 攸# (slender and curved) + 彡 pattern | *arrange* in a slender, curving pattern | *practice*; *master* | *govern/conduct oneself*.

Examples: 飲料 材料 資料
Etymology: 米 rice + 斗# ladle | *measure* out rice by ladling it | *material* (← measure grain and prepare it as the basis for a meal); *salary* (← measured grain given in compensation for services; compare 稟) | *fee*; *charge*.

Examples: 錢包 價錢 零錢
Etymology: As per 戔# (fine/slight) + 金 metal | small/fine pieces of metal | coinage | *money*; *change*; (type of) *unit of money*.

Examples: 失戀 失去 迷失
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 手 hand/action indicator + a line slanting downward | (by means of beating/flogging etc.) cause a person to *slip*/lose his footing (compare 跌) | *lose* | *miss* (an opportunity) | *mistake*.

Examples: 乞丐
Etymology: Originally, the same character as 乙 (vapors rising and hitting a blocking element; compare 气). *Request* and *beg* are borrowed meanings (compare 匃).

Examples: 好吃 吃飽 吃喝玩樂
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄏㄠˇㄔ   ㄔ ㄅㄠˇ  ㄔ ㄏㄜ ㄨㄢˊㄌㄜ`
Etymology: As per 乞# (rise and hit a blocking element) + 口 mouth | *stammer* (i.e., the breath temporarily and figuratively blocked; compare 詘). Also, *eat* (← stuff one's mouth).

Meaning: reside, live at, dwell, lodge; stop
Examples: 居住 記住 忍不住
Etymology: As per 主# (stationary) + 人 person | person remaining stationary | *dwell*; *reside*; *inhabit*; *live* | *remain put*; *house*; *home*; *address*; *dwelling*.

Examples: 即將 即使 立即
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 卩# (kneeling figure) immediately beside (or, depending on vantage point, opposite) a table piled high with food | *immediate* | *accession* (← draw into immediate proximity). *Namely* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 另外
記錄 錄取 錄音
Etymology: As per 彔# (pare/strip) + 金 metal | pare away the outer layer of bronzeware in making inscriptions | *inscribe*; *record*.

Examples: 避免 免費 以免
Etymology: Abbreviated form# of 奐 (draw a fetus out of/away from the womb) + 儿 person (| human agency) | assist the escape of a fetus from its mother by drawing it out of/away from the birth canal | *escape/be rescued from* | *avoid*; *evade*; *elude* | *exempt* (← escape from an obligation).

Examples: 交換 換取
Etymology: As per 奐# (draw out of/away from) + 手 hand/action indicator | *change*, *replace*, *exchange* or *substitute* one object for another after drawing the old one out of its position.

Examples: 基本 基礎 基督教
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧ ㄅㄣˇ  ㄐㄧ ㄔㄨˇ  ㄐㄧ ㄉㄨ ㄐㄧㄠ`
Etymology: As per 其# (square/rectangular) + 土 earth | square, earthen *foundation* | *basis*; *origin*.

Meaning: plank, board; iron or tin plate
Examples: 老板 黑板 地板
Etymology: As per 反# (thin sheet) + 木 tree/wood | wooden sheet/*board*. Compare 版.

Examples: 奴隸
Etymology: 女# woman + 又 hand/action indicator | *female servant/slave* engaged in strenuous activity.

Examples: 拿手
Etymology: As per 合 (press/fit together) + 手 hand/action indicator | *grab* a slave | *catch* | *arrest*. Originally, the character was written 拏, with 奴 in place of 合, suggesting the use of the hand in strenuous activity. Some dictionaries continue to give 拏 as standard, with 拿 noted as a variant form.

Examples: 永遠 跳遠 遠大
Etymology: As per 袁# (wrap about/enclose) + 辵 movement | move a great *distance* within enclosed territory (compare 運, 還, and 逭) | *distant*; *far*.

Examples: 結束 束縛 約束
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 木# tree/wood + a cord for bundling | compact firewood by wrapping a cord around it | *bundle* | *restrict*; *refrain*; *counter* (for bundled objects).

Examples: 高速 速度 加速
Etymology: As per 束# (compact) + 辵 movement | time compacted/compressed in rushing about (compare 走 and 怱) | *fast*; *quick*; *speedy* | *prompt*; *immediately*; *speed*. For the connection between compaction/compression and running, also compare 趨.

Examples: 地形 情形 形容
Etymology: As per 开# as described in 刑 (frame) + 彡 pattern | (frame-like and other, various) shapes and patterns | *shape*; *pattern*; *form*; *style*.

Examples: 咳嗽
Etymology: 口 mouth + 亥# for the sound alone to simulate a *cough*. Also, *clear one's throat*.

Examples: 孩子 小孩
Etymology: As per 亥# (stretched taut) + 子 child | *baby* suckling at a taut, milk-filled breast | *babyish*; *immature*.

Examples: 準備 設備 預備
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form of the right-hand element# is a depiction of arrows spread through a quiver; compare 箙. 備 adds 人 person (| human agency) | *equip/ready* a soldier | *prepare*; *provide*; *possess*.

Examples: 哥哥 大哥 大哥大
Etymology: As per 可# (shout/laugh/sing in a loud voice) doubled | *sing*. *Elder brother* is a borrowed meaning, the doubling of the pronunciation of the character 可 matching a babyspeak appellation for older brother in ancient China.

Examples: 唱歌 歌曲 歌星
Etymology: As per 哥# (sing) + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure | *sing* | *song* | *poem*; *tanka*. 歌 was devised to express the original meaning of 哥 after the latter was borrowed to express "elder brother."

Examples: 信封 封建 封閉
Etymology: 寸 here an abbreviated form of 付 (set in place) + 圭# (cone-shaped) | conical object set in place | *mound*; *tomb*; *confine* | *fief* (← place where a lord declares his sovereignty over a territory; compare 邦). *Seal* is a borrowed meaning.

Meaning: to help, assist; to defend; shoe upper
Examples: 幫忙 幫助
確定 確認 正確
Etymology: 隺 combines 隹 short, squat bird + 冖 cover that obscures | bird obscured by a covering/overhanging object. 確 is as per 隺# (framing object that obscures/is obscured) + 石 stone | obscuring stone wall. *Verify*; *ascertain*, *certain*, *positive*, *reliable* and *sound* (of mind/health) are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 時候 有時候 問候
Etymology: As per 侯# (lumpy object) + a person (| human agency) | inspect a lumpy or otherwise conspicuous object | *sign*; *symptom* (← that which attracts attention to a person/object); *scout* (← person who works following signs/clues); *weather* (← signs or indicators of weather). The application to 候 of the Japanese そうろう, a *classical verb ending*, represents a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 宿舍

Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 土# pile of earth being smoothed (lazily) with a scoop, with a bronzeware inscription form adding 八 split right and left | stretch the arms to both sides to disperse surplus earth in smoothing/leveling a pile | *surplus* (← level surplus earth). In Japan, 余 was also adopted as a Shinjitai (new character form) to replace 餘, according to which 余 also conveys the meanings *remain*; *leave*; *be left over*.

Examples: 除了 除夕 除非
Etymology: As per 余# (disperse surplus earth) + 阜 piled earth (for emphasis/clarification) | disperse surplus earth | *remove* | *divide*; *exclude*; *cancel*; *abolish* | *except*. 除 was devised to replace 余 after 余 came to convey "surplus" rather than the idea of dispersal.

Meaning: forerunner, herald, harbinger; to lie between; sea shell; to wear armor
Examples: 介紹 介入
Etymology: �� a variant form of 人 person + an element# indicating two sides | person intervening to reduce/eliminate distance between separate parties | *intervene*; *mediate*. *Shellfish* is a borrowed meaning.

Meaning: boundary, limit; domain; society; the world
Examples: 世界 界線 外界
Etymology: 介# (reduce) + 田 field | boundaries reducing a large field into smaller sections | *boundary*; *border* | *world*/circle (of the arts etc.).

Meaning: big, large; robust; name of tribe
Examples: 健壯 強壯 壯觀
Etymology: As per 丬/爿# (long and slender) + 士 male | tall and neat male | *manhood*; *strength*.

Examples: 服裝 假裝 安裝
Etymology: As per 壯# (tall and neat) + 衣 clothing | sartorial neatness | *dress neatly*; *decorate oneself*; *mode of dress*; *equipment* | *decorate*; *disguise*; *pretend*.

Examples: 人類 類似 之類
Etymology: 犬 dog/beast (| animals in general) + an element# combining 米 rice (| plants in general) and 頁 (people) | sort a variety of things according to type, creating smaller piles | *variety*; *kind* | *broadly*.

Examples: 講話 講價 講究
Etymology: As per 冓# (symmetry) + 言 words | two parties (the speaking and listening sides) taking part in a *lecture*.

Examples: 樂器 機器 器材
Etymology: An element# quadrupling 口 mouth/hole (| variety of containers) + 犬 dog/beast | vessels filled with hunted game, or meat (compare 獻). The idea is to reduce the empty space in a *container/receptacle* by filling it (compare 吉) | *vessel*; *implement*. Also, *ability* (← have capacity/capability).

Examples: 南部 南邊 東南
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a depiction of a hut or small storehouse. However, a seal inscription form is 屮 grass shoot + an element# combining 冂 boundary/enclosure and an inverted 入 pierced by two horizontal lines, suggesting sprouts placed inside a hothouse for cultivation | *south* (← direction associated with warmth, which hothouses were positioned to face).

Examples: 答案 檔案 方案
Etymology: As per 安# (rest in/on) + 木 tree/wood | rest the elbows on a wooden desk or table. *Consider* and *plan* are borrowed meanings via 按 | *proposal*; *worry*.

Examples: 畫兒 計畫 畫家
Etymology: Originally, 晝# (demarcate in writing) + 聿 implement held upright to carve/draw characters |  *demarcate*/*mark off* in writing | *draw*; *paint* | *drawing*; *picture*; *painting* | *stroke* (n.). Also, *plan* and *consider* (← written plan).

Meaning: petal, flower, leaf; brave, a hero; England, English
Examples: 英文 英俊 英雄
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄧㄥ ㄨㄣˊ  ㄧㄥ ㄐㄩㄣ`  ㄧㄥ ㄒㄩㄥˊ
Etymology: As per 央# (stretch) + 艸 grass/plant | gorgeous plant, stretching at length | *brilliance*;  *superiority* (← surpass others ← stretch at length). *England* and *English* are via the phonetic construction 英吉利.

Examples: 排斥 充斥
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 析 (split with an ax) + a mark suggesting severance | strike and split/sever with an ax. *Reject*, *repel*, *expel* and *exclude* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 告訴 訴苦
Etymology: As per 斥# (split) + 言 words | contentious split resulting in complaints/appeals | *sue*; *charge*; *complain* | *appeal*; *resort to* (← challenge the legal/judicial course of events) | *touch/move* (← appeal to one's emotions).

Examples: 帶來 帶領 地帶
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 巾 cloth with an object run through with string or cord | tie a *belt* about the waist, constricting it | *wear*; *carry*; *zone*; *accompany*.

Meaning: to differ; different, wrong; nearly, almost; an officer
Examples: 差不多 差別 差異
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 左# (aligned at an angle) + a rice plant | rice plants in irregular alignment | *inconsistent*; *difference* (← irregular) | *dispatch* (← send forth ← protrude) | *thrust*; *offer* (← dispatch). The verb さす bears many extended senses from the idea of "thrust," including *extend*; *stretch*; *insert*; *raise* (the hands); *put up*; *carry*; *hold*; and *wear*.
Effectively, a variant form of 乎 exclamation | *exclamatory, euphonic or emphatic particle*.

Examples: 似乎 合乎 幾乎
Etymology: A depiction of breath running up through the lungs and producing an *exclamation* as it leaves the mouth | *calling* | *questioning*.

Examples: 力量 測量 產量
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 重# weight + grain | *measure* grain in weighing it | *weigh* | *quantity*; *amount*; *estimate*; *consider*. It is possible that the phonetic element is the obsolete grain element; compare 良 and 秝.

Meaning: long time (ago); time passage, grow late
Examples: 不久 長久 持久
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows an aged/long-lived person with a curved back (compare 老) + a line indicating a stick on which the person leans. *Long (time)* and *long duration* are associated meanings, likened to the longevity of an aged person.

Examples: 卓越
Etymology: As per 早# (rising of the sun) + a variant of 人 person | person who rises above others | *excel*. For the idea of being excellent in the sense of surpassing, compare 特. *Table* is a borrowed meaning.

Meaning: turn, move; shake, wag; drop down
Examples: 失掉
Etymology: As per 卓# (rise above) + 手 hand/action indicator | lift an object high then *shake* or *swing* it (and let it drop).

Meaning: resemble, similar to; as if, seem
Examples: 似乎 類似 相似
Etymology: As per 以# (plow furrows) + 人 person (| human agency) | plow furrows. 似 was devised to replace 以 after 以 acquired its associated and extended meanings, but the same process occurred with 似, which acquired the meanings *resemble,* *imitate* and *copy* (← furrows of identical appearance) | *counterfeit*; *fake*.

Examples: 整理 整齊 調整
Etymology: 敕, a variant form of 勅, combines 束 bundle + 攵 action indicator | pull tightly on a bundle in straightening it | imperial decree. Compare 勅. 整 adds 正# (straight) | straighten by tying firmly | *put in order*; *arrange*; *regulate*; *make proper*; *ready*; *prepare* | *wellproportioned*; *raise money* (← prepare funds).

Meaning: to pull, draw out, attract; to stretch
Examples: 吸引 引起 引發
Etymology: 弓 bow + 丨# line that penetrates from top to bottom | *draw/pull* straight back on a bowstring | *draw out*. Extended meanings include *lead*; *subtract*; *deduct*; *connect* (a power/gas line etc.) | *recede*; *subside*. Also, *attract* (attention/sympathy) and *cite* (an authority) (← draw attention), *look up* (a word) (← draw out a single term from among many); *be finished* and *close* (← ebb away ← recede), as well as *catch* (a cold) (← have one's strength sapped ← draw out).

Examples: 上班 下班 班機
Etymology: 玨 (玉 jewel in abbreviated form, and doubled) + what was originally 八# split right and left | split a round gem in two | *group*; *squadron* (← large group of people split into smaller units, which however remain coordinated).

Examples: 迷路 迷人 昏迷
Etymology: As per 米# (concealed) + 辵 movement | stray off course on account of obscure visibility | *go astray*; *be lost* | *confound*; *be perplexed/at a loss*; *doubt*; *uncertainty*; *illusion*; *delusion*; *tempt*; *captivate*.

Examples: 圖書館 圖片 地圖
Etymology: 啚 here a variant form of 嗇# (granary) + 囗 circular enclosure | enclosed granary. *Diagram* and *draw* are extended meanings in the sense of enclosing within the boundaries of a writing medium; compare 晝/昼 and 畫/画. Also, *plan* (← diagram) and *attempt* (← plan an attempt).

Examples: 限制 制度 管制
Etymology: To a variant of 木 tree/wood, the left-hand element# adds 丿 (split) | split off part of a branch. 制 adds 刀 sword/knife | cut to *control* the growth of a tree | *arrange into shape* | *regulation*; *system*; *establish*.

Meaning: tanned leather; surname; KangXi radical number 178
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 囗# circular enclosure with a pair of crossing feet | go around/*circumambulate* or *patrol* an enclosure. (Tanned) *leather* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 學費 費用 經費
Etymology: As per 弗# (split) + 貝 commodities | split (= distribute) commodities | *spend* | *funds*; *expenditure*; *waste*; *squander*.

Meaning: stop up, block, seal, cork; pass, frontier; fortress
Examples: 閉塞 堵塞 塞車
Etymology: 土# pile of earth + the upper element of 寒 (pile construction elements in raising a shelter) | plug/fill holes in raising an earthen *fortress/fort* | *plug/dam up*; *stop (up)* | *fill*; *be filled*.

Examples: 比賽 球賽 賽跑
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 塞 fill + 貝 commodities | *compete* to fill a container with offerings | *visit a temple/shrine* and make an offering. Also, *dice* (← game of competition).

Examples: 奇怪 好奇 神奇
Etymology: As per 可# (bend) + 大 stand outstretched | person bending/leaning in an unusual position, on account of being lame | *strange*; *wondrous*.

Examples: 認識 知識 常識
Etymology: As per 戠# as described in 織 (marker) + 言 words | obtain *knowledge* by marking another person's words | (power of) *discrimination* | *acquaintance*. *Write down/record*, *sign* and *banner* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 服刑 刑事
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of 开# is a depiction of handcuffs stretching about a prisoner's wrists, framing them in punishment. A bronzeware inscription form curves the vertical strokes. 刑 adds 刀 sword/knife | *punish* (by confinement, severing of body parts or by other means).

Examples: 大型 典型 髮型
Etymology: As per 刑# (frame) + 土 earth | clay framed in the *mold* shaping it | *model* | *pattern*; *type*; *design*; *conventional form/idea*; *basic technique* (in martial arts).

Examples: 號召 召開 召集
Etymology: As per 刀# (curve) + 口 mouth | curve the arm and beckon, supplementing oral summoning | *summon* | *term of respect*. From the idea of a person of superior rank beckoning to an inferior for service, the verb めす is used as a polite expression for the following senses: *eat*, *drink*, *put on*, *wear*, and *take* (a bath/a conveyance). めす is also used in the same way for *buy* or *catch* (a cold). *Invite* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 超級市場 超市 超過
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄔㄠ ㄐㄧˊㄕ`ㄔㄤˇ  ㄔㄠ ㄕ`  ㄔㄠ ㄍㄨㄛ`
Etymology: As per 召# (curve) + 走 run | describe an arc in leaping obstacles | *exceed*; *surpass*; *go beyond*; *cross/go over*; *super-*; *ultra-*; *distant*. Compare 越.

Examples: 右邊 左邊 旁邊
Etymology: The lower part of 臱 is 方 (spread) + 穴 hole | separate holes that are in close proximity. The addition of 自 (nose) specifies the apertures of a nose, the latter an object forming a border between the two sides of a face. 邊 is as per 臱# (border) + 辵 movement | move to a *border*/*boundary* | *vicinity*; *end*; *edge* | *side* (of a polygon).

Examples: 牙刷 刷牙 牙齒
Etymology: A depiction of fangs or tusks that mesh with or cross over the bottom teeth (compare 齬 and 顎) | *fang*; *tusk*. Also, *tooth/teeth*.

Meaning: wrong, evil, depraved, vicious, perverse, heterodox
Etymology: As per 牙# (mesh; cross) + 邑 village/settlement | a crossroads settlement | *evil* (← superstitious association of crossroads with misfortune) | *wrong*; *illness*.
An abbreviated form# of 邪 (crossroads settlement) + 耳 ear | cross-question | (grammatical) *interrogative* (← crossroads taken in a figurative sense). 耶 is also used for transliterations.

Examples: 唯一
Etymology: As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 口 mouth | single out a subordinate, verbally | *only*; *solitary*.

Examples: 雖然 雖說
Etymology: The left-hand element combines 虫 insect/creature + an element suggesting a (large) head.
