The precise original signification of this combined element is obscure. 雖 adds 隹# (exert downward pressure) | lizard of a squashed appearance. *This* is a borrowed meaning (compare 惟), as are *even if* (so) and *although*.

Examples: 開始 始終 原始
Etymology: As per 台# (heavy downward pressure) + 女 woman | fetus hanging heavily in the womb | *begin*; *start* (← pregnancy as the origin of life).

Examples: 軍隊 軍人 空軍
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄩㄣ ㄉㄨㄟ`  ㄐㄩㄣ ㄖㄣˊ  ㄎㄨㄥ ㄐㄩㄣ
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 車 vehicle + an obsolete element indicating "wrap" | circular military encampment (compare 營) formed by chariots | *army* | *soldier*; *battle*.

Examples: 運動 幸運 運氣
Etymology: As per 軍# (circularity) + 辵 movement | *move about in a circle* (compare 還) | *transport*; *carry*; *convey* | (make) *progress*; *manage/carry out* (an undertaking). *Fate* comes from the idea of the circulation of good and evil in the course of one's life; compare 業.

Examples: 行李
Etymology: 子# child/offspring + 木 tree/wood | *plum* (voluminous fruit; compare 梅).

Examples: 矛盾
Etymology: A depiction of a halberd or *pike*, the base of the curved spearhead of which is covered and concealed in the shaft (compare 戊) | *arms*.

Examples: 服務員 服務生 服務
Etymology: 敄# is 矛 pike/halberd + 攵 (strike) | great exertion in battle. 務 adds 力 power/energy (for emphasis/clarification) | *work*; *serve*; *carry out one's duties*.

Examples: 權利 人權 集權
Etymology: As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 木 tree/wood | circular pieces of wood counterbalancing each other | *power* counterbalancing that of another | *right*; *authority*.

Examples: 經驗 測驗 檢驗
Etymology: As per 僉# (assemble) + 馬 horse | assemble horses for inspection | *examine*; *test* | *effect*.

Examples: 買賣 出賣 販賣
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 買# (seek to profit) + 出 proceed | go out to seek profits by selling | *sell*; *make money* | *be in demand*.

Examples: 讀書 讀者 閱讀
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 續 (pass along) + 言 words | knowledge transmitted via a communal *reading* | *read*. For the transmission of knowledge, compare 牘.

Examples: 奇怪 難怪 古怪
Etymology: 圣# is 又 hand/action indicator + 土 earth | knead a lump of earth/clay (compare 塊 and 顆). 怪 adds 心 heart/emotions | *odd* feelings aroused by the figure of a lumpy, mysterious object (compare 鬼) | *mystery*; *wonder*; *doubt*; *suspicion*; *strange*; *dubious*.

Examples: 升級 升學 回升
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a measuring scoop + a hand | raise a *measuring implement* to perform dry or liquid measurements | *measuring box*; *unit of measurement* (approximately 1.8 liters) | *box seat*.

Examples: 飛機 飛機場 起飛
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄈㄟ ㄐㄧ   ㄈㄟ ㄐㄧ ㄔㄤˇ  ㄑㄧˇㄈㄟ
Etymology: A depiction of the curved wings of a bird spread right and left in flight (compare 非) | *fly* | *speedy*.

Examples: 滿意 不滿 客滿
Etymology: 㒼# combines the head of an animal and its pelt, suggesting "cover completely" (← cover the body completely with an animal skin that has its head still attached; compare 美). 滿 adds 水 water | inundate (← cover completely with water; compare 漫) | *(be) full*; *fill* | *fulfill*; *all over*.

Examples: 衣服 舒服 服務員
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of �� features the same elements as 及, a hand + a person | spread a hand over another person's back. A bronzeware inscription form adds 舟 boat | spread boards in fashioning a boat. A seal inscription form replaces 舟 with 肉 flesh | *clothes* that spread over/*cling* to the body | *submit*; *obey* (← be closely attached to; compare 伏) | *accede* | *take (medicine) regularly* (← submit to/obey a doctor's prescription) | *counter* (for a dose of medicine/a smoke). Also, *be engaged in* and *be accustomed to*. In the derivative characters 菔 and 鵩, 服 appears in slightly different forms.

Examples: 均勻
做夢 夢想 夢見
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 蔑 (obscured vision) + 夕 evening | darkness where vision is obscured | *dark* | protracted *dream* (← obscure state of being).

Examples: 收穫 收音機 吸收
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕㄡ ㄏㄨㄛ`  ㄕㄡ ㄧㄣ ㄐㄧ   ㄒㄧ ㄕㄡ
Etymology: As per 丩# as described in 叫 (twisted threads) + 攵 action indicator | twist loose threads together in collecting them (compare 終) | *gather*; *collect*; *obtain*; *put in/away* | *restore*; *replace*; *settle*.

Examples: 眼睛 眼鏡 親眼
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + 目 eye | *eye* (fixed upon an object; compare 見 and 臣).

Examples: 創造 造成 改造
Etymology: As per 告# (bend) + 辵 movement/action indicator | *build/make* by bending objects | *make/cook up*; *invent*.

Examples: 概念 觀念 紀念
Etymology: As per 今# (contain) + 心 heart/emotions | *thought/idea* contained deep within the heart (compare 意) | *caution* (← profound idea).

Examples: 留言 留學 留學生
Etymology: As per 卯# (bend) + 田 field | field laborer coming to a stop in stooping with exhaustion (compare 勞) | *stop*; (temporarily) *stay/settle*; *hold down*; *detain*; *fix in place* | *keep* (in mind). 留 employs the same variant of 卯 as in 貿.

Examples: 上課 下課 功課
Etymology: 果# result + 言 words | *investigate* in order to obtain results | *subject*; *lesson*;  *assignment* | *department* (← department assigned to investigate; compare 科).

Examples: 破壞 破爛 破裂
Etymology: As per 皮# (align) + 石 stone | *break* then align pieces of stone | *tear*; *rip*; *expose*; *do thoroughly* | *lose*.

Examples: 精神 精彩 精力
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧㄥ ㄕㄣˊ  ㄐㄧㄥ ㄘㄞˇ  ㄐㄧㄥ ㄌㄧ`
Etymology: As per 青# (clean/pure) + 米 rice | extract the *essence* of rice in polishing it | *refine/polish*; *spirit* | *semen* (← essence); *elaborate*; *detailed* (← refining process). Note the variant form 精.

Examples: 一半 半天 半夜
Etymology: 牛 cow + 八# split right and left | split a cow in butchering it, the separate parts remaining in close proximity | *half* | *part(ly)*.

Examples: 大約 約會 節約
Etymology: As per 勺# (rise and become evident) + 糸 thread | *tie* a knot in a cord (as a sign of a pledge) | *promise*; *conspicuous mark* | *brief*; *summary* (← reduce in making compact; compare 要) | *approximately* (← summary approximating a full report in providing only the gist).

Examples: 願意 願望 寧願
Etymology: As per 原# (round) + 頁 head | round head. Eventually, 願 came to be associated with the idea of a notion that circulates persistently in the brain (compare 惱 and 慮), leading to the extended meanings *wish*; *desire*; *hope* | *request*; *petition*; *application*.

Examples: 到底 底下 徹底
Etymology: 氐# foundation + 广 building | foundation of a building | *bottom* | *reach* (a point/destination) (← reach bottom); *stay*.

Examples: 回答 答應 報答
Etymology: As per 合# (press/fit together) + 竹 bamboo | fit/fasten a cover upon a bamboo vessel | *answer*; *solve* (← answer/solution that corresponds to a question ← lid that corresponds to a container) | *repay*; *reward* (← make a fitting return).

Meaning: to respect, reverence; respectfully; 3rd terrestrial branch
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 矢# arrow + a pair of hands | straighten an arrow. A seal inscription form adds 宀 roof/building, creating 寅, the original sense of which was to straighten/stretch and stand to one's full height, inside a building. *Tiger* (as the *third sign of the Chinese zodiac*) and *3 A.M. to 5 A.M.* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 表演 導演 演出
Etymology: As per 寅# (straighten/stretch) + 水 water | stretch fluidly | *perform*; (theatrical) *play*.

Examples: 表達 達成 抵達
Etymology: Originally, 辵 movement + an element combining 大 great and 羊 sheep | procession of a great flock of sheep | *proceed smoothly*; *arrive at*; *reach* | *achieve*; *be in use*; *notice*; *deliver*; *skillful*. Suffix meaning a *plural number of humans* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 雄偉 英雄
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of 厷 combines 又 hand and a bending line representing an elbow | extend the arm toward an object. 雄 is 厷# (extend) + 隹 short, squat bird | male bird extending its wings to display authority | *male*; *strong*; *brave*; *manly*.

Examples: 深入 深刻 深淺
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕㄣ ㄖㄨ`  ㄕㄣ ㄎㄜ`  ㄕㄣ ㄑㄧㄢˇ
Etymology: As per the right-hand element# as described in 探 (deep) + 水 water | *deep* waters | *profound*; *intense*. The original reference may have been to a pool/lake located deep within the earth.

Examples: 醫院 電影院 學院
Etymology: As per 完# (surround completely) + 阜 piled earth | surrounding earthen *wall* | *mansion*; *building*; *garden* (← structure/place surrounded by a wall).

Examples: 句子 造句
Etymology: Originally the same character as 局 (bending lines demarcating a frame). In 句, the sense of "demarcation" gave rise to the meanings *phrase*, *verse*, *line*, *clause* and *sentence*.

Examples: 能夠 足夠
仁愛
Etymology: As per 人# (people in mutable interaction) + 二 two | two individuals in mutable interaction | *humanity*; *benevolence*; *virtue*.

Examples: 請假 放假 暑假
Etymology: 叚# false + 人: *false*; *deceptive*; *artificial*; *fake* | *temporary*; *provisional* (← false  condition that is only temporary) | *lend*; *borrow* (← temporary loan as opposed to a permanent gift/grant). *Leisure* is a borrowed meaning, via 暇. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character emphasizing the "false" rather than the "conceal" aspect of overlaying the body with a garment, the original sense of 叚.

Examples: 談話 談判 會談
Etymology: 炎 here an abbreviated form# of 淡 light + 言 words | light *conversation*/*talk* | *story*; *anecdote*.

Meaning: art, skill, special feat; method, technique
Examples: 美術 藝術 技術
Etymology: As per 朮# (pass through) + 行 (straight, crossing roads) | *path* through which one passes. *Rule*, *art* and *method* are figurative paths.

Examples: 奉獻 奉養
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 手 hand/action indicator + an element# combining 廾  pair of hands and 丰 (cone-shaped, fruit-bearing ears of grain) | spread/extend the arms in presenting an offering | *present*; *offer* | *serve*; *honor*; *revere*; *obey*. Also, *receive* (← receive by spreading/extending the arms).

Examples: 棒球 棒子
Etymology: As per 奉# (spread/extend) + 木 tree/wood | extend a *club/stick/pole* straight out | *straight line* | *by rote* (← perform in an unvarying manner).

Examples: 百貨公司 老百姓
Etymology: 一 (| a number) + 白# (large number of acorns) | *one hundred* (i.e., a large number).

Examples: 勝利 名勝 勝地
Etymology: As per 朕# (rise) + 力 power/energy | rise above in superiority | *be superior to*; *be predominant*; *excel* | *victory*; *win*; *defeat* (v.).

Examples: 推薦 推銷 推動
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄊㄨㄟ ㄐㄧㄢ`  ㄊㄨㄟ ㄒㄧㄠ   ㄊㄨㄟ ㄉㄨㄥ`
Etymology: As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 手 hand/action indicator | push/press down on at length | *infer*; *conjecture*; *suppose*; *assume* (← push one's ideas ← push forward ← press); *recommend*; *support* (← push forward a candidate).

Examples: 牛仔褲 仔細
Etymology: 子# child/offspring + 人 person (for emphasis/clarification) | *offspring* | *small*; *detail*. Also, *young animal*.

Examples: 存在 保存 儲存
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form# of 在 exist + 子 child | *existence* represented by children/descendants (compare 孫)| *keep*/settle (in place) (← maintain existence) | *know* (← have knowledge of what exists).

Examples: 準備 標準 水準
Etymology: As per 隼# (short, squat bird | weigh heavily) + 水 water | heavy buildup of water (compare 淵) | *level* (← level surface of a heavy buildup of water) | *standard* | *semi-*; *quasi-* (← standard that is unofficially accurate).

Examples: 往往 交往 來往
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 王# (extend) + a stylized rendering of an oracle bone character combining a leg in motion + 彳 movement | make an extensive journey | *go*; *gone* | *past*. There is no etymological connection between 往 and 主.

Examples: 容易 貿易 交易
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 彡 pattern + a rudimentary depiction of a lizard | lizard stretched flat on the ground in sunning itself. *Easy* and *peaceful* are extended meanings (← be at ease/peace) with *make light of* and *control/rule* (with ease) by further extension. *Change* and *exchange* are borrowed meanings | *divination* (← change continuously). Distinguish 易 from 昜 (sun rising high in the sky).

Examples: 況且 情況 何況
Etymology: As per 兄# (extend) + 水 water | extensive body of water. *Situation* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 晚上 晚會 早晚

Etymology: 凵 hole + an indicator# suggesting a person or object | large, round cavity into which a person/object falls (compare 禍, 陷, and 俗) | *terrible*; *bad*; *disaster* | *poor harvest*.

Examples: 離開 距離 離婚
Etymology: 离 odd beast + 隹# short, squat bird | bird and beast tangling then separating after a protracted fight | *separation* | *part* (from); *come apart*; *release*; *set at intervals*; *leave*; *drift away*; *quit*.

Examples: 政治 三明治 統治
Etymology: As per 台# (heavy downward pressure) + 水 water | work to *control* the heavy pressure exerted by a powerful river | *quell*; *calm/settle down*; *subside*; *govern(ment)*; *peace*; *healing*; *cure*.

Examples: 導演 教導 領導
Etymology: 道# street/way + 寸 hand/action indicator | *lead/conduct* another along a (figurative) path |  *guide*; *teach*.

Examples: 階段 手段 身段
Etymology: The left-hand element# is drawn from the top part of 耑 (neatly aligned). 段 adds 殳 action indicator | descend a (neatly aligned) staircase | *steps*; *stairs*; *stage* | *period*; *demarcation*; *rank*; *ranking*. Also, *method* (← descend steps in order) and *thing/matter* (← demarcation).

Examples: 團體 團圓 樂團
Etymology: As per 專# (round and/or rotating object) + 囗 circular enclosure | *group* completely surrounded by a *round* enclosure | *mass*; *lump*; *sphere* (← round/roundish objects).

Examples: 周圍 四周 周到
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows grain crops in a field, growing thickly. A bronzeware inscription form adds 囗 circular enclosure | enclosure encircling a field of grain | *circulate*; | *surroundings* (← surroundings of an enclosure); *circumference*. In derivative characters, 周 may also appear in the form seen for example in 稠, 綢 or 雕.

Examples: 調查 強調 聲調
Etymology: 周# circulate + 言 words | circulate/go about in examining/inspecting (compare 訪) | *examine*; *inspect*; *investigate*; *search*; *look into* | *study*; *look up* (a word). Also, *arrange* (← spread in orderly fashion ← spread widely), *settle* (← examine and settle a matter), *tone* (← smooth; harmonious ← spread smoothly ← spread widely), *condition* (← overall condition ← overall ← spread widely). *Prepare*, *supply* and *purchase* are borrowed  meanings.

Examples: 登記 登山 登場
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄉㄥ ㄐㄧ`  ㄉㄥ ㄕㄢ   ㄉㄥ ㄔㄤˇ
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 豆 food stand + an element# combining 廾 pair of hands + 癶 spread feet | ascent, likened to the raising of a food stand | *rise*; *ascend*; *climb* | *ride*; *promote*. 廾 eventually dropped.

Examples: 保證 簽證 證明
Etymology: 登# rise + 言 words | *(make a) report to a superior* | *testify*; *evidence*; *proof*.

Meaning: a line; to arrange in order, classify
Examples: 陳列 排列 系列
Etymology: 歹# severed bone/death + 刀 sword/knife | sever bones and arrange them in a row | *row* | *companion*; *attend*; *lots of*.

Examples: 受傷 傷心 傷害
Etymology: The right-hand element# combines 昜 rise + �� a variant of 人 person | raise the hand and strike another person | *injure* | *injury*; *wound* | *damage*; *harm*; *spoil*; *bruise*; *scratch* | *flaw*; *fault*. 人 was later appended for emphasis/clarification.
网# net + 山 mountain | *hill/knoll* associated with the production of and/or trapping by use of nets. In derivative characters, 岡 lends the semantic influence "hard rope/cable."

Examples: 剛剛 剛才 剛好
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄤ ㄍㄤ˙  ㄍㄤ ㄘㄞˊ  ㄍㄤ ㄏㄠˇ
Etymology: As per 岡# (hard rope/cable) + 刀 sword/knife | cutting implement able to slice through a *strong* or *hard* object such as rope or cable.

Examples: 排隊 牛排 安排
Etymology: As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | spread in alignment to right and left | line up; arrange; row. Also, *reject*, *exclude* and *eject* (← push off to both sides in rejecting).

Examples: 道德 品德
Etymology: �� # is an abbreviated, variant form of 直 correct + 心 heart/emotions | one's true nature. 德 adds 彳 movement/action indicator | act in accordance with one's true nature | *virtue* | *morals*.

Meaning: bolt of cloth; counter for horses
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 厂 cliff/shape indicator (here suggesting a hanging piece of cloth) + two parallel vertical lines# | two pieces of cloth set out to dry and hanging side by side | *one* (of a pair) | *counter* (for animals).

Examples: 甚至
Etymology: As per 匹 (side by side) + 甘# (sweet/rich food contained in the mouth) | consume extreme amounts of sweet/rich food | *intensity*; *great degree* | *very*; *extreme*; *enormous*; *exceedingly*; *excessively*; *serious*; *outrageous*.

Meaning: kill, slaughter, murder; hurt; to pare off, reduce, clip
Examples: 自殺 殺價 殘殺
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 乂# (vegetation cut in swaths) + an element combining millet and 殳 action indicator | harvest ears of millet and *scrape* them for their seeds | *shave*; *erase*. The primary meaning, however, is now *kill*, via the conceptual progression from "harvest" to "action that cuts off life." Compare 絶.
As per 召# (curve) + 日 sun/day | shining arc of light | *shine*; *light up*; *brightness*.

Examples: 照片 照相機 照相
Etymology: 昭# brightness + 火 fire (for emphasis/clarification) | *shine on*; *illuminate* | *reflect*. Also, *inquire* and *compare* (← make inquiry by shining a light on separate objects and comparing them), as well as *shy/self-conscious* (← shrink at having a light shone on one).

Examples: 柔軟 軟弱 軟體
Etymology: Originally, 車 vehicle + 耎# (soft) | large, wheeled plow used to turn up soft soil (lying beneath the hard upper layer) | *soft*. For the idea of softness vis–à–vis the turning of soil, compare 農. 軟 replaces 耎 with 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure (bend | pliable), and this became the standard form of the character.

Examples: 包子 麵包 錢包
Etymology: A depiction of a placenta/womb that envelops a fetus | *envelop*; *wrap*.

Meaning: to fear, be afraid of; apprehensive
Examples: 可怕 害怕 恐怕
Etymology: 白# white + 心 heart/emotions | *be afraid* (← go pale with fear; compare 怖) | *worry*; *be apprehensive*.

Examples: 便條 麵條 條件
Etymology: As per 攸# (slender and curved) + 木 tree/wood | slender, curved *branch* | *line*; *long*; *avenue* | *clause* (← line of text); *reason*; *logic*.

The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 大 stand outstretched + two marks indicating the two sides of the body | slender line of people standing outstretched | *also*; *again* (← one person after another); *armpit* (← sides of the body). Compare 胳 and 脇.

Meaning: night, dark; in night; by night
Examples: 半夜 夜裡 夜市
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 月 moon + an abbreviated form# of 亦 (slender line) | slender line traced by the moon in the *evening* sky (compare 夕) | *night*.

Examples: 商店 商品 商人
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕㄤ ㄉㄧㄢ`  ㄕㄤ ㄆㄧㄣˇ  ㄕㄤ ㄖㄣˊ
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 章# (rise) + a tall platform (compare 堂) | tall platform (rising particularly high) | *trade*; *commerce*; *business*; *merchant* (← people of China's high plateaus noted for their mercantile skills, who referred to themselves as 商) | *deal in*; *compare* (← compare goods in conducting trade/business).

Examples: 既然
Etymology: To 旡# (engorgement) the relevant oracle bone form of 既 adds a heaping plate of food | become engorged on a heaping plate of food | *already* (← have already reached a limit).

Examples: 大概 概念 概括
Etymology: As per 既# (engorged) + 木 tree/wood | wooden implement used to level off an engorged surface such as a heaping pile of grain or fresh plaster on a wall (compare 墍) | *in general*; *approximately* (← level off).

Examples: 根據 根本 根源
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄣ ㄐㄩ`  ㄍㄣ ㄅㄣˇ  ㄍㄣ ㄩㄢˊ
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + 木 tree/wood | *root* of a tree adhering to the earth | *bottom*; *base*; *origin*; *natural character*.

Meaning: supply, provide for; offer in worship
Examples: 提供 供應 供給
Etymology: As per 共# (act jointly in making an offering): *offer*; *serve* | *attendant*; *retinue*; *plural/humble suffix*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.

Examples: 拒絕 絕對 絕不
客廳 不客氣 顧客
Etymology: As per 各# (come to a stop) + 宀 roof/building | stop to rest in a covered structure | *guest*; *customer* | *traveler*; *freeloader*.

Examples: 密切 親切 一切
Etymology: As per 七# (cut) + 刀 sword/knife | *cut* neatly into small pieces | *chop*; *break*; *snap* | *break off* | *stop*; *pause*; *place to stop/leave off doing*; *turn off*; *be out of*; *run out of*; *be short of* | *expire*; *end* (of a matter); *wear out*; *wear off*; *limit*. Also, *a piece*, *a slice* and *piece of cloth*, as well as *sell below cost* and *drain* (off). *Severe*,  *serious*, *urge* and *work (on)* are from the "keen" and "sharp" elements in cutting.

Examples: 集合 集郵 集中
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows 隹 short, squat bird (tripled) above 木 tree/wood | birds assembled in a tree, pressed tightly together (compare 喿 as described in 操) | *assemble*; *gather*; *collect* | *stay*; *remain*; *reach* (a situation); *achieve*; *poem collection*. The present form uses a single 隹.

Examples: 名稱 稱號 稱呼
Etymology: 爯# combines an abbreviated form of 再 (symmetry) + 爪 (pick/pluck) | pick up/raise an object in weighing it on a balance (compare 耑). 稱 adds 禾 grain/rice | raise crops in order to weigh them. *Name* is a borrowed meaning.

Meaning: to occupy, take possession of; a base
Examples: 根據 據說 收據
Etymology: As per 豦# as described in 劇 (fierce) + 手 hand/action indicator | fierce martial activity resulting in occupation of an enemy position | *base* | *point of origin*.

水 water + 各# (come to a stop) | tributary that connects with a river and comes to a stop. 洛水 is the name of a *tributary of the Yellow River* | *Kyoto/the capital* (← association with the onetime Chinese capital of 洛陽).

Examples: 角落 落後 落實
Etymology: As per 洛# (connect) + 艸 grass/plant | chain of dewdrops falling from a plant | *drop*; *fall* | *omit*; *settle down*. Other extended meanings from "drop" or "fall" include *collapse*; *come off/out*; *die down*; *decline*; *fail* (a test etc.); *be inferior*; *remove*; *trap*; and *trick*. *Mistake* is via "omit," while *punch line* (of a joke) is by extension from "trick."

Examples: 超越 優越 跨越
Etymology: Abbreviated form of 歳 (walk about a field in harvesting) + 走 run | *exceed* the speed of another person | *surpass*; *go over/beyond* | *cross* (over) (← surpass); *go*; *come*; *move* (house). Also, *pass* and *pass time*. Compare 超.

Examples: 畢竟 竟然 究竟
Etymology: As per 音# (contained) + 儿 person | person whose movement is contained on reaching a distant border | *come to an end* | *finally*; *at last*.

Examples: 盡力 盡量
Etymology: 皿 dish/plate/bowl + an element# representing liquid dripping from a brush | ink dripping from a brush into a bowl | *use up*; *exhaust*; *run out of* (← use up the last of one's ink) | *give one's utmost*; *devote oneself to*; *be an extreme of*.

Examples: 等待 招待 待會兒
Etymology: As per 寺# (stand straight by) + 彳 movement | stand by to carry out orders | *wait*; *await*; *entertain* (← wait upon).

Examples: 新聞 聞名
Etymology: As per 門# (concealed) + 耳 ear | demand to *hear* concealed *information* | *ask*; *listen*; *rumor*; *reputation*.

Examples: 公園 校園 花園
Etymology: 囗 circular enclosure + a variant of 袁# (wrap about/enclose) | fields and gardens enclosed by a fence | *garden* | *villa*; *country house*.

Examples: 忘記 遺忘
Etymology: As per 亡# (obscure) + 心 heart/emotions | obscure state of mind, in the form of forgetfulness or  overlooking something | *forget*; *overlook*; *leave behind*. 忘 and 忙 are an example of a pair of characters devised from the same elements but expressing different meanings; for another example, see 含 and 吟.

Examples: 價值 值得 貶值
產品 產生 生產
生肖 不肖
Etymology: 小# small + 肉 flesh | small offspring that *resemble* the parents in miniature. In derivative characters, 肖 often appears in the form seen for example in 悄, 逍 or 蛸.

Examples: 消息 取消 消除
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 水 water | *extinguish* a burning object with water, leaving the original object in reduced form | *go out*; *disappear*; *grow thin*; *dwindle*; *decline* | *put out*; *turn off*; *kill* (off); *erase*. Also, *die* (← be killed off) and *spend* (← spend time ← extinguishing of a day).

Meaning: set of two, pair, couple; both
Examples: 雙胞胎 雙方 雙重
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕㄨㄤ ㄅㄠ ㄊㄞ   ㄕㄨㄤ ㄈㄤ   ㄕㄨㄤ ㄔㄨㄥˊ
Etymology: The top element# is 隹 short, squat bird (doubled) | one bird facing another. 雙 adds 又 hand/action indicator | *pair* of birds taken in hand | *two*; *counter for pairs of objects*; *match*.

Examples: 紅綠燈 紅色 紅茶
Etymology: 糸 thread + 工 here an abbreviated form# of 汞 mercury | fabric/textiles dyed a *deep red* (compare 絳) | *crimson*; *rouge* | *lipstick*.

Examples: 坐牢 坐鎮
Etymology: As per 从# a variant form of 從 (people in close formation) + 土 earth | people seated in a circle on the ground | *sit* | *be inactive*; *be* | *go*; *come* (← go/come, seated in a conveyance). *Somehow* and *somewhat* are borrowed meanings. The ancient pronunciation of the character suggests that the ground intended by 土 was specifically a hill or pile of earth; compare 垂 堆 墜 and 墮.

Examples: 座位 講座 賣座
Etymology: 坐# sit + 广 building | place indoors where people *sit* | *seat* | *constellation* (← gathering of stars); *theater* (← grouping of seats).

Examples: 發展 展出 展開
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 尸# buttocks + an element combining an abbreviated form of 衣 clothing and four objects in the shape of the character 工 (suggesting a pile of objects weighing another object down) | place the buttocks atop an object, causing it to *spread* in being flattened (compare 尉) | *expand* | *show*.

Examples: 跑步 慢跑 奔跑
Etymology: 包# envelop + 足 leg/foot | paw/hoof etc. of a beast enveloped by dirt in scratching at the earth | *run*/*flee* (← dirt kicked up by a fleeing animal).

Meaning: give, deliver, pay, hand over; entrust
Examples: 付出 對付 應付
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 尌 as described in 樹 (set/stand in place) + 人 person (| human agency) | set/stand in place or spread over by attaching | *attach*; *be attached*. Extended meanings include *apply*, *per*, *hand something to*, *entrust*, *deposit*, *set*, *bill* and *credit*.

Meaning: adhere to, append; rely on near to
Examples: 附近 附加 附上
Etymology: As per 付# (set in place) + 阜 piled earth | compacted earth set firmly in place. This meaning eventually dropped, and 附 now expresses the same meanings as 付: *attach*; *be attached*; *apply*; *per*; *hand something to*; *entrust*; *deposit*; *set*; *bill* and *credit*. In modern Japanese usage, 附 is often replaced by 付.

Examples: 幹嘛
Etymology: 口 mouth + the traditional form of 麻# for the sound alone to transliterate the second syllable of the Tibetan (b)lama (喇嘛).

The relevant seal inscription form is 人 person bending beneath a curved line# suggesting a cliff (compare 宛) | *round*; *circular*; *spherical* (← posture of the figure) | *roll up*; *make a ball of*; *wad up*. Also, *entire* (← complete ← round). *Suffix in the names of ships* is by confusion with the classical Japanese term まろ (maro), meaning "lineage."

Meaning: hold in hand; keep; carry out
Examples: 執行 固執 執照
Etymology: Originally, an abbreviated form# of 睪 (align) + 丮 (kneeling figure with arms extended) | extend the arms to bind a captive | *seize* (compare 奪); *grasp*; *take* | *do*; *execute/carry out* (← carry out a sentence) | *handle*; *treat*; *take pains*. In 執 as in 埶, 丮 came to written as 丸.
As per 一# (fullness) + 口 mouth | mouth figuratively filled with words | *say*; *speech indicator*.

Originally, an abbreviated form# of 昜 (bright) + 曰 say/speech indicator | chant/recite in a *bright*/*clear* voice | *prosper* (← bright conditions). A seal inscription form simplifies the character to 曰 + 日 sun/day.

Examples: 唱歌 合唱 演唱
Etymology: As per 昌# (chant; recite) + 口 mouth | *chant*; *recite* | *advocate*; *advance* (a theory). 唱 was devised to replace 昌 after the latter came to refer to brightness.

Examples: 技巧 科技 技術
Etymology: As per 支# (skillfully manipulate) + 手 hand/action indicator | *technique* involving skillful manipulation | *skill* | *accomplishment*.

Examples: 某些
Etymology: 木# tree/wood + 甘 (sweet food contained in the mouth) | plum (i.e., a dark fruit that grows in  abundance, and is consumed by being savored in the mouth). Compare 梅. *A certain* and *some* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 堅硬 生硬 硬體
Etymology: As per 更# (stretch) + 石 stone | line of stones stretching between two points | *hard* (as a rock) | *stiff*; *stern*; *obstinate*.

Meaning: this, thus, such; to lop off; emphatic particle
Examples: 伊斯蘭教 斯文 瓦斯
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄧ ㄙ ㄌㄢˊㄐㄧㄠ`  ㄙ ㄨㄣˊ  ㄨㄚˇㄙ
Etymology: 斤 ax + 其# (winnow) | *split* apart a winnow. *This*, *such* and *namely* are borrowed meanings.
A depiction of vapors rising from a heat source and adhering to walls or the ceiling | *mumble*; *say* (← vaporous/ambiguous utterances).
As per 云# (adhering vapors) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | *cloud* (vapor-filled, steam-like object).

Examples: 旅遊 遊客 導遊
Etymology: As per 斿# (float) + 辵 movement | *roam*/*wander* as if floating about | *move about freely* | *recreation*; *play*; *nomadism*; *be at ease*. Extended meanings include *game*; *pastime*; *diversion*; *amusement*; *pleasure*; *enjoyment*; *have fun*; *take a vacation*; *be idle*; *be out of use* and *leave free/idle*. Also, *deign to* (← undertake at one's pleasure).

Meaning: rest, put stop to, end, cease
Examples: 休息 消息 利息
Etymology: As per 自# (nose) + 心 heart/emotions | breathe through the nostrils in rhythm with the beating of the heart | *breath* | *live* | *give birth*; *increase*. Also, *stop*; *rest* (← stops and starts of steady breathing); *interest* (← increase); *son* (← give birth).

Examples: 幫助 協助 助理
Etymology: As per 且# (pile) + 力 power/energy | supplementary power that assists in piling | *help*; *assistance* | *save*; *rescue*.

Meaning: must, have to, necessary; moment; whiskers
Examples: 必須 須知
Etymology: A depiction of an old man with a long, soft *beard*. The present form is 彡 pattern (here suggesting beard whiskers) + 頁 head. *Necessary*, *should* and *ought* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 辛苦 痛苦 吃苦
Etymology: 古# hard; dried out + 艸 grass/plant | *bitter* plant that makes the mouth go dry | *stubborn*; *pain*; *agony*; *suffering*; *hardship*; *trying* (experience); *exert oneself*; *worry*; *distress*; *pressure*; *torment*; *torture*; *be at a loss*; *embarrassment*.

Examples: 效果 有效 效率
Etymology: As per 交# (twist/cross) + 攵 action indicator | cross two objects in comparing them | *take after*. *Effective* is a borrowed meaning via 効.

Examples: 品質 蛋白質 物質
Etymology: 斦 is 斤 ax doubled, emphasizing splitting. 質 adds 貝, here an abbreviated form# of 實 (house full of treasures) | split one's belongings | *pawn* | *hostage*; *mortgage* | *quality/content*; *nature*; *verify*; *ask* | *simple* (← simple reality).

Examples: 例如 例子 比例
Etymology: 列# row + 人 person (| human agency) | line objects in rows | *line up objects of the same kind*; *example*; *usual*; (the ones) *in question* | *compare* (← compare a line of similar  objects); *for example*.

The relevant seal inscription form indicates an arrow hitting a squarish, lumpy target and coming to a stop. For the idea of stopping, compare 處 and 醫. 矣 was eventually employed as a *particle* indicating the completion of an action.

Meaning: alas, exclamation of surprise or pain
Etymology: As per 矣# (come to a stop) + 口 mouth | strangled sound (compare 誒) that stops in the throat without being properly voiced | *utterance of lamentation/pain* | *alas*.

Examples: 職業 職員 辭職
Etymology: As per 戠# as described in 織 (marker) + 耳 ear | hear/take note of and mark down (as part of one's job) | *assignment*; *duties*; *employment*.

Examples: 恢復 報復 復甦
Etymology: As per 复# as described in 腹 (double back) + 彳 movement | double back along the same course | *return* | *repeat*; *once more*. Also, *report* (← repeat that which has happened by reporting it).

Examples: 輸出 輸入 運輸
Etymology: 兪# remove + 車 vehicle | take up goods from one place and *send/transport* (i.e., remove) them elsewhere.

Examples: 節目 春節 季節
Etymology: As per 即# (immediately beside) + 竹 bamboo | knots of a bamboo tree in proximate alignment | *knot*; *joint*; *knob*; *section*. Also, *season* (← 1/24th of a year), *tune/melody* (← song punctuated by many stops) and *frugal* (← join segments in economizing).

Examples: 規矩 規模 規定
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄨㄟ ㄐㄩ˙  ㄍㄨㄟ ㄇㄛˊ  ㄍㄨㄟ ㄉㄧㄥ`
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the left-hand element# is an ancient, *compass*-like measuring implement. + 見 see | observe in taking measurements" | *measure*; *standard*; *plan*; *place limits upon*.

Examples: 注意 注射 注目
Etymology: As per 主# (stationary) + 水 water | *pour* liquid into a tubular container, where it becomes and remains stationary | *pour on*; *sprinkle*; *water* (plants); *flow/empty into*; *irrigate*. *Notice*, *pay attention*, *concentrate on*, *affix*, *interpret*, and *write down* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 畢業 畢竟 完畢
Etymology: A depiction of a net spread over prey attempting to split away in escape, indicating the *end* of a chase | *finish*; *complete*.

Examples: 檢查 調查 審查
熱鬧 熱狗 熱水
Etymology: As per 埶# (cut) + 火 fire | burn off extraneous objects | *heat* | *hot*.

Examples: 加油 醬油 石油
Etymology: As per 由# (pass/run through) + 水 water/liquid | *oil* running through the mouth of its container in being poured.

Examples: 良好 不良 優良
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a grain/kernel being washed in the flow of a pure stream | *good* (← pure) | *superior*; *truly*; *considerably*.

Meaning: eat; meal; food; KangXi radical number 184
Examples: 食物 糧食 偏食
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines the top element as described in 今 (cover) + a depiction of heaped grain | grain in a covered pile in a storehouse | *eat*; *feed*; *drink*; *consume* | *make a living*. Also, *strike/absorb a blow*, *scold/be scolded*, *defeat/be  defeated* and *lose* (territory/market share etc.) (← figuratively eat or be eaten into). (Insect) *bite* is a borrowed meaning via 蝕.

Examples: 圖書館 飯館 旅館
Etymology: As per 官# (official building) + 食 food/eating | official building for taking meals | (large) *building*; *inn*; *shop*. Also, *fort*, *mansion* and *place where cultural activities are held*.

Examples: 態度 狀態 動態
Etymology: As per 能# (bear) + 心 heart/emotions | bear-like attribute(s) | *attitude*; *condition* (← state of mind or circumstances involving the bear-like attributes in question). *Keep up appearances* is a borrowed meaning.
As per 丁# (straight) + an abbreviated form of 高 tall/high | object that stands straight and tall | *pavilion*; *arbor*; *watchtower*; *restaurant*.

Examples: 停車場 停止 停頓
Etymology: As per 亭# (stand/stand straight) + 人 person | person standing straight, having come to a *stop* | *stay*; *suspend*.

Examples: 幸福 福利 祝福
Etymology: As per 畐# as described in 副 (abundance) + 示 altar/the supernatural | abundant blessings from the gods/heaven | *blessing*; *wealth*; (good) *fortune*.

Examples: 救護車 救命 救火
Etymology: As per 求# (wrap) + 攵 action indicator | wrap the arms about a person in effecting a rescue | *rescue*; *save*; *help*.

Meaning: fall over; lie down; take turns
Examples: 倒是 倒楣 跌倒
Etymology: As per 到# (trace an arc) + 人 person (| human agency) | cause to *fall*, *topple* or *collapse* | *fell*; *put/lay down* (an object on its side); *defeat*.

Examples: 父親 母親 親切
Etymology: The left-hand element# as described in 新 (sharp, and in close proximity) + 見 see; watch | observe others sharply | *parent*; *relative*; *intimate* (← be in a close relationship and receive direct stimulus); *group leader*.

Examples: 害羞 害怕 厲害
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 丯# as described in 契 (cut through and separate) + 口 mouth | *harm* or *damage* caused by something cut/bitten through and thus separated | *prevent*/*hinder* (← prevent/hinder by separating). In the derivative characters 瞎 and 豁, the lower vertical stroke of 害 extends down to the 口 element.

Meaning: confusion, state of chaos; create chaos, revolt
Examples: 混亂 動亂 胡亂
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows the left-hand element to have been two hands untangling a ball of threads by by pulling the threads up and down (compare 䜌 as described in 戀). Meanwhile, 乚 is a variant of 乙 (rise and hit a block). The combination of elements suggests a ball of tangled threads | *confusion*; *disorder* | *disturb*; *disarrange*; *rebel*; *riot*.

Examples: 跑步 進步 散步
寶貝 寶貴 寶寶
Etymology: This character was written with a combination of many different elements before 寶 was settled upon as the standard form. Among these combinations, most of the forms featured both 宀 roof/building and 貝 commodities. The phonetic similarity to 富 suggests that the original idea of the character that came to be written 寶 was that of 富, namely, a building stocked with abundant possessions | *treasure* | *currency* | *cherish*.

Examples: 衝擊 打擊 反擊
Etymology: The top element# is a variant of 毄 hit. 擊 adds 手 hand/action indicator | *hit*; *strike* | *attack*; *shoot/fire* (a gun).

Examples: 舉辦 舉手 舉行
冬天 冬季
Etymology: Originally, a depiction# of food tied to a cord that winds about a peg. A seal inscription form adds 氷 ice | *winter* (season when preserved/stored food is consumed). Compare 蓄.

Examples: 終於 始終 終場
Etymology: As per 冬# (wind about) + 糸 thread | wind a ball of thread (compare 收) | *finish*; *end* (←  finish winding) | *the close*; *termination*; *conclusion*.

Examples: 感恩 恩愛 恩情
Etymology: As per 因# (superimpose) + 心 heart/emotions | feelings of *gratitude* that superimpose themselves on the heart and adhere | *favor*. Compare 懇.

Examples: 印刷 印象 印章
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 爪 claw/hand + a variant of the abbreviated form# of 宛 (bending figures) seen in 怨 and 苑 | press down on a person in forcing him/her to kneel | *seal* (← make an impression by pressing down) | *print*; *impress*; *mark*; *sign*; *symbol*.

Examples: 限制 期限 無限
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + 阜 piled earth | earth adhering in a pile in functioning as a barrier | *border*; *limit* | *restrict*; *to the greatest extent possible*.

Meaning: rely on, be set in; consent, obey a wish
Examples: 依靠 依據 依然
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄧ ㄎㄠ`  ㄧ ㄐㄩ`  ㄧ ㄖㄢˊ
Etymology: As per 衣# (billowing garment) + 人 person (| human agency) | *conceal oneself* in/behind another person's billowing garment | *lean against*; *depend (upon)* | *request*.

Examples: 不斷 打斷 判斷
Etymology: 斤# ax + the right-hand element of 繼 (sever threads) | *sever* a curving, pendent object | *cut/break* (off); *stop*; *act/do* (resolutely); *disappear* | *decision* (← resolute decision ← decisive cut; compare 判, 裁, 決 and 折) | *refuse*; *reject*; *decline* (a request) (← negative decision on a request) | *prohibit*. Also, *permission* (← favorable decision granting permission) and *ask permission* (← request a decision). *Give notice/warning*, *abstain from* and *quit* (a bad habit) are from the original sense of severance. Also, *make an excuse* (← give reasons for a faulty act ← give reasons for a decision).

Examples: 年輕 減輕 輕鬆
Etymology: As per 巠# as described in 徑 (extensive) + 車 vehicle | long, lightweight vehicle | *light*; *lessen/lighten*; *make light of*.

Examples: 環境 環保 循環
Etymology: 睘# was originally 袁 (wrap about/enclose) + 目 eye | all-encompassing observation (compare 觀). In derivative characters, the "all-encompassing" aspect of 睘 takes the aspect "circularity." 環 adds 玉 jewel | jeweled *ring*/bracelet | *circle*; *surround*. *Return* is a borrowed meaning via 還. For "ring," compare 鐶; for "bracelet," compare 釧.

Examples: 簡單 簡直 簡便
Etymology: 間# gap + 竹 bamboo | collection of bamboo *slats* with gaps between them | *papers*; *letters*; *documents* (← texts written on bamboo slats) | *omit* (← gap) | *simple* (← simplify by omitting).

Examples: 有趣 興趣 感興趣
Etymology: As per 取# (take hold of) + 走 run | move hurriedly toward something that has taken hold of one's interests | *interest*; *taste* (← move toward that which attracts one) | *intent*; *aim* (← that toward which the heart moves) | *import*; *purport*; *tenor*; *meaning* | *contents*; *aspect*; *appearance*.

Examples: 同志 意志 志氣
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 之# (forward motion) + 心 heart/emotions | move ahead with resolution | *resolve*; *will*; *aspiration*; *intention*; *aim*; *have one's heart set on* | *kindness* (← kind intentions) | *present/offering* (← gift made out of kindness). *Record* and *memo* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 新郎
Etymology: As per 良# (flowing stream) + 邑 village/settlement | village/settlement adjacent to a pure, flowing stream. Via "pure," 郎 came to indicate a "clean/pure young man," next became a term by which wives addressed their husbands, and finally developed into a euphemism for a male | *man*.

Examples: 鄉下 家鄉 故鄉
影響 音響 響應
Etymology: 鄕 here a variant form of 卿# (be positioned at opposite sides) + 音 sound | transmission of *sound* through space from point of origin to point of reception | *resonance*; *reverberation*.

Examples: 左邊 左右
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 工 work + a hand# | the *left* hand, aligned at an angle with the right hand in assisting a task.

Meaning: follow, listen to, submit; to accompany; subsequently, then
Examples: 隨便 隨時 隨手
Etymology: As per 隋# (collapsing pile of earth) + 辵 movement | collapsing earthen wall (compare 圮, 崩 and 壞) | *follow* (← like a trail of falling dirt).

Examples: 練習 教練 訓練
Etymology: Originally 柬# (separate) + 糸 thread | separate silk threads, then process them into a finished product | *train* | *knead*; *gloss*; *polish*; *discipline*; *mature*; *season*. The present form replaces 柬 with 東.

Examples: 繼續 連續劇 手續
Etymology: �� # combines 貝 commodities + an abbreviated form of 睦 large and cordial gathering | pass along commodities in a large (commercial) gathering. 續 adds 糸 thread | goods passed along like linked threads | *continue*; *occur in succession*; *do/occur afterwards*; *sequel* (← one after another). Also, *lead to* (← continue to a certain place/point) and *resume* (← continue after a pause). (The 四 element represents a variant of the lower portion of 坴.)

Examples: 釣魚 金魚 鯨魚
Etymology: A depiction of the hard, dried skeleton of a *fish*.

Originally 反# (thin sheet of wood) + 冊 (bamboo slats) | thin, flat *nameplate* (compare 榜) spread upon a gate | (votive) *tablet*; *flat*; *thin* | *left-hand element of a Han/Chinese character* (← element by which a character may be identified ← nameplate).
As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 竹 bamboo | bound set of inscribed, bamboo strips | *book*; *chapter*; *section*; *article*; *counter* for poems or articles.

Meaning: queen, empress, sovereign; (simp. for 後) behind, rear, after
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is the reverse of the elements combined in 司 (peer through a narrow hole), and thus refers to someone kept out of sight | *empress*; *queen* (← female members of the royal/imperial family, whose quarters were secreted deep within a palace; compare 宮).

Meaning: take charge of, control, manage; officer
Examples: 公司 司機 百貨公司
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄨㄥ ㄙ   ㄙ ㄐㄧ   ㄅㄞˇㄏㄨㄛ`ㄍㄨㄥ ㄙ
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines a variant of 人 person + 口# hole | peer through a narrow hole in overseeing or administrating | *administer*.

Examples: 公尺 尺寸
Etymology: A depiction of a person measuring the length of an object by extending the hand | *measure*; *measurement*.

Examples: 郵局 結局 出局
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a pair of bending lines demarcating a narrow frame | bracket; compartment | *office*; *bureau*; *department* | *situation* (← circumstances dealt with by a specific authority). The present shape is via a seal inscription form of  the character. Compare 句.

Meaning: see off, send off; dispatch, give
Examples: 傳送 送行 運送
Etymology: The right-hand element# is a variant of 奏 offer. 送 adds 辵 movement | *send* offerings | *send/see off*; *give*; *transport*.

Examples: 積極 極了 極其
Etymology: As per 亟# (stretch to full height/length) + 木 tree/wood | wooden pillar stretching between ceiling and floor | *extreme*; (positive/negative) *pole*; *end*. Also, *exhaust* (← exhaust/come to the end of one's resources).

Examples: 資源 來源 能源
Etymology: 原# origin + 水 water | *origin* of a *source* of water | *trace*; *fountain*.

Examples: 太陽 陽光
Etymology: 昜# rise + 阜 piled earth | high, *sun-drenched hill*; *sunny place* | *sun*; *warm*; *bright*; *positive*.

Meaning: trunk of tree or of human body
Examples: 幹部 幹嘛 幹什麼
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 乾 (rise high) + 干 thick bar | high-rising tree with a thick *trunk* | *main part*; *vitality*.
A depiction of curved wings, raised high | *feather*; *wing*; *plumage*. In dual-element characters, 羽 may also appear in the form seen at the right of 詡, 翩, 翅 etc.

Examples: 練習 學習 習慣
Etymology: Originally, 羽 feather/wing + 旦# (long and flat) | bird exerting pressure in flapping its long, flat wings. *Learn* is an extended meaning (← learn by repetition ← repeated action in flapping the wings) | *accustomed*; *custom*; *take lessons*. 旦 was later replaced by 白. In derivative characters, 習 most often appears in the form seen for example in 慴, 摺 or 褶.

Examples: 維持 維護 維他命
Etymology: As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 糸 thread | fix a net in place by tying it down with ropes | *tie up*; *rope* | *maintain*; *support*.
維# (net) + 网 net | large *net* | *thin silk*; *line up* (← grid pattern).

Examples: 武器 武術 武力
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 止# (stand straight) + 戈 spear/halberd | armed warrior(s) attending on a superior | *martial*; *military* | *ferocious*.

Examples: 疑問 狐疑 懷疑
Etymology: As per 矣# (come to a stop) + an obsolete element of unclear composition and signification. *Question* may be regarded as originating in the idea of "stop and interrogate a person," leading to the associated meanings *suspicion* and *doubt*.

Examples: 巧克力 公克 克服
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a helmeted head# + 儿 person | helmeted warrior, stretched to full height (compare 亟). *Overcome* and *conquer* are borrowed meanings.

Meaning: yet, still, as ever; again; keep -ing, continuing
Examples: 仍然
Etymology: As per 乃# (soft and clingy) + 人 person (| human agency) | (cause to) *cling/stick to* | *add to* | *furthermore*; *not only that*; *according to*; *in consequence*; *yet*; *still*.

Meaning: building of two or more stories
Examples: 樓上 樓下 大樓
Etymology: As per 婁# (continuum) + 木 tree/wood | wooden structure of multiple stories | *tower*; *lookout*.

Meaning: Buddha; of Buddhism; merciful person; Buddhist image; the dead (Jap.)
Examples: 佛教 佛經 佛像
Etymology: As per 弗# (split) + 人 person | person who splits away and disappears. *Buddha* is a borrowed meaning, 佛 being used to transliterate the Sanskrit buddha | *Buddhist image*; *the deceased*; *merciful*. *France* is via the phonetic construction 佛欄西.

Examples: 足球 不足 滿足
Etymology: A depiction of a *leg*/*foot*. Conceptually, the Old Chinese term attached to 足 would have involved compression or compaction (compare the cognate 束), for instance, in compacting an object by stamping or trampling it | *sufficient*; *ample* (← compact sufficiently/amply for the purpose) | *serve a purpose*. Also, *add*/*supplement* (← add material to that being compacted) | *compensate* (for); *aid*.

Meaning: low; to lower, hang, bend, bow
Examples: 降低 低潮
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows heaped earth with a line underneath, indicating the bottom of a pile. Later, however, this element was replaced by 氐# (low). 低 adds 人 person | person hanging the head *low* | *lower*; *short*.

Examples: 廣播 廣場 廣告
Etymology: As per 黃# (extend) + 广 building | long building that extends far over its locale | *stretch*; *extensive*; *spacious*; *vast*; *spread*; *widespread*; *enlarge* | *be popular* (← widespread popularity).

Examples: 麻煩 煩惱
Etymology: Originally, 見# (fix upon) + 火 fire | figurative fire fixed upon the head | *trouble*; *worry*; *suffer from an illness* | *annoy* (another). Also, *hesitate* (← be troubled over a decision).

Examples: 明顯 顯得 顯然
Etymology: 㬎# combines 日 here an abbreviated form of 旱 dry up + 絲 thread(s) | silk threads exposed for drying in the sun. 顯 adds 頁 head | expose and make *manifest* a person's head (specifically, a severed head; compare 縣 as described in 県) | *visible*; *clear* | *noticeable*; *remarkable*. Despite appearances, 㬎 has no etymological connection with 濕 or 隰.

Examples: 號碼 碼頭 起碼
Etymology: 馬# horse + 石 stone | precious stone the color of a horse's brain. The compound 碼碯 refers to agate/cornelian. Compare 瑪. *Yard* (unit of measurement equaling 91.44 cm) is a borrowed meaning. Appendix  Made-in-Japan Characters

The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows *slender* threads twisted together and thus linked | *darkness* (← so slender as to be barely perceptible, a situation likened to darkness) | *obscure*; *mysteriousness*; *black*.

Examples: 率領 效率 比率
Etymology: The present form is 十 (gather) + an element# combining a slender thread and protruding objects | curved threads brought into alignment, creating a compact unit | *proportion*; *ratio* (the リツ term). The meanings *command* and *lead* are from the once-separate ソツ term, which suggested the idea of gathering in a neat line and tightening into an orderly unit.

Examples: 神聖 聖賢
Etymology: As per 呈# (extend) + 耳 ear | figuratively extend the hear in listening attentively | *virtuous* (← superior practice) | *holy*. Compare 貞 and 聽.

Examples: 尾巴
Etymology: 尸# buttocks + 毛 hair | long, wavy hair of an animal's *tail* | *tail end* (of a long, thin object); *copulate*.

Examples: 壞處 破壞 壞蛋
Etymology: As per 褱# as described in 懷 (fall and be absorbed) + 土 earth | collapsing pile of earth, absorbed by the ground (compare 崩, 隨 and 圮) | *collapse*; *destruction* | *pull/tear down*; *breakage*; *damage*; *injury*.

Examples: 最初 初步 初級
Etymology: As per 刀 (cutting implement) + 衣 clothing | *begin* making a garment by cutting cloth (compare 裁) | *beginning* | *first*; *first time*; *naïve*. The pronunciation of the character has been influenced by 裁 (also meaning "cut cloth").

Examples: 賦予 給予 予以
Etymology: A depiction of a weaving shuttle that stretches threads straight out | *previous*; *beforehand* (← one ring of a shuttle moves forward to a new spot, so that the former position becomes one previously occupied. Conversely, from the perspective of the former spot, the new one appears to be in advance | beforehand). In Japan, 予 was also adopted as a Shinjitai (new character form) to replace 豫, according to which 予 also conveys the nuance of space sufficient to allow one to stretch and relax.

Examples: 預備 預習 預報
Etymology: 予# (stretch) + 頁 people | long line of reserve troops, or other personnel | *in advance* (← keep/prepare in advance) | *keep* | *deposit* | *entrust* (← entrust funds for safekeeping).

Meaning: particle used to express surprise or mild emphasis; (Cant.) slurred form of the number ten
Examples: 哎呀
Etymology: 口 mouth + 牙# for the sound alone to simulate a *cry of lament* | *yell*; *interrogative particle*.

Examples: 觀眾 聽眾 大眾
負責 責任 指責
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 朿# (stab) + 貝 commodities | the torment of *debts* piled one atop another | *torture*; *condemn*; *censure*; *urge*; *drive up*; *demand*.

Examples: 戰爭 鬥爭 競爭
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 爪 claw/hand + an element# combining a horizontal line symbolizing an object with 又 hand/action indicator | two parties tugging on a long, thin object | *struggle*; *compete*; *argue*; *fight*.

Examples: 丘陵
Etymology: A depiction of the rounded cavity of a geologic basin, one surrounded by hills | *hill*; *mound*.

Examples: 當兵 士兵
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 斤# ax + 廾 pair of hands | spread the hands over the long handle of an ax-like weapon (compare 父) | (armed) *soldier* | *army*; *weapon*.

Examples: 智慧 才智 理智
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is as per 知# (direct) + an element combining 曰 say/speech indicator and 于, here an abbreviated form of 吁 (exclamation) | speak with *wisdom*, and directly to the point | *knowledge*; *intellect*.

Examples: 錯誤 誤會 耽誤
Etymology: As per 呉# (rowdy) + 言 words | quarrel involving a *mistake* | *err*.

Examples: 環境 出境 入境
Etymology: As per 竟# (border) + 土 earth (for emphasis/clarification) | *border*; *boundary* | *area*. Also, *circumstances* (← situation in which one is fixed ← fixed border).
A depiction of a curving *river* boring its way through the earth in linking distant points. Compare 河. In characters such as 巡 and 邕, 川 appears in the form 巛.

Meaning: obey, submit to, go along with
Examples: 順便 順利 孝順
Etymology: 川# river + 頁 head (| group of people) | people following a winding course traced by a river (compare 馴 and 沿) | *follow* | *sequence*; *order*.

Examples: 野餐 視野 田野
Etymology: As per 予# (stretch) + 里 (long strip of land) | long stretch of fields | *field* | *plain*; *sphere*; *out of power/outside of government*; *countrified*; *rustic*; *rough/crude*; *baseball field*.

Examples: 清楚
Etymology: As per 疋# (point in opposite directions) + 林 forest (| luxuriant growth) | plant/shrub with numerous thorns pointing in opposite directions | *thorn* plant (compare 朿) | *whip* (← implement with thorns or thorn-like protrusions). *Plain* and *clear* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 寶貴 貴姓 珍貴
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 貝# commodities + a representation of a pair of hands wrapped about and compressing a large, round bundle | compress *valuable* goods in a bundle | *precious*; *value*; *cherish* | *respect*; *honor*; *noble*.

Examples: 負擔 負責 欺負
Etymology: The crouching figure described in 危 + 貝# commodities | stoop to *carry goods on one's back* | *carry*; *bear* (a load) | *be burdened*; *be shouldered with* (responsibility); *owe*; *sustain* (an injury); *turn one's back to/upon*; *go against* | *lose*; *be defeated*; *succumb* (to); *flee* (← be defeated in battle, then turn to flee; compare 北).

Examples: 感冒 仿冒 冒險
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of 冐 is 目 eye + 冃# covered parallel lines | wrap a long blindfold around the head, covering the eyes. *Risk*, *brave* and *dare* are associated meanings (← blind attack, interpreted in a positive sense) | *have a bad effect on*; *damage* (← results of such an attack). In contemporary Japanese usage, 冐 has been supplanted by 冒.

Examples: 討厭 厭惡
Etymology: 猒# was originally 口 mouth + an obsolete element (肉 flesh and 犬 dog/beast) | the disagreeable sensation of rich/fatty meat pressing upon the intestines | *be satiated*; *become tired/sick of*. 厭 adds 厂, an accretion of uncertain function. For a cognate term in Old Chinese involving rich food, compare 甘.

Examples: 壓力 壓迫 電壓
Etymology: As per 厭# (press upon) + 土 earth | *pressure* exerted on the earth by a heavy object | *press*.

Examples: 適應 舒適 合適
Etymology: As per 啇# (variant of 啻) (unify) + 辵 movement | form a single unit *appropriate* to circumstances | *suitable*; *fit neatly*; *match* | *move*.

Examples: 沒關係 關係
Etymology: 系# connection + 人 person (| human agency) | *connect*; *link*; *lineage*; *relation* | *affect*; *modify* (a verb). *Person in charge* is via reinterpretation of the constituent elements of this character.

Examples: 測量 測試 測驗
Etymology: As per 則# (beside) + 水 water | place oneself beside a body of water to *measure* its depth | *predict*; *estimate*.

Examples: 懷念 懷孕 關懷
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form of 褱# shows a trail of round tears falling from an eye + 衣 clothing | trail of tears absorbed in one's garment | fall and be absorbed. 懷 adds 心 heart/emotions | warm feelings harbored in the heart/breast | *fondness*; *yearning/longing*; *breast/bosom/heart*; *be dear to one*; *miss* (someone); *win over*. Also, *breast pocket* and *purse*.

Examples: 歡迎 迎接 迎合
Etymology: 卬# look up at + 辵 movement | assume a kneeling position in order to *greet* a respected visitor | *welcome*; *receive*; *meet*.

Examples: 配合 分配 搭配
Etymology: Abbreviated form# of 妃 spouse + 酉 alcohol container (| feast) | wedding at which two persons are joined/aligned in marriage, becoming spouses | *align*; *combine* | *distribute*; *allot*;  *assign* (← align in distributing, allocating etc.). Also, *wife* (← wife aligned with her husband; compare 妻).

Examples: 鬼怪
Etymology: Originally, an abbreviated form# of 旡 engorgement + the obsolete "head" element described in 思 (specifically, a skull with openings at top; compare also in this context 遷 soul departing from the body) | mysterious, large and lumpy being | *ghost/spirit*; *devil*; *demon*; *ogre*.

Examples: 魔術
Etymology: As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 鬼 ghost; demon | *demon* that figuratively rubs a person's senses into numbness. There is a strong likelihood that 魔 was devised to transliterate the first syllable of the Sanskrit Mara, referring to one of the gods in the Indian pantheon.

As per 冒# (long cloth wrapping) + 又 hand/action indicator | wrap an object with a *long* strip of cloth, covering it | *lengthy*. In the present form, the 目 (eye) element in 冒 is turned sideways; distinguish from 罒 (net).

Examples: 慢慢 慢跑 慢用
Etymology: As per 曼# (cover/be covered) + 心 heart/emotions | *sloth* (← heart figuratively covered by dullness) | *slow*; *idle*; *lazy*. *Conceitedness* and *boastfulness* are borrowed meanings.
口 mouth + 圭# for the sound alone to simulate the sound of retching | *vomit*. Also, a *child's laughter* (← gurgle with happiness ← spit up) | *fawning tone of voice*.
As per 重# (run through) + 艸 grass/plant. The original sense, concerned with vegetation, is now obscure. *Control*, *manage* and *valuable* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 懂事 懂得

Etymology: 口 mouth + 烏# for the sound alone to simulate a *sigh* | *lament*; *sob*.

Examples: 味道 口味 氣味
Etymology: As per 未# (minute) + 口 mouth | minutely scrutinize the *taste/flavor* of food | *zest*; *relish*; *appreciate*.

Examples: 批評 評估 評價
Etymology: As per 平# (spread level/flat) + 言 words | leveling words | *commentary*; *criticism*.

Examples: 跳舞 舞會 鼓舞
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is as per that described in 無 (perform a dance)# + 舛 crossing legs | figure performing a *dance of entreaty* before the gods | *dance*; *flit*; *glide*.

Examples: 細心 詳細 仔細
Etymology: Variant form of 緦 fine cloth | *fine*; *slight*; *thin*; *slender*; *narrow* | *detailed*; *dwindle*.

Examples: 醫生 醫院 醫師
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄧ ㄕㄥ   ㄧ ㄩㄢ`  ㄧ ㄕ
Etymology: As per 殹# (contain; cover) + 酉 alcohol container | medicinal brew in a container | *doctor*; *cure*. The present form combines 匸 contain/conceal and 矢 arrow, a character originally indicating arrows stretching from beyond a quiver or other container. 医 combines 匸 contain/conceal and 矢 arrow | arrows stretching from beyond a quiver or other container.

Examples: 上帝 皇帝
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character depicts objects straightened into a unity, suggesting a supreme god unifying heaven and earth. Compare 君 and 王. Later, the term was applied to an *emperor*, whose functions and powers extend in like manner over the earth.

Meaning: class, category, type; to belong to
Examples: 金屬 屬於 家屬
Etymology: As per 蜀# (adhere) + a variant form of 尾 tail | adhere/be attached in copulation | *be attached to*; *belong to* | *genus*.

Meaning: love; long for, yearn for; love
Examples: 戀愛 失戀 迷戀
Etymology: 䜌# is 絲 thread(s) + 言 (make verbal distinctions | distinct) | make tangled threads distinct by stretching and untangling them. 戀 adds 心 heart/emotions | attempt to untangle confused feelings (of longing, anxiety, or love) by figuratively stretching them straight (compare 攣 and 亂) | *long  for*; *be anxious for*; *love*. The top element of the present form of the character represents a tremendous simplification.

Examples: 腐敗 失敗 成敗
Etymology: As per 貝# (split open) + 攵 (strike) | *break* objects (such as shells) in two | *lose*; *defeat* | *miss*; *fail*.

Examples: 便宜 不宜 事宜
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 宀 roof/building + 多# (originally, piled meat) | tall, neat pile of meat in a room | *good*; *right* (← neat).
昜# rise + 木 tree/wood | poplar or *willow*, the flexible branches of which rise when caught in gusts.

Examples: 追求 追捕 追查
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄓㄨㄟ ㄑㄧㄡˊ  ㄓㄨㄟ ㄅㄨˇ  ㄓㄨㄟ ㄔㄚˊ
Etymology: �� is a tall pile of (heavy) objects exerting downward pressure. 追 adds 辵 movement | pressure an enemy army by pursuing it | *pursue*/*follow*; *drive off/out*; *expel*; *catch up with* | *add*.

Examples: 灌溉 灌輸
Etymology: As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 水 water | *pour* liquid, causing it to circulate | *irrigate*; *flow into*. For the idea of a great flow, compare 渙.
The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines a horizontal line + 屮 grass shoot | bud swelling above the surface of the earth. *Camp* and *barracks* are borrowed meanings, via 頓.

Examples: 春天 春節 春季
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄔㄨㄣ ㄊㄧㄢ   ㄔㄨㄣ ㄐㄧㄝˊ  ㄔㄨㄣ ㄐㄧ`
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 屯# (swelling bud) + an element combining 日 sun/day and 艸 grass/plant | *spring* (← season when buds and other vegetation swell in the sunlight that returns after winter) | *youth*; *sexual desire*.

Examples: 勇敢 不敢當
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 甘# (contain) + an element combining two hands and a slash indicating a cover | dare to remove covered or contained objects of great value | *daring*; *brave* (← daring attempt).

As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 从 a variant form of 從 (people in close formation) | circle of people connecting this world and the other world by calling up a procession of spirits | *sorcery*; *sibyl*; *shaman*; *medium* | *maiden in the service of a shrine*.

Examples: 靈魂 靈活 心靈
Etymology: As per 霝# (linked) + 巫 sorcery | medium invoking a procession of spirits | *spirit*; *soul*.

Examples: 瘋狂 狂風 狂妄
Etymology: As per 王# (extend) + 犬 dog/beast | dog that runs *wild* and extensively (compare 戻 and 猛) | *mad*; *crazy* | *manic*; *enthusiastic*. Also, *function improperly* (← fail to act normally).

Examples: 祭祀
Etymology: The top element was originally an abbreviated form# of 刷 scrape away impurities. 祭 adds 示 altar/the supernatural | purify unclean meat by scraping away impurities and making an offering of it | *offer prayers*; *worship*; *festival* | *event*.

Examples: 實際 國際 交際
Etymology: As per 祭# (scrape) + 阜 piled earth | scrape earth in creating a structure | *come into contact* | *edge* (← point of contact for the lines of a wall or other construction) | *brink* | *occasion* (← point of contact).
丨# line that penetrates from top to bottom + 又 hand/action indicator | ruler who brings heaven (top) and earth (bottom) into harmony (compare 氳) | *oversee*; *govern*; *overseer*.

Examples: 國君
Etymology: As per 尹# (ruler who brings heaven and earth into harmony) + 口 mouth | ruler whose commands create a harmonious group. The meaning *you* originally was with respect to social superiors, but in modern Japanese is used toward social equals or subordinates.

Examples: 群眾 群島 群居
Etymology: As per 君# (group) + 羊 sheep | *flock* of sheep | *group*; *crowd*; *herd*; *swarm*; *mob*; *throng*; *cluster*.

Meaning: a family clan, ethnic group, tribe
Examples: 民族 貴族 種族
Etymology: 矢# arrow + an abbreviated form of 旅 (pennant/banner) | arrows piled beneath the fluttering pennant of a *clan*/*tribe* | *family*.
As per 奇# (lean) + 馬 horse | rider leaning on a horse | *horse riding*; *counter for horsemen*.

Meaning: neck, nape of neck; sum; funds
Examples: 項目
Etymology: As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 頁 head | nape of the neck (connecting head and trunk) | *clause*; *item* (← figurative associations, from the idea of connecting points).

Examples: 戲劇 遊戲 戲曲
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 虛 (sunken) + an element combining 豆 (food stand, here a shape indicator) and 戈 spear/halberd (the combination indicating a particular type of bladed weapon) | sink a spear in a hole in the ground as a trap for game | *sport with* (← hunt for sport ← hunt). *Laugh uproariously*, *frolic*, *joke*, *play*, *tease* and *flirt* are by figurative association with "sport with" | *theater*; *drama*; *show*.

Examples: 遇到 待遇 遇見
Etymology: As per 禺# (curve) + 辵 movement | two persons who form a pair as they *meet* at a bend in a road.

Examples: 熱狗
Etymology: As per 句# (bend) + 犬 dog/beast | bending figure of a *puppy* on unsteady legs (compare 駒) | *dog*.

Examples: 最佳 佳節 佳人
Etymology: As per 圭# (neat) + 人 person | person of neat, attractive appearance | *beautiful* (compare 娃) | *good*.

Meaning: begin; man, father; great; a distance of ten li
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a seedling curving upward in spreading from a field or seedbed | *broad/wide*; *great*. Also, *beginning* (← beginning of a plant's life cycle) | *for the first time*. (*Suffix for male names*) is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 博物館 博士 賭博
Etymology: 尃# combines 甫 (spread) + 寸 hand/action indicator | spread in announcing/proclaiming. 博 adds 十 (gather) | a collection of numerous objects, spread over a surface | *broad*; *expansive*; *extensive* | *gambling* (← spread out objects being gambled) | *hit the mark*.

Examples: 痛苦 頭痛 悲痛
Etymology: As per 甬# (run through) + 疒 illness | *pain* running all through the body | *hurt*; *ache*; *sore*; *injure*. Also, *damage*, *trying* (experience), *pitiful*, *miserable*; *tragic* and  *horrible* (← painful experience), as well as *thoroughly* and *extremely* (← thoroughgoing/extreme pain).
A depiction of a *spine/backbone*, the bones neatly aligned in a row. Compare 脊.

Examples: 露營 營養 經營
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 榮 (curve about) + an abbreviated form of 官 (wrapped about/enclosed) | circular military encampment (compare 軍), illuminated by torchlight (compare the idea of illumination in 螢) | *camp*; *barracks* | *conduct* (business); *perform*; *build* (← set up camp).

Examples: 妹妹 姊妹
Etymology: As per 未# (minute) + 女 woman | *younger sister* (← female family member who is comparatively smaller).

Examples: 健康 康復
Etymology: 庚# (firm husk) + four marks suggesting scattered rice | firm, taut husk of a grain plant | *healthy*; *sound* (← firm and taut). 康 was devised to replace 庚 after 庚 acquired its borrowed meanings.

Examples: 改善 善於 妥善
Etymology: 譱 is 誩# as described in 競 (disputation) + 羊 (abundant) | abundant words (compare 詳) | *good* (← be abundant) | *right*. 譱 has been supplanted by the form 善.

Examples: 微笑 稍微 微弱
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄨㄟ ㄒㄧㄠ`  ㄕㄠ ㄨㄟ   ㄨㄟ ㄖㄨㄛ`
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# combines a representation of thread stretching above and hanging below a line + 攴/攵 action indicator | manipulate slight threads. 微 adds 彳 movement (for emphasis/clarification) | *slight*; *fine*; *minute*.

Examples: 徵求 特徵 象徵
歷史 經歷 學歷
Etymology: As per 厤# as described in 曆 (neat lines) + 止 (leg/foot) | walk with a neat gait | *passage*; *continuation*; *one's career*.

Examples: 偶爾
Etymology: A depiction of a large seal (for pressing images that adhere in soft clay or, later, on documents). *That*, *so*, *you*, *just*, *near* and *like* are borrowed meanings. In dual-element characters, 爾 sometimes appears in the reduced form 尓.

Meaning: put hand on, press down with hand
Examples: 按照 按時 按摩
Etymology: As per 安# (rest in/on) + 手 hand/action indicator | rest a hand on (forcefully) | *press down upon with the hand(s)* | *rub*. Also, *examine/investigate* (← press an object in various spots in examining it).

Examples: 編輯 編寫 編織
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄅㄧㄢ ㄐㄧˊ  ㄅㄧㄢ ㄒㄧㄝˇ  ㄅㄧㄢ ㄓ
Etymology: As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 糸 thread | weave a binding so that records spread but remain connected | *compile*; *edit*; *combine*. Also, *knit*.

Examples: 生病 看病 病人
Etymology: As per 丙# (spread) + 疒 illness | spreading *illness/disease* | *suffering*; *worry*; *distress*; *bad habit*.

Examples: 船隻
Etymology: An abbreviated form of 雙 (pair of birds), removing one of the 隹 bird elements in order to indicate *one of a pair* | *sole*; *only*; *a few*. *Counter for ships* is a borrowed meaning, likely owing to the connection between these vessels and sea birds.

Examples: 護士 護照 救護車
Etymology: A variant form# of 矍 (enclose in the hands) + 言 words | figuratively enclose another person in verbal protection | *defend/protect*.

Examples: 補償 補充 補課
Etymology: As per 甫# (spread) + 衣 clothing | spread a piece of material over a rip/hole to supplement and mend a garment (compare 裨) | *aid*; *mend*; *compensate*; *make up for*; *supply*.

Examples: 選擇 抉擇
Etymology: As per 睪# (pick out) + 手 hand/action indicator | *pick out*; *select*; *choose* | *classify*.

Examples: 抓緊
Etymology: As per 爪# (pick/pluck) + 手 hand/action indicator | *pick* | *pinch*. Also, *scratch*, an atavistic meaning derived from 爪.

Examples: 歲數 歲月 萬歲
帶領 領導 領域
Etymology: As per 令# (long sequence) + 頁 head | string of heads severed at the *neck* (compare 県 and 梟) | *rule*; *possess* (← display severed heads to demonstrate rule) | *domain*.

Examples: 尋找 找尋
Etymology: Originally 寸 hand/action indicator + an element# combining another hand with abbreviated forms of 左 left and 右 right | settle one's hands right and left. The original sense appears to have been that of a position of obeisance taken when visiting a superior in seeking to have a request granted | *visit*; *seek* | *search for*; *ask*; *inquire*. Additionally, the phonetic evidence suggests the hands would have been concealed in assuming the position of obeisance.
囗 here an abbreviated form# of 周 (an enclosure) + 人 person | *prisoner* confined in an enclosure.

Examples: 溫暖 溫度 氣溫
保養 培養 營養
Etymology: As per 羊# (abundant) + 食 food/eating | provide abundant *nourishment* | *nurture*; *support*; *bring up*.

Examples: 保守 防守 遵守
Etymology: Originally, 又# hand/action indicator + a covering element | enclose/surround to *defend* or *protect* | *guard*; *watch* | *govern*; *observe* (a tradition); *maintain* (a position); *keep* (one's word); *stick to*. Also, *protector*, *keeper* and *babysitter*. Later, 又 was replaced by 寸, also a hand/action indicator.

Examples: 流血 鮮血 血管
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 一# (fullness) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl | deep bowl filled with sacrificial *blood*, which was then swirled.

Examples: 鄰居 居住 居民
Etymology: 古# hard + 尸 buttocks | seat oneself on a hard surface | settle/set in place | *be present* | *exist* (compare 有, 在, and 存) | *stay*; *live*.

Examples: 胃口
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 肉 flesh + an obsolete element# combining 囗 circular enclosure and 米 rice | *stomach* containing meat/food.

Meaning: say, tell; call, name; be called
Examples: 所謂 無所謂
Etymology: As per 胃# (round) + 言 words | speak in a circumlocutory manner | *say*; *name* | *a saying*; *think*; *reason*.

Examples: 差異 奇異 異常
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows 廾 pair of hands raised straight above to the sides of a person's head (in affixing a crown). *Different* and *unusual* are extended meanings (← person different from all others, and thus unusual).

Examples: 憂鬱
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is an element combining 頁 head and 心 heart/emotions + 夊 here an abbreviated form# of 後 (drag along) | pensive, dragging state of mind, causing deliberate movement (compare 愛) | *sadness*; *anxiety*; *worry*; *grief*; *disappointment*; *depression*.

Examples: 優點 優秀 優惠
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄧㄡ ㄉㄧㄢˇ  ㄧㄡ ㄒㄧㄡ`  ㄧㄡ ㄏㄨㄟ`
Etymology: As per 憂# (deliberate movement) | *graceful*; *flexible*; *gentle* (← move gracefully, with great deliberation) | *excel*; *superior* (← graceful motion) | *kind*; *tender*. Here, 人 has  no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying a nuance that dropped from the original one.

Meaning: omen; million; mega; also trillion. China = million; Japan and Taiwan = trillion
Etymology: A depiction of animal bones and tortoise shells baked in divination rites, showing the curving cracks/splits that were scrutinized in *fortunetelling* | *sign*; *indication*; *omen* | *symptom*. *Trillion* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 跳舞 嚇一跳 跳高
Etymology: As per 兆# (split) + 足 leg/foot | split away from the ground in leaping (compare 躍) | *leap*; *jump*; *spring up*; *hop*; *prance*; *bound about* | *splash*.

Examples: 禮拜 禮拜天 拜拜
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 手 hand/action indicator + objects offered to the gods or a person of high rank (compare 奉) | *bow deeply* in making an offering, then split away (= make one's departure) | *respect*; *worship*; *pray to* | *receive* (an official post); *be assigned*.

Examples: 破爛 燦爛 腐爛
Etymology: 闌# link + 火 fire | *bright* chain of flames (compare the Old Chinese cognate 粦 and its replacement character 燐). The character was however reinterpreted as flames attendant to boiling (compare 燗) or cooking | *spoil*; *rot* (← overcook food to the point of spoiling it) |  *running sore*; *inflammation*.

Meaning: Asia; second; used as a prefix to names
Examples: 亞軍 亞洲
Etymology: A depiction of a square or rectangular foundation, *subordinate* to and pressured by the structure that fills it (compare 虛) | *sub*. *Asia* is via the phonetic construction 亞細亞.

Examples: 可惡 惡劣 厭惡
Etymology: As per 亞# (downward pressure) + 心 heart/emotions | hatred/resentment induced by being pressured | *evil*; *wicked*; *bad*; *hatred* | *wrong* (← bad attitude, answer etc.). There is a possibility that the graphically similar �� (one's true nature) described in 德 has influenced the meanings of 惡 in a reverse, negative sense.

Meaning: do not, is not, can not; negative
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows four sprouting plants + 日 sun/day | the setting sun, as seen from ground level, concealed by vegetation | *late*; *end*; *not be*; *must not*; *defy*; *disobey*; *refuse*; *decline*; *empty*; *vast*.

Examples: 規模 模仿 模糊
Etymology: As per 莫# (concealed) + 木 tree/wood | wooden *mold* concealed by clay covering it | *copy*; *imitation*; *shape*; *model*.

Examples: 狀態 形狀 症狀
浪漫 浪費 波浪
Etymology: As per 良# (flowing stream) + 水 water | a *wave* (likened to a stream of water flowing atop an even layer of water).

Examples: 無聊 聊天 聊天兒
Etymology: As per 卯# (bend) + 耳 ear | figuratively bend/incline the ear in listening | *slightly*; *somewhat*; *a little* (← be able to hear only slightly).

Examples: 增加 增長 激增
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄗㄥ ㄐㄧㄚ   ㄗㄥ ㄓㄤˇ  ㄐㄧ ㄗㄥ
Etymology: As per 曾# (pile) + 土 earth | pile earth | *pile up*; *add (to)*; *increase*; *gain*; *multiply* | *breed*; *extra*; *increasingly*; *more and more*.

Examples: 核定 核對 核算
Etymology: As per 亥# (stretched taut) + 木 tree/wood | taut/hard seed or kernel (belonging to fruit or nuts  grown on trees) | *hard seed*; *core* | *nucleus*; *nuclear*.

Examples: 刺激 激動 激烈
Etymology: 敫# combines 白 white + 放 scatter | waves colliding with rocks, scattering white spray. 激 adds 水 water for emphasis/clarification | *turbulence*; *violence*; *intense*; *severe*; *extreme*; *fast* | *be excited*; *urge*; *encourage*.

Meaning: land, continental; army; an accounting form of "six"
Examples: 大陸 陸軍 陸續
Etymology: 坴 was originally 六 (mound that stretches at length) doubled | a stretch of land. 陸 is 坴# + 阜 piled earth | *land* winding far, wide and high | *plateau*; *winding*; *jump up*.

Examples: 幫忙 繁忙 急忙
Etymology: As per 亡# (obscure) + 心 heart/emotions | obscure state of mind, on account of busyness or being pressed/hurried | *busy*.

Examples: 名詞 詞典 詞彙
Etymology: 司# administer + 言 words | *words* spoken in administrating | *phrase*; *expression*; *part of speech*.

Examples: 劇本 劇情 連續劇
Etymology: 豦 is 虍 tiger + 豕 pig/boar | boar likened to a tiger in ferocity. A scribal form character combines 豦# + 力 power/energy | *fierce*/swift activity | *severe*; *rapid*. *Drama* and (theatrical) *play* are borrowed meanings. 力 eventually came to be written 刀.

Meaning: stop, rest, lodge, stay overnight; constellation
Examples: 宿舍 住宿
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of the element now written 百 shows two figures squeezed into a bed, that shrink in curling positions. 宿 adds an element combining 人 person and 宀 roof/building | (place to) curl up and sleep | *lodging*; *shelter* | *inn*. Also, *be pregnant* (← lodge a fetus). There is no etymological connection with 百.

Examples: 著急 急忙 緊急
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows 急 to have originally consisted of 及# (press on) + 心 heart/emotions | feelings of being pressed upon | *rush*; *hurry*; *hasten* | *sudden*; *emergency*; *steep*.

Examples: 抱怨 擁抱 抱負
Etymology: 包# envelop + 手 hand/action indicator | envelop in the hands/arms | *embrace*; *hug*; *hold*; *have*; *carry*; *harbor* (ideas etc.) | *protect*; *brood*.

Examples: 安靜 冷靜 平靜
Etymology: 爭 struggle + 靑/青# (clean/pure) | *bring peace*; *calm*; *quiet*; *soothe*; *appease*; *quell*; *still*; *standstill*; *peaceful* (← calm a struggle).

Examples: 攻讀 攻擊 進攻
Etymology: As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 攵 (strike) | *attack/assault* with a pipe | (the) *offensive*.
As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 水 water | *inlet* connecting to a settlement | *river*; *bay*.

Examples: 大致 一致 不致
Etymology: Originally 至# arrive + 夂 leg/foot pointed downward (here an action indicator) | *cause* to arrive, actually or figuratively (= occur) | *bring about*; *do*; *exert oneself*. The present form replaces 夂 with 攵 action indicator.

Meaning: column, row or file of troops
Examples: 陣子 陣營
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 陳 (line up in tight rows) + 車 vehicle | line up military vehicles in tight rows | *camp*; (military) *position*. Compare 軍.

Examples: 嚴重 嚴格 嚴肅
Etymology: Abbreviated and variant form of 嵒 cliff + 敢# (covered) | rugged geologic feature such as a cliff covering the side of a hill/mountain | *severity*; *strictness* (← rugged) | *solemnity*.

Examples: 宗教 宗旨 祖宗
Etymology: 宀 roof/building + 示# altar/the supernatural | mausoleum with an altar, where the deified souls of ancestors are linked with their descendants (compare 祉) | *founder* | *religion* (← believers gathering about an altar) | *sect*; *branch*.

Examples: 尊敬 敬愛 敬酒
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the left-hand element# is 人 person + an element combining horns and a mouth | person who cries out and goes stiff with fear upon being charged by a ram. 敬 adds 攵 action indicator | *be stiff/formal/ceremonious* (compare 改 and 僵) | *respect*. Note that the left-hand element of 敬 is etymologically distinct from the independent character 苟.

Examples: 警察 報警 警告
Etymology: As per 敬# (stiff; upright) + 言 words | cause others to go stiff/upright by admonishing or warning them | *warn* | *regulate*; *alarm*; *careful*.

畾# is 田 field (tripled). This element is a variant of one that added another 夕 element at the bottom left of 多 (tall, neat pile of meat). 壘 is 畾 (pile) + 土 earth | earth piled into a long/tall and winding *rampart* | (baseball) *base*.

Examples: 秘密 密切 稠密
Etymology: As per 宓# (shut tight) + 山 mountain | mountain with dense vegetation, and tightly shut off from human access | *density* | *minute*; *be hidden*.

Examples: 垂直
