Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 土 earth + an element# indicating a pendent ear of grain | marker hung in alignment with a pile of earth, the two functioning as a boundary marker | *hang*; *suspend*; *sag*; *droop*; *drop* | *a hanging*; *straw curtain*; *flap*; *dangle*; *drip*; *dribble* | *sauce*; *gravy* (← liquids that drip from the mouth). Also, *confer* (← bestow on one of lower rank).

Examples: 睡覺 睡著 睡眠
Etymology: 垂# hang + 目 eye | eyelids hung in sleep | *sleep*.

Examples: 飯店 商店 書店
Etymology: As per 占# (fixed in place) + 广 building | *store*; *shop*　(← trade conducted in a fixed place, as opposed to itinerant peddling) | *inn* | *rented house*.

Examples: 勢力 地勢 氣勢
Etymology: As per 埶# (cut) + 力 power/energy | cut (something tall/long) energetically | *force*; *power*; *energy*.

Examples: 悲劇 悲痛 悲哀
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄅㄟ ㄐㄩ`  ㄅㄟ ㄊㄨㄥ`  ㄅㄟ ㄞ
Etymology: As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 心 heart/emotions | heart split by *sadness* or lamentation | *lament*; *grieve* | *mercy* (← strive to eliminate the sadness of common people). Compare and contrast 悱.

Examples: 伊斯蘭教
Etymology: Originally, 艸 + 闌, with the etymology running: As per 闌# (link) + 艸 grass/plant | *orchid* (with a linked series of vertical or horizontal shoots). *Holland/Dutch* is via the phonetic construction 阿蘭陀. The JIS form replaces 闌 with 門 + 東.

Examples: 字幕 閉幕 揭幕
Etymology: As per 莫# (concealed) + 巾 cloth | concealing *curtain* | *act* (of a play) (← curtain marking the start/end of one act).

Meaning: hem, margin; reason, cause; karma, fate
Examples: 緣故 邊緣 結緣
Etymology: As per 彖# (drooping/pendent) + 糸 thread | pendent *edge* of fabric | *hem*; *brim*; *rim*; *fringe*; *border*; (of glasses) *frame*. Also, *connection*; *fate*; *relation*; *marriage* (← edge of one object contacting that of another).

Examples: 週末
Etymology: 周# circulate + 辵 movement | *circulate*, completing one cycle (compare 期 and 季) | *week*.
As per 尚# (rise | raise) + 攵 action indicator | raise *high and wide* | *spacious*; *broad*.

Examples: 工廠 廠商
Etymology: 敞# high and wide + 广 building | spacious *workshop*.

Examples: 簽名 簽證 簽訂
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄑㄧㄢ ㄇㄧㄥˊ  ㄑㄧㄢ ㄓㄥ`  ㄑㄧㄢ ㄉㄧㄥ`
Etymology: As per 僉# (assemble) + 竹 bamboo | assemble inscribed slats and place them in a *bamboo basket*. Also, *sign* (← inscribed slat used as a sign) | *signature*.

Examples: 香蕉 香水 香腸
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄒㄧㄤ ㄐㄧㄠ   ㄒㄧㄤ ㄕㄨㄟˇ  ㄒㄧㄤ ㄔㄤˊ
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 甘# sweet + 黍 millet | sweet *fragrance/scent* of boiled millet wafting through the air | *incense*; *perfume*; *savory* (smell).

Examples: 爽快
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 大 stand outstretched + an X on both sides of the chest# | clear the heart and body of impurities | *clear*; *refreshing* (compare 清 and 淨). Later, each of the X marks was replaced by 井 well, with the present form in turn replacing the 井 elements with 爻.

Examples: 控制 指控
Etymology: As per 空# (emptiness) + 手 hand/action indicator | create space between two points, objects or people | *hold back*; *draw in* | *refrain*; *wait*; *await*; *keep from* (← hold back) | *be near at hand*. *Copy/write down*, *note*, *memo* and *a duplicate* are borrowed meanings.

Meaning: to take turns; a turn, a time; to repeat
Etymology: 釆# scattered seeds + a representation of a basket (now written 田) | reach into a basket and scoop up seeds to spread/sow them | *number*; *order* (← count the number of times the hand is inserted into a basket) | *keep watch* (← keep watch over in turn). 釆 replaces an obsolete character that likewise indicated seeds or grain.

Examples: 翻譯 推翻 翻臉
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄈㄢ ㄧ`  ㄊㄨㄟ ㄈㄢ   ㄈㄢ ㄌㄧㄢˇ
Etymology: As per 番# (spread) + 羽 feather/wing | birds spreading and flapping their wings in preparation to  take flight | *flutter*; *wave* | *dodge*; *leap up*. Also, *change* (one's mind) and *turn over*. Note a variant form, 飜, which replaces 羽 with 飛 fly.

Examples: 普遍 普及 普通
Etymology: As per 並# (long lines) + 日 sun/day | long rays of sunlight (compare 晡 and 昉) spreading *widely* | *generally*; *pervade*.

Examples: 蠻橫
Etymology: As per 䜌# as described in 戀 (tangled) + 虫 insect | tangled and barbarous, likened to a swarm of tiny insects | *barbarian*.

Examples: 冷氣 冷氣機 冷淡
Etymology: As per 令# (long sequence) + 氷 ice | long stretch of ice | *cold*; *chilly*; *cool*. Other extended meanings include *refrigerate*, *cold-hearted* (compare 惏), *surly*, *calm* and *quiet*. *Tease* and *window shopping* are via the sense of taking a cool attitude toward a person/purchasing.

Examples: 示威 威脅 權威
Etymology: 戌 here a variant of 戈# halberd + 女 woman | exercise *authority* over a woman | *dignity*; *majesty*.

Examples: 毒品 吸毒 病毒
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 生 (fresh, slender grass shoots) + 母# (succession of offspring) | stir boiled herbs in a cooking vessel (compare 融 and 熟) for use as an aphrodisiac | *poison* (← stimulant drug) | *damage*; *ruin*; *extreme*.

Examples: 英俊
Etymology: 夋 is as per 允 (run) + 夂 leg/foot pointed downward | stop running and stand erect. Hesitant is an associated meaning (← immobile with indecision). To 夋# (stand erect), 俊 adds 人 person | person of *quality,* *genius* and/or *excellence* (← superior posture).

Examples: 聯絡
Etymology: 各 here an abbreviated form# of 洛 (connect) + 糸 thread | connecting threads/ropes of a net | *connection*; *entanglement* | *coil*; *hook*; *line*; *rope*.

Examples: 編輯 邏輯
Etymology: As per 咠# as described in 葺 (press) + 車 vehicle | press gathered objects into a transport vehicle | *gather* | *arrange*; *put into order* (← harmonious arrangement; compare 燮). *Soften*, *calm* and *gentle* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 倉庫
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 食 food/eating + 囗 circular enclosure | make tall piles of freshly harvested grain/crops in a *storehouse* (compare 藏).

Examples: 創造 創作 創傷
Etymology: As per 倉# (pile) + 刀 sword/knife | start on woodworking, creating a pile of shavings (compare 乍) | *start upon* | *create*.

Examples: 教堂 課堂 禮堂
Etymology: As per 尚# (rise | raise) + 土 earth | raise a *tall earthen platform* (object stretching high in the sky) | *palace*; *hall* (← constructions built on a platform) | *temple*; *shrine*; *capacious building*.

Examples: 外套 手套 套房
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 長 long + 大 great | long and large, covering object | *cover*; *wrap*. *Timeworn* and *hackneyed* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 依舊
Etymology: 萑 is 隹 short, squat bird + 艸 grass/plant (here acting as a shape indicator, suggesting the curvature of a pair of ears) | horned owl. 舊 adds 臼# (stooped) | owl (← bird of a stooped appearance) | *bent with rot* (compare 朽) | *old*; *former* | *old friend*.

Examples: 雜誌 複雜 夾雜
Etymology: 集# assemble (with 木 repositioned) + what was originally 衣 clothing | assemble various rags into garments | *miscellaneous*; *mix(ture)*. With regard to the 衣 element, note a variant form 襍.

Examples: 上述 描述 敘述
Etymology: As per 朮# (pass through) + 辵 movement | pass through | *explain* (← explain in a straightforward manner) | *state*; *express*; *mention*.

Examples: 恐怕 恐怖 惶恐
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of 巩 is 工 (connecting pipe/tube) + an element combining 卩 kneeling figure with arms extended (seen also in 埶) and 手 hand/action indicator | kneel and pierce a hole in connecting two objects with a pipe/tube | secure/fasten. 恐 is 巩# + 心 heart/emotions | empty/uneasy feeling in one's heart (compare 匈), as though a hole has been pierced in it | *fear* | *threaten*; *fearsome*; *awe*; *dread* | *apprehension*; *concern* | *terrible*; *horrible*; *fierce*; *tremendous* (← aspects of a threatening or fearsome object). *Probably* and *possibly* are via the uncertainty of the state of mind that fears something desired may not in fact materialize.

Examples: 漂亮 月亮 光亮
Etymology: Abbreviated form# of 諒 clear (words) + 儿: *clear*. Here, 儿 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying a meaning that dropped from the original one. *Help* is a borrowed meaning.
A depiction of a *deer*, an animal that forms a long, winding herd.

Examples: 美麗 壯麗
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 鹿# deer plus a pair of neatly aligned antlers (compare 羚) | *beautiful*; *lovely*.

Examples: 禮物 禮拜 禮拜天
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element is 豆 food stand + grain piled atop in an orderly arrangement. 禮 adds 示 altar/the supernatural | well-ordered, lengthy ritual |  *propriety* | *salutation*. Distinguish the right-hand element in this character from the independent character 豊, which is a Shinjitai (new character form) of 豐.

Examples: 啤酒 酒吧 敬酒
Etymology: As per 酉# (alcohol) + 水 water (for clarification/emphasis) | *alcohol*; *liquor*.

Examples: 餐廳 餐桌 西餐
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄘㄢ ㄊㄧㄥ   ㄘㄢ ㄓㄨㄛ   ㄒㄧ ㄘㄢ
Etymology: The top element# combines 歺 a variant of 歹 severed bone/death + 又 hand/action indicator |  strip flesh from bones. 餐 adds 食 food/eating | strip meat from bones at a meal | *eating*; *eating and drinking* | *feast*.

The relevant seal inscription form shows a variant form of 左 (left hand) spread over the handle of an implement used to flatten or lower a surface, such as a spatula or a trowel | *low*; *lowly*; *base* (← bottom) | *vulgar*; *greedy*; *mean* | *humble*; *despise* (← make oneself/another lower).

Examples: 牌子 招牌 名牌
Etymology: As per 卑# (spread low) + 片 (thin and flat piece of wood) | low-lying *signboard* | *tablet*; (playing) *cards*.

Examples: 突然 突出 突破
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄊㄨ ㄖㄢˊ  ㄊㄨ ㄔㄨ   ㄊㄨ ㄆㄛ`
Etymology: 穴# hole + 犬 dog/beast | hole from which a dog/beast suddenly springs | *thrust*; *protrude*; *frontal assault*; *attack*; *sudden* | *stab*; *prick*; *pierce*; *strike*; *push* | *push through*. For "protrusion," compare 凸 and 出.

Examples: 腳踏車 腳步 腳本

Etymology: As per 僉# (assemble) + 刀 knife/sword | assemblage of blades in a double-bladed *sword*. The numerous variant forms include 剱, 釼, 劒 and 劔.

Examples: 招待 招牌 打招呼
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄓㄠ ㄉㄞ`  ㄓㄠ ㄆㄞ˙  ㄉㄚˇㄓㄠ ㄏㄨ˙
Etymology: 召# summon + 手 hand/action indicator | summon/*beckon* (with the hand/arm) | *invite*; *engage* (professionally). Also, *bring about* and *incur* (← set in motion by beckoning).

Examples: 字典 詞典 典禮
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form# of 侖 (neat, logical assemblage of bound records) + 丌 a stand/table | heavy assemblage of records on a stand/table | *code*; *tome* (← record of weighty rules and laws) | *ceremony* (← ceremony conducted according to written rules).

Examples: 房子 房間 廚房
Etymology: As per 方# (spread right and left, or in all directions) + 戸 door (| room) | the rooms of a spreading (= expansive) residence | *room*; *house*. *Tassel*, *tuft*, *cluster*, *bunch* and *section/segment* (of fruit) are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 因素 樸素 素食
Etymology: 糸# thread + an abbreviated form of 垂 hang | pendent white/raw silk | *element*; *basis*; *simplicity*; *from the beginning* (← raw silk forming the basis of fabric and clothing woven from it).

Examples: 防守 防止 防備
Etymology: As per 方# (spread right and left, or in all directions) + 阜 piled earth | earth spread and piled to create a curved *embankment* | *defend*; *protect*; *prevent*.

Examples: 教授 傳授 授課
Etymology: As per 受# (receive/accept) + 手 hand/action indicator | *confer* an object on another (= cause another to receive) | *give*; *grant*; *endow*; *award* | *teach*; *instruct*; *initiate*; *blessing*.

Examples: 草地 草原 花草
Etymology: As per 早# (rising sun) + 艸 grass/plant | the rising sun as seen through plant life | *grass(es)* and *plants* | *rough*; *low-grade* | (rough style of) *handwriting*; *draft*.

Examples: 暴力 暴躁 暴雨
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 日 sun/day + an element combining the curled hide of an animal with the bones still attached + 廾 pair of hands | spread an animal hide and *expose* it on the ground for drying in the sun | *reveal*. The meanings *violent*, *rough* and *sudden(ly)* are either via association (← strip a hide) or are borrowings.

Examples: 考慮 疑慮
Etymology: 心 heart/emotions + an abbreviated form# of 盧 (sunken) | be sunk in finely detailed thoughts (compare 思) | *consider*; *ponder*; *be concerned about*.

Meaning: continue, carry on; hand down; to join
Examples: 介紹
Etymology: As per 召# (curve) + 糸 thread | *join* threads in a continuous semi-circle | *introduce* (← join individuals by introducing them); *succeed* (← succeed in joining together).

Examples: 背包 背後 背景
Etymology: As per 北# (back) + 肉 flesh (to emphasize the physical aspect) | one's curved *back* | *height*. Also, *contrariness*; *go back on* (one's word); *go against*; *disobey*; *go/turn away* and *avert* (← turn one's back on), as well as *carry on one's back*.

�� # combines 金 metal + a variant of 卯 (bend). The original signification of this character is obscure, but likely similar to that of 戮 (kill). 劉 adds 刀 sword/knife | force a victim to bend/hang the neck then decapitate with a bladed implement | *kill*.

Examples: 委屈 委託 委員
Etymology: As per 禾# (hang low) + 女 woman | tired (and/or stooped) woman likened to low-hanging grain | *let go of*; *leave behind* (← let hang) | *entrust* (← leave matters to others ← hang listlessly); *devote oneself to* (← allow oneself to become completely devoted to ← let go of).

Examples: 政府 首府
Etymology: As per 付# (set in place) + 广 building | *storehouse* with goods placed throughout | *governmental office*; *capital*; *administrative division*.

Examples: 記憶 回憶
Etymology: As per 意# (contained in the heart) + 心 heart/emotions | various thoughts contained in the heart | *think*; *remember*.

Examples: 諸多
Etymology: As per 者# (pile) + 言 words | compilation (figurative pile) of *many/various* words.

Meaning: be short of, lack; gap, deficit
Examples: 缺點 缺乏 缺少
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄑㄩㄝ ㄉㄧㄢˇ  ㄑㄩㄝ ㄈㄚˊ  ㄑㄩㄝ ㄕㄠˇ
Etymology: As per 夬# (scoop out) + 缶 bulging earthenware jug/vase | hole scooped into earthenware to create a container. For other meanings, see 欠.

Examples: 支援 救援 援助
Etymology: As per 爰# (twist an object about a stick) + 手 hand/action indicator | *assist*/*help* the creation of a tool or the completion of a task by twisting an object (whether or not around a stick).

Examples: 浪漫 漫畫 漫長
Etymology: As per 曼# (cover/be covered) + 水 water | unrestrained water covering a vast area | *aimless*; *wide-ranging* | *involuntarily*.

Examples: 鋼琴
Etymology: As per 今# (contain) + 玨 (玉 jewel in abbreviated form, and doubled), here a shape indicator suggesting the outline of a particular musical instrument | musical instrument in which the sound is enclosed within a sealed base | *koto* (Japanese harp/zither).
馬# horse + 罒 net | angry noises produced by a netted horse | *insult*; *abuse*; *curse*.

Examples: 單純
Etymology: As per 屯# (swollen) + 糸 thread | tassel of swollen appearance, attached to the edge of an embroidered cloth | *purity* (← single hue of a tassel). For "tassel," compare 總 (threads compressed into a tassel).

Examples: 藝術 文藝 工藝品
Etymology: 蓺# cultivate + 云 (rise) | *cultivate*/raise plants | *skill*; *art*; *accomplishment* (← cultivation in a figurative sense). 藝 was devised to emphasize the "cultivate" meaning originally borne but largely lost by 蓺, but 藝 too came to convey primarily its figurative, associated meanings.

Examples: 愛惜 可惜 珍惜
Etymology: As per 昔# (pile) + 心 heart/emotions | negative feelings piled in the heart, in the form of *regret*, *disappointment*, lamentation etc. | *lament*; *reluctant* | (reluctant to) *spare/grudge*. Also, *cherish*, *hold/regard dear*, and *precious* (← be loathe to part with), as well as *pitiful* (← lament) and *wasteful* (← sparing/grudging).

Examples: 佈置 位置 設置
Etymology: 直# correct + 罒 net | *place/set/put* nets in correct position and *leave as is* | *deal with*; *position* | *every*; *every other* (day/month etc.) (← be positioned at equal intervals).

Examples: 利益 公益 權益
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 皿 dish/plate/bowl + the character 水 (water) turned on its side, indicating liquid filling a container | *fill* | *advantageous*; *benefit* (← possess full resources) | *profit* (← employ one's advantages to gaining profit). Note a variant form 益.

Examples: 姐姐 小姐
Etymology: As per 且# (pile) + 女 woman | *elder/eldest sister* (← female figuratively atop the sororal pile; compare 狙) | *young lady* | *wife of a gangster boss*.

Examples: 誠實 誠懇 誠意
Etymology: As per 成# (straight) + 言 words | words straight from the heart | *sincerity*; *honesty*; *integrity*; *fidelity*; *truth*.

Examples: 繼續 繼承 相繼
Etymology: The right-hand element# combines 幺 slender thread (quadrupled) + bisecting lines | sever, then link the tips of threads extending beyond a framing object. 繼 adds 糸 thread for emphasis/clarification, but 繼 came to indicate *inherit*, *succeed to* or *accede to*, in the sense of linking generations. *Resume* is an associated meaning.

Examples: 胡亂
Etymology: 古# hard; dried out + 肉 flesh | rough, dry beard covering the jowls | *barbarian* (← bearded foreigner) | *of foreign origin* (← barbarian foreigners). Compare 蕃.
As per 胡# (rough, covering substance) + 水 water | (originally, a silted) *lake*. Now a lake in the general sense of the word.
As per 谷# (cavity) + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure | empty space in the heart/belly that one craves to fill | *desire*; *greed*; *want*.

Examples: 咖啡

Meaning: lean on, trust, depend on; near
Examples: 可靠 依靠 靠近
Etymology: As per 告# (bend) + 非 (spread in alignment to right and left) | *lean on*, forcing someone/something to bend | *depend on*.

Examples: 松樹
Etymology: 公# open + 木 tree/wood | *pine tree* (species with "open" fronds).

Examples: 立刻 時刻 雕刻
Etymology: As per 亥# (stretched taut) + 刀 sword/knife | *cut/chop* at a taut object | *notch*; *carve*; *engrave*.

Examples: 年紀 紀念 世紀
Etymology: 己# arise + 糸 thread | raise threads. *History*, *narrative* (record) and *chronicle* are borrowed meanings, via 記.

Examples: 退步 退休 後退
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 日 sun/day + an element# combining 辵 movement and 夂 leg/foot pointing downward (| drop) | sun dropping to the western horizon | *retreat*; *withdraw* | *keep at a distance*; *shrink* (from) | *resign*; *decline*; *refuse*; *reject*; *refrain*; *drive off/out* (← keep at a distance). Later, the 日 and 夂 elements were altered to 艮 (adhere), though the bottom-right portion now exhibits a slight distinction.

Examples: 包含 含量
Etymology: As per 今# (contain) + 口 mouth | *contain in the mouth*; *contain*; *include*. Extended meanings include *bear (in mind)*, *have*, *hold* and *imply*, as well as *give instructions* and *understand* (← give instructions that the hearer takes in and comprehends).

Examples: 裁判 判斷 批判
Etymology: As per 半# (split) + 刀 sword/knife | judgment likened to a decisive cutting in two (compare 斷, 裁, 決 and 折) | *judge* | *seal* (of judgment); *size* (← seal of a particular size).

Examples: 解釋 釋放
Etymology: As per 睪# (align) + 釆 (scatter) | take/break apart an object, scattering then aligning the pieces | *release*; *explain*; *solve*.

Examples: 波動 波及 波浪
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄅㄛ ㄉㄨㄥ`  ㄅㄛ ㄐㄧˊ  ㄅㄛ ㄌㄤ`
Etymology: As per 皮# (align) + 水 water | waves breaking in alignment | *wave*.

Examples: 承認 承包 承擔
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 丞 (raise/rise) + 手 hand/action indicator | *receive*/*succeed to* (= be raised to) a high(er) post/rank etc. | *accept*; *hear*; *listen to* (← receive word of).

Examples: 堆積
Etymology: As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 土 earth | tall, heavy pile of earth | *pile up*.

Examples: 複製 製造 製作
Etymology: As per 制# (cut) + 衣 clothing | *cut* material for clothing | *manufacture*; *make*.

Examples: 關鍵 鍵盤
Etymology: 建# erect + 金 metal | raise a metal latch/bolt | *key* (of a piano, electronic device etc.).
As per 干# (press against) + 日 sun/day | sunlight pressing against and drying up the land | *dry up*; *drought*.

Examples: 趕快 趕上 趕緊

Meaning: side; by side, close by, near
Examples: 旁邊 一旁 旁人
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is as per 方# (spread) + an element combining two horizontal lines and 八 split right and left | both *sides* of the body | *by the side of*; *nearby* | *incidentally*. Also, *spread* (*all over*) and *element positioned on the right side of a  Han/Chinese character*.

Examples: 鉛筆 毛筆 筆記
Etymology: 聿# implement used to carve/draw characters + 竹 bamboo | bamboo carved into a *writing brush* | *writing implements*; *write*; *draw*; (literary/artistic) *work*.

Examples: 註冊
Etymology: As per 主# (stationary) + 言 words | *write down*/*annotate*, fixing words in place (compare 著 and 書) | *comment*; *interpret*.

Examples: 演奏
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 廾 (pair of hands) + an element# representing a skinned, sacrificial animal the limbs of which are gathered together | *offer*/*present* a sacrificial animal | *report*; *play an instrument* (← offer a report/recital).

Examples: 樹木 樹林 果樹
Etymology: 尌# is 寸 hand/action indicator + 壴 as described in 鼓 (round drum set on a stand) | set/stand a drum in place | set/stand in place. 樹 adds 木 tree/wood | stand up a sapling in planting it | *set up*; *tree*; *plant* (v.).

Examples: 法律 律師 規律
Etymology: 聿# implement held upright to carve/draw characters + 彳 movement (| action indicator) | create written standards for regulating human conduct | *law*; *rule*; *regulate*. Compare 埒, 法, 笵 and 憲.

Examples: 地鐵 鐵路 鋼鐵
Etymology: 戜 combines 呈 (extend) + 戈 here a variant form of 伐 (cut down) | cut an extensive portion | large. In place of 戜, the right-hand element# of 鐵 substitutes �� as described in 栽 (| cut; sever). 鐵 adds 金 metal | metal used to cut (large portions of) other objects | *iron*.

Examples: 繁榮 光榮 榮幸
Etymology: �� # is 火 fire (doubled) + 冖 cover (| fire ring) | campfire burning within a fire ring. To �� (curve about), 榮 adds 木 tree/wood | blossoming flowers that curve about a tree | *blossom*; *thrive*; *flourish*; *be attractive*; *be conspicuous*; *be brilliant* | *prosper*; *boom*; *shine*; *glory*.

Examples: 昨天
Etymology: As per 乍# (create a pile) + 日 sun/day | figurative pile of days (compare 昔 and 時) | *past*; *day/year before*. 昔 and 昨 likely were variants of each other that eventually diverged in usage.
As per 爪# (pick/pluck) + 木 tree/wood (| fruit-bearing tree) | *pick*/*pluck* colorful fruit | *coloration*; *appearance*. *Die/dice* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 彩色 精彩 色彩
Etymology: 采# coloration + 彡 pattern | colors and patterns | *coloration* | *colorful* | *decoration*; *appearance*.

Examples: 歸還 歸納
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 帚 hand holding a broom + �� # as described in 追 (tall pile of objects) | sweep in circular fashion, gathering a pile. *Return* is an extended meaning (← sweep in a circle, returning to one's starting point) | *leave* (← leave to return home). A seal inscription form adds 止 stop to suggest completion of action.

Examples: 得罪 犯罪 罪惡
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 自# (nose) + 辛 needle/cutting tool | criminal marked for life by having his nose cut off (compare 劓) | *crime*; *sin*; *guilt*; *accuse*; *punish*; *mistake*. As the 自 atop 辛 form was uncomfortably similar to the character 皇 (emperor), it was eventually transformed into 罒 atop 非.

比# line up + 白. 白 replaces an obsolete element of uncertain signification, and the reason for the  selection of 白 is also obscure. *All*, *everyone* and *everything* appear to be connected with the general idea of lining up many people/objects.

Meaning: leaf, petal; page of book; period
Examples: 茶葉 葉子 中葉
Etymology: 枼# is a depiction of three leaves growing from the top of a tree, suggesting slight objects (thin, flat leaves) piled on each other. 葉 adds 艸 grass/plant (for emphasis/clarification) | *leaf* | *thin object*. *Era* and *age* are extended meanings (← piling up of generations ← fallen leaves piled upon each other; compare 祖 and 昔).

Examples: 出售 零售 銷售
Etymology: A simplified form of 讐/讎 rival, applied to rivalry in selling | *sell*.

Examples: 飛彈 彈性 原子彈
Etymology: As per 單# (weapon) + 弓 bow | *projectile* sent flying by a weapon | *bullet*; *shell*; *cannonball*. Also, *rebound*; *bounce*; *bound* (← actions of a round projectile) | *spring (up)*, as well as *winded*, *stimulated*, *excited/in high spirits* and *free with money* (← frenzied activity).

Examples: 保衛 衛生 衛生紙
措施 施工 實施
Etymology: As per 也# (stretch) + the pennant/banner element described in 旅 | streamer pushed forward by a breeze | *put into effect*; *perform*; *carry out* (← push forward) | *bestow*; *grant*; *provide*; *give alms/charity*.

Examples: 座右銘
Etymology: As per 名# (reveal oneself) + 金 metal | *engrave* an *inscription* in a metallic vessel, revealing the names of the artist or the person commissioning the work, the reasons for commemoration etc. | *inscribe*; *signature*; *motto* | *memorize* (← memorize something inscribed/written).

Examples: 冰塊 一塊 一塊兒
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄅㄧㄥ ㄎㄨㄞ`  ㄧ ㄎㄨㄞ`  ㄧ ㄎㄨㄞ`ㄦ˙
Etymology: As per 鬼# (large and lumpy) + 土 earth | large *lump/clod* of earth (compare 圣 as described in 怪, as well as 顆) | *cluster*; *group*.

Examples: 漢語 漢字 漢堡
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of �� shows the stretched hide of an animal tied to a frame + 火 fire  | stretch an object for drying over a fire. According to this process the object shrinks, leaving a minute remainder. 漢 is as per �� # (stretch) + 水 water | great, stretching river | the Milky Way (← constellation likened to a great, flowing river). The meaning *China* comes from a broad application of 漢's use in the name of the Hanshui River (漢水) in Hubei Province. Also, *man* (← ordinary male ← general populace ← general term for China).

Examples: 欣賞
Etymology: 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure + 斤# for the sound alone to simulate a joyous sound | raise a joyful sound | be *happy/pleased*. Compare 喜.

Examples: 欣賞 獎賞
Etymology: As per 尚# (disperse) + 貝 commodities | disburse (= disperse) a *reward* | *prize* | *praise*; *appreciation*.

Examples: 記載
Etymology: �� # as described in 栽 (cut; sever) + 車 vehicle | *load* cut wood on a vehicle (compare 輜) | *place atop* | *print*; *publish* (← publish by placing in print); *make a note of* (← publications that bear printed characters).

Examples: 危險 保險 風險
Etymology: As per 僉# (assemble) + 阜 piled earth | assemblage/convergence of cliff walls in a narrow mountain pass | *narrow pass* | *strategic point*; *rugged*; *dangerous*; *obstruction*.

Meaning: sow, spread; broadcast; cast away, reject
Examples: 廣播 傳播 轉播
Etymology: As per 番# (spread seeds) + 手 hand/action indicator | *sow*, *spread* or *scatter* (seeds). There is a disconnect between the Old Chinese and more recent pronunciations of this term.

Examples: 兒童
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is an element combining 東 (pierced sack) and 土 earth (suggesting the same idea found in 重 of weight thrusting heavily down upon the earth) + another element combining a needle and an eye | run through a slave-child's eye with a needle (compare 民, 敃 and 僕) | *child* (← child servant ← servant ← slave). The present form amalgamates the top two elements into 立 and the bottom two into 里.

Examples: 點鐘 分鐘 鐘頭
Etymology: As per 童# (run through) + 金 metal | *bell* (metal object struck with a motion as though to run through it; compare 鍾 as well as 鈴).

As per 奇# (lean) + 宀 roof/building | *lean on* or *draw near*/toward a building | *approach*; *bring near*; *call at/upon*; *step aside* | *depend on*; *gather* (← call at another person's dwelling for food and shelter) | *add* (up to) (← gather). Also, *entrust* (← be entrusted with the care of others) and *send* (← have objects brought to another).

Meaning: do, play or fiddle with; alley
Examples: 弄錯 玩弄
Etymology: 廾# pair of hands + 玉 jewel | hands curved about a jewel in handling/toying with it (compare 玩) | *play*; *fiddle with*; *toy/trifle with* | *tease*; *mock*; *ridicule*.

Examples: 構成 構造 機構
Etymology: As per 冓# (symmetry) + 木 tree/wood | assemble wood in fabricating a *structure* the front and back of which are symmetrical | *fabricate*; *build* | *prepare*; *device*; *style*; (mental) *preparation* | *mind/care about*. Other extended meanings from "prepare" or "fabricate" include *hospitality*; *interfere*; *feign*; and (assume a) *posture/attitude*.

Examples: 囉嗦
磁帶
Etymology: As per 茲# (luxuriant growth) + 石 stone (| mineral) | minerals rushing toward each other in a magnetic field | *magnetism* | *porcelain* (← use of such minerals in ceramic glaze). For porcelain, compare 瓷.
As per �� # as described in 榮 (curve about) + 虫 insect | insect (such as a glow-worm) that produces a ring of light | *firefly*. Compare the idea of illumination in 營.

Examples: 偉大 雄偉 宏偉
Etymology: As per 韋# (go around) + 人 person | layers of fat encircling a person of conspicuous girth | *great* | *renowned*.

Examples: 推薦
Etymology: 廌 here a variant of 塵# (advancing herd of deer) + 艸 grass/plant | herd of deer grazing as it advances | advance to present an offering | *urge*; *recommend* (← urge another to advance).

Examples: 海洋 大洋洲 西洋
Etymology: As per 羊# (abundant) + 水 water | *ocean* (← abundant water) | *Western*; *foreign* (←  things beyond an ocean).

Examples: 開啟 啟發 啟示
梅花
Etymology: As per 毎# (dark) + 木 tree/wood | *plum* (tree with abundant, dark fruit; compare 某). Note a variant form, 楳.

Examples: 策略 對策 政策
Etymology: 朿# thorn + 竹 bamboo | sharp-pronged whip/stick for taming a horse. *Policy*, *plan*, (bamboo) *slat*, *record* and *document* are all borrowed meanings (for bamboo writing slats, compare 冊).

As per 喜# (emit a joyful voice) + 口 mouth | emit a *joyful voice* | *laugh*. *Interjection* (of lamentation) is a borrowed meaning. 嘻 was devised to replace 喜 after 喜 came to refer to joy and pleasure in general as opposed to joyful voices.

Examples: 紅綠燈 燈光 電燈
Etymology: 登# rise + 火 fire | *light* raised high, such as a torch.

Examples: 檢查 檢驗 檢討
Etymology: As per 僉# (assemble) + 木 tree/wood | sort through/*check* an assemblage of wooden tablets | *inspect*; *investigate* | *seal* (← stamp a seal on tablets that have been inspected) | *regulate*.

Examples: 宣布 宣傳 宣稱
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄒㄩㄢ ㄅㄨ`  ㄒㄩㄢ ㄔㄨㄢˊ  ㄒㄩㄢ ㄔㄥ
Etymology: As per 亘# (circle about) + 宀 roof/building | circle about a structure in proclaiming | *announce*; *state*.
口 mouth + 我# for the sound alone to simulate an exclamation | *sing/recite*.

Examples: 媽媽 舅媽
Etymology: 女 woman + 馬# for the sound alone to simulate the nursery term "ma(ma)" | *mother*.

Examples: 平均 均衡 均勻
Etymology: 匀# uniform + 土 earth | level earth to uniform height | *even*; *equal*; *average*.

Examples: 黨派 派出所 派對
Etymology: �� # is a depiction of branching rivulets. 派 adds 水 water | distributaries of a main watercourse | *faction*; *group*; *school* (← branches of a main organization).

Examples: 整齊 齊全 一齊
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of 齊 shows three slender, diamond-shaped objects arranged/aligned neatly. A bronzeware inscription form adds 二# (align), while a seal inscription form transforms 二 into a board (or a piece of cloth; in either case acting to represent things in general; compare 牛 in 物, and 半) | *equality*; *arrange*; *neater*; *all together* (← match up/align).

Meaning: to help, aid, relieve; to ferry, cross
Examples: 經濟 救濟
Etymology: As per 齊# (align) + 水 water | goods in alignment on opposite sides of a river | *ferry* (across); *cross* (a river); *pass safely* | *relieve*; *aid*; *help* (← ferry material aid) | *manage* (to do/with); *finish*; *be over/at an end* | *economic management*; *settle an account*; *pay* | *settle* (a matter). Also, *do without* (← manage to do without) and *adjust*.

Examples: 吵架 打架 書架
Etymology: As per 加# (place atop) + 木 tree/wood | wooden framework atop which something is constructed | *put on*; *build* | *span*; *bridge girder*.

Examples: 享受 享有 分享
Etymology: A depiction of one of a pair of gates positioned at opposite ends of an enclosure | *entertain guests*; *enjoy* (← entertainment taking place in such a structure) | *receive* (entertainment/a privilege etc.) (← be the recipient of entertainment).

Examples: 教訓 訓練 培訓
Etymology: As per 川# (bore through) + 言 words | (a) *teaching* (← words that allow one to bore through a difficult problem) | *interpret*; *KUN reading* of a Han/Chinese character (← grasp the signification of a character ← comprehend in learning; the contrast is to 音, where the idea is to read a character for its sound).

Examples: 監視 監獄 監督
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧㄢ ㄕ`  ㄐㄧㄢ ㄩ`  ㄐㄧㄢ ㄉㄨ
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 臥 lie face down + an element# combining 皿 dish/plate/bowl and a line above it indicating water | lie face down and observe the reflection of one's face in water contained in a bowl/container | *keep watch over*; *supervise*. Compare 督 and 臨.

Examples: 藍色
Etymology: As per 監# (bowl/container) + 艸 grass/plant | *indigo* dye extracted from plant matter then allowed to run into a bowl or container.

Examples: 計劃 規劃 策劃
Etymology: 畫# demarcate/mark off + 刀 sword/knife | *demarcate*/*mark off* with a bladed implement | *divide*.

厃# combines 厂 cliff (immediately beneath which objects adhere) + a crouching person | person crouched atop a cliff, hidden from the sight of those below. Later, crouching became associated with the idea of slumping in shouldering a burden. The original form of 詹 adds 言 words | bear/endure the burden of another person's *annoyingly verbose* speech | *harp on*. 詹 acquired the element 八, a graphic accretion unrelated to the character's etymology.

Examples: 擔心 擔任 負擔
Etymology: As per 詹# (bear a burden) + 手 hand/action indicator | *shoulder a load*; *load*; *bear*; *undertake*.

Meaning: to exert, strive, make an effort; to pout
Examples: 努力
Etymology: As per 奴# (strenuous activity) + 力 power/energy | *strive*/make great exertions | *exert oneself*.

As per 享 (enclosure) + 邑 village/settlement | *enclosure* about a village/settlement | *quarters*; *red-light district*. The phonetic evidence suggests that the 享 element in 郭 has replaced a graphically similar element indicating a circular enclosure; compare 或.

Examples: 兼職
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows two ears of grain + a hand | storehouse encompassing grain that has been gathered then stored/put away | *combine*; *unite*; *serve/perform concurrently*; *simultaneous*. *Unable to do* is a borrowed meaning. In derivative characters, 兼 may also appear in the form seen for example in 嗛, 歉 or 賺.

Examples: 道歉 歉意 抱歉
Etymology: 兼 here an abbreviated form# of 慊 unsatisfactory + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure | an *unsatisfactory* state of *insufficient* provisions.

Examples: 報紙 衛生紙 紙張
Etymology: As per 氏# (flat) + 糸 thread | combed fibers pulled together and flattened into *paper* | *newspaper*.

Meaning: paste to, stick on; attached to
Examples: 體貼 貼心 津貼
Etymology: As per 占# (fixed in place) + 貝 commodities | commodities that secure/fix a loan in place | security; mortgage. Also, *put/stick on*, *paste* and *post* (← fix in place).

Examples: 暗中 黑暗 暗暗
Etymology: As per 音# (indistinct) + 日 sun/day | scant light | *dark*; *dim* | *secretly*; *hidden*; *gloomy*; *ignorant*.

Examples: 打招呼 呼吸 歡呼
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄉㄚˇㄓㄠ ㄏㄨ˙  ㄏㄨ ㄒㄧ   ㄏㄨㄢ ㄏㄨ
Etymology: 乎# exclamation + 口 mouth (for emphasis/clarification) | *call*; *call out* | *call/send for* | *summon*; *invite* | *bring about*; *arouse*; *attract* (← action that attracts/brings about a response).

Examples: 罷工 罷了
Etymology: The lower element was originally 卑 (flatten or lower). The addition of 罒 net indicated the spreading/lowering of a net over prey, ending a hunt. *Leave* (off), *stop* and *end* are associated meanings. In the present form, 卑 is replaced by 能 (bear).

Examples: 巧克力 技巧 巧妙
Etymology: 丂# as described in 号 (extend then bend) + 工 work | a piece of work characterized by curved lines | *skill*; *ingenuity*.

Examples: 彗星
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows 又# hand wrapped around the bamboo handle of a *broom* (compare 帚) | *brush*; *sweep*. *Comet* is via assigning 彗 the signification of the compound 彗星.

Examples: 智慧
Etymology: 彗# comet (| bright object) + 心 heart/emotions | *bright*; *intelligent*; *wise* (← intelligence likened to a bright comet within the mind).

Examples: 穿梭
Etymology: 穴# hole + 牙 fangs/mesh | using fangs, pierce a hole | *make a hole*; *dig*; *drill* | *pass through*; *pass an object through*; *penetration*; *investigate thoroughly*. Also, *wear/put on* (footwear) (← foot that penetrates the hole of footwear). For the idea of piercing, compare 串 and 丱.

Examples: 詳細 安詳 周詳
Etymology: As per 羊# (abundant) + 言 words | abundant words | *detailed*. Also, *familiarity* (← have detailed knowledge of something).

Examples: 雷達 雷同
Etymology: Once 畾# as described in 壘 (pile) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | successive (= figuratively piled) claps of *thunder* | *lightning*.

Examples: 協助 妥協 協辦
Etymology: 劦 triples 力 power/energy | the combined, harmonious power of many persons, pressing on a central point from two or more sides. 協 is 劦# + 十 (gather) | the united energies of many | *unite*; *cooperation*.

Examples: 叔叔
Etymology: 尗# shows a pendent, twisted bean vine (compare 弔, 弗, and 弟) + 小 small/slender | slender, hanging vine (compare also 寂). 叔 adds 又 hand/action indicator | pick beans from a slender, hanging vine | end | younger brother of one's father (← younger siblings on a figurative family vine ← beans on a vine; compare 弟 younger brother) | *uncle* (younger or older, either one).

Examples: 基督教 督促 基督
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧ ㄉㄨ ㄐㄧㄠ`  ㄉㄨ ㄘㄨ`  ㄐㄧ ㄉㄨ
Etymology: As per 叔# (slender and pendent) + 目 eye | watch over, the eyes figuratively hanging overhead | *supervise*; *command*. Compare 監 and 臨.
戸# door + 隹 short, squat bird | caged bird | *employ*; *hire* (← workers likened to caged birds). *Pay* is an extended meaning (← provide funds to keep the services of an employee).

Meaning: look back; look at; look after
Examples: 顧客 照顧 不顧
Etymology: As per 雇# (caged bird) + 頁 head | caged bird looking about nervously (compare 瞿) | *look back* | *consider*; *review*; *reflect on*; *take note of*; *pay attention to*.

Examples: 丟臉 臉色 翻臉
Etymology: As per 僉# (assemble) + 肉 flesh | assemble shredded meat on a platter. The *area between the  eyes and cheekbones* and *the face* are borrowed meanings.
夆# meet + 辵 movement (for emphasis/clarification) | *meet*.

Examples: 半島 島嶼 群島
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 鳥 (curve upward) + 山 mountain | mountain-like projection rising from the sea | *island*. 嶋 is a variant form often used in surnames.

Examples: 獎學金 得獎 獎金
Etymology: As per 將# (prod forward) + 大 stand outstretched | extend the arms in prodding others forward | *encourage*; *promote*.

Meaning: to swim; float, drift; wander, roam
Examples: 游泳 游泳池 上游
Etymology: As per 斿# (float) + 水 water | *float*; *drift*; *swim*. *Roam* and *wander* are borrowed meanings via 遊 | *enjoy* (← enjoy a rambling life). 游 was devised to replace 斿 after 斿 acquired its borrowed meanings.

Examples: 批評 批判 批發
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄆㄧ ㄆㄧㄥˊ  ㄆㄧ ㄆㄢ`  ㄆㄧ ㄈㄚ
Etymology: 比# compare + 手 hand/action indicator | *critique*; *criticize* (← critique/criticize by comparing).

Examples: 策略 忽略 侵略
Etymology: 各 here an abbreviated form# of 洛 (connect) + 田 field | paths connecting fields | *manage* | *abbreviate* (← make shortcuts) | *consider*; *outline*; *broadly*; *tactics* (← tactically effective shortcuts). *Plunder* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 縮短 短缺 短暫
Etymology: As per 豆# (a stand) + 矢 arrow | *short*, cylindrical stand for (long) arrows.

Examples: 幻想 幻象 科幻
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is a reverse image of the seal inscription form of 予 (stretch), suggesting the faintly visible tip of a thread stretching/protruding beyond a surface. The present style combines 幺 slender thread with an element signifying a slight wavering. The common reference is to a faintly wavering, slender thread | *illusion*; *vision*; *specter*; *phantom* | *confusion*.

Examples: 沙發 沙漠 沙灘
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕㄚ ㄈㄚ   ㄕㄚ ㄇㄛ`  ㄕㄚ ㄊㄢ
Etymology: 少 here a variant form of 次# (align) + 水 water | sift *sand* in aligning and sorting out desired objects | *sort*; *select*.

Examples: 散步 分散 擴散
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows 散 to be a variant of a character that is �� as described in 麻 (hemp) + an element combining 肉 flesh and 攴 action indicator | shred and *scatter* vegetable matter or flesh | *resolve*; *remove*; *pointless*. For the idea of shredding or stripping away, and for the graphical evolution of 散 as well, compare the remnant element above 食 in 餐.

Examples: 敵人 天敵
Etymology: As per 啇# (variant of 啻) (unify) + 攵 action indicator | unite to resist a powerful enemy | *enemy/rival/competitor*; *resist*.

Examples: 輪胎 輪船 輪流
Etymology: 侖# neat assemblage/alignment + 車 vehicle | neatly ordered spokes of a *wheel* | *circle*; *ring*; *loop*; *hoop*; *revolve*. Compare 輳 and 輻.

Examples: 朝氣
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows plants + an element combining 日 sun/day and a variant form of 水 water | the rising sun, as seen between plants. A seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form of 乾 (the sun rising high in the sky) + 舟, here an abbreviated form# of 朕 (rise) | rising of the *morning* sun. *Dynasty* is an extended meaning, connected with the practice of issuing imperial commands at the beginning of the day.

Examples: 窗戶 窗口
河流
Etymology: As per 可# (bend) + 水 water | long *river* with multiple bends. Compare 川.

Examples: 潛藏 收藏 隱藏
Etymology: As per 臧# (tall) + 艸 grass/plant | tall piles of crops in a *storehouse* (compare 倉) | *put in/away*; *hide* | *possess* (← possess the contents of a storehouse).

Examples: 衝動 衝擊 衝突
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄔㄨㄥ ㄉㄨㄥ`  ㄔㄨㄥ ㄐㄧ   ㄔㄨㄥ ㄊㄨ
Etymology: As per 重# (run through) + 行 (straight, crossing roads) | *main road* running through a settlement | *collision* (← collision of objects in the act of running through).

Examples: 昆蟲
Etymology: 日 here an abbreviated form# of 旬 (cycle/circle) + 比 line up | a figurative or actual circle (of people) | *companions*; *group* | *insect* (← swarm of insects).

Meaning: to mix, blend, mingle; to bumble along
Examples: 混亂 混合 混淆
Etymology: As per 昆# (circular group) + 水 water | assemble and *mix/stir* in a round container a variety of soluble objects | *blend*.

Meaning: dry; first hexagram; warming principle of the sun, penetrating and fertilizing, heavenly generative principle (male)
Examples: 乾淨 餅乾 乾杯
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 乙 (rise) + an element# combining 日 sun/day and a pennant/banner | the sun likened to a flag that rises high in and adheres to the sky | *high and bright sky* | *dry* (← air/water that rises due to heat).

Examples: 冠軍
Etymology: As per 元# (rounded/oval head) + an element combining 冖 cover and 寸 hand/action indicator | object placed on and adhering to the head | *crown*.

Examples: 成熟 熟悉 熟練
Etymology: As per 孰# (an enclosure) + 火 fire | stir meat and other ingredients in a cooking vessel (compare 毒 and 融) | soften | *ripen*; *mature*.

广 + an obsolete character# of uncertain signification that combines 人 person + 隹 short, squat bird. It seems likely that the 人 + 隹 character indicated a bird trainer/handler, and that 广 building was appended to suggest a birdhouse. + 鳥 bird (for emphasis/clarification) | *hawk* (or other bird of prey).

Examples: 延長 蔓延 綿延
Etymology: A variant form of 廷 (garden with extensive vegetation) emphasizing the "extend" rather than the "garden" aspect | *extend*; *spread* | *prolong*; *postpone*; *total of*.

Examples: 蛋糕 蛋白質 壞蛋

Etymology: 酉# alcohol container + 八 split right and left | alcohol container with vapors rising and splitting away. (Tribal) *leader* is a borrowed meaning. 酋 appears in slightly distinct variant forms in the derivative characters 輶 and 猶.

Examples: 尊敬 尊重 尊嚴
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄗㄨㄣ ㄐㄧㄥ`  ㄗㄨㄣ ㄓㄨㄥ`  ㄗㄨㄣ ㄧㄢˊ
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 酋 alcohol container + 廾 pair of hands | set in place a valuable *alcohol cask* | *respect*; *value*; *valuable*; *precious* | *noble*; *honorific title*. The present form substitutes 寸# (settle) for 廾. In derivative characters, 尊 sometimes appears in the form seen for example in 樽, 蹲 and 鱒.

Examples: 放棄 丟棄 廢棄
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is �� as described in 育 (newborn baby) + an element# combining a rectangular disposal bin/basket and 廾 pair of hands | abandon a newborn in a basket | *discard* | *renounce*.

Examples: 季節 春季 冬季
Etymology: 禾# grain/rice + 子 child (| offspring) | seasonal activity (whereby grains are planted, cultivated and harvested, in conjunction with leaving the earth fallow in winter) | *season* | *three-month cycle*. For the idea of conceptual cycles, compare 期 and 週.

Examples: 黃昏 昏倒 昏迷
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows the character was originally 昬, which is 民# (blind) + 日 sun/day | dark night/*darkness* in which nothing can be seen | *evening*; *sunset*; *nightfall* | *blind*; *blindness*.

Examples: 結婚 婚禮 婚姻
Etymology: As per 昏# (darkness) + 女 woman | *wedding ceremony* (held in the darkness of night) | *marriage*.
As per 県# (be suspended) + 系 connection | be connected in hanging suspended | *hang suspended in-between* | *prefecture* (← political unit suspended between the central and local governments).

Examples: 緊張 要緊 趕緊
Etymology: As per 臤# (adhere) + 糸 thread | tightly adhering threads | *tense*; *hard*; *tight*.

Meaning: older brother; father's elder brother; senior male 'sire'; feudal rank 'count'
Examples: 伯伯 伯父 伯母
Etymology: 人 person + 白# for the sound alone to simulate a monosyllabic term of address children would direct toward an older person of the approximate age of one's father | respected elder male |  *eldest brother*; *count*; *earl*.

Examples: 購買 採購 訂購
Etymology: As per 冓# (symmetry) + 貝 commodities | transact business so that both parties are in perfect agreement | *purchase*; *buy*.

Examples: 不僅 僅僅
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 漢 (minute) + 人 person | *barely*; *merely*; *few*; *little*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.

Examples: 結帳 算帳 帳單
Etymology: 長# long + 巾 cloth | long cloth | *screen*; *curtain*; *canopy* | *counter* (for rolls of cloth etc.); *record book*; *register* (← information recorded on long scrolls).

Examples: 基層 階層
Etymology: Originally as per 曾# (pile) + 尸 shape indicator suggesting the upper part of a building (a roof or a drop curtain/banner) | *house with multiple layers of roofing* | *layer* | *pile up*; *stratum*; *class*; *counter* (for stories of buildings).

Examples: 秋天 秋季
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 禾 grain/rice + 束 bundle | bundle and compact/shrink harvested crops in *autumn*/*fall*. The character was later reinterpreted, as shown by a seal inscription form that is 禾 plus an element combining 火 fire and 龜 turtle | dry and shrink the size of harvested crops (as turtle meat is dried over a fire; compare 焦). The present form repositions 禾 and 火 while eliminating 龜. Note also the variant form 龝, which combines 禾 and 龜.

Examples: 猜測 猜忌 猜想
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄘㄞ ㄘㄜ`  ㄘㄞ ㄐㄧ`  ㄘㄞ ㄒㄧㄤˇ
Etymology: 青# blue/green (| bluish black; compare 鯖) + 犬 dog/beast | black dog, faintly visible | *doubt* (← faint veracity ← faintly visible) | *suspect* (v.) (← doubt a person's veracity). Also, *envy* and *jealousy* (← dark products of a suspicious mind).

Examples: 偏偏 偏食 偏向
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄆㄧㄢ ㄆㄧㄢ   ㄆㄧㄢ ㄕˊ  ㄆㄧㄢ ㄒㄧㄤ`
Etymology: As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 人 person (| human agency) | *lean*; *incline* | *partiality*; *bias*. *Element at the left of a Han/Chinese character* is a borrowed meaning, via 扁.

Examples: 眼鏡 鏡子
Etymology: As per 竟# (border) + 金 metal | metal bordering a *lens* | *mirror* | *model*; *in the light of*; *consider*; *clear*; *spectacles*.

Examples: 吃喝玩樂
Etymology: 口 mouth + 曷 for the sound alone to simulate a shouting noise | *shout*; *restrain verbally*; *scold*; *threaten*.

Examples: 小偷 偷偷 偷渡
贊成 贊同 贊助
Etymology: 兟# is 先 (advance in small increments) doubled | group advancing in small increments. 贊 adds 貝 commodities | collect/accumulate presents from supporters in small increments | *support* | *praise* (← verbal support) | *panegyric*; *eulogy*; *inscription*; *dedication*. There is no etymological connection between the Shinjitai 賛 and 替.

Examples: 犯錯 犯法 犯人
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# is a frame. Here, the Old Chinese pronunciation suggest the particular sense "spread although encompassed by a framing object." 犯 adds 犬 dog/beast | dog breaking out of its enclosure and running off | *violation* | *criminal (act)*.

Examples: 勇敢 勇氣 英勇
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 甬 (run through) + 力 power/energy | stamp the ground energetically, as though to run through it | *spirited*; *lively* | *brave*; *courageous*.
果# fruit + 頁 head | (fruit-shaped or head-shaped) *clod* (compare 塊 as well as 圣 as described in 怪); *small round object* | *counter for small round objects*.

Examples: 姓名 貴姓 老百姓
Etymology: 生# birth; life + 女 woman | blood relations at birth | *surname*; *family name* (← certitude pertaining to an infant's maternal lineage).

Examples: 冷淡 清淡 沖淡
Etymology: As per 炎# (consuming blaze) + 水 water | toss water on a consuming blaze, extinguishing it | *slight*; *pale*; *faint*; *light* (← slight remainder of heat/light).

As per 加# (place atop) + 壴 as described in 鼓 (round drum set on a stand) | a feast accompanied by music | *good*; *auspicious* | *praise* (← praiseworthy feast).

The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows 人 person + a depiction of a tall, arching pile of goods | carry goods piled high upon the back. A seal inscription form replaces the objects on top with a large pile of earth | arch (extremely) *high*.

Etymology: 日 sun/day + 堯# (arch/rise high) | sun rising over the horizon, which in turn lightens the sky | *dawn*; *daylight*; *daybreak* | *enlighten*.

Etymology: As per 昔# (pile) + 人 person | person with piles of goods | *borrow*; *rent* (← receive money, goods etc. from such a person) | *debt*; *loan*.

Etymology: As per 土# (pile of earth) + 辵 movement (with its elements repositioned as in 從) | walk barefoot over uneven ground | *follower*; *foot soldier*; *fellow* (← follower/soldier etc. who goes barefoot, or on foot) | *useless* (← useless follower etc.) | *in vain*. There is no etymological connection between 徒 and 走.
A depiction of a flowing river that surrounds sandbars | *sandbar*; *sandbank* | *province*; *state* (← administrative units ← like objects in a greater entity).

Examples: 大洋洲 非洲 美洲
Etymology: 州# sandbar/sandbank + 水 water | *sandbar*/*sandbank* (in a river) | *island*; *continent* (← body of land surrounded by water).

Examples: 程序 順序 秩序

Etymology: As per 責# (pile) + 糸 thread | *spin* or *intertwine* piled threads | *achievement* (← results of spinning). For the conceptual link between achievements and a pile, compare 勣.

Etymology: A depiction of two persons in combat | *fight*; *battle*.

This meaning dropped, with 端 acquiring the borrowed meaning *end* via the original sense of 耑 (cloth hanging in neat alignment | the ends of a piece of cloth) | *edge*; *tip*; *side* | *fraction*; *portion*. Also, *vicinity* (← beside; around ← side) and *rectitude* | *right*.

Etymology: A depiction of a tree with a diminutive, curved, and minutely visible branch obscured on top | *treetop*; *small*; *trifling*; *end*; *youngest child* (← extremity of a tree) | *period of decadence* (← decadent values marking the end of an age); (in) *the future* (← extremity of time). Originally the same character as 未.

Examples: 警察 觀察 考察
Etymology: As per 祭# (scrape) + 宀 roof/building | rub a building spotless, eliminating all dirt. *Observe* is an associated meaning (← observe/inspect that which has been cleaned) | *investigate*; *judge*; *estimate*. Also, *be considerate of* and *profound*.

Examples: 抵抗 對抗 反抗

As per 祭# (scrape) + 艸 grass/plant | scrape off the tops of vegetation (compare 薛) | *short weeds*. *Large turtle/tortoise used in divination* is a borrowed meaning.

兪# remove + 心 heart/emotions | remove an (emotional) illness | *recover*. *More and more* and *surpassing/outstanding* are borrowed meanings.

As per 耑# (neatly aligned) + 玉 jewel | neatly aligned gems bestowed on an *auspicious* occasion | *congratulations*. *Fresh and lively* is a borrowed meaning.
The relevant seal inscription form is 木# tree with a horizontal line through the middle, suggesting a stump | *red*; *vermilion* (← color of a freshly cut stump).

A variant of 師 (lead soldiers), specifying a *general* or *supreme commander*.

Etymology: A variant of 挂 hang | *hang*. In Japanese, the verbs かかる and かける bear numerous meanings that stem directly or indirectly from the concept of "hang." The principal meanings follow. かかる： *hang*; *be covered with/by*; *be splashed*; *be locked*; *be caught*; *be tied (up)*; (of an engine) *start/catch*; *attack*; *be subject to*; *be suspected of*; *be connected/related*; *be involved in*; *call* (out); *be brought up*; *be anxious about*; *depend on*; *take/require* (time); *pay*; *carry* (insurance); (of a play/movie) *be showing/playing* and *set about*. かけ る： *hang*; *put* (on a stove/fire); *cover*; *sprinkle*; *pour*; *lock*; *fasten*; *grasp*; *catch/snare*; *bind* and *put/set up*. Also, *be in charge*; *weigh*, *fix*, *wear*, *multiply* and *begin to/be on the point of*.

Examples: 透過 透明
Etymology: 秀# surpass + 辵 movement | *penetrate*/*pass through* in surpassing | *create a gap/space* | *opening* (← gap) | *look through* (← look through a gap) | *transparency* (← be able to look/see through). Also, *thin* (out), *empty out* and *be free/unoccupied*, as well as *watermark* (← mark made visible by transparency).

Examples: 拍馬屁 拍攝 拍照

Etymology: As per 白# (scatter) + 手 hand/action indicator | cause the hands to join then scatter in clapping | *clap* | *beat time*.

Examples: 休息 退休 休假
Etymology: 人 person + 木 tree/wood, the latter in all likelihood a remnant of an obsolete phonetic element# that, as with other terms in Old Chinese cognate with 休, involved curvature with respect to an actual or figurative frame. The combination of elements may have suggested a person resting in the shade of a tree with curved branches, or that of a curved, wooden construction | *rest*; *stop*; *quit*. Extended meanings include *recess*; (a) *break/breather*; *holiday*; *vacation*; *day(s) off* (from work); *absence*; *sleep*; *suspend* (work); *stop* (doing); and *lay fallow*.

Examples: 雜誌 標誌

Examples: 銀行 銀幕 銀色

Later, 曰 was replaced by 日.

Etymology: As per 兆# (split) + 手 hand/action indicator | split (an object/a group) apart | *challenge*; *attempt*; *defy* | *make (romantic) advances*.

As per 奚# (aligned) + 隹 short, squat bird | domesticated birds in alignment | *chicken*; *hen*; *rooster*; *fowl*.

Other extended meanings from "fall" include *defeat*; *retire*; *give up*; *to rain*; *to snow*; and *abort* (a fetus).
As per 念# (contain) + 口 mouth | chant/recite in a mumbled voice (compare 吟 and 噤) | *hum*; *groan*; *moan*; *growl*; *snarl*.

Examples: 可憐
Etymology: As per 粦# as described in 隣 (repeated series) + 心 heart/emotions | waves of *sympathy* (compare 怜) | *pity*. Also, *treasure* and *dote on*.
