Examples: 操場 操心 操作
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄘㄠ ㄔㄤˇ  ㄘㄠ ㄒㄧㄣ   ㄘㄠ ㄗㄨㄛ`
Etymology: 喿 is 木 tree/wood + 口 mouth (tripled) | chicks chirping in a nest in a tree (compare 巣 and 集). 操 is as per 喿# (activity taking place above) + 手 hand/action indicator | *manipulate* or *operate* (from above) | *manage*; *pull strings* | *chastity*; *fidelity* (← manners that enable the smooth manipulation of human relations). Also, *puppet* and *marionette* (← figures manipulated by pulling strings).

Examples: 瘋狂 瘋子 發瘋
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄈㄥ ㄎㄨㄤˊ  ㄈㄥ ㄗ˙  ㄈㄚ ㄈㄥ
Etymology: As per 風# (flutter) + 疒 illness | *insanity* (likened to mental fluttering) | *headache*.

Examples: 宇宙
Etymology: As per 于# (U-shaped) + 宀 roof/building | large, curving roof/eaves | *the heavens/universe*. Compare 宙.

Examples: 聚集 聚餐 凝聚
Etymology: As per 取# (take hold of) + 乑 a variant of 從 (move/be in formation) | take hold of/*collect* an *assemblage* of people.

Examples: 彼此
Etymology: As per 皮# (align) + 彳 movement | align others at a distance from oneself | *over there*; *that*; *that person* (← person/object at a point opposite; compare 樣 and 方); *he*; *boyfriend*.

Examples: 採用 採購 採訪
Etymology: 采# pluck + 手 hand/action indicator | *pluck* | *take in hand*; *take*; *gather* | *pick out*; *select*; *take on*; *employ*.

Examples: 屆時 歷屆
Etymology: 凷 is 土 an abbreviated form of 圭 (clay/earth piled high in a neat cone shape) + 凵 hole | lump of earth (compare 圣 as described in 怪) that fills a hole. 届 is 凷# + 尸 body | person arriving at the top of a hill | *arrive*; *reach* | *send*; *pass along* *deliver*. Also, *report to*, *notification*, *registration*, *attend (to)*, and *attain*.

Examples: 輩子 晚輩 長輩
Etymology: As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 車 vehicle | vehicles lined up on right and left | *colleague*; *associate*; *companion* (← line of similar individuals).

Examples: 藥房 農藥 藥方
Etymology: As per 樂# (acorns) + 艸 grass/plant | grind acorns into a paste-like consistency | *medicine*; *drug* (← finely ground acorns, seeds, roots etc. used for medicinal purposes).

Examples: 騙子 欺騙
Etymology: As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 馬 horse | swing a leg over a horse in mounting it. *Deceive*, *fool*, and *cheat* are borrowed meanings, via 諞.

Examples: 紅綠燈 綠色 綠豆
Etymology: As per 彔# (pare/strip bamboo) + 糸 thread | threads dyed the vivid color of bamboo freshly stripped of its bark | *green* | *light green*.

Examples: 縮短 縮水 緊縮
Etymology: As per 宿# (shrink) + 糸 thread | shrunken fabric | *shrink*; *reduce*; *contract*; *compress*; *shrivel*; *make or become smaller/shorter*. Also, *wrinkled*, *crimped*, *curly*, *wavy*, and *frizzy*. For the connection between threads and compression/compaction, compare 總.

Examples: 符合 符號 相符
Etymology: As per 付# (set in place) + 竹 bamboo | bamboo tablet/tally split in two to make a pledge, the pieces of which, when set in place, *fit together exactly* | *tally*; *marker* | *paper charm*; *code*.

Examples: 獲得 破獲
Etymology: A variant form# of 矍 (enclose in the hands) + 犬 dog/beast | enclose caught prey (in the hands) | *gain*; *obtain*.

Examples: 幽默 沉默 默默
Etymology: As per 黑# (dark) + 犬 dog/beast | silent dog, *silence* being the aural/oral counterpart of darkness | *hold one's tongue*.

Examples: 碰到 碰上 碰見
禁止 不禁 禁令
Etymology: 林# forest + 示 altar/the supernatural | sanctified ground contained within a forest, access to which is prohibited | *prohibition*; *abstain*; *rule*.

Examples: 老婆 外婆 婆婆
Etymology: As per 波# (breaking waves) + 女 woman | *elderly woman* (likened to a wave that has already crested and broken).

Examples: 屁股 股市
Etymology: As per 殳# (throw) + 肉 flesh | *thigh*; *crotch* (← throw one leg at a time over an object, such as in straddling it).

Examples: 抽屜 抽查 抽空
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄔㄡ ㄊㄧ˙  ㄔㄡ ㄔㄚˊ  ㄔㄡ ㄎㄨㄥ`
Etymology: As per 由# (pass/run through) + 手 hand/action indicator | *extract* an object by pulling it out | *pull out*; *pick (out)*.

Examples: 恨不得 仇恨 悔恨
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + 心 heart/emotions | *resentfulness*; *hold a grudge* (← negative feelings adhering to the heart) | *blame*; *reproach*; *be bitter*; *hate* | *regret*; *repent* (← regret/repent of one's resentfulness).

Examples: 肯定 中肯
Etymology: A variant form of 肎 ( 冖 cover + 肉 flesh), indicating an arm hanging from a shoulder (compare 肩) and covering the side of the body. *Consent*, *agreement* and *permission* are borrowed meanings. In Old Chinese, neither 冖 nor 肉 conveys the pronunciation of this character, suggesting that a) one (or both) of the original components differed or b) one functioned as an abbreviated form of a now-obsolete character.

Examples: 報刊 刊物 刊登
Etymology: As per 干# (press against) + 刀 sword/knife | press with a bladed implement in shaving or engraving | *shave*; *engrave* | *publish* (← arrange wooden slats by length, trimming the edges).

Examples: 泡沫
Etymology: 包# envelop + 水 water | *bubble* (pocket of air enveloped by water; compare 沸) | *foam*; *froth*.
Abbreviated form# of 析 divide + 車 vehicle | employ (the weight, the wheels etc. of) a vehicle to divide/cut | *chop*/*sever*; *kill* (by beheading).

Examples: 漸漸 逐漸
Etymology: As per 斬# (cut) + 水 water | partially cut the flow of water (compare 澀/渋 and 減) penetrating a crevice (compare 浸) | *gradual* (← partial/gradual cut) | *gradually*.

Examples: 鋼琴 鋼筆 鋼鐵
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄍㄤ ㄑㄧㄣˊ  ㄍㄤ ㄅㄧˇ  ㄍㄤ ㄊㄧㄝˇ
Etymology: As per 岡# (hard rope/cable) + 金 metal | metal bar/rod | *steel*.

Examples: 廢話 廢氣 廢水
Etymology: As per 發# (split away in being released) + 广 building | building materials released as a structure splits apart (compare 壞 and 崩) | *abandon*; *abolish*; *decline*; *go out of use/fashion*; *die  out*.

Examples: 眼淚

Meaning: door hinge; pivot; center of power
Etymology: As per 區# (curve/bend) + 木 tree/wood | cylindrical *pivot* (bending in) penetrating the shaft of a door.

Examples: 贏得

Meaning: used in transliterating non-Chinese words such as Europe, ohm; surname
Examples: 歐洲
Etymology: As per 區# (curve/bend) + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure | bend and *vomit*. *Europe* is a borrowed meaning, from the phonetic construction 歐羅巴 (欧羅巴).

Examples: 發財 財產 財富
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 材 (raw) material + 貝 commodities | resources of value | *property*; *wealth*.

Examples: 訂婚 訂位 簽訂
Etymology: As per 丁# (straight) + 言 words | verbally straighten out/*correct* errors (compare 証) | *revise*.

Examples: 長途 前途 途徑
Etymology: As per 余# (stretch) + 辵 movement | long *road/way* (one that stretches far) | *distance*; *counter* (for routes).

Examples: 接觸 感觸
Etymology: As per 蜀# (insect adhering to a leaf) + 角 horn (| insect feelers) | the feelers of an insect adhering to the surface of the object they *touch* | *feel*; *strike* | *take in*; *perceive*;  *touch upon*; *contrary to/in violation of* (← touch or figuratively upon something prohibited).

Examples: 聖賢
Etymology: As per 臤# (adhere) + 貝 commodities | tightly packed collection of valuable goods | estimable (← goods worthy of esteem) | *wisdom*/*intelligence* (← wise enough to evaluate properly).
桀# (raise/rise high) + 人 person | person whose talents raise him/her above others | *excel*; *be outstanding*.

Examples: 擺脫 脫離 超脫
冰箱 箱子 信箱
Etymology: 相# mutual + 竹 bamboo | bamboo baskets hung from both sides of a vehicle | *box*; *container*.

Examples: 佈置 佈告 佈告欄
Etymology: As per 布# (spread) + 人 person (| human agency) | *spread*; *announce*; *publicize*.

Examples: 神仙 仙丹
Etymology: An earlier form of 仙 is 僊, which is the right-hand element# as described in 遷 (soul departing from the body) + 人 person | *wizard* or *hermit* attaining transformation via separation of soul and body. In 仙, this element is replaced by the cognate 山.

Examples: 冰箱 冰淇淋 冰塊
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄅㄧㄥ ㄒㄧㄤ   ㄅㄧㄥ ㄑㄧˊㄌㄧㄣˊ  ㄅㄧㄥ ㄎㄨㄞ`

Examples: 分析
Etymology: Originally, 木 tree/wood + an element# (possibly a variant of 乍, but now written as 斤 ax) indicating cutting or chopping | split/*divide* wood by chopping it | *analyze* (← figurative division of elements in analyzing).

Examples: 蒼白 蒼蠅
Etymology: As per 倉# (pile) + 艸 grass/plant | piled, freshly cut grass | *green*; *blue* (← deep color of freshly cut grass) | *pale* (← stored, faded grass).

Examples: 國籍 書籍 古籍
Etymology: As per 耤# (pile) + 竹 bamboo | pile inscribed bamboo tablets for preservation | *register*; *document*; *book*; *write down*.

Examples: 堅持 堅強 堅定
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧㄢ ㄔˊ  ㄐㄧㄢ ㄑㄧㄤˊ  ㄐㄧㄢ ㄉㄧㄥ`
Etymology: As per 臤# (adhere) + 土 earth | tightly adhering earth | *hard*; *solid*; *firm* | *serious*; *formal*.

Examples: 監獄 地獄
Etymology: 犾# is a depiction of two dogs, suggesting a pair of dogs tangling in a fight. 獄 adds 言 words | *trial*; *suit*; *sue* (← be entangled in a harsh dispute; compare 訟) | *prison*.
犬 here an abbreviated form# of 犾 as described in 獄 (pair of dogs) + 口 mouth (doubled) | pair of howling dogs | *cry*; *wail*.

Examples: 夏天 夏季
Etymology: A depiction of a dancer whose face is covered by a large, square mask (compare 欺). *Summer* is an extended meaning (dance performed in celebration of summer).

Examples: 信賴 依賴
Etymology: 束 here an abbreviated form# of 剌 (sharp) + an element combining 貝 commodities and a variant of 人 person | person who suffers a sharp reduction in circumstances, and pleads for material relief | *ask*; *request* | *entrust*; *depend/rely on*; *count on*. Also, *call in/on* (a specialist), *dependable* and *reliable*.

Examples: 懶得 懶惰 懶散
Etymology: As per 賴# (sharp reduction) + 心 heart/emotions | *lazy*; *languid* (← sharp reduction in energy) | *neglectful*.

Examples: 吞吞吐吐
Etymology: As per 天# (top of) the head + 口 mouth | raise a container of liquid above the head and pour the contents into the mouth | *swallow*; *drink*.
As per 夭# (slender and limber) + an abbreviated form of 高 tall/high | tall, limber youth | *tall and limber* | *superior*; *arrogant*; *put on airs*.

Examples: 吊橋
Etymology: 喬# tall and limber + 木 tree/wood | arching, wooden *bridge*.

Examples: 穩定 平穩 穩健
Etymology: As per 㥯# as described in 隱 (conceal) + 禾 grain/rice | conceal and reserve a supply of harvested crops | *calm*; *quiet*; *peaceful* (← conceal one's volatile feelings from others) | *moderate*.

Examples: 露營 露天 暴露
Etymology: 路# + 雨 rain/natural phenomena. A variant of 落 *dew* | *open*; *exposed* (← see through a transparent object). Also, *transience of life* (← dew as a quickly dissipating element). *Russia* is via the phonetic construction 露西亜 (露西亞).

Examples: 上旬 下旬 中旬
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 匀 (arrange in a circle) + 日 sun/day | one *cycle of ten days* (according to a traditional calendar). *The season when foods taste their best* is by extension from the minor meaning of "pervade" (← time when fish, fruits and vegetables are to be found all over/at their peak).

Examples: 詢問
Etymology: As per 旬# (cycle/circle) + 言 words | make rounds in inquiring/consulting | *inquire*; *consult*.

Examples: 森林
Etymology: 林# forest + 木 tree/wood |　dense growth of slender trees encompassing a settlement, sacred place etc. | *forest*; *woods*.

Examples: 塵土 灰塵
Etymology: 鹿 (long herd of) deer + 土 earth | *dust* kicked up by an advancing herd of deer | *dirt* | *trash*; *waste*. As the Old Chinese pronunciation of 塵 matches that of 廛 (long strip), the two characters are graphically similar, and both involve long strings of objects, 塵 may be regarded as a variant and reinterpreted form of 廛.

Examples: 習慣 慣例
Etymology: 貫# penetrate; go through + 心 heart/emotions | condition created by going through an action/activity to the point of thorough penetration | *become/make accustomed to* | *train*; *exercise*; *custom* | *become skillful*.

Meaning: the elbow; help a person shoulder a load
Etymology: 寸 here an abbreviated form# of 守 defend + 肉 flesh | defend oneself using a particular body part, the *elbow*.

Examples: 壽命 壽星
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 老 (aged person) + ridges surrounding a paddy or field | aged person following a long, curved ridge about a paddy/field | *longevity*; *long span* (← length of an aged person's lifespan) | *congratulations* (← celebration of long life).
壽# (long and curved) + 水 water | large, swelling waves | *swell*; (high) *wave*. Compare 波 and 浪. 涛 is a variant form sometimes encountered.

Examples: 友誼
Etymology: 宜# good/proper + 言 words | *good*/*proper*, *suitable* words | *friendship*; *intimate relation*.

Examples: 佔有 獨佔 佔據
Etymology: As per 占# (fixed in place) + 人 person (| human agency) | *occupy* (by force).

Examples: 紅茶 奶茶 茶館
Etymology: Variant of 荼 (plant with a bitter taste) applied to *tea* | *brown*; *tea ceremony*.

Examples: 階段 階層 階級
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄐㄧㄝ ㄉㄨㄢ`  ㄐㄧㄝ ㄘㄥˊ  ㄐㄧㄝ ㄐㄧˊ
Etymology: As per 皆# (line up) + 阜 piled earth | aligned steps/stairs | *step*; *stair* | *ladder*; *class*; *floor*.

Examples: 豐富 豐盛 豐收
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄈㄥ ㄈㄨ`  ㄈㄥ ㄕㄥ`  ㄈㄥ ㄕㄡ
Etymology: 豆 food stand + an element# combining 山 mountain and 丰 cone-shaped, fruit-bearing ears of grain (doubled) | abundant grain piled high in a cone shape on a food stand | *abundance*; *rich*. Distinguish this element from the right-hand element of 禮, which is etymologically unrelated.

Examples: 暑假 暑期 中暑
Etymology: As per 者# (pile of brushwood/firewood) + 日 sun/day | *hot*; *heat*. 暑 was devised to replace 者 after 者 acquired its borrowed meaning.

Examples: 電子郵件 郵局 郵票
Etymology: 邑 village/settlement + 垂# (boundary marker) | distant, frontier settlement | *mail* (← distant  relay points for mail). The pronunciation of 郵 has been influenced by 華.

Examples: 危險 危機 危害
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄨㄟ ㄒㄧㄢˇ  ㄨㄟ ㄐㄧ   ㄨㄟ ㄏㄞ`
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows 厄# (withdraw in a kneeling position from a cliff) + a second crouching figure at top | kneel in a dangerous, slightly off-balanced position at a cliff | *danger*. Related meanings included *risky*; *critical* (condition); *close/narrow* (escape) | *nearly*; *almost*; *barely* (← close escape), as well as *fear* (for); *be anxious*; *uncertain*; *unreliable*; *dubious* and *doubt* (← fear/be anxious or doubtful about escaping a dangerous situation).

Examples: 寒假 寒冷
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 宀# roof/building + an element combining piled bricks/stones and 廾 pair of hands | create layers of building materials in raising a shelter. Later, 氷/ 冫 ice was added at bottom to emphasize a structure offering protection from the *cold*.

Examples: 戒指 戒備
Etymology: 廾# pair of hands + 戈 spear/halberd | *admonish* or *prohibit* by the threat of force | *warn*; *instruct*.

Examples: 機械
Etymology: 戒# admonish + 木 tree/wood | *weapon(s)*; *shackles* (← wooden contrivances used in admonition/punishment) | *device*; *machine*.

Examples: 隱藏 隱士 隱約
Etymology: The element above 心 in 㥯 was originally 爪 claw/hand + an element combining a symbol in the shape of 工 + another hand | use one hand on top and the other on the bottom to cover and conceal a 工-shaped object. The addition of 心 heart/emotions suggests secrets concealed firmly in the heart. To 㥯# (conceal), 隱 adds 阜 piled earth | earthen wall behind which objects are concealed | *hide/conceal*.

Examples: 爸爸
Etymology: 父 father + 巴# for the sound alone to simulate a term of address directed toward a *father*. Compare the conjunction between the sound "pa" and the meaning "father" in many Indo-European languages.

Examples: 公共汽車 汽車 汽水
Etymology: 气# steam + 水 water (for emphasis/clarification) | *steam*.

Examples: 慘重
Etymology: As per 參# (commingle) + 心 heart/emotions | mixed, painful emotions | *pain*; *misery*; *piteous*; *wretched*.

Examples: 旅行 旅館 旅遊
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a flag attached to a pole (= pennant/banner; now styled styled 方 + �� ) + 从# a variant form of 從 (run with others in a line) | run/march in formation, accompanied by a military standard | *trip*; *travel*; *journey* (← large group of people on the move).

Examples: 農村 鄉村
Etymology: As per 寸# (settle) + 木 tree/wood | settlement bordering or within woods | *village*.

Examples: 星辰
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines a person + a hoe (comprised of a handle attached to a bivalve's shell), twitched to turn soil | twitch a hoe in turning soil. *Dragon* (as the *fifth sign of the Chinese zodiac*) and *7 A.M. to 9 A.M.* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 振動
Etymology: As per 辰# (twitch) + 手 hand/action indicator | twitch/tremble | *shake*; *wave*; *swing*; *sway*; *wag* | *reject*; *jilt*; *stand (someone) up*; *use* (violence); *wield* (power); *display* (one's abilities); *flourish*; *invigorate*; *lean*. Also, *appearance*, *manner of doing* and *pretense* (← impression made by an actor in shaking the hands in gesturing), *give up* and *abandon* (← give up/abandon an undertaking in the face of rejection), *oscillate* and *sprinkle on* (← swing), *tend toward* (← lean), *do well* (← flourish), and *choreography* (← dancer's manner of doing).

Examples: 瓦斯
Etymology: A depiction of two overlapping tiles, forming a round shape | *tile* | *unglazed earthenware*.  *Gram* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 瓶子 花瓶 熱水瓶

Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 口 mouth beneath a representation# of two slender, oblong sacks (compare 東). Here, the sacks indicate an array of similar, ordinary objects. The combination of elements suggests an array/*group* of ordinary (= low-ranking) officials meeting and conversing | *official*; (low-ranking) *office(r)*; *comrade*.

Examples: 遭到 遭受 遭遇
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄗㄠ ㄉㄠ`  ㄗㄠ ㄕㄡ`  ㄗㄠ ㄩ`
Etymology: As per 曹# (array) + 辵 movement | set off and *meet* a variety of people | *encounter*; *subject/be subject to*.

Examples: 挫折 打折 曲折
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a tree cut in two + 斤 ax | chop/cut lumber | *break*; *snap*; *interrupt*; *die*; *lose* | *bend*; *fold*. Also, *turn* and *suitable time/moment* (← reach a turning point ← interrupt) | *opportunity*. Other extended meanings include *yield to* (← bend in defeat ← bend), *judge* and *decide on* (← decisive decision ← decisive cut; compare 判, 斷, 裁 and 決), *at the time of* (← time ← suitable time), and *folded object* or *small wooden box* (← end or point created by a fold ← fold).

Examples: 哲學
Etymology: As per 折# (cut) + 口 mouth | wise/cutting words | *wisdom*.

Examples: 零錢 零用錢 零件
Etymology: As per 令# (long sequence) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | prolonged rain/drizzle | *drops of water* (compare 露, 落 and 靈) | *tiny*; *little* | *zero*.

Examples: 採納 歸納 接納
Etymology: As per 内# (place inside) + 糸 thread | patch/mend vestments by inserting needle and thread through the holes (compare the replacement character 衲). *Pay*; *supply*; *deliver*; *furnish*; *store*; *put away* are via reinterpretation of the constituent elements of the characters as fabric paid as tribute or a tax, and which is stored away. Also, *accept* (← accept that which is paid/supplied) | *settled*; *finished*; *content*.

Examples: 珍貴 珍惜 珍珠
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄓㄣ ㄍㄨㄟ`  ㄓㄣ ㄒㄧ   ㄓㄣ ㄓㄨ
Etymology: The right-hand element# is 彡 pattern + �� a variant of 人 person | hair fully layered over a person's head. 珍 adds 玉 jewel | fully perfect (= flawless) jewel | *unusual*; *rare*.

Examples: 出席 缺席 主席
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 庶 (pile) + 巾 cloth | pile seating mats on the ground/floor (for a feast) | *mat* | *rank*; *post*; *position*; *seat* (← determining the placement of one's seating mat). Also, *spread* (a mat) and *cushion*.

As per 里# (long strip) + 口 mouth | bring a long utterance to an end | emphatic auxiliary, bringing a sentence to an end. *Mile* is a borrowed meaning, the pronunciation of the character serving to transliterate the English term.

Examples: 奠定
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form shows 奠 to be a combination of 酋 (alcohol container) + an abbreviated form# of 典 (a stand/table) | extend an alcohol container and set it down on a stand | *pay one's respects*; *make an offering*; *an offering*. Also, *settle* and *decide* (← settle upon ← set in place).

As per 奠# (extend downward) + 邑 village/settlement | settlement extending down slopes (also the name of an ancient province in present-day Henan). *Formal* and *courteous* are borrowed meanings (via the acquired "offering/pay respects" senses of 奠).

Examples: 吹牛 鼓吹
Etymology: 口 mouth + 欠 here an abbreviated form# of 次 for the sound alone to simulate blowing | *blow*; *puff*. ��

Examples: 煙火 吸煙
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of 垔 shows a potter's wheel to which clay adheres in the potterymaking process. 煙 is as per 垔# (adhere) + 火 fire | *smoke* that adheres to walls and ceilings | *soot*; *fumes*; *smoky*; *dimly visible*.

Examples: 倫理
Etymology: 侖# neat assemblage/alignment + 人 person | people in orderly arrangement | *principle(s)*; *ethics*; (moral) *code*; *companion*.

Examples: 洪水
Etymology: As per 共# (act jointly) + 水 water | *great* confluence of waters resulting in a *flood* | *big*.

Examples: 搖擺 搖頭 搖晃
姑娘 老闆娘 新娘
Etymology: As per 良# (pure) + 女 woman | pure young female | *girl* | *daughter*. Compare 孃.
As per 方# (spread) + 艸 grass/plant | the spreading *fragrance* of plants (compare 苾 and 菩) | *honorific prefix*.

Meaning: large rope, cable; rules, laws; to demand, to exact; to search, inquire; isolated
Examples: 思索 勒索 索賠
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines the stalk of a hemp plant + fibers torn from the stalk | separate the slender fibers of a hemp plant and pile them up. 索 adds 糸# thread | the separate fibers of a *rope* or *cord* | *search (for)* (← separate in searching).

Examples: 高峰 山峰
Etymology: As per 夆# (cone-shaped) + 山 mountain | mountain the sides of which meet at the top in a cone shape | *peak*.

Examples: 組織 編織 紡織
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of 戠 combines 弋 stake + an abbreviated form of 辛 needle/cutting tool | use a sharp implement to notch a stake, creating a marker. 戠# replaces 辛 with 音 sound | mark/pay attention to a sound. 織 adds 糸 thread | *weave* a *banner* that serves as a marker | *silk fabrics*.

Examples: 優惠 互惠
Etymology: A variant form of 褱 as described in 懷 (fall and be absorbed), indicating a *benefaction* from above, whether actually (rain for crops) or figuratively (a *blessing*) | *bless*; *have mercy on*; *benevolence*; *kindness*; *warmth* | *bestow*; *favor*. *Calm* is an extended meaning, while *smart* is a borrowed meaning. For "benefaction," compare 恤.

Examples: 杯子 乾杯
Etymology: As per 不# (bulge) + 木 tree/wood | bulging wooden bowl (for soup/drinks) | *goblet*; *wineglass*; *sake cup* | *counter* (for cupsful). Also, *trophy* (← valuable goblet etc. given as a prize).

Meaning: to float, drift, waft; to exceed; superfluous
Examples: 浮動
Etymology: As per 孚# (envelop/enclose) + 水 water | *float* (← floating body largely enveloped by water); (rise to the) *surface* (compare 泛) | *life buoy*; *buoyant*; *unsubstantial*; *exceed*; *be carried off*; *be delirious*; *be cheerful*; *occur to*; *save* (money).
As per 良# (flowing stream) + 犬 dog/beast | *wolf* (← animal belonging to a large pack the hunting activities of which are likened to a flowing stream).

Examples: 隔壁 隔閡 隔天
Etymology: As per 鬲# (partition) + 阜 piled earth | an earthen *barrier/partition* | *interpose*; *separate* | *interval*; *be distant/apart from*; *lie beyond* | *distinction*; *discrimination*; *reserved attitude*; *estranged*.
耶# a variant form of 邪 (crossroads settlement) + 木 tree/wood | *(coconut) palm* (← tree often found in arid crossroads settlements).

Examples: 房租 出租 租賃
Etymology: As per 且# (pile) + 禾 grain/rice | *levy*/*tithe*, originally paid with (piles of) harvested crops. Compare 税.

Examples: 忽然 忽略 忽視
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄏㄨ ㄖㄢˊ  ㄏㄨ undefined`  ㄏㄨ ㄕ`
Etymology: As per 勿# (obscure) + 心 heart/emotions | absent-minded (← obscure consciousness) | *neglect*; *disregard* (← neglect/disregard out of absent-mindedness) | *in a moment/an instant*; *suddenly* (← happen before one is cognizant of the fact ← absent-minded).

Examples: 複習 複雜 複製
Etymology: As per 复# as described in 腹 (double back) + 衣 clothing | *double-layered article of clothing* | (article of) *clothing*; *overlap*; *double*; *multiply*; *plural*.

Examples: 莊嚴
Etymology: As per 壯# (tall and neat) + 艸 grass/plant | tall plant. *Solemnity*, *village*, *villa*, *store*, *shop* and *storage barn* are all borrowed meanings (for "storage barn," compare 藏 and 倉).
示 altar/the supernatural + 出# protrude | emergence/appearance of evil spirits | *evils/ills* | *curse*; *haunt*; *punishment*.

Examples: 存款 貸款 匯款
Etymology: The left-hand element is a variant of 柰, which is 木 tree/wood + 示 altar/the supernatural | press a knife to carve characters into offerings made of soft wood from a Chinese apple tree. 款 is as per 欠# (cavity) + the left-hand element to suggest a block on which characters were carved | carve characters into a block by scooping out wood (creating cavities) | engrave; engraved characters. *Amity*, *clause* and *sincerity* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 菜單 點菜 青菜
Etymology: 采# pluck + 艸 grass/plant | pluck/pick *greens*/*vegetables* | *rape* (plant); *side dish*; *cuisine*.

The relevant oracle bone form of 畐# is a depiction of an alcohol container with a bulging middle and of abundant capacity (compare 腹). 副 adds 刀 sword/knife | cut/divide abundant contents into half | *halve* | *assist* (← assist by cutting/dividing) | *complement*; *supplement*; *accompany*; *duplicate*; *secondary*; *assistant*; *vice-*.

Meaning: plan a project; stand on tiptoe
Examples: 企業 企圖
Etymology: As per 止# (stand straight) + �� a variant of 人 person | stand on tiptoes, alert to carry out a *plan*, *plot* or *scheme* (compare 跂 and 僥) | *attempt* (← attempt to carry out a plan).

Examples: 打擾 干擾 困擾
表揚 發揚 宣揚
Etymology: 昜# rise + 手 hand/action indicator | *raise* fried food out of oil, scattering drops of oil | *elevate*; (deep) *fry*.

Examples: 老鼠
Etymology: A depiction of a *rat/mouse* with a long, straight tail. 鼡, a simplified form, appears in 猟, the  Shinjitai (new character form) of 獵.
As per 疑# (come to a stop) + 疒 illness | condition in which the thinking process is paralyzed, a condition likened to stupidity | *foolish*.

Examples: 鼓勵 鼓舞 鼓掌
Etymology: 壴# is a round drum with decorations on the top, set upon 豆 food stand (| a stand). 鼓 added 攴 action indicator in its original sense of a hand holding a stick | *hand drum*. In contemporary orthography, 攴 is replaced with 支 (originally, a hand holding a bamboo branch).

Examples: 刺激 諷刺 刺殺
Etymology: As per 朿# (stab) + 刀 sword/knife | *stab*; *stick*; *pierce*; *prick*; *sting*.
歩# walk + 頁 people | people marching in close formation, with no interval between them | *occur repeatedly* (← various persons marching over a given spot).

Examples: 打針 針對 方針
Etymology: A variant form of 鍼:*needle* | *pin*; *fishhook*; *thorn*; *staple* | *stitch*; *hand* (of a clock); *acupuncture*.

Examples: 革命 改革 變革
Etymology: A depiction of a tautly stretched animal hide, one being made into *leather* | *make taut*. Also, *reform* (← renew an object by stretching it tautly).

Meaning: rule by might rather than right

Examples: 暫時 短暫
Etymology: As per 斬# (cut) + 日 sun/day | a figurative cut in days/time | *temporary*; *provisional* | (after a) *long time*.

Meaning: third person pronoun; he, she, this, that
Examples: 伊斯蘭教
Etymology: As per 尹# (ruler who brings heaven and earth into harmony) + 人 person (| human agency) | bring into harmony. *Third person pronoun* is a borrowed meaning. *Italy* is via the phonetic construction 伊太利亜 (伊太利亞), or 伊太利.

The relevant seal inscription form shows two curving lines serving as an abstract representation of the idea of movement through open space + 冖 cover | move through the open area of a covered space | *superfluity* (← space other than that necessary in which to move). There is no etymological connection with 几.

Examples: 沉默 沉思 沉重
嘴巴 插嘴 吵嘴
Etymology: 觜# beak/bill + 口 mouth (for emphasis/clarification) | *beak/bill*; *thin protrusion*.

Examples: 倉庫 庫存 水庫
Etymology: 車# vehicle + 广 building | *storehouse* for covering vehicles.

Examples: 後悔 悔恨
Etymology: As per 毎# (dark) + 心 heart/emotions | dark emotions, in the form of *regret* or *vexation* | *repent*; *mourn* | *mortifying*; *condolences*.

Examples: 陰謀 陰影
Etymology: 侌# is 云 (rising vapors) + 今 (contain) | be clouded over and gloomy. 陰 adds 阜 piled earth | cloud-shadowed side of a hill | *be clouded over*; *shadow*; *dark*; *obscure* | *back/behind*; *negative*; *gloomy*.

Examples: 寂寞
Etymology: As per 叔# (slender and pendent) + 宀 roof/building | *desolate* building, where silence hangs in the air | *still*; *deserted*; *lonely* | *lacking*; *sad*.

Meaning: rely on, depend on; lean heavily
Etymology: As per 奇# (lean) + 人 person (| human agency) | *lean on* (a person); *rest against*; *rely/depend on*.

Examples: 探親 探討 偵探
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 穴 hole + an element combining 又 hand/action indicator and 火, here an abbreviated form of 炎 (consuming blaze) | poke at a fire in penetrating the deep recesses of the hole where it burns. A later form added 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | search for an object by penetrating a deep recess and groping/fumbling for it | *fumble/feel about for*; *search/look for*; *probe* | *explore*. The right-hand element# of the present form replaces the hand and fire elements with 木.

Examples: 祖父 祖母 祖先
Etymology: As per 且# (pile) + 示 altar/the supernatural | figurative pile of ancestors, associated with rituals held at an altar | *ancestor* | *grandfather*; *founder*.

Examples: 摩托車 按摩 觀摩
Etymology: As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 手 hand/action indicator | *rub* (off); *scrape* | *stroke*; *polish*.

Examples: 距離 差距
Etymology: As per 巨# (distant) + 足 leg/foot | *spur* (that keeps the digits of a fighting cock separated/at a distance from each other) | *distance*.

Meaning: ride, ascend; avail oneself of; numerary adjunct for vehicles
Examples: 乘客
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a person atop a tree | help a person climb a tree (compare 丞) | *mount*; *ride* (← clamber atop) | *help someone get on* (a conveyance); *get into/take* (a bus/train etc.); | *give someone a lift*; *convey*. Also, *multiply* (← place atop), *take part* (← get on a vehicle with others) and *deceive* (compare English "take someone for a ride").

Examples: 剩下
Etymology: 乘# multiply + 刀 sword/knife | cut off a *surplus*, multiplying the number of pieces and leaving a *remainder*.

Examples: 普遍
Etymology: As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 辵 movement | journey far, but remain in contact | *widespread*. Also, *general* (compare 凡).

Examples: 蟲子 害蟲 昆蟲
Etymology: Originally, a character unrelated to 虫, and indicating a swarm of maggots | *insect*; *bug*; *worm*.

Examples: 發燒 燃燒 紅燒
Etymology: As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 火 fire | leaping, curling flames | *burn*; *roast*; *bake*; *heat* (up); *broil* | *aglow*; *sunburnt*; *jealousy*. Also, *print* (photos) (← develop a print from a negative using heat).

Examples: 興隆
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 降 descend + 生 life | vital force winding upward in spite of downward resistance | *rise* | *prosperity*; *superiority*.

Examples: 薄弱 脆弱 懦弱
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 弜# (doubling of 弓 flexible, curved bow) with two sets of the element 彡 pattern | supple, decorated (or ornamental) bows | *weak*; *feeble*; *weaken* (← soft ← supple). Also, *inferior* and *young*. In derivative characters such as 搦, 嫋, 溺, 蒻 and 鶸, the two strokes at bottom left parallel each other.

Examples: 嚴肅
Etymology: An abbreviated form of 淵 (concentration) + an abbreviated form# of 晝 (demarcate in writing) | concentrate in writing | *quiet* (← quiet atmosphere promoting concentration); *solemn*.

Meaning: common artemisia; sighing of wind; mournful; dejected
Etymology: As per 肅# (concentrate) + 艸 grass/plant | medicinal concentrate that cleanses the bodily system | *artemisia* (the leaves of which supplied a concentrate taken internally to combat fever, and which was also made into moxa for external application i.e. moxabustion).

Meaning: grasp, hold fast, take by hand
Examples: 把握 握手 掌握
Etymology: 屋# cover + 手 hand/action indicator | *grasp/grip* an object, covering it in the hand | *seize*; *hold*. Also, *handle* and *a handful*.

Examples: 寧可 寧願 安寧
Etymology: 寍# is 宀 roof/building + an element combining 心 heart/emotions and 皿 dish/plate/bowl | settle into a relaxed position while partaking of food indoors. 寧 alters 皿 into 罒 and adds 丂 as described in 号 (extend then bend) | settle oneself in a relaxed posture, with a plate of food alongside | *quiet*; *peaceful*. *Rather* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 聯盟
Etymology: As per 明# (manifest the hidden) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl | drink blood from a bowl in making a *vow/oath*, causing the gods to manifest themselves | *alliance* (← allied forces keeping the vow they have made).

Examples: 反覆 答覆 顛覆
Etymology: As per 復# (double back) + 襾 cover | boat that is blown back in a breeze and overturns, becoming covered in water | *capsize*; *turn over*; *overturn*; *turn back*. Associated and extended meanings include *overthrow*, *overrule* and *disprove*, as well as *cover* and *spread over*.

Examples: 憲法
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 害 (cut) + 目 eye | (full/partial) cutting off of vision (compare 瞎). A seal inscription form adds 心 heart/emotions to suggest the (full/partial) cutting off of one's desires as well | *law* (← create the rule of law by restricting desires; compare 律, 埒, 法 and 笵) | *constitution*.

Examples: 耐心 忍耐 耐用
Etymology: As per 而# (soft and droopy) + 寸 hand/action indicator | soften an object, improving its durability | *endure/bear*; *persist*; *withstand* | *be fitting*.

Meaning: anxiety; to worry about, be anxious
Etymology: As per 秋# (shrunken) + 心 heart/emotions | *anxiety* (← feelings of a shrunken heart; compare 愀) | *sorrow*; *grief*; *lamentation*; *distress*.

Meaning: move; dispel; distribute; plectrum, play stringed instrument
Etymology: As per 發# (split away in being released) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | push/set objects aside | *push aside*; *set aside* *release* | *allocate* | *spring* (outward/upwards; compare 孛); *separate* (← become separated as a result of being released) | *eliminate*; *reject* (← separate those chosen from those not). Also, *plectrum*.

The relevant oracle bone form of 冘 shows that it originally combined 川 river and 牛 cow | drive cattle across a river, their bodies sinking in being largely submerged. A bronzeware inscription form alters the character by showing a person weighed down by a heavy bar across the shoulders | slump; sink. 沈 is 冘# + 水 water | sinking person/object (compare 没) | *sink*; *immerse*; *submerge* | *go down*; *set*; *be mired in*.
As per 升# (raise/rise) + 日 sun/day | rising sun | *rise*.

Examples: 頭髮 髮型
Etymology: As per 犮# (split away) + 髟 hair | split one's *hair* to both sides in parting it | *hairstyle*.

Examples: 悲哀
Etymology: 口 mouth + 衣# for the sound alone to simulate a sobbing noise | *grief*/*sorrow* | *pathos*; *pity*, *compassion*; *mercy*.

Examples: 烏龜
Etymology: A depiction of a *tortoise* or *turtle* with a curved shell.

Examples: 眉毛 眉頭
Etymology: A depiction of a long, curved *eyebrow* covering an eye | *eyebrow-shaped object*.

Examples: 考卷 試卷
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 券 (wrap/roll up) + a bending figure | *curl*; *roll*; *roll up*; *reel*; *coil*; *wind* (up/around) | *volume* (of a set of *books*, originally, rolled *scrolls*).

Examples: 顏色
Etymology: As per 彦# (handsome/well-formed) + 頁 head | *face*; *forehead*; *countenance*; *appearance* | *influence* (← face/person that carries weight). 顏 was devised to replace 彦 after 彦 acquired its associated meanings. Compare the form 顔.

Examples: 稍微
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 禾 grain/rice | small ears of crops | *slight*; *a little bit*. Also, *gradually* (← bit by bit).

Examples: 殘暴 殘酷 殘殺
Etymology: As per 戔# (fine/slight) + 歹 severed bone/death | cut/strip flesh from bones, leaving only a slight remainder | *remain*; *leave behind*; *be left over* | *remainder*; *run short*; *small*; *cut into* | *cruel* (← cruel enough to cut/slash another; compare 殺 and 絶).

Meaning: join together, attach to; add to
Examples: 搭配
Etymology: 荅# (press/fit together) + 手 hand/action indicator | press tightly together in raising/being raised upon or into something | *ride* (← riders squeezed together on top of an animal, or passengers packed into a vehicle).

Examples: 傻瓜
反映 放映
Etymology: As per 央# (stretch) + 日 sun/day | sun stretching/*shining* over a wide area (compare 影) | *reflection*; *projection* (← dark spot attending to sunlight striking an object) | *shade*; *shape*. Also, *match/go with* and *be conspicuous* (← reflect) | *be attractive* (← striking).

Examples: 拜託 委託
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 托 rely on + 言 words | place reliance on someone verbally | *entrust*.
江# inlet/river + 鳥 bird | *large waterfowl* inhabiting an inlet/river | *vast* (← great wingspan of a large waterfowl).

Examples: 美妙 巧妙 奧妙
Etymology: As per 少# (small/slight) + 女 woman | woman of slight build | *mystery*; *odd* (← mysterious/odd presence ← slight build).

Examples: 辯護 辯論 爭辯
Etymology: As per 辡# as described in 弁 (split) + 言 words | fluent, divisive *speech* | *fluency*; *dialect*.

Examples: 多媒體 媒體
Etymology: As per 某# (abundance) + 女 woman | woman who acts as an *intermediary* between a man and a woman, the goal being to ensure the birth of abundant children.

Examples: 吵架 吵鬧 吵嘴
Etymology: 口 mouth + 少# for the sound alone to simulate a shouting noise made in argument | *argue* | *disturb*; *disturbance*.

Examples: 比擬 擬定 虛擬
Etymology: As per 疑 (come to a stop) + 手 hand/action indicator | bring to a stop. *Imitate*,*resemble* and *model on* are borrowed meanings.

Meaning: disobey, violate, defy; be apart from
Examples: 違反 違背 違約
Etymology: As per 韋# (go around) + 辵 movement | two patrols crossing while circling in opposite directions | *differ* (← cross) | *be mistaken*; *alter*; *sprain* (a wrist/ankle); *break a promise*.

Examples: 桌子 書桌 餐桌

Meaning: melt, fuse; market, sell; to pass time, finish, cancel
Examples: 推銷 銷路 銷售
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄊㄨㄟ ㄒㄧㄠ   ㄒㄧㄠ ㄌㄨ`  ㄒㄧㄠ ㄕㄡ`
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 金 metal | *melt* a lump of metal | *wear down/out*. Also, *erase* and *eliminate*.

Examples: 藉口
Etymology: As per 耤# (pile) + 艸 grass/plant | pile mats of woven grass (compare 簀) | *mat*. Later, the term was applied to folding mats, *spread* out for the same purpose of creating a sitting surface. *Lend* is an extended meaning (← spread funds) | *borrow* (← receive spread funds). Also, *trample* (← trample grass to make an even sitting surface ← create a sitting surface). *Make excuses* and *pretext* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 肥胖
Etymology: As per 半# (split) + 肉 flesh | *sliced meat from a sacrificial offering* | *wide-open*. *Fat* is a colloquial meaning unconnected to the etymology of this character.

Examples: 領域 區域 地域
Etymology: As per 或# (enclosed land) + 土 earth | enclosed land | *enclose*; *area*. 域 was devised to replace 或 after the latter acquired its borrowed meanings.

Examples: 輪船 船隻
Etymology: Abbreviated form# of 沿 (follow/run along a prescribed course) + 舟 boat | *boat* progressing along a prescribed course | *ship*.

Examples: 勞動 勞工 勞力
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 榮 (curve) + 力 power/energy | bend/stoop in *labor* and/or *fatigue* (compare 留) | *work hard*; *hard work*.

Examples: 洞穴
Etymology: As per 同# (run through) + 水 water | *cave* through which water runs | *penetrate*.

Examples: 寢室
Etymology: The addition of 宀 roof/building to 侵 (deep) indicated a room crammed deep into the corner of a house. 寢 combines an abbreviated form# of this element + 爿 long, wooden sleeping pallet | *lie down*/*sleep* in a *back/inner room* | *lay down*; *go to bed*. Also, *leave* (unused).
As per 余# (stretch) + 彳 movement | lazy, stretching motion | *slow*, *deliberate*.

Examples: 無可奈何
Etymology: A variant of 柰 as described in 款 (carve characters), here suggesting that the production of the characters involves not carving but rather pressing an implement downward into soft clay (compare the derivative character 捺). *How* and *what* are borrowed meanings. 奈 is also used in transliterations, such as 奈落 (Sanskrit or Pali: naraka), referring to hell/purgatory or the underworld in general.

Examples: 金額 匾額 差額
Etymology: 客# guest/customer + 頁 head (| group of people) | *notice board* to attract guests/customers | *amount* (← fee displayed on a notice board). *Forehead* is a borrowed meaning, via a character combining 頁 and 各 rather than 客.

Examples: 倍數
Etymology: As per 咅# (spread) + 人 person (| human agency) | break an object in two (causing the pieces to spread) | *break in two*; *double*; *more and more*; *increase*; *times* (← cut in two, doubling the number).

Examples: 農業 農場 農產品
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 辰# (turn soil) + 林 forest | burn brush and turn soil, exposing soft, sticky earth | *farming*/*agriculture*.

Examples: 擺脫 搖擺
Etymology: As per 罷# (spread over) + 手 hand/action indicator | cause to spread over | *spread (in display)* | *push open* (to right and left); *shake/swing* (back and forth).

Examples: 蠻橫
祝賀
Etymology: As per 加# (place atop) + 貝 commodities | congratulatory presents piled high | *congratulations*.

Examples: 拖鞋 拖累 拖延
