Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 監 keep watch over + 見 see (for emphasis/clarification) | keep watch over objects from a high vantage point | *look out over*; *survey*; *see*.

As per 由# (pass/run through) + 辵 movement | (actual or figurative) *path/road* running from one point to another | *way* or *teaching* leading to advancement or enlightenment. Also, *lead* and *guide*. Compare 逌.

Examples: 凌晨
Etymology: As per 夌# as described in 陵 (stretch) + 氷 ice | thick wall of ice stretching skywards | *surpass* | *overcome*. Also, *icehouse* | *keep out/at bay*. *Insult*, *break a rule* and *commit a crime* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 茫然
Etymology: 汒# is as per 亡 (obscure) + 水 water | vast spread of water, extending into obscurity | inundation. 茫 adds 艸 grass/plant | *vast*, grassy plain | *boundless* | *vague* (← only vaguely discernible on account of vastness).

Examples: 點燃 燃料 燃燒
Etymology: 然# burn + 火 fire (for emphasis/clarification) | *burn*.
馬# horse + 玉 jewel | precious stone the color of a horse's brain. The compound 瑪瑙 refers to agate/cornelian. Compare 碼.

As per the right-hand element/享# as described in 惇 (swarm within an enclosure) + 攵 action indicator | swarm of people at work within an enclosure | *industrious* | *kind*; *cordial* (← industrious on behalf of others; compare 惇 and 醇).
兪# remove + 玉 jewel | jewel with all flaws excised | *high-grade jewel* | *beautiful*.
金# gold + 帛 cloth/silk | silk into which gold is woven | *brocade* | *fine clothing*; *beautiful*.
As per 風# (flutter) + 木 tree/wood | *maple* (the samara/fruit of which flutters in the breeze).

Examples: 賓館 貴賓 來賓
Etymology: The two elements at the top of the relevant bronzeware inscription form represent a character# combining 宀 roof/building + 豕 pig/boar | throng of pigs inside a pigpen. 賓 adds 貝  commodities | throng of gift-bearing guests, in close contact | (honored) *visitor*; *guest*.

Examples: 電梯 樓梯
Etymology: As per 弟# (vertical alignment) + 木 tree/wood | wooden *ladder* or steps (permitting one to ascend and descend).
As per 其# (square/rectangular) + 玉 jewel | beautiful, rectangular *jewel*.

As per 則# (beside): | *side* | *move (toward)*; *lean*; *one of two facing sides* | *raise* (← raise the head so as to face another person directly). Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
As per 交# (twist/cross) + 口 mouth | *bite*; *chew* (← teeth crossing back and forth in biting/chewing/gnawing). Compare 嚙 and 齩.
黑# black (soot) + 土 earth | clods of soot | *ink block*; *India ink*. For soot, compare 煤.

Examples: 悶熱 納悶
Etymology: As per 門# (concealed) + 心 heart/emotions | gloomy, depressed feelings concealed in the heart | *anguish/agony* (caused by melancholy). Compare 懣.

Etymology: As per 青# (clean/pure) + 日 sun/day | *clear day* | *clear up*. Note the variant form 晴.

Examples: 恐怖
Etymology: As per 布# (spread) + 心 heart/emotions | fear spreading over the heart | *frightened*; *afraid*. Compare 恐.
As per 領# (string of objects) + 山 mountain | string of peaks in a *mountain range* | *peak*.

Meaning: middle brother; go between, mediator; surname
Etymology: 中# center/middle + 人 person | person acting as an *intermediary* | *matchmaker*; *gobetween*; *personal relations* | *fellowship*.
員# round (| perfectly round | harmonious) + 音 sound | *rhyme*; *meter*; *tone* (← rounded/harmonized sound).
As per 九# (bump up against and bend/curve) + 日 sun/day | the *rising sun* figuratively hitting the eastern horizon and curving upward | *morning sun*.

Examples: 綜合
Etymology: As per 宗# (link) + 糸 thread | link and thereby *arrange*/*unite* numerous threads | *rule*; *control*.

Examples: 失蹤
Etymology: 從# follow + 足 leg/foot | *footprints* following one after the other | *traces*; *tracks*. Compare 迹, 跡, 蹟 and 踪.

Examples: 姿勢 姿態
Etymology: As per 次# (align) + 女 woman | woman preoccupied with aligning/arranging her wardrobe | *appearance*; *figure*; *form*; *shape*.

Meaning: take a big stride; pass by
Examples: 邁進
Etymology: As per 萬# (virulent | vigorous) + 辵 movement | pass over vigorously (such as in working a bladed implement over a whetstone; compare 礪) | *pass by* | *pass out of sight*; *exceed*. Also, *excel* (← exceed others).

Examples: 傢伙
榮譽
Etymology: As per 與# (raise in unison) + 言 words | raise words of *praise* in unison | *honor*; *glory*; *fame*; *renown*; *reputation*.

Examples: 褲子 牛仔褲
Etymology: As per 庫# (cover) + 衣 clothing | *pants/trousers* covering the U-shaped crotch.

Examples: 促進 促成 促使
Etymology: As per 足# (compress) + 人 person (| human agency) | *press* | *urge* | *stimulate*; *draw attention to*.

Examples: 駕駛
Etymology: A variant form of 駟 (team of four horses), replacing 四 with 史 (an official) | official riding a  galloping horse | *run fast*; *drive at high speed* | *fast*.

Examples: 報仇 仇恨
Etymology: As per 九# (bump up against and bend/curve) + 人 person | *enemy* (with whom one comes to grips in battle) | *rival*; *adversary*. Also, *hatred* and *grudge*, as well as *revenge* (← take revenge against one's enemy).

Examples: 粗心 粗糙 粗魯

Etymology: As per 且# (pile) + 米 rice | pile/heap of unpalatable rice | *coarse*; *rough*.

Examples: 牧場
Etymology: As per 攵# (strike) + 牛 cow | strike cattle | *raise livestock*; *pasture*.

Examples: 蛋糕 糟糕
Etymology: As per 羔# (fit into a pot) + 米 (glutinous) rice | (glutinous) *sweets* (stirred in a pot).

Examples: 貝殼
Etymology: 壳# is a depiction of a hard, curved seashell. 殼 adds 殳 action indicator | pound on hard shells | *shell*; *husk*.

Examples: 蝴蝶
Etymology: As per 枼# as described in 葉 (thin/flat/slight) + 虫 insect | (thin-winged) *butterfly*.
凶# terrible + 儿 person | *terrible*/fearful person or human-like apparition | *cruel*; *fearsome* | *fear*.

Examples: 鍋子
Etymology: 咼# (variant of 冎 round or rounded cavity) + 金 metal | rounded, deep cooking utensil | *pot/pan*.

Examples: 恐懼
尖銳

Meaning: sing, hum; recite; type of poetry
Etymology: As per 今# (contain) + 口 mouth | indistinct sound contained within the mouth (compare 音) | *groan*; *moan*; *hum*; *sing*; *recite* | *poem*. 吟 and 含 are an example of a pair of characters devised from the same elements but expressing different meanings; for another example, see 忙 and 忘.

Examples: 幸虧 吃虧 多虧
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 于# (U-shaped) + a variant of 雇 (birdcage | frame) | Ushaped, bright portion of the waning moon | *waning of the moon* | *grow small*; *loss*.
支# branch + 木 tree/wood | *branch*; *bough*; *twig*. 枝 was devised to replace 支 after the latter came to refer to "branch" in primarily abstract senses.

Examples: 廣闊 開闊 寬闊
Etymology: As per 活# (pour out) + 門 gate | gate with ample space, allowing people and objects to pour out | *broad*; *wide* | *distant* (← be wide apart). Compare 豁.

Meaning: aches, pains; be fond of; love
Examples: 疼愛 心疼
Etymology: 冬# winter + 疒 illness | stinging *pain* experienced in the cold of winter | *sting*; *smart*; *ache*; *twinge*.

Meaning: pick up, collect, tidy up; accounting form of the numeral ten
Examples: 收拾
Etymology: As per 合# (press/fit together) + 手 hand/action indicator | *pick up*/*gather* scattered pieces and select that those fit together | *find* | *select*. Also, *catch* (a taxi) (← pick up) and *escape hardship* (← be picked/plucked out of hardship ← pick up). As with 壱, 弐, and 参/參, this character is used as a substitute for the usual number (in this case, 十) in documents as a  precaution against forgery.

Examples: 毅力
Etymology: 豙# combines 豕 pig/boar + 立 stand | boar raising its bristly mane in response to a threat. 毅 adds 殳 action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | stand taut/be *resolute* | *strong*.

Examples: 牙刷 刷牙 刷子
Etymology: The left-hand element# is a variant of 屈 (bend). 刷 adds 刀 sword/knife | bend in scraping (compare 祭) | *scrape away impurities* | *rub*; *clean* (← compare 擦) | *print* (← rub paper on a woodblock with a brush).

Examples: 糊塗
Etymology: As per 余# (stretch) + an element combining 水 water and 土 earth | stretch in spreading coats of *mud* over a wall | *coat* | *paint*; *get muddy*.

Examples: 破裂 分裂
Etymology: As per 列# (sever) + 衣 clothing | cut/rip material | *rip*; *tear*; *split*; *rend*; *break apart*.
As per 它# (stretch) + 阜 piled earth | long/steep bank or slope. 陀 appears primarily in transliterations of Sanskrit terms such as buddha (Buddha: 仏陀 or 佛陀) and Amitabhah (Amida: 阿弥陀).
�� # as described in 栽 (cut; sever) + 口 mouth | cut off the end of a sentence | *exclamatory particle*; *interrogative particle* (at the end of sentences).

Examples: 鄰居 鄰里
取悅 喜悅
默契 契機
Etymology: The top element# combines 丯 a depiction of a piece of wood or bone that has been cut through and thus separated from the remainder + 刀 sword/knife | cut and separate wood or bone into pieces in creating a pledge/vow, with each party retaining a piece. 契 adds 大 great | great *pledge*/*vow* created by the means described above | *promise*; *tally*; *match*. In derivative characters the top element of 契 is often written in the form seen for example in 絜, 齧 or 挈 (and the same for 契 itself, as in 楔 and 禊).

Examples: 轟動 轟轟烈烈
Etymology: 車 vehicle (tripled) | the *roar/rumble* of multiple vehicles on the move | *reverberate*; *blast* | *be well-known* (← possess a name that reverberates with many). The pronunciation of the character simulates the roar of vehicles.

A depiction of a small bronze container in the shape of a sparrow, presented as a reward for services rendered to the state, and used for warming alcohol. The meaning later shifted to indicate a goblet, specifically, one in a set of goblets. *Peerage* and *court ranking* are associated meanings, via the social strata of the recipients.
并# align + 尸 (here a shape indicator suggesting a screening object) | align screening objects | *screen*; *shield*; *fence*; *wall*.

Meaning: to be stationed at, reside at; to stop
Etymology: As per 主# (stationary) + 馬 horse | tether a horse, causing it to become and remain stationary | *stop*; *rest*; *stay*; *park* (a car/bicycle).

Examples: 打賭 賭博 賭場
Etymology: As per 者# (pile) + 貝 commodities | actual or figurative pile of goods being *bet*/wagered | *wager*; *gamble* | *take a chance*.

Examples: 蜂蜜 蜜蜂
Etymology: As per 夆# (cone-shaped) + 虫 insect | *bee* (← that lives communally in cone-shaped beehives) | *hornet*; *wasp*.

Examples: 電扇 扇子
Etymology: 戸 here an abbreviated form# of 扁 (spread, but remain in contact) + 羽 feather/wing | folding *fan*, the slats of which spread but remain in contact when the fan is in use.
A depiction of a small, curved boat | curve; bend. *Cow* (as the *second sign of the Chinese zodiac*) and *1 A.M. to 3 A.M.* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 害羞
Etymology: 羊 sheep + what was originally not 丑# but rather 又 hand/action indicator | *offer* (fine food). *Shame* and *be ashamed* are borrowed meanings via 忸 | *disgrace*.

Examples: 疏忽 疏導 疏散
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕㄨ ㄏㄨ˙  ㄕㄨ ㄉㄠˇ  ㄕㄨ ㄙㄢ`
Etymology: �� # a variant of 疋 (point in opposite directions) + 㐬 as described in 流 (flow) | *pass through* in flowing between opposite points. Other meanings pertaining to this character are borrowings via 疎.

Examples: 欽佩
Etymology: 金 here an abbreviated form# of 鉗 restrain oneself + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure | restrain oneself and bow in the presence of someone or something inspiring *respect* or reverence | *revere*.
As per 申# (bolt of lightning) + 土 earth | marker, likened to a bolt of lightning, thrust into the *earth* as a *divination sign*. *Southwest* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 不堪
Etymology: 甚# extreme + 土 earth | *endure* extreme pressure exerted by an earthen construction | *bear*; *(with)stand* | *fitting* (← fit to endure pressure).

Examples: 洩氣
Etymology: A variant of 泄 *leak*/*drip*, combining 曳 drag + 水 water.
屰# reverse + 辵 movement | *reverse*; *go against*; *invert*; *opposite*; *upside-down*; *inside-out*; *defy*; *disobey*; (go to) *meet*; *in advance*.

Examples: 抬頭
哎呀 哎喲
餅乾 月餅
Etymology: 并# align + 食 food/eating | align food, in particular rice cakes | (glutinous) *rice cake*. 餠 is the older style of this character.

Examples: 彌補
綱領
Etymology: As per 岡# (hard rope/cable) + 糸 thread (for emphasis/clarification) | *rope*; *cord*; *cable* | (figurative) *lifeline*. Compare 緪 and 綆.
As per 若# (supple) + 心 heart/emotions | provocation strong enough to overcome a supple (= accepting) state of mind | *incite*; *bring about* (← provoke into taking action).
As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 羽 feather/wing | *raised tail feathers* of a pheasant | *raise high*. Also, *outstanding* and *stand on tiptoes*.

Examples: 墮胎
Etymology: As per 隋# (collapsing pile of earth) + 土 earth (for emphasis/clarification) | collapsing/falling earth | *fall*; *drop*.

Examples: 狠心
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + 犬 dog/beast | *sounds produced by dogs (adhering in) fighting/biting each other* (compare 獄). *Perversion* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 頑強
Etymology: As per 元# (rounded/oval head) + 頁 head | rounded/oval head | *stubborn* (← make no progress in convincing another ← circular discussion going round and round in a person's head; compare 願) | *stout*. 頑 was devised to convey the original sense of 元, but it too acquired extended meanings.

Meaning: kind of sedge grass, used anciently for raincoats
Etymology: 沙# sand + 艸 grass/plant | variety of *sedge* (← plant that grows in poor/sandy soil).

As per 察# (rub spotless) + 手 hand/action indicator | *rub* spotless | *chafe*; *rustle*. Also, *run through* (one's money) (← be reduced to threadbare clothes) | *become worldly-wise*. 擦 was devised to replace 察 after the latter's transformation of meanings.

Examples: 贈品 贈送 捐贈
Etymology: Originally as per 曾# (pile) + 貝 commodities | a pile of gifts/offerings | *give/present*.

Examples: 凝固 凝結 凝聚
Etymology: As per 疑# (come to a stop) + 氷 ice | flowing water coming to a stop in hardening into ice | *rigidity*; *concentration*; *stiff*. *Strain*, *be absorbed in*, *fix attention on* and *elaborate* (v.) are extended meanings.

Examples: 愛滋病 滋味
Etymology: As per 茲# (luxuriant growth) + 水 water | luxuriant growth of water plants | *thrive*; *luxuriant*; *rich*.
青 here an abbreviated form# of 靜 calm/peaceful + 立 stand | stand still/at ease | *tranquil*;  *at ease*; *peaceful*.
The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a club held by 鬼# (large, lumpy being) | fearsome, lumpy being that clubs its prey | *fear*; *apprehension*; *dread*; *awe* | *reverence*.
As per 壴# as described in 鼓 (drum set on a stand) + 彡 pattern | *beat* a drum in a rhythmic pattern (compare 鼖). *Swell* is a borrowed meaning via 膨.

As per 廷# (extend) + 手 hand/action indicator | cause an object to extend *straight* | *straighten* | *surpass* | *go ahead*/*pull out* (ahead) of others. Also, *counter* (for spears, candles, guns, palanquins etc.).

Examples: 拋棄
愚蠢
Etymology: As per 禺# (curve) + 心 heart/emotions | warped (← curved) mind | *hardheaded*; *stupid*; *foolish*; *silly*.
As per 正# (straight) + 彳 movement | march in straight formation on a military expedition |  *subjugate*.

Examples: 侮辱
Etymology: 辰 + 寸. However, the original form of the character is likely to have been a variant form# of 農 (soft) + 心 heart/emotions | soften/weaken another person's emotional state | *humiliate*; *insult*; *shame*; *disgrace*.

Examples: 開朗 朗讀 朗誦
Etymology: As per 良# (flowing stream) + 月 moon | stream of moonlight (compare 星) | *bright*; *clear* | *cheerful* (← bright personality).

Examples: 安慰 慰問
Etymology: As per 尉# (bending figure that is branded) + 心 heart/emotions | *comfort*/*console* a person who has been branded (= a person who is suffering) | *cheer up* | *relief*; *hobby*; *amusement*; *diversion*; *pastime*; *make sport of*. For the idea of comforting a suffering person, compare 恤.

Meaning: meditation, contemplation (dhyana); to level ground for altar; abdicate
Etymology: 單# single + 示 altar/the supernatural | meditation resulting in metaphysical unity. *Zen (Buddhism)* is via a transliteration of the Sanskrit dhyana (meditation).

Examples: 青蛙
Etymology: 虫 insect/creature + 圭# for the sound alone to simulate the croaking of a *frog*.
禾 grain/rice + an abbreviated form# of 舂 pound | pound grain into fine pieces. *Qin Dynasty* (221-206 B.C.E.) is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 火災 水災 災害
Etymology: Originally 才# (pile) + 火 fire | conflagration that reduces buildings to piles of ashes | *disaster*; *misfortune*.
A depiction of a tall *tripod kettle* or cauldron with two hoop-like (or ear-shaped) handles. Compare 鬲.

The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 卜 divination + an abbreviated form# of 鼎 tripod kettle/cauldron | inspect smoke rising from an upright vessel to divine the future | *rectitude* (← upright) | *righteous*; *chastity*.

Examples: 偵探
Etymology: As per 貞# (inspect): | *investigate*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.

Examples: 讚美 讚嘆
Etymology: 贊# praise + 言 words (for emphasis/clarification) | *praise*.

Examples: 椅子
Etymology: As per 奇# (lean) + 木 tree/wood | wooden furnishing upon which one leans | *chair*.
果# fruit + 多 much/many | *large number/quantity* of fruit | *tremendous*.

The relevant seal inscription form shows two figures bending beneath a cover (compare 丸) | *bend* (= make the body round) in concealment | *wind*. *As if*, *just like*, *addressed (to)* and *allotment* are borrowed meanings. In derivative characters, 宛 exerts either the conceptual influence "bend" (婉 惋 捥 etc.) or "circular" (埦 椀 碗 etc.).
As per 宛# (circular) + 石 stone (| stoneware; chinaware) | round *bowl* | *teacup*. Compare 埦, 椀 and 鋺.
As per 何# (bear a load) + 艸 grass/plant | *lotus* (← plant borne on water). *Bear a load*, (a) *load*, *burden* and *undertake* are meanings applied after 何 was borrowed to express "what."
As per 皮# (open up) + 手 hand/action indicator | *open up*. 披 was devised to replace 皮.

Examples: 趨勢
Etymology: As per 芻# (compress) + 走 run | compress time and space in running | *run*; *hasten toward*; *head for*. For the connection between compression/compaction and running, compare 速.
去# withdraw + 力 power/energy | *coerce* others into withdrawing. *Long period of time* derives from the compound 劫波, a transliteration of the Sanskrit kalpa.

Examples: 迅速
Etymology: 卂 depicts slender birds flying in tight formation (compare 進). 迅 is 卂# + 辵 movement | *swift* movement.
As per 由# (pass/run through) + 竹 (rigid, tubular) bamboo | *flute/pipe* (← cylindrical instruments through which sound passes) | *whistle*.

Examples: 烤肉
肩膀
Etymology: A variant form of 肯 (originally, an arm hanging from a shoulder) | *shoulder*.

Examples: 變遷 升遷
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# is combines 1) two pairs of hands about a skull with openings at top (the fontanels described in the entries for 兒 and 思) and 2) a kneeling figure + 廾 (pair of hands) | soul departing the body (through the head) as a result of magical or ascetic practices. 遷 adds 辵 movement | depart and *transfer*/*shift* one's location | *change*.
As per 女# (supple) + 水 water | softly/gently curving watercourse (originally, the name of a river in China). *You* is a borrowed meaning.
As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 缶 bulging earthenware jug/vase | large, tube-shaped *jug/cistern*. Compare 瓮 and 甕.
欲# desire; greed + 心 heart/emotions (for emphasis/clarification) | *desire*; *greed*; *lust*; *passion*.

The relevant seal inscription form is 虍 tiger# (here suggesting a tiger-stripe pattern; compare 彪) + an element combining a container and 皿 dish/plate/bowl | cooking pot with a tiger-stripe pattern, half-sunken into the earth. *Hut/cottage* is a borrowed meaning via 廬.

Examples: 爐子
Etymology: As per 盧# (cooking pot) + 火 fire | *cooking stove*; *furnace* (compare 鑪) | *hearth*; *sunken fireplace*.

Examples: 魅力
Etymology: As per 未# (obscure) + 鬼 (large, lumpy being) | be enchanted (compare 妄) by an obscure entity | *enchantment*; *fascination*; *charm*. The compound 魑魅魍魎 is a general term for evil spirits resident in forests, mountains and rivers.

Meaning: unit of length equal 3.3 meters; gentleman, man, husband
Examples: 姑丈 丈夫
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines 又 hand (suggesting measurement; compare 度) with 十# ten | a stick serving as a *measurement* of ten hand lengths (尺) (slightly over three meters) | *height* | *stature*; *length*.

Examples: 巡邏 巡視
Etymology: 巛 variant of 川# river + 辵 movement | move in the manner of a river that swirls about sandbanks (compare 州) | *circulate (about)* | *go round*; *surround*; *turn* | *go about*; *concern* (a subject); *think over*.

Examples: 措施
Etymology: As per 昔# (pile) + 手 hand/action indicator | pile (v.) | *place* (in order) | *dispose of*; *deal with*.
禾 grain/rice + 平# (spread level/flat) | spread crops flat/level in weighing them | *weigh*; *steelyard*; (weighing) *scale*. Also, *measure* and *gauge*.

Examples: 沿海 沿途 沿襲
Etymology: As per 水# (long, winding flow of water) + an obsolete character indicating a ravine (compare 谷)  | water splitting into branches as it follows/runs along a winding, prescribed course in a ravine | *run along*; *lie along*; *follow* (a custom/rule).

Examples: 痕跡
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + 疒 illness | *scar* adhering to the skin | *mark*; *trace*.

Examples: 濫用
Etymology: As per 監# (bowl/container) + 水 water | water overflowing a bowl or container | *overflow*; *inundate*; *excess*; (fall into) *disorder*. In modern Japanese usage, 乱 often replaces 濫 in compounds.

Examples: 漲價 上漲
Etymology: 張# stretch + 水 water | stretch of river that rises/swells | *overflow*. Compare 滕.

Examples: 彎腰 撐腰
Etymology: 要# waist/hips + 肉 flesh | *waist*; *hips*; *small of the back*. 腰 was devised to replace 要 after the latter acquired its extended meanings.
As per 戔# (fine/slight) + 貝 commodities | low-grade commodities of slight worth | *cheap*; *shabby*; *inferior* | *contemptible* | *poverty* (← substandard or contemptible living conditions).

Examples: 妥當 妥善 妥協
Etymology: A variant form of 垂 hang (compare 朶, another variant of 垂 also composed of etymologically unrelated elements), with the specific nuance "hang in the appropriate way/place" | *contentment* (← be satisfactory ← be appropriate) | *calm*; *peace*.

Examples: 血液 液體
Etymology: As per 夜# (slender line) + 水 water | trail of *fluid/liquid* (compare 滴).
鳥 bird + 我# for the sound alone to simulate the honking of a (domesticated) *goose*.

Examples: 軌道
Etymology: As per 九# (bump up against and bend/curve) + 車 vehicle | *rut* (← marks left in the earth by a vehicle's rotating wheels).

Examples: 丘陵
Etymology: 夌 combines an abbreviated form of 坴 as described in 陸 (stretch) + 夂 leg/foot pointed downward | stretch the legs in relaxation. 陵 is 夌# (stretch) + 阜 piled earth | long stretch of earth | *(imperial) tomb/mausoleum* (← hill-shaped tombs).

Examples: 扭轉
Etymology: As per 丑# (curve/bend) + 手 hand/action indicator | curve/bend/*twist the hand in seizing* | *pull/draw tight*. Compare 搦.

Examples: 沙漠 漠視
Etymology: As per 莫# (concealed) + 水 water | *desert* (where water sources are concealed) | *vast*;  *vague*.

Examples: 蝦子 蝦米
Etymology: As per 叚# (overlay) + 虫 insect/creature | *shrimp* (with a layered shell) | *lobster*. Compare 鰕, the Made-in-Japan character 蛯, and 蟹.
As per 足# (compress) + 手 hand/action indicator | compress the hand about an object | *grasp*; *catch*; *seize* | *capture*; *arrest*.

Examples: 民謠 謠言
Etymology: As per 䍃# as described in 搖 (waver) + 言 words | *sing* in a wavering/quavering voice | *folksong*; *Noh song*.

Examples: 氣氛
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 雰 mist/fog + 气 rising vapors (| air/atmosphere) | mist/fog as one manifestation of *air*, *atmosphere* or *weather*.

Examples: 塑膠
Etymology: As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 肉 flesh | *sticky* substance produced by separating the non-edible portions of a bird from the edible ones and boiling the former down (compare 餃) | *stick to*; *glue*.

Examples: 傳遞
Etymology: 虒# is 虎 tiger + 厂 cliff/shape indicator | mythical animal conceived of as crawling on its belly, in sequential motion, one leg at a time. 遞 adds 辵 movement/action indicator | move sequentially, in *relay* or stages | *stage*.

Examples: 葬禮
Etymology: 死# death between 艸 grass/plant at top and at bottom | *bury* a corpse by piling earth atop it.

Examples: 骯髒

Etymology: As per 兩# (aligned pair) + 人 person | *pair*; *couple* (of people); *two*. *Skill* and *ability* are via the compound term 技倆.

Examples: 旺季 旺盛
Etymology: As per 王# (extend) + 日 sun/day | extensive sunlight (compare 晃 and 曠) | *flourishing*; *prosperous* (← extensive prosperity; compare 郁).

Examples: 燕窩 燕子
Etymology: A depiction of a *swallow*, the nests of which adhere to the walls of caves or cliffs. *Relaxation* and *enjoyment* are borrowed meanings; compare 讌.

Examples: 茂密
Etymology: As per 戊# (cover) + 艸 grass/plant | thick vegetation covering a wide area | *thick growth* | *thrive*.

Examples: 循環 遵循
Etymology: As per 盾# (follow) + 彳 movement/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | *follow*. *Circulate* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 屍體
Etymology: 尸# corpse + 死 death (for emphasis/clarification) | *corpse*.

Examples: 鑽石 鑽研
Etymology: As per 贊# (accumulate in small increments) + 金 metal | *drill/bore*, with shavings accumulating in small increments | *a drill*. Compare 鐫. Also, *make a deep/profound study of* (← drill deeply).

Examples: 搖晃
Etymology: As per 光# (light extending from a torch) + 日 sun/day | bright sunlight (compare 曠 and 旺) extending over the land | *shining*; *clear*.

Examples: 悄悄
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 心 heart/emotions | shriveled emotions, in the form of sadness or *depression* | *quiet*; *silent*.

Examples: 翅膀
Etymology: 支 here an abbreviated form# of 肢 limb + 羽 feather/wing | *wing(s)* | *fin*. *Merely* and *solely* are borrowed meanings.
As per 余# (stretch) + 斗 ladle | stretch a ladle at a slant to pour out its liquid contents | *slanting*; *tilted*; *at an incline*; *crooked*; *diagonal*; *oblique*.

Examples: 廁所
Etymology: As per 則# (beside) + 广 building | *toilet* beside a residence | *mingle* (← toilet used in common).

Examples: 溜冰
Etymology: As per 留# (round) + 水 water | liquid that collects to form a round, slippery puddle (compare 潦) | *collect*; *build up*. Also, *drip* and (rain)*drops* (← drops of rain that collect; compare 霤).
As per 隺# as described in 確 (framing object that obscures/is obscured) + 鳥 bird | *crane* (← bird whose platform nests are obscured in shallow waters) | *white*.

Examples: 喪失 沮喪 喪事
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 亡# dead + 哭 cry/wail | prolonged lamentation for the deceased | *mourn*.

Examples: 盒子
Etymology: As per 合# (press/fit together) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl | *lidded utensil*.
As per 率# (compact) + 手 hand/action indicator | compact an object by throwing it (or letting it fall) to the ground | *fall*. Compare and contrast 捽.

Examples: 慚愧
Etymology: As per 鬼# (large and lumpy) + 心 heart/emotions | *shame*; *ashamed* (← misshapen emotions).

Examples: 瀟灑
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 驪 (neatly aligned) + 水 water | neatly aligned trickles of water running off from objects being washed | *pour*; *sprinkle*; *wash* | *purify*; *be clean/refreshed*. Compare 洒 and 釃.

Examples: 津貼
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 聿 here an abbreviated form# of 盡 use up; exhaust + 彡 pattern | pattern created by water and land where the water is low (compare 淺) | *harbor*; *dock*.
A variant form of 乃 (soft and clingy) + 皿# dish/plate/bowl | *fill* a dish with (soft) food | *be/become full*; *satisfy*.

Examples: 動脈 靜脈 山脈
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 派 (rivulets) + 肉 flesh | *vein*; *blood vessel* (← rivulets concealed in the body) | *pulse* | (faint) *hope* (← faint sensation of a pulse).

Examples: 漢堡
Etymology: As per 保# (cover) + 土 earth | *fort* or *fortress* covering a large swath of earth.

Meaning: release, cast away, let go; disperse; relax
Examples: 撒謊
Etymology: 散# scatter + 手 hand/action indicator | *scatter* | *sprinkle*; *give someone the slip*.
As per 廛# (long strip) + 糸 thread | long strip of fabric/clothing wrapped about the body | *wrap/wind about*; *wear*. Also, *tie/bind* (← tie/bind in wrapping).

Examples: 遵守 遵循
Etymology: As per 尊# (settle) + 辵 movement | settle a matter | *follow*; *comply with*; *obey*.

Examples: 嬰兒
Etymology: 賏# is an abbreviated form of 賡 (continue without interruption) + 貝 shell | string of shells, made into a necklace. 嬰 adds 女 woman | shell necklace extending about a woman's neck | *extend about*. *Baby* and (musical) *sharp* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 櫻桃
Etymology: 嬰# extend about + 木 tree/wood | flowering blossoms extending about a tree (compare 榮) | variety of plum tree | *cherry tree*; *red*; *pink*.

Examples: 扮演 打扮
Etymology: As per 分# (split) + 手 hand/action indicator | dress up in *disguise*; *dress up* (as) (← divide one's habitual and temporary identities).

Examples: 渾身
Etymology: As per 軍# (circularity) + 水 water | mix liquid with a circular motion, causing it to become *turbid* | *as a whole* (← mix thoroughly).
As per the right-hand element# as described in 珍 (fullness) + 走 run | *pursue* and take full advantage of an opportunity | *proceed toward*; *take advantage of an opportunity*; *follow*.

Examples: 牢騷 坐牢
Etymology: 宀 roof/building + 牛# cow | barn/stable for cattle | *jail/prison* | *secure* | *hard*; *tight* (← hard/tight security). Also, *sacrifice* (← sacrifice an animal confined for this purpose).
As per 白# (scatter) + 水 water | tethered rafts/boats scattered over the surface of water (compare 舶) | *be anchored*; *wharf*; *lodge*; *overnight stay*; *shoal*; *shallow lake*; *shallows*.

Examples: 慎重 謹慎 審慎

Etymology: As per 林# (encompass) + 玉 jewel | jeweled necklace strung about the neck | *jewel*; *tinkling of a string of jewels* (compare 玲 and 瓏).

Examples: 疲倦
Etymology: 卷# curl + 人 person (| human agency) | assume a curled position in *fatigue* (compare 惓) |  *languor* | *grow weary of*; *lose interest in*.

Examples: 豆腐 腐敗 腐爛
Etymology: As per 府# (storehouse) + 肉 flesh | stored meat that has spoiled | *spoil*; *rot*; *decompose*; *decay*; *go bad*; *corrode*; *corrupt*.
As per 它# (snake) + 虫 insect/creature | *snake/serpent*. 蛇 was devised to replace 它.

Examples: 搜集
Etymology: As per 叟# (search) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | *search*.

Examples: 患者
Etymology: 串# pierce + 心 heart/emotions | *worry*; *suffer* (← heart that is figuratively pierced) | (be) *ill*; *trouble*.

Examples: 埋伏 起伏
Etymology: 犬 here an abbreviated form# of 犾 as described in 獄 (pair of dogs) + 人 person | pair of dogs lying curled at their master's feet | *bend/lie down*; *cover (up)*; *hide*; *obey* (← all actions commonly associated with dogs) | *bow*; *prostrate oneself*; *turn over*; *lower*; *cast down*; *lay an ambush*.

Examples: 陶瓷 陶器
Etymology: As per 匋# (knead) + 阜 piled earth (for emphasis/clarification) | knead clay in a vessel | *pottery*; *ceramics*; *porcelain*.

Examples: 惡劣
Etymology: 力 here an abbreviated form# of 勵 exert + 少 (small/slight) | make but a slight/*weak* exertion | *inferiority*.

Examples: 疲倦 疲勞 疲憊
Etymology: As per 皮# (align) + 疒 illness | align the legs and *bend* over on account of *fatigue* (compare 留) | *get/be tired*.

Meaning: to save money, store, reserve; an heir
Examples: 儲存 儲蓄 儲備
Etymology: As per 諸# (compilation): | *keep in reserve*; *save*; *store* (up). Also, *profit* and *profitmaking* (← surplus money). Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying the sense "compilation" that dropped from 諸.

Meaning: pole; stick; club; pole as unit

Examples: 塑膠
Etymology: As per 朔# (conjunction of beginning and end points) + 土 earth | *clay figure*; *model* (that returns to clay when destroyed).
As per 容# (contain voluminous objects) + 艸 grass/plant | fruit/flower containing numerous seeds. The compound 芙蓉 refers to a lotus plant.

Examples: 聯繫
Etymology: Variant form# of 毄 link + 糸 thread | link/*connect* with thread, string or rope | *tie/fasten* (an object to) | *hang*; *be connected/involved*. Note a variant form, 繋.
As per 立# (exert continuous downward pressure) + 水 water | *teardrops* pressing on the cheeks | *cry*; *sob*; *weep* | *moan*; *regret*.
As per 立# (exert continuous downward pressure) + 米 rice | full, ripe ears of rice hanging heavily on the plant | (a) *grain* | (a) *drop*; *droplet* (← small object resembling a grain).

Examples: 渴望 解渴
Etymology: As per 曷# (cut off) + 水 water | *cut off a supply of water* | *parched*; *thirst*.

Examples: 玻璃
Etymology: 玉 jewel + 离# for the sound alone to transliterate the final syllable of the Sanskrit vaidurya (lapis lazuli: 吠瑠璃). The compound 玻璃 refers to crystal and/or glass.

Meaning: the main beams supporting a house
Etymology: As per 東# (run through) + 木 tree/wood | *ridge*, *ridgepole* or *ridge beam* running from one end of a roof to the other | *counter for buildings*.

Examples: 奔騰 沸騰 圖騰
Etymology: As per 朕# (rise) + 馬 horse | horse leaping in the air | *rise* (of prices).

Examples: 玻璃
Etymology: 玉 jewel + 皮# for the sound alone to transliterate the first syllable of the Pali phatika (crystal: 玻璃). Also, *glass*.

Examples: 返回
Etymology: 反# return + 辵 movement | *return* to one's point of origin | *turn over*; *reverse*; *fall upside down*. Compare 僨.

Examples: 併發 合併
Etymology: 并# align + 人 person (| human agency) | align to *unite*/*join*/*combine*/*put together*.

Examples: 利弊
Etymology: As per 敝# (split) + 廾 pair of hands (| action indicator) | split an object in half, devaluing it | *evil* (← destruction ← rip apart) | *humble prefix* (← humility ← render an object worthless ← destroy).

Examples: 埋伏
Etymology: As per 里# (long strip) + 土 earth | long furrows in which seeds are buried | *bury*; *cover* | *fill* (with).

Examples: 晉級

Etymology: 希# rare + 禾 grain/rice | *scarce*/*rare* crops (= poor harvest; compare 飢 and 饑) | *thin/slight* (← slight quantity).

Examples: 鴨子
Etymology: 鳥 bird + 甲# for the sound alone to simulate the quacking of a (wild) *duck*.

Examples: 流汗 冷汗 血汗
Etymology: As per 干# (press against) + 水 water | *sweat* pressing against the skin.

Meaning: male of animals; bolt of door
Etymology: As per 士 (erect; male) + 牛# cow/bull | (erect) bull | *male* (creatures).

Examples: 暢銷 舒暢
Etymology: 昜# rise + 申 (stretch) | *stretch* high/long | *proceed smoothly* | *free and easy*.
As per 忝# (attach) + 水 water | use a sticky fluid to *attach* one object to another | *append*; *add*; *accompany* (← add a layer). Also, *comply with*, *satisfy* and *marry* (← complete ← add to).
As per 夭# (slender and limber) + 女 woman | woman twisting her body alluringly (compare 嬌) | *alluring*; *bewitching*; *weird*. *Calamity* is a borrowed meaning, via 殀.

Examples: 劑量
Etymology: As per 齊# (align) + 刀 sword/knife | align cut pieces of bark and plant roots for medicinal use | *medicine*; *drug*.

Examples: 廣泛
Etymology: A variant form of 汎 float: *float*; *rise*; *cover*; *arise*. *Overturn* and *capsize* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 火柴
Etymology: As per 此# (line up irregularly) + 木 tree/wood | irregularly shaped pieces of *brushwood* or *firewood*.
As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 山 mountain | *high/towering* cliff/precipice at which one squats for safety (compare the crouching figure as described in 危 and in 負).

Meaning: lead by hand, take with; carry

Examples: 文壇
Etymology: As per 亶# (long and flat) + 土 earth | long and flat, earthen altar | *platform*; *dais*; *rostrum*. Compare 禅.

Examples: 使喚
Etymology: 口 mouth + 奐# for the sound alone to simulate a *yell* (compare 喊) | *call (out)* | *summon*.
As per 考# (bend) + 手 hand/action indicator | *torture* by bending/twisting body parts | *strike*.
苹# floating weed + 水 water (for emphasis/clarification) | *floating weed*; *duckweed*. Compare 蘋.

Examples: 勾結
Etymology: A variant of 句 (bend): *bend*. *Hook* and *capture* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 催眠
Etymology: As per 崔# (squat): | squat (with the *urge*) to defecate | *meeting/gathering/function* (←  gathering at which attendees squat) | *sponsor*; *hold* (← sponsor/hold a meeting). Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
As per 唐# (rise) + 米 rice (here suggesting sugar cane, a plant similar in shape to a rice stalk) | boil sugar cane (similar in shape to a rice stalk), causing steam to rise | *sugar*.

Examples: 櫃子 衣櫃 櫃臺
Etymology: As per 匱# (empty container) + 木 tree/wood | wooden container | *chest*; *coffer*; (wooden) *tub*.

Examples: 螞蟻
Etymology: As per 義# (blade-like) + 虫 insect/creature | *ant* (creature with a bite that cuts like a blade).

Examples: 販毒 販賣 小販
Etymology: As per 反# (thin sheet) + 貝 commodities | goods laid out on display (compare 舗) on a board | *sales*.

Examples: 抑制
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 手 hand/action indicator + an element# that is 印 (press down upon a person in forcing him/her to kneel) written in reverse | push/press down upon another in forcing him to kneel | *exert pressure*; *restrain*; *hold down*; *control* | *suppress*; *repress*. The present form uses 卬.

As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 虫 insect/creature (here, in its original sense of "snake," suggesting a dragon) | vivid *rainbow* connecting the two ends of the sky. Anciently, a rainbow was regarded as one type of dragon.

Meaning: surname; water in which rice has been rinsed; a river that flows into the Han
Etymology: As per 番# (spread) + 水 water | grain spread throughout water in which it is washed | *water in which rice has been washed* | *whirlpool*.
As per 亢# (stretch) + 土 earth | *hole,* *pit* or *shaft* stretching deep into the earth (compare 阬) | *bury*.

As per 莫# (concealed) + 日 sun/day | concealment of the sun at *sunset*/*nightfall* | *become dark* | *end* | *spend time* (← passage of time ← grow dark) | *earn a living*; *livelihood* (← manner in which one passes time ← passage of time). 暮 was devised to replace 莫 after 莫 lost its connection with nightfall.

复 is an abbreviated form of 畐 as described in 副 (alcohol container with a bulging middle) + 夂 leg/foot pointed downward (| action indicator) | send back/return something received (in kind) | double back. 腹 is as per 复# (double back) + 肉 flesh | *stomach* of an obese person (i.e. with an extra layer of fat doubled atop the abdominal muscles) | *abdomen*; *belly*.
As per 者# (pile of brushwood/firewood) + 火 fire | *cook*; *boil*. Like 暑, 煮 was devised to replace 者 after 者 acquired its borrowed meaning.

Examples: 抄襲 侵襲 襲擊
Etymology: 龖 is 龍 dragon (doubled) | dragons pressed closely together in flight. 襲 combines 龍 (an abbreviated form# of 龖) + 衣 clothing | wear layers of clothing (← double/pile up garments) | *inherit*; *succeed to* (← add goods, offices etc. to those already in one's possession). Also, *attack*; *sweep over* and *seize* (← attack like dragons in flight).

Examples: 模仿 仿冒 仿造
Etymology: As per 方# (spread right and left, or in all directions) + 人 person | person producing imitations and causing them to spread by distributing them | *imitate*. *Wander* is a borrowed meaning via 倣.
As per 辟# (spread) + 肉 flesh | the spreading flesh of the *arm*. *Elbow* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 口吻
Etymology: As per 勿# (obscure) + 口 mouth | *lips* (that obscure the inside of the mouth) | *kiss*.

Examples: 浴室 沐浴
Etymology: As per 谷# (cavity) + 水 water | submerge oneself in a water-filled cavity such as the base of a waterfall, or a bathtub | *bathing* | *pour* (water); *shower*; *immerse oneself* (in an activity). Other extended meanings from "pour" include *heap upon*; *bask* (in sunshine); *receive/be subjected to* and *under fire*.
As per 匡# (extend within a framing object) + 木 tree/wood | *wooden frame* (of a door) | *threshold*; *sill*.
高# high/tall + 攴 action indicator | raise the arm high, then *strike* down upon an object | *beat*; *pound*.

Examples: 保佑
Etymology: As per 右#: *protect* | *help*; *assist*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one. Compare 侑.
As per 方# (spread right and left, or in all directions) + 彳 movement | *wander* (compare 徬 and 徘) | *irresolute* (← unsettled state of mind ← unsettled). *Resemble* is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 謹慎
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 漢 (minute) + 言 words | pay minute attention to one's words | circumspection | *consideration*; *caution*; *restraint*; *humility* | polite term of *respect* for another.

As per 丘# (hill) + 山 mountain | rugged, rocky *mountain* | *peak*. 嶽 and 岳 are distinct characters, but 岳 is the Shinjitai (new character form) adopted in Japan during the twentieth century to replace 嶽 for official use.

Examples: 敘述
竊賊
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element is a variant# of 戎 (seize goods). 賊 adds 貝 commodities (for emphasis/clarification) | seize goods | *plunder*; *bandit*; *thief*.

Examples: 罐頭 罐子
Etymology: As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 缶 bulging earthenware jug/vase | widemouthed, bulging earthenware jug/vase | *vessel*; *can* | *boiler*.

Examples: 多寡 寡婦
Etymology: The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a child with a large head + 宀 roof/building | a solitary child (compare 孤) indoors | *alone* | *widow*; *few*; *minimal*.

Examples: 燦爛
Etymology: 粲# bright + 火 fire | *brilliant* fire | *vivid*; *bright*.

Examples: 情侶
Etymology: As per 呂# (align in a row) + 人 person | companions, people in figurative alignment | *companion* | *associate(d) with*.

Examples: 地攤 攤子 攤位
Etymology: As per 難# (stretch over) + 手 hand/action indicator | *stretch/spread out*; *extend* | *open*. Also, *allocate* (← extend goods to another person ← stretch out).

Examples: 青翠
Etymology: As per 卒# (compact) + 羽 feather/wing | (female) *kingfisher* (← compact bird of *green* color). Compare 翡.

Examples: 羨慕
Etymology: Abbreviated form of 膳 (meals; provisions) + the top element as described in 盜 (drool with desire) | (figuratively/actually) drool with desire for food (compare 涎) | *covet*; *yearn for* | *envy*. *Be left over* and *remainder* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 綿延
Etymology: 緜 is 帛# white cloth + 系 connection | connected fibers of *cotton* in a piece of cloth. However, 緜 has been supplanted by 綿, which substitutes 糸 for 系 and transposes the elements.

Examples: 謎語
Etymology: 迷# be lost + 言 words | be lost/confounded by a *riddle* or *puzzle* | *enigma*.

Meaning: to cover (with the hand); shut, conceal; ambush
Examples: 掩蓋
Etymology: 奄# cover/conceal + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | *cover*/*conceal*.

Examples: 比喻
秩序
Etymology: 禾 grain/rice + 失, here an abbreviated form# of 迭 rotation | rotate crops | *sequence*; *order*.

Examples: 輝煌
Etymology: As per 皇# (extend) + 火 fire | extensive fire/flames | *bright*; *glittering*; *gleaming*. Compare 炯.

Examples: 賠償 索賠
Etymology: As per 咅# (spread) + 貝 commodities | spread money or payment in kind to provide full *compensation* for the original value of a (lost/destroyed) object | *indemnity*. For the correlation of the concept "spread" with the meaning "compensate," compare 補.

Examples: 標籤
Etymology: As per 韱# (slender/fine) + 竹 bamboo | slender pieces of bamboo used as markers or lots in divination | *marker*; *lot* | *lottery*.
As per 冊# (bamboo slats) + 玉 jewel | (slat-like) *coral*. *Centimeter* is a borrowed meaning.
As per 殸# as described in 聲 (carry over a distance) + 香 fragrance | fragrance carrying over a distance | *fragrant*; *be fragrant*.

Examples: 威脅
Etymology: As per 劦# as described in 協 (pressure from two sides) + 肉 flesh | the two sides of the body, under pressure | *threaten* (← be threatened by attackers at both sides; compare 狹) | *frighten*; *fear*; *be scared*; *startle*.
As per 句# (bend) + 手 hand/action indicator | *confine* a prisoner in a bending posture | *detain*; *adhere*.
As per 丑# (curve/bend) + 糸 thread | curved and knotted *string* or *cord* | *tie*; *knob* (of a seal).

Examples: 哎喲
愚蠢
Etymology: 春# spring + 虫 insect (doubled) | *squirming/wriggling insects* (← newly born life forms, likened to the fresh growth of vegetation in spring). *Foolish* is a borrowed meaning via 惷.
As per 永# (stretch far) + 言 words | *chant/recite* a poem by prolonging one's voice | *sing*.

Examples: 鑰匙 湯匙
Etymology: As per 是# (spoon) + 匕 double-pronged eating implement | *spoon*. 匙 was devised to replace 是 after 是 acquired its extended meanings.
闌# block + 手 hand/action indicator | *block*; *obstruct*.

Examples: 皮膚 膚淺 肌膚
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 虜 (emaciated) + 肉 flesh | (emaciated) *skin*.

Examples: 步驟
Etymology: 聚# assemblage + 馬 horse | galloping assemblage of horses | *gallop* | *fast*; *sudden* | *often* (← quick repetition of an act ← gallop).

Meaning: to marry, give a daughter in marriage
Etymology: 家# household + 女 woman | woman sent to another household | *marry* (off a daughter) | *bride*; *one's wife*; *one's daughter-in-law*.

Examples: 寺廟
Etymology: 朝# dynasty + 广 building | imperial court. Later, 廟 was applied to a *temple* or *shrine* (←  place for venerating ancestors ← place for paying respects to the emperor) | *mausoleum*.

Examples: 懷孕 避孕 孕婦
Etymology: A depiction of a pregnant woman, her belly protruding (compare 巳) | *pregnancy*.
As per 我# (bladed weapon) + 人 person (| human agency) | person striking suddenly with a bladed weapon or implement | *sudden* | *soon*.
干# thick bar + 肉 flesh | *liver* (← bar-shaped, vital organ) | *courage* (compare English "guts," as also in 腹 or 膽).

Examples: 籠罩
Etymology: 卓# (rise above) + 罒 net | fish-catching *basket* (pulled high out of the water). *Wrap* and *cover* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 香腸
Etymology: 昜# rise + 肉 flesh | gas rising in the *intestines*.
As per 半# (split) + 反 bend back | split in rebellion | *revolt*; *rebel*.
As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 匚 enclosure | basket with lids/doors that open in alignment to both sides. *Bandit*, *evil person* and *not* are borrowed meanings.

Abbreviated form of 楚# whip (with the 疋 element written in variant form) + 卩 kneeling figure | whip a kneeling person, then dismiss him | *get rid of*; *remove* | *retire* (from office). Also, *unload* and *wholesale* (← get rid of).

Examples: 旗袍
Etymology: 包# envelop + 衣 clothing | padded/lined garment that envelops the body | *padded clothes*; *coat*.

Examples: 撒謊 說謊
Etymology: 荒# wild + 言 words | *lie* (← wild words).

Examples: 貿易 外貿
Etymology: Variant of 卯# (bend) + 貝 commodities | bend another person to one's demands in trading | *trade*; *business*.

As per 委# (hang low) + 鬼 ghost; demon | a name for a particular country in ancient China, regarded as populated by short and unsightly inhabitants. The meaning *high* likely stems from association with the mountainous areas of the country. Other pejorative names for countries and their residents that involve shortness include 倭 and 夷.

As per 卸# (whip) + 彳 movement | whip a horse in driving a chariot | *manage*; *control*; *tame*. Also, *honorary prefix* (originally, with reference to one who manages/controls). *Defend* is a borrowed meaning via 禦.

Examples: 防禦
Etymology: As per 御# (whip) + 示 altar/the supernatural | festival/ceremony held to drive off evil | *ward off*; *resist*; *block*; *defend*.

Examples: 踴躍
蘋果
Etymology: As per 頻# (no interval) + 艸 grass/plant | *floating weed* or semi-aquatic fern, resting directly on the surface of water | *duckweed*. Compare 萍.

Meaning: purify water by allowing sediment to settle; clear, pure
Etymology: 登# rise + 水 water | the clear part of a liquid substance that rises to the top | *make/become clear* | *clean*; *transparent*; *purify* | *serene*. Also, *put on airs* (← superior to others  ← pure).

As per 粦# as described in 隣 (repeated series) + 鹿 deer | a fabulous creature reputed to emit a repeated, multi-colored glow. The creature is supposed to have the trunk of a deer, the tail of a cow and the hooves and mane of a horse, and to make perfect right angles in turning (compare 麒). The compound 麒麟 refers to the male and female of the beast, with 麒 normally understood to represent the former and 麟 the latter. 麒麟 also applies to the *giraffe*, an animal which may have been the model for the imaginary beast.

Examples: 宵夜
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 宀 roof/building | rays of sunlight that stream indoors at dusk, growing ever finer | *early evening*; *night*.

Examples: 陌生
Etymology: As per 百# (spread) + 阜 piled earth | spreading *footpath* (compare/contrast 阡), originally a raised path running through a rice field | *road running through a village/town*. *One hundred* is a borrowed meaning via 百.

The right-hand element# is as per 丙 (spread) + an L-shaped frame | spread over a low, narrow space. 陋 adds 阜 piled earth | low, narrow space between (earthen) walls | *low*; *narrow*; *cramped* | *narrow-minded* | *mean*. Compare 窶.

Examples: 委屈 屈服
Etymology: 出# protrude + 尸 buttocks | *bend* over, causing the buttocks to protrude.

Meaning: heart, from bottom of one's heart
Examples: 苦衷 衷心
Etymology: 中# center/middle + 衣 clothing | wrap *inside* one's clothing | *inner feelings*. For the association between clothes and feelings, compare 褱 as described in 懷.

Examples: 崗位

Meaning: to toss about; to swing; to rock
Etymology: As per 湯# (vapor rising from boiling water) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl | *wash/sweep away* with boiling water. *Waver* and *cause a person to waver/give in* are borrowed meanings, via 蕩.

厤# is 厂 cliff/shape indicator (here suggesting a roof) + 秝 (禾 grain/rice doubled | sheaves of grain) | count neat lines of sheaves in a storehouse (compare 稟) | manage. 曆 adds 日 sun/day | neat lineup or arrangement of days that enables easy counting | *calendar* | *destiny*; *fate*; *lifespan*; *era*; *period*.
As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 心 heart/emotions | force another to *ponder*/*think deeply*. *This* (*only*) is a borrowed meaning, via 唯.

Meaning: a concourse; to flow together, gather together; to remit money
Examples: 匯款 外匯 匯票
Etymology: 淮# is as per 隹 (exert downward pressure) + 水 water | heavy buildup of water | name of a particular river. 匯 adds 匸 (contain) | converging waters that collect in a containing basin | *confluence*; *swirling water*.

Examples: 誘惑
Etymology: 秀# surpass + 言 words | *persuade* another person by surpassing his power of resistance | *induce*; *tempt*; *incite*; *cause* | *invite*; *ask*; *move* (a person to tears etc.).
As per 圭# (cone-shaped) + 木 tree/wood | general term for various species of trees that grow or are cultivated in the shape of a cone | (general term for) *aromatic trees*; *katsura tree*.
As per 那# (supple) + 女 woman | supple, *graceful* woman | *elegant*; *captivating*.

Examples: 目睹
Etymology: As per 者# (pile) + 目 eye | *look carefully/closely* at a pile of objects. A variant form, 覩, replaces 目 with 見 see while repositioning 者.

Examples: 宮殿
Etymology: Variant form# of 展 (place the buttocks atop an object) + 殳 action indicator | place the buttocks on an object in settling upon it | *rear* (← rear end). Also, *palace* and *hall* (← sit on a throne) | *lord*. との refers to a place name, that is, と as in 大和 (やまと) and の as in 名 (な・の), which supplied names for high-ranking families in ancient Japan. *Mr.*, *Ms.*, *Mrs.* and *Miss* are via extension from "lord" in the sense of being honorifics.

Examples: 師傅
Etymology: As per 尃# as described in 博 (spread) + 人 person | large group attending on/accompanying an important person | *attend upon*; *accompany* | *tutor*; *minder*.

Examples: 謙虛 謙遜
Etymology: As per 兼# (gather then put/store away | keep concealed) + 言 words | speak with *modesty* or *humility* (← conceal how one actually evaluates one's own abilities).

Examples: 鑰匙
Etymology: As per 龠# (oblong object) + 金 metal | (key of a) *lock* equipped with a cylinder | *key*; *to lock (up)*. Also, *vital point* and *pivot* (← vital point at which a lock opens).

Examples: 領袖
Etymology: As per 由# (pass/run through) + 衣 clothing | *sleeve* (← the part of a garment through which the arms run; compare 褎) | *insert in one's sleeve*.
As per 丑# (curve/bend) + 金 metal | *knob*; *button*; a *handle* (← curved pieces of metal).
As per 眉# (long, curved eyebrow) + 女 woman | woman arching an eyebrow seductively | *flirt*; *seductive* | *flatter*. Also, *beautiful*.

An abbreviated form# of 乾 (rise high) + 羽 feather/wing | (long, hard) feather raised in being used as a writing implement | *writing brush* | *letter* (← writing produced by such a brush). *Fly high* is via reinterpretation of the constituent elements of the character.

Examples: 捧場
Etymology: As per 奉# (spread/extend) + 手 hand/action indicator | *hold an object in both hands* and extend it in a ritual offering | *offer*.

Examples: 憤怒 氣憤
Etymology: As per 賁# (swell) + 心 heart/emotions | swelling emotion, in the form of *wrath*, *anger*, *rage*, *indignation* or *resentment*.

Examples: 猴子
Etymology: As per 侯# (lumpy object) + 犬 dog/beast | lump-shaped ape/*monkey*.
As per 卒# (compact) + 米 rice | compact rice in polishing/refining it | *pure* | *refined*; *elegant* | *style*.

Examples: 跨越
Etymology: As per 夸# (U-shaped crotch) + 足 leg/foot | *straddle* or *stride over* an object, the crotch forming a U-shape | *astride*; *bestride*; *span*; *step over*. 跨 was devised to replace 夸 after 夸 lost its connection with "straddle."

Examples: 螞蟻

Etymology: As per 矣# (come to a stop) + 土 earth | *dust* settled over stationary objects.

Examples: 冤枉
Etymology: As per 王# (extend) + 木 tree/wood | strong wind (compare 凰) extending tree branches and forcing them to *bend* | *force* (v.); *distort*. Also, *perverse* and *in vain*.

The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 即 (kneel immediately beside a table piled high with food) + an element# showing an additional person on the other side of the table | two figures positioned on opposite sides of a table. 卿 was originally used with exclusive reference to elder members of families who were permitted to eat in front of an altar. However, over time it came to designate the rank of an aristocrat | *noble*; *lord*; *minister*; *head of a government agency*. *You* is via the use of the term by a ruler toward a subordinate.
斯# split + 手 hand/action indicator | *rip*; *break*; *tear*.

Examples: 花紋 指紋 皺紋
Etymology: As per 文# (fine, detailed pattern) + 糸 thread | a hem stitch | *pattern* | *family crest*.

Meaning: to row or paddle boat; to scratch
Examples: 划不來 划得來
雕刻
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 彫 (carved pattern) + 隹 short, squat bird | bird pattern carved into a utensil | *carve*; *sculpt*; *chisel*; *inscribe*; *engrave*. Also, *eagle*.

Examples: 哺乳動物
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 孚# (envelop/enclose) + 乙 here a shape indicator to suggest a  breast | (mother's) *milk* enclosed in a *breast* | *feed* (a baby); *infantile*.

Examples: 肩膀 翅膀
Etymology: As per 旁# (spread to/be on both sides) + 肉 flesh | the *shoulder blades* (one on each side of the body) | *upper arm*. *The sides of the body* is via a Japanese reinterpretation of the elements.

Meaning: rely upon; protector; fight; war, weaponry
Examples: 打仗
Etymology: As per 丈# (a stick) + 人 person (| human agency) | wield a *stick* in battle | *weapon*. Also, *lean/rely/depend on* (← stick that offers support in walking).

Examples: 手電筒
Etymology: As per 同# (run through) + 竹 (rigid, tubular) bamboo | (bamboo) *tube* through which liquids or solids run | *pipe*; *gun barrel*.

Examples: 辜負
Etymology: 古# hard; dried out + 辛 (cutting tool | punish) | severe (= hard) punishment for a *crime*.

Examples: 馬桶
Etymology: As per 甬# (run through) + 木 tree/wood | *tub* or (wooden) *bucket* that receives water running through a pipe or tube.
As per 弗# (split) + 彳 movement (| action indicator) | split into *like* or similar groups | *similar to*. Also, *dim(ly)* (← similar to the point of being dimly/barely distinguishable).

Examples: 衰退
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 衣 clothing + an element# indicating a straw raincoat | straw raincoat wrapped about the shoulders | *weaken*; *decline* (← straw that becomes sodden and shrinks).

Examples: 打獵 獵人 狩獵
Etymology: 巤 is a depiction of a pheasant with bound wings, captured by being pressured from all sides in hunting. 獵 is 巤# + 犬 dog/beast | *hunting* (in general). *Fishing* and *shellfish gathering* are associated meanings.

Examples: 譬如
Etymology: As per 辟# (spread) + 言 words | figurative spread of words in offering an example, or in illustrating (a point) | *example/illustration*.
熏 here an abbreviated form# of 薰 fragrance + 力 power/energy | the (figuratively) fragrant result of effort | *merit*.

Examples: 襯衫
Etymology: 彡# (hair-like) pattern + 衣 clothing | *thin garment* (with a pattern resembling strands of hair). Also, a *sleeveless garment*.

Examples: 誠懇
Etymology: As per 貇# as described in 墾 (adhere) + 心 heart/emotions | adhering/lasting feelings of *cordiality* or *sincerity* (compare 恩) | *courteous*; *intimate*.

Examples: 凍結 冷凍
Etymology: As per 東# (run through) + 氷 ice | ice running through a given spot | *frozen over* | *freeze*; *chill*.

Examples: 親戚
Etymology: As per 尗# as described in 叔 (slender and pendent) + 戉 (battle-ax) | *battle-ax* with a slender, elliptical haft | *hatchet*. (Familial) *relative*, *grieve* and *sad* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 新穎
Etymology: As per 頃# (incline) + 禾 grain/rice | sharp ears/spikes of a grain plant, inclining on account of their weight | *outstanding* (← sharp).

Examples: 主軸
Etymology: As per 由# (pass/run through) + 車 vehicle | *axle*/*shaft* running the width of a vehicle | *axis* | *scroll* (← similarity of shape).

Examples: 殖民地 繁殖 生殖
Etymology: 直 here an abbreviated form# of 植 plant (v.) + a now-obsolete element of uncertain significance that came to be written 歹 | *breed*; *increase*; *multiply*.

Examples: 撤回 撤銷
Etymology: As per the right-hand element# of 徹 (pass through) + 手 hand/action indicator | *remove* obstacles, allowing easy passage | *withdraw*.
覃# extensive + 水 water | extensive *water-filled abyss* | *deep pool*; *deep*.

Examples: 婚姻
Etymology: As per 因# (superimpose) + 女 woman | superimposition of one family upon another in *marriage*.

Examples: 昂貴
Etymology: 卬# look up at + 日 sun/day | *raise* one's head to observe the sun | *rise* (high); *look up*. Also, *haughty* (← take a superior attitude) and *tense* (← high emotions).

Meaning: pour, splash, water, sprinkle; violent, malignant
Examples: 活潑
Etymology: As per 發# (split away in being released) + 水 water | release water in sprinkling/pouring | *sprinkle*; *pour*; *splash* | *leap* (← splash upwards).

Examples: 唱腔 腔調
Etymology: As per 空# (emptiness) + 肉 flesh | *body cavities*, including the *chest cavity*.

Examples: 臉龐
Etymology: 龍# dragon + 广 building | *voluminous* (← huge dragon filling a structure) | *huge and dimly visible* | situation *in disarray*. For the idea of a dragon in a building, compare 寵.
奧# deep + 水 water | *inlet* winding *deep* into land; *bend in a river*; *deep water*. In Japan, the character also has the meaning *offshore*.

Meaning: wink, blink; in a wink, a flash
Examples: 瞬間
Etymology: As per 舜# (flame-like) + 目 eye | flame-like, rapid movement of the eyes in winking/blinking | *wink*; *blink* | *twinkle*; (in a) *flash*.
As per 同# (run through) + 金 metal | *copper* (← a metal easily run through in drilling) | *bronze*; *brown*.
支# branch + 肉 flesh | *the limbs*, likened to branches | *arms and legs*. Also, *branch element*.

Examples: 糾正 糾紛
Etymology: 丩# as described in 叫 (twisted threads) + 糸 thread (for emphasis/clarification) | *entwine* thread | *twist* | *rectify* (← prevent another from straying; compare 救) | *follow about*; *examine* (← twist); *be strict with* (← rectify). A variant form, 糺, combines 糸 thread + 乚 a variant form of 乙.

Examples: 草叢
Etymology: As per 取# (take hold of) + 丵 as described in 對 (thick clump of tall grass) | take hold of and *gather bushes*/*shrubs* | *thicket*.

Meaning: expand; open up; support or push
Examples: 開拓
Etymology: 石# stone + 手 hand/action indicator | *clear/open up land* by removing stones.

Examples: 主宰
Etymology: 辛# needle/cutting tool + 宀 roof/building | *oversee* food preparation indoors, including the cutting of meat | *manage*; *control*.

Examples: 鍛鍊
湊巧 緊湊
Etymology: As per 奏# (gather) + 水 water | ships in a *port/harbor*, gathered/assembled in a tight group | *assemble*.

Meaning: weaver's shuttle; go to and fro
Examples: 穿梭
Etymology: As per 夋# as described in 俊 (stand erect) + 木 tree/wood | erect *shuttle* of a loom. Compare 杼.

Examples: 住宅
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of 乇 depicts a hand raising an object in the palm straight up, separating the object from others. 宅 is as per 乇# (separate) + 宀 roof/building | be separated from others in being confined to a *residence* | *be/stay at home*.
As per 舌# (chisel-like implement in motion) + 刀 sword/knife | scrape at with a bladed implement (compare 歳) | *scrape*; *shave* | *tear off*.

Meaning: sesame; a purplish or brown mushroom thought to have miraculous powers; 'a divine and relicitous plant' (Karlgren)
Etymology: 之# (forward motion) + 艸 grass/plant | (a particular variety of fast-growing) mushroom. *Turf* is a borrowed meaning | *lawn*; *grass*.

Examples: 冰淇淋
Etymology: 林# forest + 水 water | rain dripping in a forest | *drip* | *desolation* (← desolate feeling created by the sound of dripping water) | *lonely*. Compare 漓.
As per 敝# (split) + 死 die/death | split an enemy apart | *kill* (an enemy) | *die*.

Examples: 驕傲
Etymology: 喬# tall and limber + 馬 horse | horse prancing, head raised high | *pride*; *arrogance*.

Reverse image of 身# pregnant (| fecund) + 殳 action indicator | (make) *abundant*; *prosperous*; *flourishing*. The *Yin Dynasty* (c. 1766 to c. 1050 B.C.E.; also known as the 商 Shang) is a borrowed usage.

Examples: 墳墓
Etymology: As per 莫# (concealed) + 土 earth | *grave/tomb* where the deceased are concealed.

Examples: 補償 賠償
Etymology: 賞# bestow; reward + 人 person (| human agency) | bestow compensation | *compensate*; *indemnify* (a person) | *reparation*; *atonement*.

Examples: 冥想
Etymology: In its present form, 冖# cover + an element combining 日 sun/day + 六 (originally, 入 enter) | cover blocking the entry of sunlight | *darkness* | *the depths*; *the other world* (← unseen dimension). Also, *stupidity* (← dark ignorance). However, 冥 itself is likely the source of the 冖 element/character, suggesting that a different combination of elements conveyed the idea of darkness in the earliest form of 冥.
As per 少# (small/slight) + 火 fire | *fry* lightly | *roast*; *broil*.

Examples: 利潤
Etymology: As per 閏# (concealed) + 水 water | liquid concealed in the earth that slowly oozes out | *ooze*; *moisten* | *benefit*; *enrich*; *profit*. Also, *dim/cloudy* (← concealing mist).

Examples: 放蕩
Etymology: As per 湯# (vapor rising from boiling water) + 艸 grass/plant | pond vegetation wavering like vapors | *waver*; *cause a person to waver/give in*. Also, *spread* (← spread in a wavering manner) and *licentiousness* (← irresolute/loose behavior ← waver). *Wash/sweep away* is a  borrowed meaning, via 盪. In that connection, note that 蕩 has a variant form 蘯.

Examples: 狂妄
Etymology: As per 亡# (obscure) + 女 woman | be thoroughly captivated by a woman for obscure reasons (compare 魅) | *lack foundation*; *incoherent*; *false*.

Examples: 飢餓
Etymology: As per 我# (bladed weapon | blade-like) + 食 food/eating | lean, blade-like appearance of a starving person (compare 飢) | *hunger*; *starvation*.

Examples: 掙扎
Etymology: As per 乚# a variant form of 乙 (rise and hit a blocking element) + 手 hand/action indicator | *pull* up (and through) | *prick/stab*.

Meaning: wait; look towards; turn one's back on
Examples: 佇立
Etymology: 宁# stand tall/still + 人 person | servant (compare 侍, 伃 and 妤) standing still | *stand still* | *figure*; *appearance* (← appearance of a standing figure). Compare 竚.
尸 an abbreviated form# of 尻 buttocks + 水 water | *urine* issuing from between the buttocks. For urine, compare 溲.

As per �� # as described in 券 (wrap/roll up) + 目 eye | take a panoramic/wraparound view of one's surroundings (compare 観) | *look back* | *take an interest in*; *take care of* (← keep a watchful eye on).

Meaning: wet, moist, humid, damp; an illness
Examples: 潮濕
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 水 water + an element# representing bundles of thread pressed together | soften bundles of thread by submerging them in water | *wet*; *moisten*; *damp* | *rain*. There is no etymological connection with the 㬎 element described in 顯.

Examples: 盲目 盲從 盲人
Etymology: As per 亡# (obscure) + 目 eye | obscure vision | *blind*.

Examples: 實踐
Etymology: As per 戔# (fine/slight) + 足 leg/foot | take fine steps (compare 前) | *step*/*tread* (on) | *put into practice*; *perform* (← trample an object for a specific purpose).

The right-hand element# is 爪 claw/hand + 壬, here an abbreviated form of 妊 pregnancy | have (immoral) intercourse with a pregnant woman. 淫 adds 水 water (| sexual fluids) | indulge heavily in immoral sex (compare 甚 and 耽) | be encompassed in *immorality* | *indecency*; *licentiousness*; *obscene*; *steep oneself in vice*. Note a variant form 婬 which replaces 水 with 女 woman.

Examples: 貧窮 貧苦 貧民
Etymology: 分# portion + 貝 commodities | apportion one's possessions to the point of *poverty*.
As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 言 words | deceptive words (separate from the truth) |  *err*.

Examples: 規矩
Etymology: As per 巨# (large/great framing tool) + 矢 arrow (| ancient measuring implement) | *carpenter's square* | *standard*. Compare also 榘 as described in 渠. For the use of 矢 to indicate a measuring implement, compare the original left-hand element of 規.

Meaning: varicolored, variegated; mixed; contradict, argue; suddenly
Etymology: 爻# cross/mix + 馬 horse | *spotted/dappled* horse (← horse with a mixed pattern; compare 駮 and 斑) | *mix*; *mixed* | *call a person to account* (← get mixed up in a dispute and try to straighten it out).

The relevant bronzeware inscription form of the right-hand element# is a depiction of a deep, round basin filled with water, such as found at the base of a waterfall. 淵 adds 水 water (for emphasis/clarification) | *deep pool*; *deep waters* | *profound* (← profundity ← deep pool). Also, *depths*, *abyss* and *pond*.

Examples: 棍子
Etymology: As per 昆# (circular group) + 木 tree/wood | clubs wielded by a gang of ruffians | *club* | (walking) *stick*; *cane*.
As per 也# (stretch) + 馬 horse | horse running at blurring speed (compare 闖) | *run*; *gallop*; *drive (something) forward briskly*.
As per 夫# (stretch out/over) + 手 hand/action indicator | stretch/hold out the arms to *support* oneself or another person | *help*.

Examples: 聘請
Etymology: As per 甹# as described in 娉 (pay a visit) + 耳 ear | pay a *visit* to learn of another person's intentions | *invite* | *employ* (← invite to take up a post). *Take a bride* is a borrowed meaning, via 娉.

Meaning: trough; manger; vat, tank; groove; a distillery
Etymology: As per 曹# (array) + 木 tree/wood | small wooden *vat/tub* that holds a medley of animal feed.
As per 危# (off-balanced) + 言 words | use *deceit* to put another off balance | *unreasonable*.
As per 未# (obscure) + 日 sun/day | things obscure in poor sunlight | *dark* | *ignorant*; *foolish*.

Examples: 洗澡
Etymology: As per 喿# as described in 操 (activity taking place above) + 水 water | float above, on the surface of water | *bathe*; *wash*.

Examples: 辣椒
Etymology: 束 here an abbreviated form# of 剌 (sharp) + 辛 needle/cutting tool | *severe* pain caused by a  sharp weapon | *violent* (activity/pain). Also, *hot*, *spicy* and *bitter* (← sharp taste).

Examples: 蚊子
Etymology: 虫 insect + 文# for the sound alone to simulate the buzzing of a *mosquito*.

Meaning: Buddhist priest, monk; san of Sanskrit sangha
Etymology: 人 person + 曾# for the sound alone to express the initial syllable in the term 僧伽, the Chinese transliteration of the Sanskrit sangha (community of disciples) | (Buddhist) *priest/monk*.

Examples: 柱子
Etymology: As per 主# (stationary) + 木 tree/wood | cylindrical *pillar*; *post*; *column* | *support*; *stand up* (an object).

Examples: 挫折
Etymology: As per 坐# (circular) + 手 hand/action indicator | *crush* or *break* in flattening objects into a circular shape (compare 摧) | *frustrate* (a plan); *dampen* (spirits) (← crush ambitions). Also, *sprain* (an ankle) (← result of excessive downward pressure).

Examples: 燈籠 籠子 籠罩
Etymology: As per 龍# (winding) + 竹 bamboo | *basket* woven of curved bamboo strips | *contain*; *include*; *encompass*. Also, *unite*, *shut oneself up* and *cage*. For cage, compare 槞. A  variant form, 篭, employs the 竜 form of 龍.

Examples: 發抖 顫抖
Etymology: 斗# ladle + 手 hand/action indicator | *shake off/out* excess food or liquid in ladling | *shake*; *tremble*.

Examples: 驚訝
Etymology: As per 牙# (mesh; cross) + 言 words | words exchanged in crossing paths | *meet*. Also, *suspicion* and *doubt* (← cautious attitude toward a stranger).

Examples: 蓬勃
Etymology: 孛# spring up + 力 power/energy | *sudden* action, in the form of springing up or bursting forth.

Examples: 顛覆
淘氣 淘汰
Etymology: As per 匋# (knead) + 水 water | *wash* (impurities out/away) with a kneading motion | *select* (← sort rice by relative quality; compare 汰).

Examples: 撲滅
Etymology: As per 菐# as described in 僕 (rough) + 手 hand/action indicator | *strike* roughly.

Examples: 瘟疫
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 温 (hold in heat/warmth) + 疒 illness | *contagious disease* characterized by fever. The idea is of heat held down in the body.
As per 養# (abundant) + 疒 illness | *itchy* skin condition caused by an overly rich diet.

Meaning: indulge; excess; numeral four; particle meaning now, therefore; shop
Etymology: Originally, 隶# seize + 镸/長 long | align objects that have been seized/obtained | *line up horizontally*; *shop/store*; *extend in length*. *Relax*, *do as one pleases*, *four* (used in documents as a precaution against forgery) and *therefore* are borrowed meanings. In the present form, 隶 is replaced by 聿.

Examples: 噴漆
Etymology: 桼# originally depicted cuts in a tree made at intervals, producing a slender trickle of sap. 漆 adds 水 water (| liquid) | *lacquer* tree.
As per 星# (bright) + 犬 dog/beast | imaginary animal with a bald, shiny pate and human-like face, for which (a particular species of) *orangutan* may or may not have been the original inspiration.

As per 占# (fixed in place) + 巾 cloth | image transferred to and fixed on cloth as a rubbing | *document*; *paper*; *bill*; *notice* (compare 牒). Also, *counter* for Japanese paper, tatami, folding screens and other objects. For rubbings, compare 摺 and 搨.
As per 左# (assist): | *assist*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
As per 斤# (adhere) + 示 altar/the supernatural | figuratively adhere to the gods in imploring them to grant one's wishes | *pray*; *wish/hope* (for).
As per 委# (hang low) + 矢 here an abbreviated form of 短 short | hang *low*; be *short* | *dwarf*. Compare 倭.

Examples: 賄賂
Etymology: As per 有# (extend) + 貝 commodities | extend a *bribe* (compare 賕) | *finance*; *supply*; *offer*; *provide*; *serve*; *boarding* (← extend incentives to obtain labor or other services).

Examples: 精緻
Etymology: A variant form of 絰 (fine rope) | *fine*; *dense*.
宛# bend + 女 woman | the *graceful* figure of a bending (= supple) woman | *gentle*; *beautiful*. For the coupling of "supple" and "beauty," compare 鵷.
As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 食 food/eating | tall, irregular pile of food | *abundant*; *plentiful*.

Meaning: rush in, burst in, charge in
Etymology: 門# gate + 馬 horse | horse making a *sudden entry* then disappearing behind a gate (compare 閃) | *intrusion*. Also, *inquire* (← intrude to inquire).

Examples: 歧視
諷刺
Etymology: As per 風# (flutter) + 言 words | *recite* in a fluttering/trembling voice | *recite from memory*. *Insinuate* is a borrowed meaning. The compound 諷刺 indicates satire, sarcasm or mockery.
As per 敖# (spread/roam without restraint) + 火 fire | blazing fire | *roast*; *parch*. Also, *endure* (← withstand an ordeal as scathing as a fire).

Examples: 門診 急診 診斷
Etymology: As per the right-hand element# as described in 珍 (fullness) + 言 words | *examine*/*diagnose* via a full set of questions | *see/consult* (a medical specialist).
相# mutual + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | pillars of *frost*, facing each other.

Examples: 和諧
Etymology: As per 皆# (line up) + 言 words | harmonious alignment of words | *harmonize*; *smooth over/out* | *suitability*.

Meaning: to strive, endeavor, struggle; to earn; to pierce; to wedge in
Examples: 掙扎

Meaning: unit of measure equivalent to thirty catties
Etymology: 匀# uniform + 金 metal | piece of metal of uniform weight | *unit of weight* (approximately 7.7 kilograms).
Originally an abbreviated form# of 眽 gaze + 見 see | gaze in seeking | *seek*.

Meaning: sound of beating wind and rain; light, ethereal
Examples: 瀟灑
Etymology: As per 蕭# (cleanse) + 水 water | deep and clear, cleansing flow of water | *clean* | *neat*; *tidy*.
肖 here a variant form of the top element of 祭# (scrape) + 尸 (shape indicator) | *scraps*; *fragments* | *junk*.

Meaning: spread out, arrange; shop, store; place to sleep, bed

Examples: 派遣 消遣
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of the right-hand element# combines 㠯 as described in 官 (wrapped objects) + a pair of hands | pass/send a wrapped object to someone else. 遣 is the right-hand element# + 辵 movement (for emphasis/clarification) | *send/dispatch* | *expend*; *spend*; *present*. Also, *manipulate* (← manipulate in sending/dispatching). Also, *consume* (← consume what is sent one).

Examples: 舞蹈
Etymology: 舀# dip + 足 leg/foot | *stamp* the feet. In contemporary Japanese usage, 蹈 is generally replaced by 踏.

Examples: 懸殊 懸崖
Etymology: As per 縣# as described in 県 (hang suspended) + 心 heart/emotions | emotional state likened to  hanging suspended | *hang* (suspended); *be undecided*; *be distant/apart* | *offer* (a prize) (← hold out an enticement at a tantalizing distance).

Examples: 蝴蝶
Etymology: As per 胡# (rough, covering substance) + 虫 insect/creature | insect/creature with a rough covering substance. The compound 蝴蝶 (sometimes written 胡蝶) refers to a butterfly.

Meaning: juice, liquor, fluid, sap, gravy, sauce
Examples: 果汁
Etymology: As per 十# (gather) + 水 water | liquid gathered at the bottom of a container/bowl | *juice*; *soup*; *gravy* | *sap*.
As per 龍# (winding) + 手 hand/action indicator | wrap the arms around a variety of objects | *bring together*; *possess*.
As per 凡# (a sail) + 巾 cloth | a *sail*. 帆 was devised to replace 凡 after 凡 acquired its associated meanings.
A depiction of a lidded *vase* or *pot* | *jug*; *jar*. Also, *key point* and *vital point* (← ancient game in which the objective was to toss arrows into a jar).

Meaning: large stringed musical instrument; dignified, massive; sound of wind
Etymology: An abbreviated form of 琴 stringed instrument + 必# for the sound alone to simulate a sound produced by a *(large) stringed instrument* | *large koto*.
A variant form of the element minus 鳥 as described in 鷹 (hunting hawk), indicating a bird targeted as prey by hunting hawks | *wild goose*.

惠# benefaction + 禾 grain/rice | heavy *ears/heads* of grain (a benefaction of the heavens). *Crest* (of a wave) and *point* (of a spear/writing brush) are via association with the tips of the ears of grain plants.

Examples: 慷慨
Etymology: As per 既# (engorged) + 心 heart/emotions | heart engorged with sadness | *lament*; *regret*; *deplore*.

Meaning: hum; sing softly; groan, moan; (Cant.) an interjecting indicating disapproval

Examples: 淒涼
Etymology: As per 妻# (aligned) + 水 water | aligned torrents/cascades of chilly water | *chilling*; (terribly) *cold*; *dreadful*.
As per 莫# (concealed) + 肉 flesh | *membrane* (← fleshy element that conceals).

Examples: 過濾
Etymology: As per 慮# (fineness) + 水 water | *filter/strain* (fine particles). Compare 漉.

氾# overflow + 艸 grass/plant | *thick grass*; name of a particular variety of *grass*. *Bee* may owe to a symbiotic relation between a particular variety of grass and bees. *Rule* and *regulation* are borrowed meanings.
As per 如# (supple) + 心 heart/emotions | supple/pliant attitude of tolerance or forgiveness | *tolerate*; *forgive*; *excuse* (← follow a suggestion to demonstrate magnanimity) | *thoughtfulness*.

Examples: 醬油
Etymology: As per 將# (long and slender) + 酉 alcohol container | fermented, viscous liquid that forms a long, slender trail when poured | (viscous) *sauce*; *sticky/gooey food*. The compound 醬油 indicates soy sauce. 醤 is a variant form.

Examples: 纖維
Etymology: As per 韱# (slender/fine) + 糸 thread | *slender*, *fine* thread.

Examples: 輻射
Etymology: As per 畐# as described in 副 (abundance) + 車 vehicle | abundant/numerous spokes radiating from a hub | *spoke*. Compare 輪 and 輳.

Examples: 幼稚
Etymology: 穉 is as per 犀# (slow) + 禾 grain/rice | late-developing grain | *young* (child); *infant* (← slow-developing creature). 穉 has been supplanted by the form 稚.

Meaning: sweet smelling, rich in aroma; (Cant.) to move, hit
Etymology: As per 有# (extend) + 邑 village/settlement | extensive, *prosperous* settlement (compare 旺) | *fragrant* (← fragrance of prosperity/success).

Examples: 募集
Etymology: As per 莫# (concealed) + 力 power/energy | strive to obtain something concealed, or not at hand | *appeal* (for/to); *invite*; *recruit*; *raise* (money) | *grow intense*.

Examples: 猶豫
Etymology: As per 予# (stretch) + 象 elephant | space sufficient for even a large animal to stretch and relax.
As per 廷# (extend) + 舟 boat | long, narrow vessel (such as a dugout canoe) | *small boat*.
古# hard; dried out + 木 tree/wood | *dried out* tree/wood | *wither*; *die*; *be seasoned*.

Examples: 寵愛 寵物
Etymology: 龍# dragon + 宀 roof/building | lavish attention on a confined dragon | *cherish*; *favor*; *favorite*; *affection*. Here, as in 龕, 龍 may be understood as representing a treasured possession.

Examples: 漁民
Etymology: 魚# fish + 水 water | pull fish from water | *fishing*.
奄# cover/conceal + 水 water | *cover with water*; *soak*. Also, *stop* (← immobilize by covering with water).

Examples: 岩石
Etymology: 山 standing in for either the lower portion of 嵒 or the 山 at the top of 巖 (both: *cliff*; *crag*; *rock*) + 石 stone for clarification.

Examples: 鞭炮
Etymology: As per 便# (cause to spread) + 革 leather | wield a *whip* | *encourage* (← whip on).

Examples: 裁縫
Etymology: 逢# meet 糸 thread | *sew*, causing the raw material to meet (compare 篷).
An abbreviated form# of 班 (split into a group) + 文 (pattern) | *spotted/dappled/speckled* or *mottled* patterns forming a group. Compare 駮 and 駁.
干# thick bar + 竹 bamboo | *bamboo pole* | *pole*. Also, *neck* of a violin or shamisen.

Meaning: a camel; humpbacked; to carry on the back
Examples: 駱駝
Etymology: As per 它# (stretch) + 馬 horse | *camel* (← animal with an elongated neck; compare 鴕). "Camel" is normally expressed, however, by the compound 駱駝. Compare again 鴕, as well as the compound 駝鳥, both of which refer to an ostrich.
As per 奇# (lean) + 山 mountain | mountainous headland | *cape*; *promontory*. Compare 埼 and 碕.

Examples: 冤枉
Etymology: Effectively a variant form of 宛 (bend beneath a cover), the substitution of 兔 (variant form of 兎 rabbit) for the two bending figures in 宛 suggesting a rabbit crouching under the cover in which it is trapped | *be framed/falsely accused*.
