The relevant oracle bone form of 菐# depicts a rough slave/servant spreading his arms in falling prostrate. Distinguish 菐 from 業 (stand with notched wooden supports on both ends) and note that the present-day meaning of 菐 (thicket) is borrowed from the graphically similar 丵. A needle (suggesting the blinding of slaves: compare 艮, 民, and 童) hangs over the slave's head, and a tail is appended to lay unqualified stress on the near-animal nature of a slave's lowly status. adds 人 person for emphasis/clarification | *servant* (person of low birth and rough manners) | humble reference to self | *I* (← casual masculine reference to self).

Examples: 重疊
Etymology: 畾 is a variant of an element adding another 夕 to the bottom left of 多 (tall, neat pile of meat). 疊 adds 宜 (originally, also piled meat). 疊 therefore expresses the tautological idea of pile up + pile | *pile/fold* an object to a number of layers | *fold up*; *tatami* | *put an end to* (← fold and put away after using).

Examples: 剎車

Meaning: fall down, drop, sink, go to ruin
Etymology: As per 隊# (collapse) + 土 earth | collapsing earth | *fall*. Devised to replace 隊 after the latter's transformation of meanings.

Examples: 遮蔽
Etymology: As per 庶# (pile) + 辵 movement | pile objects in screening/cutting off | *obstruct*; *block*; *cut off* | *interrupt*.
As per 累# (winding/spiral) + 虫 insect/creature | *spiral shell*(fish) | *conch shell*.

Meaning: fry in fat or oil; boil in water
Etymology: As per 前# (small increments) + 火 fire | *roast*, *parch* or *fry* food a little at a time | *boil (down)*; *decoct*.

Examples: 過癮 上癮
Etymology: 隱# conceal + 疒 illness | concealed illness in the form of a *craving*, (bad) *habit* or *addiction*.

Examples: 蠟燭
Etymology: As per 巤# as described in 獵 (capture and bind) + 虫 insect | bees bound/held captive in an  apiary | *beeswax* | *wax*.
As per 害# (cut) + 目 eye | *one-eyed*; *blind (in one eye)* (← have one's vision partially cut). Also, *lie/fabrication* (compare English "a blind lie").
壽# long span + 示 altar/the supernatural | prolonged *entreaty/prayer* | *pray*.
As per 欠# (cavity) + 土 earth | *hole*/*depression* in the earth (← cavity ← open-mouthed) | *cause to fall into a hole*; *cut a hole into*; *dig a hole*; *fall into a difficult situation*.

Examples: 奪魁
Etymology: As per 鬼# (large and lumpy) + 斗 ladle | large ladle. *Leader*, *founder* and *conspicuous* are either borrowed meanings (via 傀) or extended senses via "large" | *take the lead*. Logically, the classifier for 魁 should be 斗, but it is traditionally given as 鬼.

Examples: 嘴唇
Etymology: As per 辰# (twitch) + 口 mouth | twitching *lips*.

Examples: 手錶
呼籲
娛樂
颱風
Etymology: As per 台# (heavy downward pressure) + 風 wind | *typhoon* (originally, simply a strong wind, and not necessarily identical with the modern meteorologic definition of "typhoon").
尸# buttocks + 米 rice (| food) | *feces* (← waste matter of food processed by the body, issued from between the buttocks).
As per 占# (fixed in place) + 水 water | fix objects in a tub and *soak* them | *moisten*.

Examples: 安撫 撫養 撫育
Etymology: As per 無# (concealed) + 手 hand/action indicator | run the hand gently over a concealed object to determine its nature (compare 摸) | *stroke*; *pat*; *smooth down* | *comfort*; *calm* (v.).
A depiction of a slender *umbrella* with adhering raindrops | *parasol*.
喬# tall and limber + 女 woman | woman twisting her body alluringly (compare 妖) | *coquetry*; *seductiveness*.
As per 易# (stretch flat) + 金 metal | *tin* (← a metal easily stretched/pounded flat). *Give* and *offer* are borrowed meanings.

An abbreviated form# of 冗 (open space) + 禾 (round) grain/rice | plenteous open space on the forehead (as a result of hair loss) | *be/grow bald*. Also, a type of *short-cropped hairstyle worn by children* | *young servant girl at a brothel*.

Examples: 淪陷
Etymology: 侖# neat assemblage/alignment + 水 water | neat *ripples* (compare 漣) above a sinking object | *sink*.

Meaning: peel, peel off, to shell, strip
Examples: 剝削
Etymology: As per 彔# (pare/strip) + 刀 sword/knife | *pare*; *strip (off)*; *peel*; *come/peel off*; *shell* (a nut). 剝 was devised to replace 彔 after the latter came to be associated specifically with carving.

Examples: 揭幕 揭曉
Etymology: As per 曷# (cut off) + 手 hand/action indicator | cut off access/passage by putting up a barrier | *put up*; *hoist* | *run* (an article) | *declare*.

Examples: 溶化
Etymology: As per 容# (contain voluminous objects) + 水 water | *dissolve/melt* voluminous objects in liquid | *liquefy*; *thaw*; *mix*.
As per 若# (supple) + 匸 contain/conceal | supple mulberry leaves hidden in a container |  *hide*; *conceal*.

Examples: 花盆 盆地
Etymology: 分# portion + 皿 dish/plate/bowl | apportion food in a wide-mouthed basin/bowl (compare 盤). *Buddhist festival of the dead* is via a transliteration of the Sanskrit ullambana.
As per 勇# (run through) + 水 water | water that runs through an aperture in gushing from the earth (compare 涌) | *gush forth/out*; *spring up* (naturally); *breed*.

Meaning: neighborhood, urban subdivision; (J) priest's residence; (Buddhist) priest; boy
Examples: 街坊
Etymology: As per 方# (spread) + 土 earth | earth spread to create an embankment (compare 壩). Originally the same as 防, but 坊 eventually was applied to the idea of streets divided into squares | *town* | *residences* (of princes, priests, artisans etc.) | *priest* | *young boy* (← acolyte).
屵 is 山 mountain + 厂 cliff/shape indicator | mountain cliff/crag. 炭 is 屵# + 火 fire | fuel source dug from outcroppings | *coal* | *charcoal*; *carbon*.

卜 + 走. However, 卜 here likely functions as it does in 仆 and 訃, namely, as an abbreviated form# of 菐 as described in 僕 (servant). 赴 adds 走 run | servant rushing to *attend* to his master | *rush up toward*; *go/proceed to* (hurriedly); *approach*.
As per 專# (round and/or rotating object) + 石 stone | round(ed) *stone*. *Tile* is a borrowed meaning via 甎.
Originally a depiction of a *chestnut tree* with rows of *chestnuts* (the prickly burrs of which create a stinging pain when touched).

Examples: 狹小 狹窄
Etymology: As per 夾# (pressed between) + 犬 dog/beast | be pressed on by wild animals, with nowhere to turn | *narrow* (← narrow margin for escape) | *small*; *reduce*; *narrow-minded*.
As per 匊# (wrap about) + 艸 grass/plant | flower of a wrap-about appearance | *chrysanthemum*.
口 mouth + 戛# for the sound alone to simulate *cackling* or the *cry/song* of a bird.

Examples: 氧氣

Etymology: As per 盧# (cooking pot | shape indicator) + 馬 horse | *donkey*; *ass* (← creatures of a shape likened to a cooking pot; compare 鱸).

Examples: 公債
Etymology: As per 責# (debts): | *debt*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.

Examples: 摧殘 摧毀
Etymology: As per 崔# (squat) + 手 hand/action indicator | *crush*/*smash*/*break* in making squat (compare 挫). Also, *stretch* (to the point of causing destruction/harm).

Examples: 鹽巴
Etymology: As per 監# (container) + 鹵 salt/alkali | container of *salt* | *chloride*.

Examples: 挽救
Etymology: As per 免# (draw out of/away from) + 手 hand/action indicator | *draw* (out/away) | *pull* (back) | *saw*; *turn* (on a lathe); *grind*.

貇 combines 艮 (adhere) with 豸 animal that ambles along the ground | teeth of a sharp-toothed beast adhering to an object or to the piece of food being gnawed | gnaw. 墾 is as per 貇# (adhere) + 土 earth | agricultural tool adhering to the soil in *cultivation*.
As per 叚# (overlay) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | *reddish clouds* or *haze* that overlays the sky | *dim*; *blurred*.
戈 here a variant of 戉# battle-ax + 人 person (| human agency) | *cut down* an enemy with a weapon such as a battle-ax | *defeat* | (minor meaning of) *boast* (← boast of exploits).
As per 半# (split) + 田 field | *ridge*/path splitting fields | (water's) *edge*.

Examples: 逍遙
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 辵 movement | take small steps in strolling | *stroll*; *ramble*; *saunter*; *wander*.
As per �� # as described in 榮 (curve about) + 玉 jewel | *halo* given off by jewels | *clarity*. Also, a *stone as beautiful as a gem*.

Examples: 發脾氣 脾氣
Etymology: As per 卑# (spread low) + 肉 flesh | *spleen* (← internal organ associated with the flat/low earth).
白 white, here an abbreviated form# of 袙 (warrior's) headband + 巾 cloth | *kerchief*; *hood*.

Examples: 噪音
Etymology: As per 喿# as described in 操 (noisy chirping) + 口 mouth | *noisy* chirping of birds (or other chatter).

Examples: 收穫
Etymology: A variant form# of 矍 (enclose in the hands) + 禾 grain/rice | enclose grain in the hands in harvesting | *harvest*.

Examples: 束縛
Etymology: As per 尃# as described in 博 (spread) + 糸 thread | spread an object and bind it with thread/rope | *bind*; *tie*; *restrain*. Compare 繃.

Meaning: halo in sky; fog; dizzy, faint
Etymology: As per 軍# (circularity) + 日 sun/day | *halo*/*corona* encircling the sun | *dizzy* (← effect of staring at a corona) | *confused*; *grow unclear* | *fade* (← fading of clarity). Compare 暉 and 焜.

Examples: 裙子
Etymology: As per 君# (group) + 衣 clothing | *skirt* (with a harmonious arrangement of layers, pleats, decorations etc.).
As per 巠# as described in 徑 (extensive) + 頁 head | (long) *neck* extending between the head and torso | *throat*; *head*.

Examples: 竊賊
Etymology: Originally 穴# hole + an element combining 米 rice and a variant of 廾 pair of hands | insect that darts into a hole and consumes rice stealthily | *steal*. Over time, 米 was replaced by the similar 釆 scattered seeds, while the pair of hands element was dropped.

Examples: 混濁
Etymology: As per 蜀# (adhere) + 水 water | mud, in which objects adhere | *become muddy/cloudy/turbid* | *murky*; *unclear*; *fuzzy*; *impure*; *act evasively* | *voiced consonant/sound*.

Examples: 海峽 峽谷
Etymology: As per 夾# (pressed between) + 山 mountain | *ravine*/*gorge* pressed between cliffs. Compare 岬.

Examples: 倘若
Etymology: As per 尚# (disperse) + 人 person | person disappearing from sight | *obscure*. *Conditional indicator* is a borrowed meaning.
縕# tangled hemp + 艸 grass/plant | tangled pile of harvested vegetation | *pile up*; *store* (up). Compare 薀.

Meaning: bag, purse, sack; put in bag
Examples: 囊括
Etymology: As per 襄# (sack) + a variant of the element that came to be written 東 (sack bound on two ends and pierced by a shaft) | *sack*; *bag*; *pouch* | *container*. 囊 was devised to replace 襄 after 襄 lost its connection with "sack."
As per 弟# (vertical alignment) + 刀 sword/knife | *shave* up and down.

Examples: 敷衍 衍生
Etymology: As per 行# (straight, crossing roads) + 水 water | water crossing over/transgressing the banks of a straight waterway and spreading over surrounding land (compare 沺) | *overflow*; *spill (over)*; *spread*. Also, *thrive*, *grow thick* and *be rampant* (← spread), as well as *be left over* (← amount left over after spilling).

Examples: 車廂
Etymology: 相# mutual + 广 building | (rooms in a) *wing*, aligned with those opposite | *side room*. In Japan, the character also refers to an (overhang attached to) *eaves*. It also indicates a *passageway*, generally under the eaves (or extension of the eaves) of the main roof, that partially or completely encloses the main part of a building.

Examples: 心臟
Etymology: As per 藏# (pile) + 肉 flesh | the body's vital organs, conceived of as being piled one atop the other | *organ*.

Examples: 枕頭
Etymology: As per 冘# as described in 沈 (sink) + 木 tree/wood | wooden *headrest* or *pillow* onto which the head sinks.

Examples: 慌張
Etymology: 荒# wild + 心 heart/emotions | wild state of mind | *be confused/flustered*; *be agitated*; *panic* | *busy*; *hurried*; *rushed*; *bustling*.
相# mutual + 水 water | name of a river in present-day *Hunan Province*. Legend had it that the river was protected by a pair of goddesses.
As per 息# (breathe) + 火 fire | breathe/blow upon a fire to *extinguish* it | *cease*; *perish*.
玄 an abbreviated form# of 幼 young + 田 (here a shape indicator suggesting partitioned pens) | young *livestock* contained in partitioned pens | *domestication*.

Examples: 儲蓄
Etymology: As per 畜# (contained) + 艸 grass/plant | preserved plants/vegetables contained in being stored for winter provisions | *store (up)*; *save* | *grow/wear* (a beard/mustache) (← additional provision for winter).

Examples: 削減 剝削 削弱
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄒㄩㄝ ㄐㄧㄢˇ  ㄅㄛ ㄒㄩㄝ   ㄒㄩㄝ ㄖㄨㄛ`
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 刀 sword/knife | shave, scrape, plane or pare, creating small likenesses of the original object | *shave/plane/pare*; *reduce*; *remove*; *erase*; *cut*; *delete*.
鳥 bird + 朋# for the sound alone to suggest the Middle Chinese pronunciation of 鳳 (q.v.) | *large bird*.

Examples: 證券
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of �� # shows the palm of an open hand (symbolizing a handprint as a guarantee) + 廾 pair of hands (suggesting the parties involved in a transaction) | wooden slat on which handprints were made as a guarantee. As proof of a transaction, this slat was cut in two, each piece wrapped/rolled up with an encircling cord, and one piece given to each of the two parties involved. 券 adds 刀 sword/knife (for emphasis/clarification) | cut slats serving as proof of a transaction into two pieces | *draft*; *certificate*; *ticket*.
As per 眇# (obscure) + 水 water | obscure edges of a wide expanse of water | *dim*; *boundless*.

Examples: 臘月
Etymology: As per 巤# as described in 獵 (capture and bind) + 肉 flesh | *year-end rite* involving sacrifices of captive, bound animals (compare 腊) | *the end of the year*; *12th lunar month*.

Examples: 伺候
Etymology: As per 司# (peer through a hole): | *look in* on a person | *glance surreptitiously at*; *wait upon* (a person of high rank) | *visit*; *inquire after/about*; *consult*; *hear*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
雷 here a variant of 累# (winding/spiral) + 艸 grass/plant | spiral petals of a *bud*.

Meaning: near, close by, next to, towards, against; to wait; to lean on
Etymology: As per 矣# (come to a stop) + 手 hand/action indicator | cause to come to a stop in order/sequence | *push* (from behind) | *approach*. 挨 is rarely used except in the compound 挨拶 (greeting).

Examples: 豆漿
Etymology: As per 將# (long and slender) + 水 water | liquid poured in a long, slender trail (compare 醬) | (thick) *liquid substance* | *general term for drinks*.
As per 取# (take hold of) + 女 woman | *take as a bride*; *marry*.

Examples: 廚房 廚師
Etymology: As per 尌# as described in 樹 (set/stand in place) + 广 building | storage closet (for foodstuffs) | *kitchen*. Note a variant form 厨.
爭# (long and thin) + 目 eye | narrow the eyes in observing (compare 省) | *observe*; *watch*.

Meaning: kind of marsh grass; feudal state
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 辥 as described in 櫱 (cut grass/vegetation) + 艸 grass/plant | slice through bundles of vegetation | *mugwort* (compare 艾 and 薩).

Examples: 蓬勃
Etymology: 逢# meet + 艸 grass/plant | plant with triangular-shaped ears or spikes that meet at the top. *Mugwort* (よもぎ: compare 艾, 蒿, 薛) is a borrowed meaning.
羅# net + 金 metal | *gong* with a reticulated pattern.

The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# is 豕 pig/boar + 八 split right and left | pig/boar being butchered. 遂 adds 辵 movement | drag a heavy object such as a pig/boar along a winding course all the way to its destination (compare 水) | *carry through* | *accomplish*; *attain*; *achieve*; *wind up* (making/doing). In derivative characters, 遂 also appears in the form seen for example in 隧 and 燧.
As per 宣# (proclaim) + 口 mouth | proclaim noisily, as a *boisterous* crowd (compare 諠 and 讙) | *noisy*. It is possible that here 宣 is intended to function mimetically, conveying the sound of clamor.
As per 丁# (strike a nail) + 金 metal | metallic *spike*; *nail* | *hit/hammer* (a spike/nail).

Examples: 堵塞
Etymology: As per 者# (pile) + 土 earth | piled earth forming a *wall* | *prevent*; *stop* | *stop up*.

Meaning: rich, good as wine; pure, unmixed
Examples: 膽固醇
Etymology: As per the right-hand element/享# as described in 惇 (swarm within an enclosure) + 酉 alcohol | alcohol swarming with fermenting agents | *pure*; *unmixed* (← pure/unmixed alcohol; compare 淳) | *cordiality* (← sincere affection; compare 惇 and 敦).

Examples: 耕地
Etymology: A variant form of 开# as described in 刑 (frame) + 耒 plow | *till* or *cultivate* with a frameshaped plow.
As per 賓# (contact) + 水 water | *shore/beach* (where land and water contact). 浜 originally represented another term, being as per 兵 (spread over) + 水 water | creek.

Examples: 履歷 履行
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form is 夂# leg/foot pointed downward + an obsolete character that appears to have suggested "make plodding progress, by various means." Eventually, the focus shifted to shoes worn in plodding along | *wear shoes* | *wear*; *put on*. The present form is 尸 + 復 (double back) | *tread*.

Examples: 艱苦 艱難
Etymology: As per 艮# (adhere) + �� as described in 漢 (stretch over a fire) | *distress*; *trouble* (← suffering/hardships consequent to adhering directly to a fire) | *difficult*; *hard*. Compare 難.
As per 韋# (go around) + 糸 thread | *woof/weft* thread, circling about the warp thread | *latitude*.

奻# is 女 woman (doubled) | quarreling women. 姦 adds another 女 element to emphasize inappropriate behavior | *wicked*; *immoral*. *Adultery* is a borrowed meaning, likely influenced by 奸 (have illicit contact with a woman) | *obscene*; *debauched*. *Noisy* is via the original sense of "quarrel."

Examples: 誠摯
Etymology: 執# seize + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | *seize*. *Attentiveness* and *gift/present* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 烏鴉 鴉片
Etymology: 鳥 bird + 牙# to simulate the cawing of a *crow* | *black*; *coal-black* (← color association). Compare 烏.

Examples: 水蒸氣 蒸發 蒸氣
Vocabulary Zhuyin: ㄕㄨㄟˇㄓㄥ ㄑㄧ`  ㄓㄥ ㄈㄚ   ㄓㄥ ㄑㄧ`
Etymology: 烝# rise + 艸 grass/plant | *steam* rising from (cooked) vegetables | *sweaty*; *stuffy*.

Examples: 葡萄
Etymology: 艸 grass/plant + 匍# for the sound alone to transliterate the first syllable of a term thought to have originated in Persia and meaning grape (vine), transliterated into Chinese as 葡萄. *Portugal* is via the phonetic construction 葡萄牙.

靃 combines 隹 short, squat bird (doubled) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | (the sound of) birds hurriedly taking flight in a sudden rainstorm | *quick*; (disappear) *suddenly*. 靃 has been supplanted by 霍, which eliminates one of the 隹 elements.
As per 支# (skillfully manipulate) + 女 woman | *female entertainer* skilled in singing, dancing and the musical arts. Also, *prostitute* (← provider of sexual entertainment; compare 娼).

Examples: 棉被 棉花
Etymology: 帛 here an abbreviated form# of 綿 cotton + 木 tree/wood | *cotton* plant.

禾 grain/rice + an abbreviated form# of 爭 (tug on a long, thin object) | take crops firmly in hand in tugging on them to harvest | *take/hold firmly in the hand* | *unit of volume* (← weight of harvested crops). Also, *authority* (← take power in hand ← take in hand).

Meaning: scoop out of water; dredge, fish
Etymology: As per 勞# (stoop) + 手 hand/action indicator | stoop in dredging, or in dragging a seine | *dredge*; *drag*; *fish up*.
As per 申# (stretch) + 口 mouth | prolonged *groan*/*moan*.
As per 弗# (split) + 手 hand/action indicator | split/*sweep away* to both sides | *stroke*; *refuse* (compare 不 and 非). *Pay* is a borrowed meaning.

Originally 弍: 弋 stake + 二# two | *two* stakes aligned side by side. As with 壱, 参/參, and 拾, this character is used as a substitute for the usual number (in this case, 二) in documents as a precaution against forgery.

Examples: 蠟燭
Etymology: As per 蜀# (adhere) + 火 fire | *light* from a wick adhering to a candle. Compare 炷.
徴# summon + 心 heart/emotions | summon a subject for *reprimand*/chastisement| *chastise*; *punish*; *teach someone a lesson* | *learn a lesson*; *learn from (bitter) experience*.

Meaning: to entertain, feast; a feast, banquet
Examples: 宴會
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 晏 (settle) + 宀 roof/building | settle in /down to an indoors *feast* or *banquet*. Compare 讌.

Examples: 閃爍
Etymology: As per 樂# (grind/continue at length) + 火 fire | *shine*/*sparkle* continuously. *Melt* is a borrowed meaning, via 鑠.

Examples: 淘汰
Etymology: As per 太# (great) + 水 water | sift in a great amount of water and *sort*/*select* by quality. Compare 淘.

Examples: 癌症
Etymology: As per 嵒# (large, embedded rocks) + 疒 illness | rock-like, cancerous tumor | *cancer*.

Examples: 嘀咕
崩潰
Etymology: As per 朋# (spread in alignment) + 山 mountain | dirt spreading in alignment as a hill/mound collapses (compare 壞, 隨 and 圮) | *collapse*; *crumble*; *fall apart*; *break*; *destruction*; *demolition* | *decline*; *worsen*; *rout* (an enemy position).

Examples: 油膩
Etymology: As per 貳# as described in 弐 (aligned) + 肉 flesh | aligned slabs of *viscous grease/fat* | *fat*; *fatty*.

Examples: 撰寫
Etymology: As per 巽# (arrange in formation) + 手 hand/action indicator | collect and arrange (writings) | *compile* writings | *write*; *compose* (← write/compose for compilation). *Select* is a borrowed meaning via 選.

Examples: 樸素
Etymology: As per 菐# as described in 僕 (rough) + 木 tree/wood | rough, *unprocessed lumber* | *simple*; *natural*; *plain*.

Examples: 棺材
Etymology: As per 官# (wrap about/enclose) + 木 tree/wood | wooden *coffin* in which a corpse is enclosed.

Examples: 歌頌
Etymology: 公# public + 頁 head (| group of people) | declaim to a public crowd | *recite*; *acclaim*; *praise*.

Meaning: vigor; body; dark part of moon
Examples: 落魄 魄力
Etymology: 白# white + 鬼 ghost; demon | whitish, ghostly *spirit* | *soul*.
As per 完# (surround completely) + 攴 strike/hit | *bandits*/*thieves* surrounding their objects of attack | *enemies*; *invade*.

Examples: 葡萄
Etymology: 艸 grass/plant + 匋# for the sound alone to transliterate the second syllable of a term thought to have originated in Persia and meaning grape (vine), transliterated into Chinese as 葡萄.

Meaning: to adorn oneself, dress up, use make-up
Examples: 化妝品 化妝
Etymology: 爿 here an abbreviated form# of 裝 (sartorial neatness) + 女 woman | woman dressing/adorning herself | *dress/adorn oneself*; (wear) *make-up*.

Examples: 遼闊
Etymology: As per 尞# as described in 僚 (circular continuum) + 辵 movement | move to a *distant* point along a circular course.

Examples: 馬鈴薯
Etymology: A variant form of 藷 (*potato*/*yam*/*tuber*), replacing 諸 with 署#.

Meaning: sun, air in sun, expose or dry in the sun
Examples: 曝光
Etymology: 暴# expose + 日 sun/day | *expose* objects in the sun to dry. 曝 was devised to replace 暴 after  暴 came to be most often associated with the meanings "violent" and "rough."
咨# inquire + 言 words (for emphasis/clarification) | *consult*; *confer*.
羅# net + 艸 grass/plant | *vine*; *creeper* (← plant that creates a net-like cover).

Examples: 頒發 頒獎
Etymology: 分# portion + 頁 people | apportion (goods/information) to a crowd | *divide*; *distribute*.

Examples: 細菌 病菌
Etymology: As per 囷# (round) + 艸 grass/plant | *fungus* (round growth that appears on vegetation) | *germ*.

Examples: 嚮導 嚮往
Etymology: 鄕 here a variant form of 卿# (be positioned at opposite sides) + 向 advance upon | *head off/out*  or *guide* another to a distant destination. *Be (in the) past* is a borrowed meaning via 曏.

Examples: 流氓
Etymology: As per 亡# (obscure) + 民 people | obscure (= marginalized) *people* | *immigrants*; *subjects*.

Meaning: stalk of shrub, trunk of tree
Etymology: 木# tree/wood + 攵 (stick held in the hand) | *stick*; *whip* | *one by one* (← count one by one with a stick) | *counter* (← inaugurate a count).

Examples: 報酬 應酬
Etymology: As per 州# (flow) + 酉 alcohol container | alcohol flowing freely in *reward* | *remuneration*.
口 mouth + 朝# for the sound alone to simulate a sneering noise | *sneer* | *ridicule*. Compare 嗤.

Examples: 橘子
Etymology: As per 矞# (circular) + 木 tree/wood | tree bearing round *citrus fruit*. たちばな (Citrus tachibana) is not the mandarin orange, but an inedible variety of citrus fruit native to Japan.

Examples: 欺侮 侮辱
Etymology: As per 毎# (dark) + 人 person | darken another person's reputation | *be contemptuous of*; *scorn*; *despise*; *make light of*.

Examples: 海灘 沙灘
Etymology: As per 難# (stretch over) + 水 water | shoal; sandbar; bank (← thin slice of land stretching over water). In Japanese, *open sea*, which is via reinterpretation of the character (compare 沖, also reinterpreted in Japan to mean "open sea").
As per 婁# (continuum) + 尸 body (| person) | appearance of one person after another | *often*; *frequently*.
The relevant seal inscription form shows chicks in a *nest* high in a tree (compare 喿 as described in 操) | *build a nest*; *lair*; *den*; (spider's) *web* | *hotbed*.

Examples: 精髓
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 隨 follow + 骨 bone | *marrow* (← element that follows the contours of bones) | *essense* (← essential element) | *pith*; *core*; *point of a matter*.
As per 卑# (spread low) + 石 stone | low-lying stone (marker) | *monument*; *memorial stone*; *tombstone*. Compare 礴.

Examples: 梨子
Etymology: 利# sharp + 木 tree/wood | tree that produces sharp-flavored fruit | *pear*. Compare 棠.

Examples: 礦產 礦工
膨脹 通貨膨脹
Etymology: 長# long + 肉 flesh | swollen/bloated flesh | *swelling*. Compare 膨.
遣# send; dispatch + 言 words | *reprimand* delivered by an envoy | *reproach*.
As per 柬# (separate) + 火 fire | *refine* (metal), separating out impure elements (compare 錬). Also, *knead into shape*.
豸 animal that ambles along the ground + 勺# (rise and become evident) | *leopard*/*panther* leaping in attack. For the idea of a leaping animal, compare 麃.

Examples: 擅長
Etymology: As per 亶# (long and flat) + 手 hand/action indicator | flatten | *monopolize*; *act arbitrarily*; *selfish* (← flatten the will/interests of others) | *self-indulgent*.

Examples: 肌肉 肌膚
Etymology: As per 几# (tall | tall and lean) + 肉 flesh | *skin* of a lean/starving person (compare 飢).
樊# fence + 手 hand/action indicator | *climb/clamber up* a fence | *hang on to*.

Examples: 開闢
Etymology: As per 辟# (spread) + 門 gate | *spread* (open) a gate | *open*; *open out/up*.

Meaning: small cup or container; classifier for lamps, etc.
Etymology: As per 戔# (fine/slight) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl | small *cup* (for drinking alcohol) that holds only a slight volume of liquid.

啚# combines a variant form of 嗇 granary + a square suggesting a particular place | (tall) granary in a specific place. 鄙 adds 邑 village/settlement | *rural district* in which granaries are sited | *the country* | *countrified*; *rustic* | *mean*; *base*.
As per 甫# (spread) + 水 water | *shore* of a *bay*, *beach* or *inlet* (← spreading waterside).

Examples: 尷尬

Etymology: As per 朱# (stump) + 木 tree/wood | *stump* | *stock*; *share(s)*. 株 was devised to replace 朱 after the latter acquired its extended meanings.

Meaning: serve, attend upon; attendant, servant; samurai
Etymology: As per 寺# (stand straight by): | *servant*; *retainer*; *warrior*; *samurai*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.

Examples: 逗留
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 豎 (stand) (n.) + 辵 movement | shuffle in place (compare 躕) | *stay*; *remain*; *stop*.

Examples: 喉嚨
Etymology: As per 侯# (lumpy object) + 口 mouth | lump of food in the *throat*.

Meaning: to cultivate, plant; to care for plants
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of �� # combines 才 cut off + 戈 spear/halberd | cut; sever. 栽 adds 木 tree/wood | trim a tree in cultivating it | *cultivation*; *planting*.

Examples: 免疫 瘟疫
Etymology: 殳 an abbreviated form# of 役 (series) + 疒 illness | *epidemic* (← illness that strikes serially).

Examples: 飼養
Etymology: 司# administer + 食 food/eating | administer (= distribute) feed in raising animals | *keep* (a pet); *raise* (animals).

Examples: 鉛筆
Etymology: Abbreviated form# of 沿 (follow/run along a prescribed course) + 金 metal | molten *lead* running along a prescribed course in being refined (compare 鑄).
As per 辟# (spread severed body parts) + 刀 sword/knife | *slash*/*cleave* | *rip*; *tear*; *break* | *ear-splitting sound*.
As per 叟# (narrow/thin) + 舟 boat | long, thin *boat* | *counter for boats*.

Examples: 仕女
Etymology: As per 士# (erect) + 人 person | servant standing erect in waiting upon a person of high rank (compare 寺 and 侍) | *official*; *serve*; *work*; *do*.

Examples: 島嶼
Etymology: As per 與# (raise in unison) + 山 mountain | *island* (← mountain-like protrusion rising from a body of water).

Examples: 郊區 郊外
Etymology: As per 交# (twist/cross) + 邑 village/settlement | *suburb* (← residential area sited close to a town, allowing for easy crossing back and forth in commuting).
果# fruit + 衣 clothing | a woman's *bare*, rounded breasts, likened to fruit | *naked*; *nude*; *open*.

Examples: 海嘯
Etymology: As per 肅# (concentrate) + 口 mouth | *howl/roar* (← concentrated noise produced by the mouth). Also, *brag* and *lie brazenly* (the meanings of the Japanese verb うそぶく), in the sense of talking big (← loud voice).

Examples: 公寓 寓言
Etymology: As per 禺# (curve) + 宀 roof/building | curved, hut-like *temporary abode* | *stay/use temporarily*. Also, *do under the pretext of* (← temporary expedient).

貍 is 里 here an abbreviated form# of 埋 bury + 豸 animal that ambles along the ground | fox-like animal that shelters in burrows or dens. In Japan however 貍 has been applied to the *raccoon dog* | *sly* (← supposed attribute of a raccoon dog). 狸 replaces 豸 with 犬 dog/beast.
As per 丙# (spread) + 木 tree/wood | spreading (= long) wooden *handle* | *shaft*; *grip*. *Design*, *pattern*, *figure*, (person's) *build* and *character* are borrowed meanings.
As per 那# (supple) + 手 hand/action indicator | *rub* to make supple | *shift*.
As per the right-hand element# of 肺 (split right and left) + 水 water | *abundant* water splitting off right and left | extensive *swamp/marsh*.

Examples: 詞彙
Etymology: As per 果# (round) + 彑 variant form of 彐 head of an animal | *hedgehog/porcupine* (animal that curls into a ball for protection; compare 蝟). Also, *gather*, *assemble* and *(same) kind* (← great number and similarity of porcupine needles).

豆# a stand + 臤 (adhere) | a *vertical/upright* stand adhering to the floor. *Child* slave/servant is a borrowed meaning, likely influenced by the meaning of the 臣 element in 臤 when functioning as an independent character. 竪 is a variant form of 豎.

Meaning: companion, colleague; officials; bureaucracy; a pretty face
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of 尞# shows a bonfire with a ring of flames, forming a circular continuum. 僚 adds 人 person | (figurative) circle of individuals belonging to a particular group | *colleague*; *fellow*; *official*.

Examples: 狹窄
Etymology: As per 乍# (pile) + 穴 hole | create a *narrow* opening in a pile | *make narrow*.
As per 丈# (a stick) + 木 tree/wood (for emphasis/clarification) | *walking stick*; *staff*; *cane*.
An abbreviated form# of 冑 (armor, including a helmet) + 儿 person | helmeted figure | *helmet*; *headgear*.

Examples: 走廊
Etymology: As per 郎# (flow) + 广 building | flowing (= extensive) passageway of a building | *hallway*; *corridor*; *gallery*.
As per 湯# (vapor rising from boiling water) + 火 fire | boiling water that scalds | *scald*; *heat up*; *iron* (v.).

Examples: 惶恐 驚惶
Etymology: As per 皇# (extend) + 心 heart/emotions | fraught, extended emotions, in the form of anxiety | *be anxious* (compare 遑) | *fear*. Compare also 恇.

Meaning: raise voice, yell out loud, shout; stammer
Etymology: A variant form of 咄 scold. *Stammer* and *stutter* are borrowed meanings, via 訥. 内 replaces 出 to indicate a shift in the initial consonant from T- to N-; compare 訥, 蚋, 汭, 芮 and 枘.
火 fire + 耳 ear, with the meaning *bright*. 耳 is a replacement element, with the identity of the original element being uncertain.
As per 卓# (rise above) + 糸 thread | raise thread high in weaving | *spacious* | have  *margin/leeway*.
As per 乞# (rise and hit a blocking element) + 辵 movement | *reach*/*extend to* a point where further elevation or progress is blocked | *at last*; *finally*; *after all*; *until*.
As per 冊# (bamboo slats) + 木 tree/wood | enclosing *fence* made of wooden/bamboo slats |  *palisade*; *weir* | *obstacles*; *bondage*.
As per 奐# (draw out of/away from) + 火 fire | *bright*/*brilliant* flame(s) drawn away from a fire's fuel source | *shining*.

Examples: 嫉妒

Etymology: 鳥 bird + 區# for the sound alone to simulate the calling of a *seagull*.

Meaning: go upstream, go against current; formerly
Etymology: As per 朔# (conjunction of beginning and end points) + 水 water | *go upstream*/*go against the current* and return to one's starting point. Compare 泝. Also, *retrace the past*; *return to a source/origin*.

Examples: 蒼蠅
崩潰
Etymology: As per 貴# (compress) + 水 water | structure compressed in collapsing due to overflowing water (compare 濊) | *collapse*; *rout/be routed*; *crush* | *sore* (← inflammation bursting through the wall of an internal organ ← water bursting through a structure).

Examples: 攪和
Etymology: As per 覺# (be stimulated) + 手 hand/action indicator | stimulate by mixing | *mix*; *turbidity* | *confusion*; *disturbance*. Compare 淆.
口 mouth + 孔# for the sound alone to simulate roaring/bellowing | *roar*; *bellow*; *shout*; *howl*; *bark*.

Examples: 竭力
Etymology: As per 曷# (cut off) + 立 stand | stand exhausted, one's breath cut off (compare 歇) | *exhaust*; *end*.
垂# hang + 口 mouth | trail of drool/*spittle* hanging from the lower lip | *saliva*; *sputum*.
As per 妻# (aligned) + 木 tree/wood | birds aligned in roosting in a tree (compare 栖) | *roost*; *dwelling*; *dwell*; *live* (v.).

Examples: 倡導 提倡
Etymology: As per 昌# (chant; recite) + 人 person | *musician* or *actor* entertaining by reciting or singing (compare 娼) | *recite*, *sing*; *proclaim*.

Meaning: take out; pull out; clean out
Etymology: As per 匋# (knead) + 手 hand | knead then take/*scoop* (out) | *take/pull out*; *remove* (from a holder/container).
奄# cover/conceal + 人 person | cover/conceal oneself. *I* and *me* are borrowed meanings.
As per the right-hand element# of 侵 (penetrate) + 水 water | water that penetrates thoroughly | *immersion*; *soak*; *flood*; *steep*; *moisten*; *wet*.

Examples: 酌量
Etymology: 勺# ladle + 酉 alcohol container | ladle (*pour out/serve*) alcohol | *drink*; *take into consideration* (← show consideration toward someone/something, as in pouring a guest a drink).
A variant form of 巾# cloth + an element combining 糸 thread and 虫 insect | *silkworm cocoon*, from which silk is produced. Compare 絹.
As per 夫# (stretch out/over) + 艸 grass/plant | *water lily* stretching over the surface of a pond | *lotus*. Compare 蓮.

Examples: 倒楣
Etymology: As per 眉# (long, curved eyebrow) + 木 tree/wood | *crossbeam* curving over/under a gate in the shape of an eyebrow.

Meaning: mortgage, pledge; deposit; to pawn; to arrest, detain, guard
Examples: 押金 抵押
Etymology: As per 甲# (press down on) + 手 hand/action indicator | *press*/*push* down on | *thrust*; *shove*; *hold down*; *stop*; *stamp* (papers/a passport etc.); (a) *weight*; *pressure* | *seize*; *catch*; *arrest* | *control* (← restrain and control). 押 was devised to replace 甲 after the latter came to refer to a husk or shell.

Examples: 苛責
Etymology: As per 可# (shout/laugh/sing in a loud voice) + 艸 grass/plant | plant that irritates the throat as does shouting | *torment*; *harsh* | *scold*.

Examples: 鴿子
Etymology: 鳥 bird + 合# for the sound alone to simulate cooing | *dove*; *pigeon*.
A depiction of an object with a protrusion rising from its center | *protrude*; *convex*. For "protrusion," compare 出 and 突.
斤 ax + 匚# enclosure | create a finely crafted enclosure | *craftsman*; *master*.
As per 卓# (rise above) + 心 heart/emotions | feelings of grief/lamentation that rise above (= overcome) the heart | *grieve*; *lament*; *mourn*.
朱# + 虫 insect | *spider*. The conceptual influence lent here by 朱 is uncertain.

Examples: 繩子
Etymology: 糸 thread + 黽 frog/amphibious creature. It is likely that 黽 has replaced an obsolete element. The adoption of 黽 may have been intended to indicate a rope-like pattern on the back of a particular type of frog | *rope*.

京 here an abbreviated form# of 涼 (flow) + 手 hand/action indicator | fluid motion | *graze* against; * brush by/past/over*; *snatch* | *steal* | *plunder*. Also, *blurry* as well as *husky* (voice) (← indistinct sensations ← graze).
As per 㒼# as described in 滿 (cover completely) + 目 eye | figuratively cover another person's eyes (compare 冒 and 曼) in deceiving him | *deceive*; *cheat*. Compare 謾.

Examples: 墳墓
Etymology: As per 賁# (swell) + 土 earth | swelling/bulging earth of a *burial mound* or *tumulus*. Compare 墦.

Examples: 啤酒

Etymology: 舀# dip + 水 water | dip into liquid, causing an *overflow*.
As per �� # as described in 續 (pass along commodities) + 貝 commodities (for emphasis/clarification) | *pay for* | *redemption*; *expiation*; *atonement*.
As per 單# (fanning motion) + 虫 insect | fanning/beating motion of *cicada* wings. Compare 螗. Note a variant form 蝉.

Examples: 香蕉
Etymology: 焦# scorch + 艸 grass/plant | vegetation of a dark hue, as if scorched. The compound 芭蕉 refers to a *banana/plantain* plant.

Examples: 貶值
Etymology: Abbreviated form of 泛 cover + 貝 commodities | hold down the price of commodities | *devalue*; *depreciate* | *look down on*.

Examples: 包裹
Etymology: As per 果# (round) + 衣 clothing | *wrap* (in cloth/clothing) | (wrapped) *package*.
As per 蒙# (cover/conceal) + 月 moon | *dimly visible moon*, hidden by cloud cover | *dim*; *hazy*; *obscure*.
As per 牙# (mesh; cross) + 艸 grass/plant | buds that mesh | *bud* | *sprout*; *shoot* | *sign*; *beginnings*; *omen* (← buds, sprouts or shoots as harbingers of something new).

Examples: 顫抖
Etymology: 亶 here an abbreviated form# of 邅 (faltering movement) + 頁 head | faltering motion represented by *nodding* of the head | *tremble*; *shake*. Compare 震.

Examples: 乾燥
Etymology: As per 喿# as described in 操 (activity taking place above) + 火 fire | rising heat, that causes objects to *dry (up)* (compare 焦).

Examples: 沙啞
Etymology: As per 亞# (downward pressure) + 口 mouth | blockage of the throat (compare 唉) | *mute*.

Examples: 懶惰
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 隋 (collapsing pile) + 心 heart/emotions | *laziness* (likened to partial emotional collapse). Compare 怠.

Examples: 糧食
Etymology: As per 量# (measure grain) + 米 rice | measured rice | *food*; *provisions*; *nourishment*.

Examples: 貸款 借貸
Etymology: 代# alternate + 貝 commodities | alternate ownership in lending/loaning | *lend*; *loan*; *rent* | *bill*.
As per 溥# (spread) + 竹 bamboo | strips of bamboo spread in record-keeping | *account book*; *register*.
耑 here an abbreviated form# of 遄 quick + 口 mouth | *gasp*, *pant* or *breathe hard* (← quick intakes of breath).
As per 星# (invigorating) + 肉 flesh | the pungent, invigorating *smell of raw meat* | *rank  odor* | *fishy*.

Examples: 敷衍
Etymology: 旉# combines 甫 (spread) + 方 (spread) | spread at length over a flat surface. 敷 adds 攵 action  indicator | *spread/lay* at length over a flat surface | *cover*; *pave*. Also, *set up* and *effectuate* (← cover existing gaps).
旱# dry up (| be/become rough) + 心 heart/emotions | *rough*; *brutish* | *courageous*. Also, *strong*.
As per 畺# (tight; taut) + 人 person | *die and go stiff*; *rigor mortis*. For stiffening of the body compare 敬, and see also 殭 (effectively a variant form of 僵).

Examples: 尷尬
締結 締造 取締
Etymology: As per 帝# (unify) + 糸 thread | *bind* objects with thread | *tie*; *tighten*; *close*; *shut*; *fasten*; *turn off* | *firm*; *solid*; *control strictly*; *straighten (oneself) out* | *economize*; *be thrifty*.
As per 札# (pin/nail in place) + 糸 thread | *fasten* in place by binding/tying with thread or rope | *bind*; *tie* (up).

Examples: 斧頭
Etymology: As per 父# (hand spread over an ax handle) + 斤 ax | *ax*; *hatchet* | *chop*. 斧 was devised to replace 父 after 父 came to mean "father."
As per 禁# (contain) + 衣 clothing | outer layer of clothing containing one beneath it | *collar*. Compare 衿.

As per 害# (cut) + 車 vehicle | linchpin (compare 舝 as described in 桀) cutting rotation of a wheel, allowing *control* of the vehicle's speed | *supervision*. For the connection between cutting and control, compare 乂.

Examples: 遲鈍
Etymology: As per 屯# (swollen) + 金 metal | metal with *dull* edges that swell outwards (as opposed to  being neatly sharpened) | *dim*; *dimwitted*; *slow* (of action) | *weak(en)*.
As per 重# (run through) + 肉 flesh | *swelling*; *swell*; *tumor* (← swellings, tumors etc. running all through the body).
尊# settle + 足 leg/foot | settle into a *squat/crouch* (compare 踆).

Meaning: be fond of, have weakness for
Examples: 嗜好
Etymology: As per 耆# (preserved food) + 口 mouth | *have a weakness/strong urging for* (preserved food or any other kind of product) | *like*; *prefer*. 嗜 was devised to replace 耆 after the latter's transformation of meanings.
兪# remove + 辵 movement | pass/cross over (← remove oneself to a different location) | *exceed* | *even more/further*. Compare 踰.

Examples: 瀑布
Etymology: 暴# expose + 水 water | *sudden downpour* that exposes objects. *Waterfall* is an associated meaning.
干# thick bar + a variant form of 网 net | *long-handled bird-catching net* (compare 禽). *Rare* is a borrowed meaning.
愈# heal + 疒 illness (for emphasis/clarification) | *healing*; *cure*.

Examples: 忙碌
Etymology: As per 彔# (scatter right and left) + 石 stone | *the sound of stones tumbling over each other* as they scatter. Japanese has many borrowed meanings attached to the terms ろくな and ろくに; in modern orthography 碌 is not used in these cases.

Meaning: rice growing in field, rice plant
Examples: 水稻
Etymology: 舀# ladle + 禾 grain/rice | *rice plant* likened in shape to a ladle.
覃# extensive + 言 words | *talk* extensively.
As per 感# (shut off sensation) + 手 hand/action indicator | *shake* a person/creature insensate | *move*.

Examples: 凋零
Etymology: As per 周# (grain plants) + 氷 ice | icy conditions causing (grain) plants to *droop*, *wither* and die | *fade*.
口 mouth + 肖# for the sound alone to simulate a whistling noise | *whistle* (compare 嗾) | *signal by whistling* | *watchman*.

Examples: 發掘
Etymology: 屈# bend + 手 hand/action indicator | bend to *dig*. Compare 堀.

The relevant seal inscription form of 歰 shows that the doubled element on top was originally inverted feet, so that the character featured two feet pointing downward + two feet pointing upward | tangling of legs | be stopped. 澀 adds 水 water | liquid that does not flow, but seeps (compare 漸) | *proceed haltingly* | *astringency* (← tongue rendered numb by the deep penetration of astringent juices; compare 浸) | *sober*. Also, *be unwilling/reluctant*, *austere*, *quiet* and *stingy*. 歮 is a variant form of 歰, and 澁 a variant form of 澀. In contemporary Japanese orthography, 澀/澁 is written 渋.

Meaning: smear with blood in sacrifice; rift, quarrel

Examples: 慚愧

Meaning: tunnel, underground passageway, path to a tomb
Examples: 隧道
Etymology: As per 遂# (follow a winding course) + 阜 piled earth | a winding *underground passage* leading to the bottom of a burial mound or of a signal tower (compare 燧) | *tunnel*.

Examples: 膨脹 通貨膨脹
Etymology: As per 彭# (surge/swell) + 肉 flesh | swelling flesh | *swell*; *bulge*; *bloat*; *fill*. Compare 脹.

Meaning: cheat, defraud, swindle; trick; to feign
Etymology: As per 乍# (create a pile) + 言 words | pile up lies | *lie*; *deceive*.

Examples: 醞釀
Etymology: As per 襄# (supple/soft) + 酉 alcohol container | soften ingredients in brewing an alcoholic beverage | *brew* | *cause*; *give rise to*.

Examples: 脂肪
Etymology: As per 旨# (sweet/rich food) + 肉 flesh | rich *fat* | *grease*; *resin*.

Examples: 凳子

Meaning: lever, pole, crowbar; sharpen; (Cant.) a wardrobe, trunk
Etymology: As per 貢# (connect) + 木 tree/wood | piece of wood that connects | *lever*. Compare 梃.
As per 式# (straight) + 手 hand/action indicator | *wipe* with a straight motion.
The right-hand element# is 土 earth + 日 (sunlight that softens objects it strikes) | hard earth softening in the sun. 捏 adds 手 hand/action indicator | *knead clay into an object* | *fabricate*.

叧# combines an abbreviated form of 冎 (joint of a bone) + 刀 sword/knife | sever/separate a limb from its joint. 拐 adds 手 hand/action indicator to reinforce the idea of physical separation, eventually acquiring the specific sense of separating a person from his/her kin | *kidnap*. Also,*deceive* (← use deception in kidnapping).
As per 昔# (pile) + 酉 alcohol container | foodstuffs piled for preservation in *vinegar*. Compare 酢.
As per 尉# (bending figure) + 艸 grass/plant | *dense*, bending vegetation | *growth*.
As per �� # as described in 榮 (curve about) + 鳥 bird | bird with a neck-band | *bush warbler*.
As per 令# (long sequence) + 人 person | lengthy and *clever* performance given by a musician and/or *actor* | *smart*.

Meaning: dry in sun, expose to sun
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 驪 (neatly aligned) + 日 sun/day | align objects neatly and *expose to the sun* | *dry in the sun*. Compare 晒.

Examples: 鬍子

Etymology: As per 桼# as described in 漆 (cut at intervals) + 肉 flesh | the *knee*, a joint that cuts the leg into two sections (compare 節) | *lap* (formed when sitting with the knees together).

Examples: 空曠
Etymology: As per 廣# (extend) + 日 sun/day | extensive sunlight (compare 晃 and 旺) | *spacious* | *emptiness* (← empty space).

Examples: 抉擇
Etymology: As per 夬# (scoop out) + 手 hand/action indicator | *scoop/gouge/hollow out*; *bore*. Also,  *archery glove* (compare 玦).
益/益# fill/full + 水 water | fill to the point of overflowing | *brim* | *spill*; *overflow* | *inundate*. Compare 灎.

Examples: 解剖
Etymology: As per 咅# (spread) + 刀 sword/knife | object that spreads in being split/divided in two | *split* (in two); *divide*.

As per 㐬# as described in 流 (flow) + 玉 jewel | *jewel* with a slippery surface over which the fingers flow. The compound 琉璃 is an abbreviation of 吠吠瑠璃, a transliteration of the Sanskrit vaidurya (lapis lazuli).

Examples: 蝸牛
Etymology: 咼# (variant of 冎 round or rounded cavity) + 虫 insect | *snail* (← creature contained in a rounded shell).

Examples: 逮捕
Etymology: 隶# (seize) + 辵 movement | *chase* and seize/*capture* | *reach*.
As per 亦# (slender line) + 大 stand outstretched | slender line of people| *stretch on*. 奕 was devised to replace 亦.

Meaning: by side of, beside, near, close
Examples: 傍晚
Etymology: As per 旁# (both sides of the body) + 人 person | both sides of a person | *side* | *besides*.
As per 句# (bend) + 金 metal | bent, metallic *hook/barb*.

Examples: 輕蔑
Etymology: The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a person plus an element# combining an eye afflicted with inward-growing eyelashes (trichiases) and 戊 (cover) | person with obscured vision, the eyes being covered with inward-growing eyelashes | *scorn*; *disdain*; *contempt* (← refusal to recognize ← inability to see). Also, *slight* (adj.) (← so few/little as to be barely recognizable).

Examples: 襪子
Etymology: As per 蔑# (obscure) + 衣 clothing | *socks* (obscure on account of being hidden in shoes; compare 韈).
As per 叚# (overlay) + 日 sun/day | figurative overlaying of days/time, creating a surplus | *leisure* (time).

Meaning: urge on; rise up; stir, excite; to raise up; lofty
Etymology: 從 here an abbreviated form# of 縱 vertical + 耳 ear | prick up one's ears | *rise*; *tower* (over). *Strut* is a borrowed meaning.
As per 巴# (spread) + 疒 illness | *scar* spread over the skin. Compare 瘢.
As per 知# (direct) + 虫 insect | *spider* (← swift creature that moves in straight lines).
兆 here an abbreviated form# of 桃 peach + 女 woman | woman likened in elegance/beauty to that of peach blossoms | *beautiful*; *handsome*.

Examples: 恍惚
Etymology: As per 光# (light extending from a torch) + 心 heart/emotions | *absent-minded*; *enraptured* (as though dazzled by light). Also, *dim/hazy*.
As per 是# (straight) + 土 earth | straight earthen *embankment* | *bank*; *levee*; *dike*.
屈# bend + 穴 hole | bend to enter a *cavern* or *cave*.
As per 肅# (concentrate) + 糸 thread | *embroider(y)* (← intricately concentrated pattern on fabric).
As per 規# (observe) + 穴 hole | observe through a hole | *peep through/into*; *spy (on)*; *watch for*.

Examples: 泡沫
Etymology: As per 末# (minute) + 水 water | minute *foam*, *froth* or *suds* | *spray*; *splash*.
As per 癸# (rotate) + 艸 grass/plant | sunflower (that rotates to face the sun). In Japanese, 葵 indicates *hollyhock*, a variety of *mallow*.

Examples: 奴隸
轎車
Etymology: 喬# tall and limber + 車 vehicle | tall, lightweight *palanquin* or *sedan-chair* (carried high on the shoulders of attendants).
As per 區# (curve/bend) + 口 mouth | bend and *vomit* | *feel nauseated*. Compare the original sense of 歐.

Examples: 遮蔽
Etymology: As per 敝# (split) + 艸 grass/plant | split vegetation (compare 茇) in which prey is covered/hidden (to reveal it) | *cover*; *hide*.

Meaning: an intelligence report; to spy; spying
Etymology: As per 枼# as described in 葉 (thin/flat/slight) + 言 words | chatter of slight substance (compare 喋) | *spying* (← chat a person up to gain information).

Examples: 襯衫
Etymology: As per 親# (intimate) + 衣 clothing | intimate garments | *underwear* | *approach*; *draw near*.

Examples: 清晰
Etymology: 析# divide + 日 sun/day | divide by making *clear* distinctions | *obvious*. It is also possible that 晰 was devised as a variant form of 皙 white, with clarity likened to bright sunlight.

Examples: 牙膏 石膏
Etymology: 高 here an abbreviated form# of 皜 pure white + 肉 flesh | white fat | *tasty food*; *fat* | *grease* | *ointment*; *paste* (n.) (← greasy substance).
As per 盧# (sunken) + 艸 grass/plant | *reed* sunken into a marsh | *rush*.
As per 僉# (assemble) + 攵 action indicator | assemble/*collect*/*gather* then *arrange/put away* | *take in*; *incorporate*. *Tighten* and *stiffen* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 皺紋
Etymology: As per 芻# (compress) + 皮 skin/hide | *wrinkle* (← compressed skin) | *crease*.
As per 夋# as described in 俊 (stand erect) + 山 mountain | *steep, high mountain* | *severe*.

Examples: 鼻涕
Etymology: As per 弟# (vertical alignment) + 水 water | (trail of) *tears*.

Examples: 鈔票
Etymology: As per 少# (small/slight) + 金 (money) | *paper money*; *bank notes*. *Snatch* and *seize* are borrowed meanings.

Examples: 沮喪
Etymology: As per 且# (pile) + 水 water | impediment that creates a buildup of water | *impede*; *disturb* | *be dejected/discouraged* (← encounter impediments to obtaining one's desires).
As per 鄭# (extend downward) + 手 hand/action indicator | *throw*/*cast* an object straight down | *throw away*. Also, *hit/punch* (← throw a punch).

Meaning: a piece of cloth used wrap bundles
Examples: 包袱
Etymology: As per 伏# (curl about) + 衣 clothing | *wrapping cloth*.

Examples: 腐蝕 侵蝕
Etymology: 食# food/eating + 虫 insect | insect nibbling food or (other) flesh | *eat into*; *encroach*; *erode*; *undermine* | (lunar, solar etc.) *eclipse*.

Examples: 乞丐
舅舅 舅媽
Etymology: As per 臼# (stooped) + 男 man | stooped (= older/elderly) human male (compare 久) | *brother(s) of one's mother*; *father of one's husband*.
As per 咸# (shut) + 鹵 salt/alkali | salt contained in a shut mouth (compare 鹽) | *salty* taste that causes the lips to pucker.

Meaning: honest, simple, unsophisticated; cyanogen; ethane dinitrile
Etymology: As per the right-hand element/享# as described in 惇 (swarm within an enclosure) + 水 water |  swarming waters (compare 準 and 澱) | *sincere* (← emotional depth; compare 惇). Also, *pure* (← pure, swarming waters) | *simplicity* (← pure/unmixed; compare 醇).
林# forest + 火 fire | forest fire | *burn* | *boil*; *cook*.

Examples: 灌溉

Meaning: collect, gather, assemble; seek; spring hunt; assemble for war
Etymology: As per 鬼 (large and lumpy) + 艸# grass/plant | *madder* (← plant the flower petals of which *collect* in thickly bunched racemes; compare 茜) | *gather* (← collect in a bunch). Also, *search for* and *hunt* (← search for nuts, berries etc. to collect ← collect) as well as *hide* and *cover* (← cover what one has gathered).
As per 翟# (rise high) + 戈 spear/halberd | raise a bladed weapon and *stab*, *thrust* or *poke*. Also, *stamp* and *seal*.
As per 芻# (compress) + 隹 short, squat bird | *chick* (← bird of compressed size) | *infant*. Also, a *prefix* indicating a small and/or cute object.
As per 共# (act jointly) + 口 mouth | the roar of a crowd (raising/carrying a voluminous object) | *resound*; *reverberate*.

As per 夌# as described in 陵 (stretch) + 艸 grass/plant | *water caltrop* (the fruit of which has long, well-defined lines). (Water caltrop also goes by the name of water chestnut, but it is the corms of a different plant, Eleocharis dulcis, that feature in Chinese cuisine.) *Diamond-shaped* is via the compound 菱形.

Examples: 肺炎
Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element#, which in contemporary fonts can be identical in form with 市, combines 八 split right and left + a bud | buds split right and left. 肺 adds 肉 flesh | *lung* (← internal organ found on both sides of the chest).
As per 區# (curve/bend) + 身 body | curved/bent *body*.

Examples: 阿姨
Etymology: As per 夷# (downward) + 女 woman | *mother's/wife's sister*; *younger sister of one's wife*; *aunt*; *concubine*. The common denominator in the meanings is the idea of a female social inferior (from the perspective of a male in close relation). With respect to females low in a hierarchy, compare 娣.

Examples: 壟斷
Etymology: As per 龍# (winding) + 土 earth | winding *ridge* between fields | *mound*; *hill* (compare 隴) | *grave* (← burial mound).

Meaning: rivet gaze upon, keep eyes on

Examples: 奢侈 奢望
Etymology: As per 者# (pile) + 大 great | great pile/collection of objects | *luxury*; *extravagance* | *treat* (to a meal).
An abbreviated form# of 沙 select + 糸 thread | select, high quality *silk fabric*.

Meaning: to fade; withered or dried leaves; tobacco
concave, hollow, depressed; a pass, valley
Etymology: A depiction of a concave object sunken in the middle due to pressure from above | *concave*; *indented*; *hollowed out*.
宛# bend + 肉 flesh | (flexible) *wrist* | *arm* | *talent*; *ability* (← accomplishments ← things accomplished with the hands/arms). For wrist and arm, compare 捥.

Examples: 怠慢
Etymology: As per 台# (heavy downward pressure) + 心 heart/emotions | respond to pressure by becoming lazy/idle etc. | *be lazy*; *be idle*; *neglect*; *be inattentive*; *skip* (class/work etc.).
陰# shadow + 艸 grass/plant | *shade* cast by vegetation | *protect* (← protect by covering in shade) | *help* (← protective assistance).
As per 臤# (adhere) + 肉 flesh | the testes, which adhere to the scrotum. *Kidney/the kidneys* is a borrowed meaning.
As per 閣# (cause to stop) + 手 hand/action indicator | *catch hold of and stop* | *put/lay down*.

Examples: 搏鬥
Etymology: As per 尃# as described in 博 (spread) + 手 hand/action indicator | spread the hand in slapping/striking | *slap*; *strike*. Also, *grasp* and *seize* (spread the hand over an object in taking possession of it).

The right-hand element# combines 彡 pattern + an abbreviated form of the right-hand element of 隙 (faint light spreading through small fissures) | faint pattern. 穆 adds 禾 grain/rice | *quiet*/*calm* of a grain field with crops planted at regular intervals | *gentle*; *reverent*; *respectful* (← behavior of a quiet/calm individual).

Examples: 飢餓
Etymology: Effectively a variant form of 饑, combining 几# (tall | tall and lean) + 食 food/eating | long, lean appearance of one suffering from a lack of food (same as for 餓) | *hunger* (for); *starve*.

Examples: 蹺課
瑕疵
Etymology: As per 此# (irregular) + 疒 illness | irregularly shaped *bruise* on the skin | *wound*; *illness* | *flaw*; *fault*; *defect*; *demerit*; *weakness*.

Examples: 軍閥
Etymology: As per 伐# (cut down) + 門 gate | restrict (= cut down on) entry to a gated structure | *clan*; *faction*; *clique*.

Examples: 憧憬
Etymology: As per 童# (run through) + 心 heart/emotions | be figuratively run through with *yearning* | *aspiration*; *longing for*; *admiration* (← yearning for an object or trait one does not possess).
As per 島# (project) + 手 hand/action indicator | *pound* projecting/protruding objects (such as hulls).

The right-hand element# originally combined 小 small (doubled) + 白 white (| light) | faint light emanating small fissures. 隙 adds 阜 piled earth | *fissure/crack/crevice* in a mound or wall | *discord* (← fissure between individuals). Also, *spare time* (← open space in one's schedule).
As per 危# (kneel) + 足 leg/foot | *kneel*.
As per 呈# (extend) + 辵 movement | show off one's prowess in carrying out an extensive undertaking | *strong*; *brawny*; *robust* (← strong enough to carry out an undertaking successfully).

As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 人 person | *resemble* (another person) | *disguise oneself* (← dress down or otherwise alter one's appearance so as to resemble others). Also, *be(come) thin/emaciated* (← reduced semblance of oneself).

Examples: 混淆
Etymology: As per 肴# (cross; mix) + 水 water | mix in liquid | *mixing*; *turbidity* | *disorder*. Compare 攪.

Meaning: bow down, face down, look down
Etymology: As per 府# (set in place) + 人 person | assume a servile posture | *look/face down*; *bend down* | *lie prostrate*.
As per 査# (pile) + 水 water | pile of *dregs*/*lees* at the bottom of a container. Compare 滓 and 糟. Depending on the font, the right-hand element may appear as 木 atop 旦.

Examples: 通緝
Etymology: As per 咠# as described in 葺 (press) + 糸 thread | press in stitching or spinning thread | *spin thread*; *hemstitch*. *Collect*, *gather* and *take hold of* are borrowed meanings via 輯.
As per 申# (stretch) + 糸 thread | band stretched about the waist, that holds the body erect | *gentleman* (← person of upright stature).
彊# strong + 土 earth | fortified, earthen *border/boundary*.

Examples: 饅頭
Etymology: As per 曼# (cover; be covered) + 食 food/eating | steamed *bun* with fillings (← meat/vegetables etc. covered by dough).

Examples: 沸騰
Etymology: As per 弗# (split) + 水 water | splitting away of bubbles (compare 泡) on the surface of boiling water | *boil*.

Examples: 餃子 水餃
Etymology: As per 交# (twist/cross) + 食 food/eating | *stuffed dumplings* (created by twisting dough back upon itself).

Examples: 憧憬
Etymology: As per 景# (expansive) + 心 heart/emotions | expansive longing | *long for*.

Meaning: a white horse with black mane; a camel
Examples: 駱駝
Etymology: 各 here an abbreviated form# of 洛 (connect) + 馬 horse | stage horse, in particular, a *white  horse* with a long, braided black mane.
As per 斤# (adhere) + 艸 grass/plant | *celery* (that grows in close proximity to bogs, marshes and other bodies of water). *Parsley* is a borrowed meaning.
As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 彳 movement | *wander* off/about. Compare 彷 and 徬.

穴 here an abbreviated form# of 穿 (pierce a hole) + 鼠 rat/mouse | rat/mouse piercing a hole and fleeing | *flee* (and *conceal* oneself) | *expel*; *drive off/out*. *Rewrite*, *rework* and *edit* are borrowed meanings.
口 mouth + 帝# for the sound alone to simulate crying out (continuously/repeatedly, and on the part of humans, animals or insects) | *cry* (out); *weep*.

Meaning: waste cotton, raw silk or cotton
Etymology: As per 如# (supple) + 糸 thread | supple *threads of silk or cotton* | *cotton* | *pad with cotton*.

The relevant seal inscription form combines 肉 flesh with a representation# of a jagged *backbone* (compare 呂) | *back*; (a person's) *height*. Also, *ridge* (elevated in the middle, and depressed on the sides).

Examples: 停滯 滯留
Etymology: As per 帶# (tie) + 水 water | tie/bind, constricting the flow of liquid | *stop*; *stay*; *stagnate*; *pile up* | *overdue*. Also, *reside* (← stay).

Meaning: neighing of a horse; gravel voiced, husky throated; (Cant.) to hiccough
Etymology: 口 mouth + 斯# for the sound alone to simulate neighing/braying | *neigh*; *bray*; *whinny*.

Meaning: fold hands on breast; bow, salute
Etymology: As per 共# (act jointly) + 手 hand/action indicator | *fold the arms* (or cross the hands) on the chest | *observe but take no action*.
As per 欣# (raise) + 手 hand/action indicator | *raise high*; *raise vigorously*.

Examples: 輿論
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 與 (raise in unison) + 車 vehicle | raise/*shoulder* a *palanquin* | *many*; *all* (← many people uniting to shoulder a load).

Meaning: linger, walk to and fro, hesitain
Etymology: 回# rotation + 彳 movement | *wander* in circles, without getting anywhere.
口 mouth + 華# for the sound alone to simulate *noise*/*clamor*. Compare 譁.

Examples: 疲憊
Etymology: 心 heart/emotions + 備# for the sound alone to simulate panting or labored breathing | *fatigue*/*exhaustion*.
矛# pike/halberd (| shape indicator) + 艸 grass/plant | (pike-shaped) *miscanthus* (compare 茆 and 萱) | *rushes*; *grass*. Also, *thatched roof* (← thatch with miscanthus reeds or rushes) | *house*.
喬# tall and limber + 矢 arrow | *bend* a tall bow in firing off an arrow | *straighten*; *correct* (← bend back into shape) | *reform*.

The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 今# (contain) + a net with a handle | contain (birds) in a net in capturing (compare 罕) | *capture*; (captive) *bird* | *captive*. A seal inscription form adds a depiction of an animal's buttocks.

Examples: 懸崖
Etymology: 厓 here a variant form of 圭# (cone-shaped) + 山 mountain | cone-shaped *cliff* | *precipice*.
As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 水 water | *sprinkle/pour water* (from high above, in an arc) | *slight*; *thin* (← slight trickle of water).
口 mouth + 豕# pig/boar, here a simplified form of the lower element of 冢 for the sound alone to simulate pecking | *peck*; *pick at*.

Meaning: bit; hold in mouth, bite; gag
Etymology: 金# metal + 行 (straight, crossing roads) | metallic, T-shaped *horse's bit*, contained in the animal's mouth when the horse bites down upon it | *place/hold in the mouth*. Also, *keep in mind* (← thoughts contained within; compare 憶). Logically, the classifier for 銜 should be 行, but it is traditionally given as 金.

Examples: 腐朽
Etymology: 丂# as described in 号 (extend then bend) + 木 tree/wood | tree *bending with rot/decay*.
As per 耑# (neatly aligned) + 手 hand/action indicator | *align neatly*; *measure*; *weigh* | *surmise*; *conjecture*.
As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 宀 roof/building | *empty* building, one separated from a main structure | *vacant*; *deserted*; *lonely*.

Examples: 瑕疵
Etymology: As per 叚# (overlay) + 玉 jewel | *flaw/blemish* overlaying the surface of a jewel | *defect*; *mistake*; *fault*.

Examples: 虔誠
Etymology: As per 文# (fine, detailed pattern) + 虍 tiger | (striped) tiger. *Respect* and (act with) *reverence* are associated meanings (← dangerous creature eliciting reverence).
As per 詹# (bear a burden) + 目 eye | (from the perspective of one stooping under the weight of a burden) *gaze*/*look* upward at another person.

Examples: 懦弱
Etymology: As per 需# (soft) + 心 heart/emotions | *weak-minded*; *timid*; *cowardly* (← soft-hearted).

Examples: 滲入
Etymology: As per 參# (commingle) + 水 water | liquid that seeps in or soaks through (compare 漸, 浸 and 潛) | *seep*; *soak*; *permeate*; *infiltrate*.
As per 廉# (gather then put/store away) + 竹 bamboo | *bamboo blind/screen* rolled up then stored away | *rattan blind*.

Examples: 萎縮
Etymology: As per 委# (hang low) + 艸 grass/plant | drooping/fading plant | *droop*; *fade* | *decline*; *weaken*; *be exhausted*.

Examples: 清澈
磋商 切磋
Etymology: As per 差# (irregular) + 石 stone | *polish* a precious stone to remove irregularities. Compare 瑳.

Meaning: drain off, leak; flow, pour down
Etymology: As per 寫# (pile) + 水 water | overflow of water | *pour*; *flow*; *drain*; *transfer water*. Also, *have diarrhea* (← flow of liquified offal).

Examples: 辣椒
Etymology: As per 叔# (slender and pendent) + 木 tree/wood | a species of Zanthoxylum, the berries of which hang on panicles. These berries are used in making Sichuan pepper | *Japanese pepper (tree)*.
The right-hand element# described in 榻 (press flat) + 土 earth | collapsed/flattened pile of earth | *collapse*. Compare 圮.
Originally, a variant of 莫# (concealing vegetation), the 日 element replaced by 犬 dog/beast to suggest growth luxuriant enough to conceal a beast | *grassy plain*.

Examples: 土壤
Etymology: As per 襄# (supple/soft) + 土 earth | softened *earth*/*soil*.

Examples: 脖子
鍛鍊
Etymology: As per 段# (neatly aligned) + 金 metal | pound metal with rhythmic, downward blows |  *temper*; *forge* | *train*; *drill*; *discipline* (← administer disciplinary beatings).
As per 爵# (small) + 口 mouth | *chew* food into small pieces. Compare 齪.
As per 旁# (spread to/be on both sides) + 石 stone | stone used to balance a scale | *weigh*. *Pound* (the weight and currency) is a borrowed meaning.

Examples: 蔓延
Etymology: As per 曼# (long and winding object that covers/is covered) + 艸 grass/plant | covering *vine* or *tendril* (compare 葛 and 葎) | *spread*; *thrive*.

Meaning: broad, wide, open, empty; to expand
Examples: 輪廓
Etymology: 郭# enclosure; quarters + 广 building | expansive (enclosed) building | *wide*; *spread." *Enclosure*, *quarters* and *red-light district* are borrowed meanings via 郭.
As per 壽# (long and curved) + 金 metal | pour molten lead into a long and curved die or *cast* (compare 鉛) in smelting | *mint*; *coin*.
As per 巠# as described in 徑 (extensive) + 艸 grass/plant | long *stalk*/*stem*.
口 mouth + 頓 for the sound to transliterate the English *ton*.
As per 某# (dark) + 火 fire | *coal*; *soot* (← dark by-products of fire) | *sooty*. Compare 灰 and 墨.
甚# extreme + 力 power/energy | penetrate deeply in considering/investigating | *consider thoroughly*; *perception*; *intuition* (← profound insight). Compare 含 and 念.
As per 韱# (slender/fine) + 歹 severed bone/death | cut enemies into fine pieces | *massacre*; *annihilate*.
As per 乃# (soft and clingy) + 手 hand/action indicator | toss an object softly | *throw*.
口# mouth + 木 tree/wood | *apricot* (← tree fruit savored in the mouth). Compare 梅, a closelyrelated fruit thought to be beneficial for pregnant women on account of its voluminous production.
夏# summer + 广 building | summer residence | *house*.

Examples: 溫馴
Etymology: 川# river + 馬 horse | horse following a winding course traced by a river (compare 順 and 沿) | *obedient*; *docile* (← follow). Also, *tame* (v.), *train* (v.) and *domesticate* (← cause to follow/become obedient).

Meaning: stand erect, stand up; pile up
Examples: 對峙
Etymology: As per 寺# (stand straight) + 山 mountain | stand erect and *tower* over | *soar*.

As per 辟# (punish) + 人 person | *remote* place for punishing criminals | *rural*; *inaccessible*; *secluded*; *out of the ordinary*. *Biased* is a borrowed meaning via 癖. Here, 亻 /人 has no semantic function, serving simply to create a separate character conveying meanings that dropped from 辟.

Meaning: beat, fight with fists, hit; to strike, brawl
Etymology: As per 區# (curve/bend) + 殳 action indicator | *beat* a person into a bending position | *hit*; *strike*; *punch*; *slap*.

Examples: 暴躁 急躁
Etymology: As per 喿# as described in 操 (activity taking place above) + 足 leg/foot | leg scratching irritably at the ground below (compare 騷) | *irritability*; *anxiety*; *noisy*.
戒# admonish + 言 words | verbal admonition/warning | *admonish*; *warn*.
As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 手 hand/action indicator | *run a pole through an object*, raise it, then *carry on the shoulders*.

As per 夾# (pressed between) + 頁 head | the jaw (← part of the head that enables food and other objects to be pressed between the upper and lower rows of teeth). *Cheeks* is via a different perspective on sandwiching with regard to the head (i.e., cheeks between which food in the mouth is pressed).

Examples: 背誦 朗誦
Etymology: As per 甬# (run through) + 言 words | run through a text in reciting or chanting | *recite*; *memorize* (by reading aloud).
舂# pound + 木 tree/wood | pound a wooden *stake* in the ground.

Examples: 耽誤
Etymology: As per 冘# as described in 沈 (sink) + 耳 ear | drooping ears | *indulgence* (← droopiness) | *be absorbed in*. Compare 甚 and 淫.
A variant of 番# (basket used in sowing) + 共 (act jointly) | group spreading manure contained in a basket | *feces* | *filth*.

Meaning: diverge, branch off; fork in road

Examples: 汲取
Etymology: As per 及# (press on) + 水 water | *draw water* (← lower a bucket to the point that it presses down beyond the surface of well water) | *scoop* (up/out); *ladle* (out) | *pour* (tea).

Examples: 分泌
Etymology: As per 必# (split) + 水 water | liquid that splits in flowing in separate streams | *flow* | *secretion*.

Examples: 肥皂 香皂

Etymology: The relevant seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form# of 書 (written work) + 日 sun/day surrounded by straight lines on all four sides | (written) demarcation of sunshine from darkness | *noon*; *afternoon*; *daytime*. 晝 eliminates the two vertical strokes toward the bottom of the character.
咼# (variant of 冎 round or rounded cavity) + 水 water | water swirling in a cavity | *whirlpool*; *eddy*.
㐬 here an abbreviated form# of 疏 pass through + 木 tree/wood | *comb* passed through the hair. Compare 櫛.
As per 居# (settle/set in place) + 金 metal | the set teeth of a *saw*.

Examples: 警惕
Etymology: As per 易# (stretch flat) + 心 heart/emotions | flattened emotions, in the form of *fear*, *dread* or anxiety | *be anxious*. Compare 惵.

Examples: 贓物
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 藏 (pile) + 貝 commodities | a pile of *stolen goods* (compare 搶) | *bribery*. Compare 賊.
As per 焦# (shrink) + 石 stone | partially *submerged* rocks that shrink from view at high tide | *reef*.

Examples: 地毯 毯子 毛毯
Etymology: As per 炎# (consume) + 毛 hair | *wool rug/carpet* (that consumes/fully covers the surface of a floor). Compare 氈.
As per 戎# (seize soft goods) + 糸 thread | (prized) *fuzzy, woolen fabric*.

Examples: 冰淇淋
復甦
Etymology: 生# birth; life + 更 change | *be resuscitated*; *be revived*; *be reborn*.
敕 a variant form of 勅, here a variant of 耎# (soft) + 女 woman | *young* (← young and therefore soft/supple woman). Compare 嬬.
幾# minute + 言 words | *criticize*/*disparage* minutely | *press* (for answers).

Examples: 華裔
Etymology: 衣 clothing + an abbreviated form# of 矞 (circular) | the rounded *hem* or *train* of a garment | *border* (← end of a garment). Also, *descendants* and *posterity* (understood as figuratively following in the train of ancestors).

Examples: 吭聲
Etymology: As per 亢# (the throat) + 口 mouth | *throat*; *windpipe*. 吭 was devised to replace 亢 after the latter took on its extended meanings.

As per 里# (long strip) + an obsolete character signifying "split" | plow long, neat furrows | *manage*; *control*. *Ancient unit of weight* (equaling 1/100 of a 匁) is a borrowed meaning | *small amount*.
As per 央# (stretch) + 歹 severed bone/death | have one's limbs stretched in torture | *calamity*; *misfortune*.

Examples: 旗幟
Etymology: As per 戠# as described in 織 (marker) + 巾 cloth | *flag* serving as a marker or *sign* | *streamer*.

Meaning: to rub or roll between the hands
Etymology: As per 差# (irregular) + 手 hand/action indicator | roll/rub an object in smoothing out irregularities | *roll/rub between the hands*.

Examples: 花瓣
Etymology: As per 辡# as described in 弁 (split) + 瓜 pendent, oval-shaped melon/gourd | *petal* resembling a melon/gourd split into symmetrical halves | *seed* | *valve* (← resemblance of shape).
As per 㐬# as described in 流 (flow) + 石 stone | *sulfur* (← mineral composed of the discharge of volcanic flow).
As per 交# (twist/cross) + 犬 dog/beast | *cunning/crafty* animal (compare 獪 and 猾) able to twist and make its escape | *sly*; *deceitful*.

Meaning: hoof; leg of pork; little witch
Etymology: As per 帝# (unify) + 足 leg/foot | the single-unit capsule of a horse's *hoof*. Compare 蹢.
欠 here an abbreviated form# of 次 (align) + 火 fire | align pieces of wood for a fire | *burn*; *boil*; *cook*.

Examples: 粗糙

Etymology: As per 唐# (rise) + 土 earth | raised earth, in the form of a *dike* or *embankment*. *Pond* is by association with an earthen water tank.

Examples: 媳婦
筷子
不懈
Etymology: As per 解# (remove a protective element) + 心 heart/emotions | strip away tense/guarded emotions | *be relaxed*. Also, *laziness*.

Examples: 大嫂 嫂子
Etymology: 叟# elder + 女 woman | one's *elder brother's wife*.

象# elephant (| large object) + 木 tree/wood | a large tree, the nuts and bark of which were a staple food and dyeing product, respectively, in certain parts of China | *horse chestnut*. For (Japanese) horse chestnut, compare the Made-in-Japan character 栃.
As per 加# (place atop) + 艸 grass/plant | lotus stem, atop of which rests a multi-layered flower. *Eggplant* (茄子) is a borrowed meaning.

Meaning: clasp under arm; hold to bosom
Etymology: As per 夾# (pressed between) + 手 hand/action indicator | press/be pressed between | *insert*; *interpose*; *be caught/sandwiched between*.

Examples: 陶瓷
Etymology: As per 次# (align) + 瓦 tile/earthenware | enamel aligned on the surface of earthenware | *highquality chinaware*. For chinaware (porcelain), compare 磁.
覽# survey + 手 hand/action indicator | take in (a situation) | *take hold of*; *grasp* | *arrange* (what has been taken/grasped).

Examples: 嫉妒
Etymology: 疾# illness + 女 woman | *jealousy*; *envy* (← unhealthy mental states regarded as characteristic of women). Compare 妬.

Meaning: to build, pile up; stone steps, brick walk
Etymology: 切# cut + 石 stone | stones cut into regular shapes and used as *steps* or building materials | *pile up*; *stone paving* under eaves. *Time* and *occasion* are borrowed meanings.
澡# float + 艸 grass/plant | floating *aquatic plant*.
As per 留# (round) + 疒 illness | a roundish *bump*, *swelling* or *tumor*. Also, a *nuisance*, particularly with reference to a child. Compare 疣.

Examples: 鞠躬
Etymology: As per 匊# (wrap about) + 革 leather | tightly wrapped leather *ball* (compare 毬). Also, *quiz/grill* (in investigating) (← tighten the pressure on a suspect; compare 絞 and 訊).

Examples: 別墅
Etymology: 野# field/plain + 土 earth | earthen structure in a field or on a plain | *shed*; *rest house* | *villa*. Also, *countryside* and *suburbs*.

Examples: 瑣碎
Etymology: As per the right-hand element# described in 鎖 (small shells, pierced and strung together) + 玉 jewel | *small* fragments (of jewels, linked in a chain) | *trifling*.
As per 巨# (great/large tool) + 金 metal | (*great/large*) metallic, *hook-shaped tool* | *metallic*; *steel*.
犬 dog/beast + 袁#. The original form of the character, however, was 犬 + 爰 (twist about) | the twisting figure of an ape or *monkey*.
As per 畐# as described in 副 (abundance) + 虫 insect/creature | colony of bats | *bat*.

Examples: 沐浴
Etymology: As per 木# (cover) + 水 water | cover oneself with water in bathing | *wash* (one's hair/body); *bathe*.
As per 婁# (drag slaves) + 手 hand/action indicator | *pull* (a person along) | *embrace* by pulling a person toward oneself.

Examples: 抽屜

Etymology: As per 因# (superimpose) + 口 mouth | food superimposed over the pharynx in swallowing | *swallow* (compare 嚥) | *throat*. Also, *choke*.
Originally as per 曾# (pile) + 心 heart/emotions | emotions that pile upon each other, in the form of hatred, detestation etc. | *hate*; *detest*; *loathe* | *animosity*; *be jealous*.

Examples: 衣裳
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 常 (long skirt) + 衣 clothing (for emphasis/clarification) | *skirt*.
走# run + 阜 piled earth | abruptly rising hill (← earth that runs up) | *abrupt*; *steep*.

Meaning: the rush of water; turbulent; noisy, restless
Etymology: As per 匈# (cavity) + 水 water | water surging through a cavity | *surge/become turbulent*.

Examples: 喉嚨
Etymology: As per 龍# (winding) + 口 mouth | a bent *throat* (as opposed to a straight one).

Examples: 嗓子
鞏固
Etymology: As per 巩# as described in 恐 (fasten) + 革 leather | fasten with a piece of leather | *bind tightly* | *tight*; *hard*; *firm*.
庸# work + 人 person | *hire*/*employ* a worker.

Examples: 骯髒
慷慨
Etymology: As per 康# (firm and taut) + 心 heart/emotions | taut emotions | *impassioned*.

Examples: 火焰
Etymology: As per 臽# (contain in a cavity) + 火 fire | *flame* of a pit fire. Note that 炎 may substitute for 焰 in compounds.
As per 浦# (spreading waterside) + 艸 grass/plant | *cattail*/*bulrush* (growing at waterside).
柔# soft + 手 hand/action indicator | soften | *rub/knead* (to soften) | *crumple* | *be confused/disordered*.

Examples: 畸形
Etymology: As per 奇# (lean) + 田 field | irregularly-shaped portion of land that leans/juts out from a field |  *remainder*; *odd (sum/number)* | *strange*; *crippled*; (physically) *defective*.
As per 里# (long strip) + 魚 fish | *carp* (patterned with long strips).

Examples: 教誨
Etymology: As per 毎# (dark) + 言 words | *instruct*, eliminating the darkness of ignorance.
倉# storehouse + 舟 boat | *hold* (of a ship).

Examples: 紡織
Etymology: As per 方# (spread) + 糸 thread | spread threads in spinning | *spin*.

Examples: 豁達
Etymology: As per 害# (cut) + 谷 (cavity) | cut in scooping out a *wide* opening | *open*. Compare 闊.
As per 霸/覇# (spread) + 土 earth | spreading *embankment* (compare 坊 and 防) | *dam*.

As per 交# (twist/cross) + 糸 thread | twist fabric and pull *tight* | *wring*; *strangle* | *squeeze out* (water); *press*. Also, *scold*, *grill* (a person), *drill* (a person), (photographic) *stop/diaphragm*, and *tie-dyeing*.

Meaning: to press or extract juices; a press to extract juices; a vegetable

Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 攬 take hold of + 糸 thread | take hold of a *mooring rope*/*hawser*.
乏# limited + 目 eye | quick *wink*. Compare 睫.

Examples: 哺乳動物
Etymology: As per 甫# (spread) + 口 mouth | mouth spread over a breast in suckling | (of food or a breast) *take into/hold in the mouth*.

Examples: 沼澤
Etymology: As per 召# (curve) + 水 water | *marsh*/*swamp* with a curving shore.
As per 龍# (winding) + 耳 ear | elongated, deformed ear | *deafness*; *deaf person*.

Examples: 枷鎖
Etymology: As per 加# (place atop) + 木 tree/wood | wooden restraining device placed atop the shoulders, and encasing the head | *shackles*; *fetters*.

Examples: 懊惱
Etymology: 奧# deep + 心 heart/emotions | *deep anxiety*.

Examples: 恍惚
Etymology: As per 忽# absent-minded + 心 heart/emotions | *absent-minded* | *be/become senile*; *vague*. Also, *fall in love* and *be/become enraptured*. 惚 was devised to convey the sense of "absent-minded" after 忽 underwent its transformation of meanings.
As per 師# (lead) + 竹 bamboo | lead/conduct water via a (bamboo) *filter*/*sifter* (compare 簁 and 沙) | *sieve*; *sift*.
As per 半# (split) + 手 hand/action indicator | *break* an object into pieces | *mix*; *stir* (← break ingredients into smaller pieces and stir in a pot).
As per 倉# (pile) + 疒 illness | *swelling*, *tumor*, *boil* or *scab* piled on the skin. Compare 疽 and 疵.
As per 君# (group) + 穴 hole | group of people falling into a hole | *be in trouble*; *be at a loss*. Also, *rebuke* (← place someone in a figurative hole).
As per 留# (round) + 木 tree/wood | roundish *pomegranate* fruit.
As per 祘# as described in 算 (close, circular formation) + 艸 grass/plant | *garlic* (the heads of which are arranged in close, circular formation).

Examples: 鯨魚
Etymology: As per 京# (expansive) + 魚 fish | *whale* (← expansive sea creature).
朿# thorn doubled | *thorns* | *severe*; *stinging*. Compare 棗.

Examples: 藩籬
Etymology: As per 離# (tangle; adhere) + 竹 bamboo | tangled, *rough-woven fence* (originally, one made of bamboo strips).

Examples: 蔬菜
Etymology: 疏# pass through + 艸 grass/plant | plant with loosely bunched shoots, allowing the passage of air and water. The compound 蔬菜 refers to vegetables or greens in general.
柬# choose; select + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | *choose*; *select*.
As per 靑/青# (clean/pure) + 虫 insect. The compound 蜻蛚 refers to a cricket (insect that produces a clean, strong calling sound), while 蜻蛉 is a dragonfly (with transparent wings).

Examples: 咳嗽
