Etymology: 口 mouth + 欶# for the sound alone to simulate coughing | *cough*. *Gargle* and *wash/rinse* (the mouth) are borrowed meanings via 漱.

Examples: 藩籬
Etymology: As per 潘# (spread) + 艸 grass/plant | rough-woven fence created by spreading branches | *feudal lord* (← protection offered by a lord ← protection offered by a fence) | *fief* | *han* (feudal clan or domain in the Edo period).

Meaning: to capture, imprison, seize; a prison
Examples: 俘虜
Etymology: 力 power/energy + an abbreviated form# of 盧 (sunken) | line of emaciated captives/prisoners (compare 奚 and 婁) | *captive*; *prisoner*.
As per 明# (manifest the hidden) + 艸 grass/plant | *bud*/*sprout* manifested in breaking through the surface of the earth | *sprouting*; *beginning*. Note a variant form styled 萠.

Examples: 戰戰兢兢
Etymology: As per 克# (stretch) (doubled) | stretch to one's full height in watchfulness (compare 企) | *be watchful/discreet*.

Meaning: pointed tip of something long like a branch; rudder
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 木 tree/wood | *treetop* | *tip* (of a branch).

Examples: 節儉
Etymology: As per 僉# (assemble) + 人 person (| human agency) | be *thrifty*/economical in assembling (= collecting) goods | *economy*; *frugal*.

田# field + 勹 wrap | *land about the imperial capital* and under direct rule of the emperor | *outskirts*; *suburbs*; *cultivated land*; *crops*. Logically, the classifier for 甸 should be 勹, but it is traditionally given as 田.
As per 畺# (tight; taut) + 艸 grass/plant | *ginger* (← plant with tightly demarcated rhizomes).

Examples: 阻撓
Etymology: As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 手 hand/action indicator | *bend* a tall object (into a particular form) | *disarrange*; *disturb* (← bend an object out of its original shape). For disturb, compare 鐃.
As per 廷# (extend) + 虫 insect/creature | a long insect/creature. The compound 蜻蜓 refers to a dragonfly, and 蝘蜓 to a gecko.

Examples: 惋惜
Etymology: 宛# bend + 心 heart/emotions | heart figuratively bent with *regret*. Compare 怨.

Examples: 針灸
Etymology: As per 久# (long and curved) + 火 fire | moxa formed into a long and curved stick for use in *moxibustion*. Compare 艾.
As per 羔# (fit into a pot) + 穴 hole | *kiln* (into which kneaded clay is inserted) | *oven*.
As per 咢# (cross, especially, cross over, or back and forth) + 心 heart/emotions | feeling of *surprise/astonishment* when events develop contrary to expectations | *be flustered*; *panic*.
泉 spring + 肉 flesh | fluid-secreting organs of an animal or human | *glands*.
As per 台# (heavy downward pressure) + 氷 ice | heavy, *melting* block of ice | *smelting* (compare 鑠) | *knead into shape*.
叕# connect + 糸 thread | connect/link multiple objects with thread | *bind*. Also, *spell*, *write* and *compose* (← create a written work ← bind scrolls).
As per 勺# (rise and become evident) + 火 fire | *bright* signal fire | *burn*; *red* | *clear*.

Examples: 紊亂
Etymology: As per 文# (fine, detailed pattern) + 糸 thread | confused/disorderly pattern on a piece of fabric | *fall into confusion/disorder*.

Meaning: pick out; scrape off; scrape meat
Examples: 剔除 挑剔
Etymology: As per 易# (stretch flat) + 刀 sword/knife | *cut/scrape* in flattening an object | *scoop/gouge out*.
As per 孚# (envelop/enclose) + 卵 egg | envelop an egg in incubating it | *incubate*; *hatch*.
As per 占# (fixed in place) + 米 rice | sticky, *glutinous* rice (compare 黍) | *stick/adhere to*; *persevere*; *linger*. In connection with 黍 and the meaning "glutinous," note a variant form 黏.
As per 童# (run through) + 巾 cloth | *flag* or *military banner* run through by a flagpole.

Examples: 惦記
渠道
Etymology: 榘 combines 矩 carpenter's square + 木 tree/wood | a wooden carpenter's square. 渠 is an abbreviated form# of 榘 + 水 water | *ditch/channel/canal* shaped like a carpenter's square.

Examples: 嶄新
Etymology: As per 斬# (cut) + 山 mountain | *steep* (peak cut into a) mountain | *high*; *rugged*. Compare 巉.
The top element# combines 殳 action indicator + an element depicting a chisel in 臼 (a mortar) | chisel (v.). 鑿 adds 金 metal | *bore* with a metal *chisel*.
公# public + 言 words | public disputation | *accuse*; *litigate*; *sue*; *suit*. Compare 獄.

Examples: 吩咐 囑咐
猖獗
Etymology: 昌# prosperous + 犬 dog/beast. The meanings *violent*, *go on a rampage*, *unruly* and *frenzied* are via extension (violently active ← vigorous ← prosperous) | *rampant*.
As per 辡# as described in 弁 (split) + 糸 thread | *braid* (split) threads.

Examples: 僱用

Etymology: 巫# sorcery + 言 words | words, likened in trickery to sorcery, that *distort* reality or defame | *slander*; *defamation*.

Examples: 囑咐
Etymology: 屬# adhere + 口 mouth | lips adhering to another person's ear in whispering a *request* | *entrust to*.

Meaning: prisoner of war; take as prisoner
Examples: 俘虜
Etymology: As per 孚# (envelop/enclose) + 人 person | envelop/surround captives | *captive*.

Examples: 奢侈
Etymology: 多# much/many + 人 person | person of many possessions (to the point of extravagance; compare 奓) | *extravagant*; | *luxury*. Also, *proud/arrogant* (← lord it over others ← extravagant).

As per 曷# (cut off) + 衣 clothing | coarse, dark cloth cut to make clothing | *coarse cloth* | *brown*. *Dark blue* also derives from the primary meaning, the clothes of low-ranking retainers in ancient Japan having been cut from coarse blue cloth.

Examples: 脂肪
Etymology: As per 方# (spread right and left, or in all directions) + 肉 flesh | spreading/protruding *flesh* | *fat*; *grease*.

Examples: 和睦
Etymology: 目 eye + 坴# as described in 陸 (stretch) | *cordial* gathering, the participants stretched in relaxation as they eye each other in a *friendly* atmosphere.

Examples: 罹難
Etymology: An abbreviated form# of 羅 net + 心 heart/emotions | suffer misfortune (likened to being caught in an emotional net) | *distress*; *suffer from* (an illness); *meet with* (a disaster).
母# mother + 手 hand (| finger) | *thumb*; *big toe* (digits likened to a mother, the remaining fingers/toes likened to children).

Examples: 吩咐

Etymology: As per 甘# (contain) + 金 metal | contain an object in a metal frame | *pincers* | *restrain oneself*; *shut one's mouth*. Compare 鋏.
As per 我# (bladed weapon | blade-like) + 虫 insect | *moth* (← blade-thin creature). *Ant* is a borrowed meaning, 蛾 being construed as an abbreviated form of 蟻 (ant).
An abbreviated form# of 殼 (husk) + 禾 grain/rice (for emphasis/clarification of the husk of a grain plant) | *grain* | *cereal*.
As per 胥# (separate) + 女 woman | male separated from his own family in marrying into another | *son-in-law*; *bridegroom*.
As per 旬# (cycle/circle) + 竹 bamboo | circular clump of *bamboo shoot*s.

Examples: 靴子
Etymology: 化# + 革 leather. 靴 was devised to transliterate a word used by one northern Chinese tribe that referred to leather riding boots | *footwear*; *shoe*.

Examples: 商榷
Etymology: As per 隺# as described in 確 (framing object that obscures/is obscured) + 木 tree/wood | *log bridge*, the bottom of the logs obscured in the water | *exact a toll/levy* (← charge for allowing passage over a bridge) | *monopoly* (← possess exclusive control).

Examples: 簇擁
Etymology: As per 族# (arrows piled beneath a pennant/banner) + 竹 bamboo | bamboo *arrowheads* (compare 鏃) | *swarm*; *collect*.

Examples: 撮合
Etymology: As per 最# (take a pinch) + 手 hand/action indicator | *grasp*; *pinch*; *take* (a photo) | *film* (a movie). 撮 was devised to express the original sense of 最 after 最 came to refer to extremes.

Examples: 廢墟
Etymology: As per 虛# (sunken) + 土 earth | *ruins* that have sunk into the earth.

Examples: 疙瘩

Etymology: 臭# smell + 口 mouth (| action indicator with reference to the face) | *smell* (v.). 嗅 was devised after 臭 came to be used as a noun.

Examples: 峭壁
Etymology: As per 肖# (resemble in miniature) + 山 mountain | portion of a high and *steep mountain* (← portion that resembles the entirety) | *rugged*; *rough*.

Meaning: watch carefully, stare at, focus on
Examples: 矚目
Etymology: 屬# adhere + 目 eye | *watch carefully*, the eyes figuratively adhering to the object being watched.

Examples: 疙瘩
嘮叨
Etymology: As per 刀# (curve) + 口 mouth | *curl the lower lip* | *be appreciative*; *be ravenous for* (← appreciate/be ravenous for food; compare 饕) | *greedy*.

Examples: 稠密
Etymology: As per 周# (grain plants) + 禾 grain/rice | thick growth or great quantity of grain plants | *grow thick*; *great quantity*; *density*. 稠 was devised to replace 周 after 周 acquired its extended meanings.

Meaning: drunk, to become violent under the influence of alcohol
Examples: 酗酒
Etymology: 凶# terrible + 酉 alcohol container | *act wildly* under the influence of alcohol.
玉 jewel + 豕# for the sound alone to simulate the sound of a jewel being struck repeatedly by a tool in being cut/polished | *polish*.
An abbreviated form# of 塞 fortress/fort + 木 tree/wood | (wooden) *fort/stronghold* or *stockade*.

Examples: 帳篷
Etymology: 逢# meet + 竹 bamboo | weave rushes, causing the material to meet (compare 縫) | rush-woven *awning* (for vehicles or boats) | *small boat*.
欠 bent, open-mouthed figure + 矣# for the sound alone to simulate a *sigh*. Compare and contrast 欵.
As per 賤# (slight amount) + 水 water | *sprinkle/splash on* or *spray* (a slight amount of water) | *pour*.
As per 襄# (insert) + 金 metal | *insert* softened metal into a mold, or pour into crevices | *inlay*; *fill*.
垂# hang + 金 metal | metal object set to hang, or used to strike down upon another object | *spindle*; *sinker* | *weight*.
周# circulate + 糸 thread | fabric/*fine silk* wrapped about the body | *be dressed/clothed in* | *detailed*.
朿# thorn doubled and aligned vertically to indicate a thorned *jujube* (or *Chinese date*) tree. Compare 樲. Also, regarding the repositioning of elements, compare 棘.

Examples: 裝潢
Etymology: As per 黃# (extend) + 水 water | *wide expanse of water* (compare 汪, 泂 and 浤) | *pond*.

Examples: 囉嗦

Meaning: to alarm; to instigate, arouse, incite
Examples: 慫恿
Etymology: 從# follow + 心 heart/emotions | compliant state of mind | *advise*; *persuade* (← advise/persuade another person to comply).

Examples: 時髦
Etymology: 毛# (fine strands of) hair + 髟 hair | *bangs*; *long hair* (of a young child); *long mane* (of a horse). Also, via the sense of the long mane of a fine horse, *excellent* and *outstanding*.

Examples: 賄賂
Etymology: 各 here an abbreviated form# of 洛 (connect) + 貝 commodities | connections obtained through gifting/bribery | *bribe*.
As per 臽# (contain in a cavity) + 食 food/eating | *meat, vegetables or sweets crammed into a bun* | *bean jam* (← type of filler).

As per the right-hand element# of 姉 (irregular alignment) + 木 tree/wood | tree with notably irregular branches | *persimmon*. *Wood chips* and *shingle* are via reinterpretation of the constituent elements of the character as indicating irregularly shaped pieces of wood.

Examples: 潺潺
Etymology: 孱# weak + 水 water | barely audible murmuring *sound of flowing water*.
As per 甲# (press down upon) + 門 gate | plate of a *sluice* or *floodgate* pressing down in closure | *opening and closing of a gate* (compare 沍). Compare also 闔.

田 field + an element# combining 攵 (strike) and an obsolete character of uncertain identity. The original intent seems to have been "strike (with a hoe or plow) in creating ridges or furrows" | *ridge*; *furrow* | *unit of measurement*. Also, *rib* (in ribbed cloth). 畝 replaces 攵 with 久.

The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 貝 commodities + a depiction of a square frame | fill a container/storehouse with goods | *storage*; *lay in stock*; *save*. The square frame element came to be written 宁.
As per 夭# (slender and limber) + 水 water | *irrigate*; *pour* (← slender stream of water) | *fertile* (← soil made fertile by irrigation).

Examples: 慫恿

Etymology: As per 匡# (extend within a framing object) + 竹 bamboo | objects extending within a *bamboo basket*.
疢# fever + 火 fire | *phlegm* (which in ancient China was associated with heat).

Examples: 菠菜
Etymology: 艸 grass/plant + 波# for the sound alone to transliterate the first syllable of the Northern Indian term palak (spinach: 菠薐).

Meaning: used with pong for ping pong
Examples: 乒乓球

Etymology: As per 皇# (extend) + 虫 insect | variety of *locust*, swarms of which extend over a wide area.

Meaning: used with ping for ping pong
Examples: 乒乓球

Meaning: tie up; bind, truss up; bundle
Etymology: As per 困# (bind) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) | *bind*; *tie/truss up*.

Examples: 猖獗
Etymology: As per 厥# (seizure) + 犬 dog/beast | *unruly* beast | *storm about* | *fly into a rage*.
As per 全# (fully) + 木 tree/wood | cylindrical wooden nail/wedge serving to fully stop an object up as a *plug*, *stopper* or *bar*.

Examples: 祭祀
Etymology: As per 巳# (descendant) + 示 altar/the supernatural | *worship* of ancestors, carried out by descendants | *enshrine*; *festival*. Also, *year* (← worship on an annual basis).

Examples: 鋤頭
Etymology: As per 助# (supplementary power) + 金 metal | *plow*; *hoe* (n. and v.) (← implements that supplement human power). Compare 耡.

Examples: 醞釀
Etymology: As per �� # as described in 温 (lid held down on a container | hold in/down) + 酉 alcohol container | *ferment* alcohol held in a lidded barrel | *brew*.
As per 白# (scatter) + 舟 boat | boats scattered over the surface of a body of water (compare 泊) | *boat*.

As per 乚# a variant form of 乙 (rise and hit a blocking element) + 車 vehicle | run over and *crush* an object, reducing it in size. Also, *grate* (← grating sound made in running something over) | *creak*; *squeak*.

Examples: 狩獵
Etymology: As per 守# (enclose/surround) + 犬 dog/beast | *hunt* by surrounding animals (or, by driving them into an enclosure and surrounding to prevent their escape) | *gather*; *pick* | *view nature* (← enjoy the outdoors).

As per 骨# (circulate) + 犬 dog/beast | pack animals that hunt by tightening a circle about their prey (compare 獪) | *sly*; *cunning* (compare 狡) | *(put into) disorder* (← use cunning to upset the customary order).

Examples: 隔閡

Meaning: bright; daybreak, dawn; the next day
Examples: 翌日
Etymology: Variant form of 昱 (bright sunlight), the adoption of 羽 suggesting bright sunlight accompanying the rising sun at daybreak or dawn via the "wings standing high" | rise aspect of 翊 | (the) *next* (day); (the) *following* (day); *tomorrow*.

As per 鬼# (large and lumpy) + 木 tree/wood | *Chinese scholar tree*; *Japanese pagoda tree* (← Styphnolobium japonicum: tree of a rounded shape, with pea-like clusters of flowers). Also, a Zhou Dynasty *rank-indicator*, said to originate in the custom of officials of this rank being seated facing three of these same trees.
As per 家# (hut/shed) + 禾 grain/rice | *harvested crops* in a storehouse | *plant crops*; *earn a living*; *work* | *gain* (← work).
毚# greedy; cunning + 食 food/eating | *gluttony* (← greediness for food) | *greed*.
As per 段# (neatly aligned) + 糸 thread | satin/*damask* (silk cloth with a neat pattern).

Examples: 嘮叨
胳膊
Etymology: 各# each + 肉 flesh | each *side of the body* | the *sides of the body*; *armpit(s)*. Compare 胠, 脇 and 亦.

Examples: 胳膊
Etymology: As per 尃# as described in 博 (spread) + 肉 flesh | arm (← part of the body that spreads in various directions) | *upper arm* | *shoulder*.

Examples: 打烊
匾額
租賃
Etymology: As per 任# (encompass responsibility) + 貝 commodities | goods/money paid to someone employed, who bears responsibility | *employ*; *hire* | *rent* (to/from); *wages*; *charge*.

Examples: 嘀咕

Etymology: 包# envelop + 雨 rain/natural phenomena | *hail* (← water enveloped by ice). Compare 霰.
As per 康# (firm husk of a grain plant) + 米 rice | *rice chaff* (← by-product of husked rice) | *rice bran*.
累 here an abbreviated form# of 縲 bind + 馬 horse | *mule* (← bind a load on the back of a pack animal).
As per 秋# (shrunken) + 金 metal | short-handled *hoe* (forcing the user into a bent over/shrunken posture).
